original_reviews:
We had high hopes staying here, however our experience was a full 1 star.
The 1 star is strictly for location.
We spent 3 nights here with our family of 4 for just over $1,200 only to be surprised at checkout there were over $120 more fees and that's not including parking our own car.

The elevator was down 2 out of our 3 nights. The staff was not friendly, nor welcoming. They also did not help us with navigating around the city, no tips, no advice, no help with direction.

The water pressure was awful, actually there wasn’t any water pressure … more like a trickle.

original_reviews:
When we first entered our room, we immediately noticed blood on the outside of the toilet bowl. We called for housekeeping, but no one showed up. After calling again, they sent an engineer - despite me clearly stating there was blood that needed to be cleaned, not a plumbing issue. The engineer left to find a cleaner, and when that person finally arrived, they didn't even clean the bloody area.
My wife is a registered nurse, and seeing unidentified blood in what should be a clean, sterile environment was deeply upsetting. She understands the serious risks of bloodborne pathogens like HIV, Hepatitis B, and Hepatitis C, and was honestly disturbed that proper sanitation protocols were not folowed. She made it very clear that under OSHA and health safety standards, this kind of contamination is unacceptable and potentially hazardous. We ended up using the lobby restroom instead of the one in our room. On our way out to dinner, we spoke in person to the front desk, explained exactly what happened, and were assured the issue would be resolved before our return. But when we got back hours later, the blood was still there. This experience  left us feeling extremely  uncomfortable and ignored. For a hotel of this standard, this was a major failure in both cleanliness and responsiveness.
Update: The hotel publicly replied, stating they've already "reached out to me directly" to address my concerns , but no one has contacted me. I have not received a phone call, email, or message from management. This adds to my frustration, as it feels like they are more focused on
appearances than genuinely addressing guest experiences.

original_reviews:
The room was great, spacious and beautiful.
However we were offered a “$75 upgrade to the bay view, with a $50 credit to their restaurant”. We happily accepted, and at no point did anyone clarify the upgrade was $75/day, and we did not confirm the total price of the upgrade either. We ended up paying 100s of extra dollars that we had not budgeted for.

When checking out we tried to clarify that we were told the upgrade was $75 flat and they said that’s not how their upgrades work and there’s nothing they can do to correct this misleading offer.

We really enjoyed our stay but we felt this “promotion” was quite predatory, so watch out for the offers they make.

original_reviews:
Loved everything about this place. Clean, cozy room with charming nautical decor and mine has a distant view of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge, sunrises and sunsets were beautiful. The location is unbeatable, right in Fisherman’s Wharf and close to souvenir shops, restaurants, and the Powell-Hyde cable car stop.

Huge thanks to Corinne, who greeted every guest with a warm smile, so friendly and welcoming. She truly made the stay even better.

Great value for money. Highly recommend, and I’d absolutely stay here again solo or with my family!

original_reviews: I was looking to be near Fisherman's Wharf but a bit removed from the crowds. This was the perfect location for that. ||The only negative was the parking situation. We had planned to leave the car all day upon check out (and fully prepared to pay) but they said our car had to be picked up by 1pm from the valets. I should have researched it ahead of time so I could have made different arrangements because it really made us shift our plan for the day to all of a sudden have our car for our SF sightseeing day.||Oh, and the windows desperately need to be cleaned. We had a Bay View room and the view was really compromised by the very filthy windows. If paying a premium for the view, I would expect a clean window. The rest of the room and hotel was very well taken care of and clean so the windows were a surprise. Probably just caught them on an off day.

original_reviews:
Charming Hotel in Fisherman’s Wharf – A Comfortable Stay

This was my second time staying at this hotel in the past 10 years, and it still has its charm. The location in Fisherman’s Wharf is perfect,convenient and scenic. The reception staff were relatively friendly, though they seemed a bit overwhelmed at times.

The room was spacious and featured a very comfortable king-size bed, which made for a great night’s sleep. While the bathroom felt quite dated and the shower pressure was underwhelming, everything was clean and well-maintained.

Overall, I was happy with my stay and would consider returning again.

This hotel has elegantly whimsical nautical styling, including various staff uniforms (!) All employees were welcoming and helpful, the Blue Mermaid restaurant had wonderful food and excellent service. We never had to wait to be seated and were pleased with every dish we tried.  The hotel location at the end of the fisherman's wharf area was ideal for our long weekend of experiencing some of the highlights of San Francisco.
The room was clean, seemed recently updated, and it also featured unique interior styling details that made our stay feel special and certainly out of the ordinary.

original_reviews: This hotel ended up being better than I thought. If you're a super light sleeper like I am, you may have issues unless you get a "courtyard" room (just inner walls & a couple plants.) My room was on the street but on the very backside of the hotel. Day time was still noisy but night was quiet enough. Beds/ pillows sup comfy. Inside dark/ no natural light but nice & clean. Only had drinks at the restaurant & they were so bad we sent them back. Didn't try the food. This was disappointing. ALL employees were nice & helpful. BUT our stay was tainted by a BUNCH of sneaky & undisclosed extra fees. They advertise valet parking as $75/ night (you have no other choice if you have a vehicle.) But when you checkout they charge you a "tax" on the valet so it ends up being $85/ night. Just be upfront & honest & say it's $85. Then all the other taxes/ fees also, which isn't necessarily the fault of the hotel. However they double charged us for parking. When we tried to call & discuss both the front desk guy & front desk manager tried to tell us the bill was correct & to just accept it. It was only after we didn't let up that they acknowledged & corrected the mistake. But even the correction they didn't fully refund us. Whether that was an honest accident or another sneaky attempt to extort more money, I'm not sure. They did eventually fix that as well but it required yet another phone call on our end. This truly soured the whole experience which was otherwise wonderful and pleasant.

original_reviews: My husband and I have been staying at the Argonaut Hotel every year for over 20 years and always get a Bayview room. This year, I tried to make reservations the week of April 28th, and the rates were extremely high. I emailed Argonaut and Tony recommended we select any other week because of an event in the city, and he would provide us with a great rate and a great City View room. When we checked in Steven provided excellent customer service. He also introduced us to the Assistant Front Desk Manager, Stephanie. She welcomed us to the hotel and thanked us for being a returning guest. She also offered to help us with any reservations for future stays. Steven allowed us to have an early check in at no charge. We had a great room as promised. All front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We always love talking to their bell captain, John. Domingo and John both provide excellent customer service and are a great asset to their team. Eileen Thompson

original_reviews: My Wife and I stayed in the Argonaut for four nights in May. We were very inpressed with the location, the hotel staff were exceptional including the restaurant staff. our room was lovely and the star shaped pillow on the bed was a great touch. The food for breakfast and the evening meal were exceptional and we loved the way the restaurant was decorated. We were sad to leave the Argonaut and as a momento wanted to take one of the star pillows home with us. Sadly we could not fit one in our luggage but since returning home to the Uk I have contacted the hotel to ask about getting a pillow sent back to the Uk. Aaron from the housekeeping team was extremely helpful and our pillow turned up and looks great on out own bed as a constant reminder of our stay. I would not hesitate to recommended the Argonaut hotel and will be looking to return as soon as we can to stay.

original_reviews: My husband and I stayed here on a romantic weekend and had the absolute best time! We booked a King suite  with a huge bathtub and it was comfy and spacious! We were spoiled by the hotel staff with a welcome gift of wine and a stuffed seal, and they also surprised us on our wedding day with chocolate covered strawberries, and champagne! The location was perfect for exploring cute little shops and restaurants. I will say that the neighborhood is loud with music outside and bustle of people until about 10 PM and the restaurant blue mermaid opens early, so expect some noise. However, we will definitely stay there again and highly recommend!

original_reviews:
What a brilliant hotel in such a fab location.  The staff were all very helpful and cheerful! Brendan , the concierge, was particularly accommodating.
We had a superb view of the bay and we glimpsed the Golden Gate Bridge through the bedroom window on the left and the Bay Bridge on the right.
Location is ideal to explore Fisherman's Wharf. The Cable Car Terminus is round the corner. And Pier 39 is a short walk away.
Added bonus - great restaurant Blue Mermaid  is part of hotel. Food was excellent.
This hotel is highly recommended for food , location, service and accommodation. We would definitely return here in the future.

reviews: we recently stayed at the argonaut hotel in san francisco and had a fantastic experience! situated in the heart of fisherman’s wharf, the argonaut is just steps away from the cable car turntable and ghirardelli square and a few blocks down from pier 39.  while the area is bustling with tourists, it offers convenient access to many attractions and transportation. from the moment we entered, the inviting atmosphere and helpful staff made us feel welcome. the hotel's nautical theme, with its exposed brick walls, wooden beams and maritime decor, adds a charming touch. ||we stayed in a city view king room overlooking the cable car turntable. despite some nearby construction, the view was still enjoyable and is sure to improve once the work is completed. the room was spacious, clean, and the bed was comfortable. there were a few dust bunnies along the wooden beams, but nothing that detracted from our stay.|the blue mermaid restaurant. |the french toast was exceptional! we’re from south louisiana  and know a thing or two about donuts and french toast and my son said it was the best he’s ever had. chef’s kiss! it was so good, it would be worth it to just stop in for breakfast even if you didn’t choose to stay at the hotel. | staying in fisherman’s wharf is undoubtedly touristy, but it was exactly where we wanted to be. the argonaut hotel's prime location, comfortable accommodations, and attentive staff made our trip memorable. thank you for having us! we would gladly stay here again on our next visit to san francisco.
cleaned_advanced: recently stayed argonaut san francisco fantastic experience situated heart fisherman wharf argonaut step away cable car turntable ghirardelli square block pier area bustling tourist offer convenient access many attraction transportation moment entered inviting atmosphere helpful staff made u feel welcome hotel nautical theme exposed brick wall wooden beam maritime decor add charming touch stayed city view king overlooking cable car turntable despite nearby construction view still enjoyable sure improve work completed spacious clean bed comfortable dust bunny along wooden beam nothing detracted staythe blue mermaid restaurant french toast exceptional south louisiana know thing two donut french toast son said best he ever chef kiss good would worth stop breakfast even didnt choose staying fisherman wharf undoubtedly touristy exactly wanted argonaut hotel prime location comfortable accommodation attentive staff made trip memorable thank u would gladly next visit san francisco

original_reviews: We recently stayed at the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco and had a fantastic experience! Situated in the heart of Fisherman’s Wharf, the Argonaut is just steps away from the cable car turntable and Ghirardelli Square and a few blocks down from Pier 39.  While the area is bustling with tourists, it offers convenient access to many attractions and transportation. From the moment we entered, the inviting atmosphere and helpful staff made us feel welcome. The hotel's nautical theme, with its exposed brick walls, wooden beams and maritime decor, adds a charming touch. ||We stayed in a City View King Room overlooking the cable car turntable. Despite some nearby construction, the view was still enjoyable and is sure to improve once the work is completed. The room was spacious, clean, and the bed was comfortable. There were a few dust bunnies along the wooden beams, but nothing that detracted from our stay.|The Blue Mermaid restaurant. |The French toast was exceptional! We’re from south Louisiana  and know a thing or two about donuts and French toast and my son said it was the best he’s ever had. Chef’s Kiss! It was so good, it would be worth it to just stop in for breakfast even if you didn’t choose to stay at the hotel. | Staying in Fisherman’s Wharf is undoubtedly touristy, but it was exactly where we wanted to be. The Argonaut Hotel's prime location, comfortable accommodations, and attentive staff made our trip memorable. Thank you for having us! We would gladly stay here again on our next visit to San Francisco.
reviews: good bits: the location, the view from our room of the bay and alcatraz, the complimentary bottled water at reception. |bad bits: not good value for money - our suite was very expensive and the rest of the hotel did not live up to expectations. service was non existent - we took our own bags to our room (no assistance was offered), every time we tried to call guest services we got an ai bot that was utterly useless and infuriating. the restaurant was average with surly service and very expensive. our one and only experience with the concierge on our first morning was so poor we relied on google from there on in - she ignored the questions we asked and tried to upsell us on things we weren’t interested in. the one piece of info we did get out of her turned out to be incorrect. |the hotel is in a beautiful old building but alas feels soulless in the communal areas and there is no sense of a ‘hub’. staff weren’t rude but neither were they friendly. there was little proactivity - there was a lot of chatting amongst themselves while guests stood around waiting for attention. |overall our stay was not terrible, but neither was it great and for the money we spent it wasn’t good value so we could not recommend it. |we were not asked about our stay at checkout. |i was send a satisfaction questionnaire after leaving which i filled out honestly but the hotel has not followed up about any of our feedback. |it just felt like they didn’t care very much. |a real shame.

reviews:
reserved a deluxe king room through costco travel.  going up there to meet family.  arrived late.  brother waiting in lobby.  checked in and was assigned room 401. brother and i went up together.  we both gasped when we opened the door.  argonaut had upgraded me to a gloriously beautiful suite.  i’ve been to some nice places, but this was easily the largest and nicest suite i have ever been in.

stayed thursday through monday.  the level of service matched the quality of the room.  corinne at the front desk was exceptionally kind, patient and helpful.

the location is pretty great.  short walk to the f train stop to go to embarcadero and giants stadium.  short walk the other way to the bus stop for the #19 bus which links to the rest of the city.  great place, great location.

reviews:
i don’t normally leave a review like this but it was rather upsetting for the money we spent for the last few days of our honeymoon. firstly the location is great, the hotel is clean and a nice size room.
however we had what sounded like a party next door to us through paper thin walls we could hear everything. we eventually called down at 1am to ask if they could call up next door to tell them to quiet down however they didn’t ask what side, said they will do and the ‘party’ continued until gone 3am. following that evening our ac unit rattled ridiculously loud we had to turn it off but it continued making a whirling noise for several hours as well as the fridge and pipes in the bathroom whenever next door flushed the toilet. you can just hear everything next door and above.
we have also been to plenty of hotels on our trip where they have made us aware of the holding charge and how much, but here the person at the desk was very transactional and did not warn us about the $300+ holding charge… my husband and i are concerned for being charged so much without even communicating it (hoping we receive this back promptly)

reviews:
check in was great, steven is very professional yet welcoming and funny at the same time.  suite was nice and it was  clean, bed comfortable.  bathtub was dirty and we did not use it.  since our last stay it seems like this hotel is more geared towards the tourist and not locals wishing to stay there.  everything feels like an up-sale from the $20 stuffed seal on the bed to the strategically place bottles of wine and water in the room. all placed with glasses, yet no pricing anywhere.  are they complimentary or?  we left them alone as they didn't appeal to us as we were heading to gary danko's for an elegant dinner near by. (the only reason we stayed here on this night).  check out was not as nice as check-in, it was more here ya go get out.
received printed copy of room bill and we left.  two days later receive an email with a new invoice stating we are being charged for eating a bag of cheeze-it's and tates cookies.  we did not! first diabetic people can't or at least shouldn't eat that junk and second i suspect they are trying to just up-charge us thinking we are tourist or the maid stole them.  but it definitely wasn't us.   this hotel is off our list.  beware of your bill people check it well.
tried to call their billing department after the usual phone tree garbage, press 1 the press 2 then press .... ending up talking to an answering machine.  lets see if and when i get a call back.
additionally this was a thursday night in early may yet we enjoyed (not) the loud motorcycles and cars racing up and down the street until about 11 pm.

reviews:
i stayed at the argonaut recently and had a really enjoyable experience. the location is absolutely fantastic, right in the heart of everything and perfect for exploring san francisco on foot.

all the staff i encountered were friendly, professional and courteous. a special mention goes to brendan and matt, who were both incredibly helpful and genuinely went above and beyond to assist. they made a great impression and added a personal touch to the stay.

the room was spacious, with plenty of storage, a comfortable bed and a nice modern shower with good amenities. it was clean, well kept and ideal for relaxing after a day out in the city.

i had breakfast at the blue mermaid, which is attached to the hotel. the free option included one pastry and one drink, which felt a little stingy. i upgraded to a cooked breakfast. it was ok overall, though probably a bit pricey for the quality. i only ate there in the morning so can’t comment on the rest of the menu.

overall, it was a great stay in a lovely hotel with fantastic staff. i would certainly book the argonaut again and recommend it to others looking for a comfortable and well-located base in san francisco.

reviews: well appointed and clean rooms. perfect location by the bay with the ability to safely get outside and walk/go for a run/bike ride through fort mason, through marina field, and all the way to the golden gate. hyde  st cable car is right nearby!  staff members so kind and helpful! left my jewels in the safe, and housekeeping brought them to management where i was able to swing back through the city to pick them up. so very grateful to them. joanna boyle of “the social butterfly” concierge services in the hotel was so helpful with ideas of where to go, made us a dinner reservation where we got a window seat at a popular restaurant, and she was just a delight! our family (two teens, my husband and i) highly recommends the argonaut!

original_reviews:
I stayed at the Argonaut recently and had a really enjoyable experience. The location is absolutely fantastic, right in the heart of everything and perfect for exploring San Francisco on foot.

All the staff I encountered were friendly, professional and courteous. A special mention goes to Brendan and Matt, who were both incredibly helpful and genuinely went above and beyond to assist. They made a great impression and added a personal touch to the stay.

The room was spacious, with plenty of storage, a comfortable bed and a nice modern shower with good amenities. It was clean, well kept and ideal for relaxing after a day out in the city.

I had breakfast at The Blue Mermaid, which is attached to the hotel. The free option included one pastry and one drink, which felt a little stingy. I upgraded to a cooked breakfast. It was OK overall, though probably a bit pricey for the quality. I only ate there in the morning so can’t comment on the rest of the menu.

Overall, it was a great stay in a lovely hotel with fantastic staff. I would certainly book the Argonaut again and recommend it to others looking for a comfortable and well-located base in San Francisco.
reviews: the argonaut was the perfect place for the one night we stayed in san francisco. great location, excellent customer service from all the employees we interacted with. my one suggestion would be to request a room on the top floor. older buildings are tough to soundproof, and it sounded like the group who was staying above us were running a daycare for toddlers from 3am through the rest of the night.

i would highly recommend the argonaut hotel to anyone staying in san francisco

reviews:
as an international visitor i'm comparing this to other hotels in the world.
the beds were very comfortable, reception staff very helpful although understaffed on one occasion so i gave up waiting.
internet was unusable, the hotel tried hard and got me connected but as soon as i went back to my room the speed was so slow we could not use it. we had four devices all experienced the same problem, even when they gave us another network to try. by reception it did work much better but no good within the room. service connected but no bandwidth capacity.
qr code for room service did not work, displayed table not found message. tried to call, no answer. after going to reception i was told it was closed already, i think it was soon after 9pm. i thought the whole point of room service was to get food late at night, obviously not here. luckily there is an in & out just up the road.
the room fridge had nothing in it, not sure why they take a $100 per night deposit?
these things may be usual here, but i'm sure many visitors are from other countries, the price was high and i expected more, so i won't be staying here again.

reviews:
this hotel is fantastic.  i have been here a few times, and it seems to get better every time. the staff is kind, welcoming, and knowledgeable.  i have never been disappointed.

on my most recent trip, steven & coco helped me out huge. i accidentally booked one night instead of 2 nights.  it was highly stressful, since i had business meetings all day.  and my fiance was going to have to vacate the room.
they were booked solid, and things looked hopeless.  they put in a ton of extra work to move reservations around, and make things happen for me.  they were booked solid anyway.  so, they could have just told me i was screwed.  that would have been th easy route.

this place is fantastic no matter what. but this type of service and effort makes me an even more loyal customer.

reviews:
this was our third time coming to this site because of its location near the wharf and our experiences from the past.   we actually like this location because it forces us to walk around to see everything that the wharf area has to offer and it’s a way to burn off food as you have to walk back to the hotel.
this was our first time bringing our 7 year old daughter as we wanted to share the experience with her.  the staff were nothing short of amazing and went above and beyond to make her feel welcomed.  we had a two queen bed room facing the bay.  this time we got the alcatraz view and it was great to see my daughter enjoy that view of the bay.   the rooms we get are always clean and fully stocked with what we need….sound proof too.
the best part of this trip and i know this is a small little hype but my wife forgot her earplugs and sleep mask.  the hotel apparently had a bunch of them in stock for guests like my wife.
the restaurant attached was always delicious and we normally utilize it as our breakfast spot before hitting the town.

original_reviews: Lovely, well- maintained hotel in a great location. Would definitely stay again !
reviews:
the argonaut hotel is in san francisco's fisherman's wharf. as someone who lives nearby, i have not stayed there, but i've heard many positive comments from friends who have. this review looks at the hotel’s history rather than its services.

the hotel is located in the historic haslett warehouse. this warehouse was built between 1907 and 1909 by the california fruit canners association, which later became known as del monte. at one time, it was part of the world's largest fruit and vegetable cannery. architect william mooser designed the building, which features red brick walls and douglas fir beams, reflecting the industrial style of its time.

canning stopped in 1939, and the building was used for various purposes until the national park service took it over in 1978. in 2001, plans were made to turn the warehouse into a boutique hotel. however, in march 2002, a five-alarm fire caused significant damage and delayed the project. i remember that night well. aaron peskin was the district 3 supervisor at the time, representing the fisherman's wharf area. he played a key role in saving the old historic walls from demolition. despite the fire setback, restoration continued, and the argonaut hotel opened in august 2003.

today, the argonaut hotel has 252 rooms decorated in a nautical theme to celebrate the building's maritime history. the ground floor also includes the san francisco maritime national historical park's visitor center, which offers guests insights into the area's rich seafaring heritage.
cleaned_advanced: argonaut san franciscos fisherman wharf someone life nearby stayed ive heard many positive comment friend review look hotel history rather service located historic haslett warehouse warehouse built california fruit canners association later became known del monte one time part world largest fruit vegetable cannery architect william mooser designed building feature red brick wall douglas fir beam reflecting industrial style time canning stopped building used various purpose national park service took plan made turn warehouse boutique however march fivealarm fire caused significant damage delayed project remember night well aaron peskin district supervisor time representing fisherman wharf area played key role saving old historic wall demolition despite fire setback restoration continued argonaut opened august today argonaut decorated nautical theme celebrate building maritime history ground floor also includes san francisco maritime national historical park visitor center offer guest insight area rich seafaring heritage

original_reviews:
This was our third time coming to this site because of its location near the wharf and our experiences from the past.   We actually like this location because it forces us to walk around to see everything that the wharf area has to offer AND it’s a way to burn off food as you have to walk back to the hotel.
This was our first time bringing our 7 year old daughter as we wanted to share the experience with her.  The staff were nothing short of amazing and went above and beyond to make her feel welcomed.  We had a two queen bed room facing the bay.  This time we got the Alcatraz view and it was great to see my daughter enjoy that view of the bay.   The rooms we get are always clean and fully stocked with what we need….sound proof too.
The best part of this trip and I know this is a small little hype but my wife forgot her earplugs and sleep mask.  The hotel apparently had a bunch of them in stock for guests like my wife.
The restaurant attached was always delicious and we normally utilize it as our breakfast spot before hitting the town.
reviews:
spacious rooms with first-class box spring beds – we slept very well. the solid brick walls give a high-quality, quiet feeling. however, at check-in (12:00), we specifically asked for a quiet room, and the receptionist assured us we’d get one. but when we arrived later, we were given a noisy room by the street and next to a loud ventilation system. thankfully, we could switch to a great room on the 4th floor.

another issue: we were told we’d get a $15 credit for the restaurant, but it was only mentioned verbally. the next evening we ate there and paid by card – only afterward did we remember the credit. reception then said nothing could be done. a simple voucher would’ve avoided this frustration.

overall, still a very good hotel – just a few things to improve.

original_reviews:
The Argonaut Hotel is in San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf. As someone who lives nearby, I have not stayed there, but I've heard many positive comments from friends who have. This review looks at the hotel’s history rather than its services.

The hotel is located in the historic Haslett Warehouse. This warehouse was built between 1907 and 1909 by the California Fruit Canners Association, which later became known as Del Monte. At one time, it was part of the world's largest fruit and vegetable cannery. Architect William Mooser designed the building, which features red brick walls and Douglas fir beams, reflecting the industrial style of its time.

Canning stopped in 1939, and the building was used for various purposes until the National Park Service took it over in 1978. In 2001, plans were made to turn the warehouse into a boutique hotel. However, in March 2002, a five-alarm fire caused significant damage and delayed the project. I remember that night well. Aaron Peskin was the District 3 Supervisor at the time, representing the Fisherman's Wharf area. He played a key role in saving the old historic walls from demolition. Despite the fire setback, restoration continued, and the Argonaut Hotel opened in August 2003.

Today, the Argonaut Hotel has 252 rooms decorated in a nautical theme to celebrate the building's maritime history. The ground floor also includes the San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park's Visitor Center, which offers guests insights into the area's rich seafaring heritage.

The staff is very nice and helpful and the general hospitality is excellent. reviews:
i will only stay here when i come to sf for work. and also - 100%, most definitely haunted. 😂

the hotel: i was so impressed by the staff here. most all of the staff called me by name, asked me how my day was, delivered my luggage and packages to my room. they were always in a good mood and it was overall just a breath of fresh air. comfy beds, amazing food, and just a super cozy spot in a safe part of the city.

the ghost story: i was staying in room 4024 (i think!) - and at around 4:00 in the morning, something woke me up. i'm still not sure what. i am partially deaf, so i normally sleep through the night. i looked down the hallway in my room and the bathroom light was turned on. i knew that the light was set to be motion activated. i sat there for a while and waited for it to turn off, which it did. and about 30 seconds later, it turned back on, and i heard things moving around on the counter in the bathroom. it sounded like my makeup powder jar being shifted and picked up a few times. this lasted about 60 seconds. i eventually got up to look, but there was nothing there, and it was too hard to tell what if anything had been moved. needless to say it took me an hour to fall back asleep. 😂 - i didn't feel super scared at all, it was just an experience that was unexplainable. i did try to explain it. i even looked up any seismic activity that could have caused it to give an explanation and there was nothing on that date / time reported. i tested how sensitive the motion light was and i had to fully walk in the bathroom for it to turn on, it wasn't sensitive at all. if it was only the light, ok - it could be electrical. but the fact that it happened twice, and i heard what sounded like someone in the bathroom moving my things around? 👀

i asked the front desk about it and they kindly turned the motion setting off for me for the final night haha. overall - love this spot, it felt like a home away from home and the spooky element added a fun paranormal experience & reminder of the history behind the location.

original_reviews:
I will ONLY stay here when I come to SF for work. And also - 100%, most definitely haunted. 😂

The hotel: I was SO impressed by the staff here. Most all of the staff called me by name, asked me how my day was, delivered my luggage and packages to my room. They were always in a good mood and it was overall just a breath of fresh air. Comfy beds, amazing food, and just a super cozy spot in a safe part of the city.

The ghost story: I was staying in room 4024 (I think!) - and at around 4:00 in the morning, something woke me up. I'm still not sure what. I am partially deaf, so I normally sleep through the night. I looked down the hallway in my room and the bathroom light was turned on. I knew that the light was set to be motion activated. I sat there for a while and waited for it to turn off, which it did. And about 30 seconds later, it turned back on, and I heard things moving around on the counter in the bathroom. It sounded like my makeup powder jar being shifted and picked up a few times. This lasted about 60 seconds. I eventually got up to look, but there was nothing there, and it was too hard to tell what if anything had been moved. Needless to say it took me an hour to fall back asleep. 😂 - I didn't feel super scared at all, it was just an experience that was unexplainable. I did try to explain it. I even looked up any seismic activity that could have caused it to give an explanation and there was nothing on that date / time reported. I tested how sensitive the motion light was and I had to fully walk in the bathroom for it to turn on, it wasn't sensitive at all. If it was only the light, ok - it could be electrical. But the fact that it happened twice, and I heard what sounded like someone in the bathroom moving my things around? 👀

I asked the front desk about it and they kindly turned the motion setting off for me for the final night haha. Overall - LOVE this spot, it felt like a home away from home and the spooky element added a fun paranormal experience & reminder of the history behind the location.

original_reviews: The location is top notch right at fisherman's wharf, you can't really beat the area in SF.  As for the hotel, 5* all the way. The rooms are gorgeous and have great character. reviews: let me start by saying that i would give a 5 star review of this hotel, however with the obsessive amount of noise that will prevent you from relaxing and getting rest, which is the main thing one would be looking for when booking a hotel, then i cannot honestly give 5 stars. whether it was noise traveling through the walls from neighboring rooms or stomping from rooms above, you won’t be able to get passed the loud noises. then top it off with the street noise right outside the rooms on the street below. our last night here, there was a gathering of low rider vehicles who had their sound systems up so loud, all you could hear is the base rattling the walls of the room. not much that the hotel could do about it, but they knew that this took place on a regular basis when the weather is good outside. sure wish they would’ve have mentioned this when booking! nonetheless, if extreme noises are your thing, stay here. if you’re liking to get rest and be able to relax, beware. it’s an expensive nights stay to not be able to enjoy your stay.

reviews:
i recently  had the pleasure of staying at the argonaut hotel in san francisco, and i must say, it was a memorable experience that deserves recognition. from the moment i checked in, i was impressed by the cleanliness and comfort of the room. it was spotless, well-appointed, and remarkably quiet—a perfect retreat after a day exploring the city. i also want to commend the hotel for maintaining such a fresh and odor-free environment, even though it is pet-friendly. it made me wish i had brought my dog instead of leaving her at a boarding facility!

one highlight of my stay was the excellent customer service. during checkout, i noticed unexpected charges on my final bill. after reaching out to the team, angel palacios, the front desk supervisor, responded swiftly and professionally. they identified the error, issued a refund for the charges, and even went above and beyond by waiving the daily guest amenity fees as a gesture of goodwill. this level of attentiveness and care turned a potential inconvenience into a positive experience.

additionally, i want to give special kudos to the blue mermaid restaurant. i forgot to bring dining utensils, but their staff kindly provided us with plates and silverware without hesitation. it’s these thoughtful touches that truly elevate a guest’s stay.

if there’s one small improvement i’d suggest, it would be offering complimentary refreshments in the lobby or waiting area. however, i understand that health codes may pose a challenge. i’d also love to see bidets added to the bathrooms—an amenity that would add extra comfort and convenience for guests.

the argonaut hotel has left a lasting impression with its outstanding service, attention to detail, and guest-centric approach. i highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting san francisco—it’s a gem that combines charm, comfort, and top-notch hospitality.

Whether it was noise traveling through the walls from neighboring rooms or stomping from rooms above, you won’t be able to get passed the loud noises. original_reviews:
I recently  had the pleasure of staying at the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco, and I must say, it was a memorable experience that deserves recognition. From the moment I checked in, I was impressed by the cleanliness and comfort of the room. It was spotless, well-appointed, and remarkably quiet—a perfect retreat after a day exploring the city. I also want to commend the hotel for maintaining such a fresh and odor-free environment, even though it is pet-friendly. It made me wish I had brought my dog instead of leaving her at a boarding facility!

One highlight of my stay was the excellent customer service. During checkout, I noticed unexpected charges on my final bill. After reaching out to the team, Angel Palacios, the Front Desk Supervisor, responded swiftly and professionally. They identified the error, issued a refund for the charges, and even went above and beyond by waiving the daily guest amenity fees as a gesture of goodwill. This level of attentiveness and care turned a potential inconvenience into a positive experience.

Additionally, I want to give special kudos to the Blue Mermaid restaurant. I forgot to bring dining utensils, but their staff kindly provided us with plates and silverware without hesitation. It’s these thoughtful touches that truly elevate a guest’s stay.

If there’s one small improvement I’d suggest, it would be offering complimentary refreshments in the lobby or waiting area. However, I understand that health codes may pose a challenge. I’d also love to see bidets added to the bathrooms—an amenity that would add extra comfort and convenience for guests.

The Argonaut Hotel has left a lasting impression with its outstanding service, attention to detail, and guest-centric approach. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco—it’s a gem that combines charm, comfort, and top-notch hospitality.

We found the restaurant here very good with many options.  We found restaurants within walking distance and spent more than we should for some Ghirardelli chocolates as the square was right next door! Had the weather been a little better and had we more time we could have walked have a block to catch the start of the trolley cars - we splurged for a day excursion to Alcatraz and Muir Woods through aviator and this was a perfect way to see - however- once here at hotel found the6 have a concierge you could coordinate tours with so wish I had investigated prior to - we took a transfer from Transfeero.com to and from airport for 80 bucks each way for 2 -  we highly recommend! !

reviews:
terrible hotel whose sole goal is to extract as much money from their guests as possible while providing subpar services.

i came expecting more because of the good reviews, but ultimately, it's a big disappointment.

the hotel is dated, and not super well cleaned. the shampoo/conditioner is the lowest quality you can get (basically what you'd expect from a motel six). for the price and the crazy high resort fee ($75), you'd certainly expect more.

they charge $5 for a small bottle of water, and fill the room with candy that they can't wait to gouge you on. they have coffee, but don't have any tea bags to offer (come on! they're really not that expensive, do you really have to cheap out here when you charge so much already?)

they also don't have a microwave. and when asked about it, the receptionist gave some "oh it's cause of the fire code" answer. the real answer is that they want to force you into the extremely overpriced hotel restaurant on-site.

all-in-all, it's a hotel designed to extract every penny from rich older people while delivering subpar value. i'd stay away from this one.

original_reviews:
Terrible hotel whose sole goal is to extract as much money from their guests as possible while providing subpar services.

I came expecting more because of the good reviews, but ultimately, it's a big disappointment.

The hotel is dated, and not super well cleaned. The shampoo/conditioner is the lowest quality you can get (basically what you'd expect from a Motel Six). For the price and the crazy high resort fee ($75), you'd certainly expect more.

They charge $5 for a small bottle of water, and fill the room with candy that they can't wait to gouge you on. They have coffee, but don't have any tea bags to offer (come on! They're really not that expensive, do you really have to cheap out here when you charge so much already?)

They also don't have a microwave. And when asked about it, the receptionist gave some "oh it's cause of the fire code" answer. The real answer is that they want to force you into the extremely overpriced hotel restaurant on-site.

All-in-all, it's a hotel designed to extract every penny from rich older people while delivering subpar value. I'd stay away from this one.

the hotel doesn't serve breakfast and bed cover was like sleeping under a tarp.

arrived after a six hour flight and was told that my room wasn't available until tomorrow due to repairs, then sent me to another hotel across town at 11pm. i booked weeks in advance and they didn't say anything until we arrived. the next day the room wasn't ready until 9:30pm, but the hotel they sent me to had checkout at 11am.

would not return if they paid me. go to the zephyr or hotel capri instead, both are better.

reviews:
what would you do if you turned up to a hotel at 7pm and was told that due to a late check out your room wouldn't be available until 9pm? context, i'd just flown in and the time at home was 3am when i arrived. i saw the air stewards loading up in their bus as i arrived so this looks like standard practice. no alternatives room were available and they wanted to charge full price for my stay. i'm guessing they charged for the late check out too.

the hotel did provide a $100 voucher for the blue mermaid bar, which is mediocre in food and drink. the staff were helpful enough. i would have rather been sleeping though.

when i did get to my room, the thin walls meant that i was woken up by the room next door - at least someone was enjoying themselves.

if you like themed hotels in the centre of a tourist village then this might be the place for you.

original_reviews: Our stay at the Argonaut Hotel was delightful. Room was clean and spacious. We love the location.
reviews:
we booked a city view suite, which vary in size from approximately 600-900 square feet. we requested that we be assigned a corner; the corner suites are larger than the non-corner suites.

the room was spacious and beautifully-appointed in a nautical theme. sliding wood doors separate the bedroom from the living area and from the bathroom, which had a deep massage tub and a standalone shower. a door separates the main bathroom area from the toilet, which further enhances privacy.

there are two large flat-screen tvs and a formal dining room table and chairs. a hideaway bed couch and two large chairs occupy the living space, along with two smaller tables. the room also has a mini-fridge that contains beverages for purchase if one is so inclined. a small safe sits in the coat closet in the main space, while the bedroom also contains another closet.

housekeeping service provided by eva was exceptional, and i want to also single out josh, karina, and brian at the blue mermaid for providing service that was above and beyond. the front desk staff was also friendly and helpful.

the location at the end of fisherman’s wharf near ghirardelli square and across from the national maritime historical park was optimal. we had stayed near union square and/or market street and nob hill on previous visits but we found this location to be the best and most convenient overall.

original_reviews: very bad
reviews:
***update***
after seeing mr. tony roumph's response, i actually asked to meet with him (since we were still at the hotel when i had posted the review), especially since his response was so professional, and not at all argumentative. he introduced me to the chef, mr. amod singh. mr. singh was personable and friendly and so willing to create a vegetarian indian meal for us for that evening.

we enjoyed an amazing dinner of dal, rice, and sabji (vegetable) along with a delicious appetizer, pakoras, and finger-licking-good dessert, kheer.

also, regarding the shower, mr. roumph immediately sent a maintenance person to our room to fix the shower handle thing - and it worked perfectly the next morning.

will i go back to the argonaut? yes!!

thank you to mr. roumph and mr. singh for making our trip even more pleasurable.

*****************************************************************

rooms are ok, a bit smaller than expected. the bathroom is old and needs upgrading, but the shower has good water force. the bathroom is very, very small, one sink, barely any room to put toiletries.
**
and i miss the amenity kits offered by hotels in the past. these days, it's all about large bottles, locked down, and nothing else - no shower cap or those fragrant hand soaps that i absolutely love. at least 4+ star hotels should bring those back.
***
the drinks served at the restaurant were fantastic....the breakfast, not so much. what's up with such few vegetarian choices?  we thought about having dinner at their blue mermaid restaurant but found scarce vegetarian options, surprising since it's sfo, and even more given their chef is indian, a mr. amod singh.
**
people have got to do more to cater to vegetarian people, and no, offering one or two token dishes is not adequate.

original_reviews:
***UPDATE***
After seeing Mr. Tony Roumph's response, I actually asked to meet with him (since we were still at the hotel when I had posted the review), especially since his response was so professional, and not at all argumentative. He introduced me to the chef, Mr. Amod Singh. Mr. Singh was personable and friendly and so willing to create a vegetarian Indian meal for us for that evening.

We enjoyed an amazing dinner of dal, rice, and sabji (vegetable) along with a delicious appetizer, pakoras, and finger-licking-good dessert, kheer.

Also, regarding the shower, Mr. Roumph immediately sent a maintenance person to our room to fix the shower handle thing - and it worked perfectly the next morning.

Will I go back to the Argonaut? YES!!

Thank you to Mr. Roumph and Mr. Singh for making our trip even more pleasurable.

*****************************************************************

Rooms are OK, a bit smaller than expected. The bathroom is OLD and needs upgrading, but the shower has good water force. The bathroom is VERY, VERY SMALL, one sink, barely any room to put toiletries.
**
And I miss the amenity kits offered by hotels in the past. These days, it's all about large bottles, locked down, and nothing else - no shower cap or those fragrant hand soaps that I absolutely love. At least 4+ star hotels should bring those back.
***
The drinks served at the restaurant were fantastic....the breakfast, not so much. What's up with such few vegetarian choices?  We thought about having dinner at their Blue Mermaid restaurant but found scarce vegetarian options, surprising since it's SFO, and even more given their chef is Indian, a Mr. Amod Singh.
**
People have got to do more to cater to vegetarian people, and no, offering one or two token dishes is not adequate.

reviews:
the location of the argonaut hotel in san francisco is excellent, offering a respite from some of the more challenging issues currently affecting the city. however, the overall experience was mixed.

while the hotel’s location is a strong point, the staff were not particularly friendly or engaging. they performed their duties but did not go beyond the basics to ensure a pleasant experience for guests.

the rooms and hotel facilities are nice, but we did notice that they could benefit from more thorough cleaning. there was a noticeable amount of dust, which detracted from the overall comfort.

additionally, we had an issue with the air extractor (or aov system) in our room—it was quite noisy. the management did offer an apology and a small reduction on the taxes, which was appreciated given that we only stayed for two nights.

overall, while the location and the hotel's features are good, improvements in staff friendliness and cleaning standards would enhance the guest experience.

original_reviews:
The location of the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco is excellent, offering a respite from some of the more challenging issues currently affecting the city. However, the overall experience was mixed.

While the hotel’s location is a strong point, the staff were not particularly friendly or engaging. They performed their duties but did not go beyond the basics to ensure a pleasant experience for guests.

The rooms and hotel facilities are nice, but we did notice that they could benefit from more thorough cleaning. There was a noticeable amount of dust, which detracted from the overall comfort.

Additionally, we had an issue with the air extractor (or AOV system) in our room—it was quite noisy. The management did offer an apology and a small reduction on the taxes, which was appreciated given that we only stayed for two nights.

Overall, while the location and the hotel's features are good, improvements in staff friendliness and cleaning standards would enhance the guest experience.

original_reviews:
I recently stayed at Argonaut Hotel  and it was an amazing experience!

The location is absolutely perfect—situated right in the heart of the city, it made exploring all the major attractions incredibly convenient

The staff were exceptionally friendly and went out of their way to ensure I had a comfortable stay. From the warm welcome at check-in to their helpful tips on local spots, they truly made me feel at home. The room was spotless and well-maintained, with all the amenities I needed for a relaxing stay

Overall, Argonaut Hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a top-notch stay in the city!

original_reviews: Lovely big rooms with comfy beds. Great location with easy walking to local amenities
reviews: we stayed here recently for a two-night stay. it is a great location, we were able to walk to much of what we had on our list. and when we needed to book a lyft, it was very easy to get picked up/dropped off. the room, while small, was so cute and quaint, with the brick, star pillows, and nautical theme. and best of all, it was so quiet! i booked a courtyard room and did not hear anything. if you've been in that area, you know there are a ton of tourists, music, etc. so the fact that it was dead silent was amazing. no view, but we don't spend time looking out the windows when we're on vacation so it was worth it lol. service was very nice both on the hotel and blue mermaid next door. we had a deal for a free continental breakfast and the second morning they had run out of pastries. so the server subbed in toast (which we preferred anyway) for free. next time we are in san francisco, will absolutely stay here again! just one suggestion for the front desk staff (who were all very friendly and nice) -- it would be great if they could note the amenities like free bottled water and the $15 credit for the blue mermaid. you have to scan a qr code to see the amenities which guests may or may not do. secondly, there is a lot of stuff in the room. snacks, wine, beverages, stuffed animal for purchase and in various areas of the room. given how small the room is, it was a little annoying to have all that in the way. recommend removing most of it from the desk, and reducing the sheer quantity altogether.

reviews: my husband, dog, and i had a 5-star experience during our 3-night stay at the argonaut hotel a few weeks ago. although the price may be high, it is a true luxury experience. the rooms are exceptional, their attentive staff is top notch, and the location can't be beat. their entire hotel is nautical themed, which fits perfectly with their location near the water. the lobby was extravagant with a beautiful fireplace and a lot of comfortable seating. there is also an intimate, upscale bar adjacent to the hotel lobby. valet parking is available if you have a vehicle. our room was pleasantly spacious with a large bathroom, an open-space bed and desk area, and extremely comfortable beds. the room was more than suitable for two adults and our pup. upon arrival and checking in, we were greeted by the doorman and valet with excitement, especially when they saw our dog. we were happy that the dog fee was a reasonably-priced, flat rate, compared to other hotels, but when checking in, they pulled out a welcoming gift for our pup. the packaging was impressive, though we weren't expecting much. however, when we got to the room and opened the package we were surprised to find a box fully packed with quality items which included a rope toy in the shape of an anchor, cheetah-print tennis ball, a branded argonaut neck scarf, and a treat, all for our dog. she even made the paws of fame board while we were visiting. as noted above, this location can't be beat. located near ghirardelli square and fisherman's wharf, there are plenty of options for dining and shopping close by. we had a great experience during our time at the argonaut hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

original_reviews: great atmosphere, nice well maintained historic building. clean ( except the new carpet and little trimmings and the edges weren't done. ). great bed and the accessible shower was done correctly ( not common in hotels). the bar is small and i hope you like common drinks ( not well stocked). the breakfast bakery items and fruit plates were wonderful. the bar (restaurant) staff is very nice and accommodating. the front desk is polite. the concierge is often not there and when they are they do not have a lot of fun answers. overall i would return, and do my homework on what is in walking range.

original_reviews: i dine at the blue mermaid frequently with my family. i'm a long time local of san francisco. last night i was taking a walk from pac heights to the area and needed a bathroom. i figured i would pop into the argonaut hotel since i'm always there for food. the puny little fella behind the counter was rude and inconsiderate and said that i needed to be a hotel guest to use the bathroom when i was already in the lobby and our friend kylie was in room 407. can you believe to my surprise that he would not let me use the lobby restroom?! i've just never heard of such rude customer service or behavior from anyone. the security guard was nicer since he was about to offer it to me until the guy behind the front desk intruded in our conversation and refused the door code. shame on you for refusing a lady a common courtesy task of allowing someone to use your facilities. honestly, i'm still aghast at your thoughtlessness. someone needs to fire him. he has glasses and a hat. he's just a heartless human, sad to say. what has this city become where you can't be kind to locals anymore?
reviews: deceptive pricing! on their website it states free valet parking with stay, but what it doesn't say is that you have to book directly with the hotel. if you use third party site, booking for example. you will not receive that perk and have to pay $65 for parking. steven the hotel staff member was unapologetic and could care less about our concerns i would think twice about reserving a room at this hotel unless you want some surprise costs when checking out. the rooms were clean and comfortable and the hotel location was perfect if your visiting pier 39 and other attractions nearby.

original_reviews: location is very good and convenient to many fun things with in walking distance. however, the room with an exterior view is extremely noisy with amplified street music and car traffic. make sure to have earplugs! beware that the pull-out bed in the suite is not usable, that is, unless you can tolerate sleeping directly on the mattress springs. would not recommend due to extreme exterior noice and uncomfortable beds.
reviews: the argonaut hotel is not only the perfect location, it is adorable! it's just steps away from the aquatic park, the buena vista, ghirardelli square, cable car hop on location, fisherman's wharf, and pier 39! it appears it has been newly renovated with a nautical theme. bed linens were super comfortable, and so was the bed. although we did not eat any food there, the bar was great. front desk staff was super helpful and accommodating. they gave us bottled waters and helped me adjust our reservation to a parking included package, which saved us some money. if we need to get away and want to stay in san francisco or have out of towners visiting again, we will definitely be going back to the argonaut hotel!

original_reviews: unfortunately, our stay at the argonaut hotel wasn't very pleasant. my husband, our two-year-old daughter, and i got so many bug bites from our one-night stay, which cost a total of $450. we felt that the stay wasn't worth the price. the only reason we chose this hotel was its close proximity to the marathon--it was just a few minutes' walk. however, i feel awful that my daughter is scratching constantly because of these bug bites. i'm not sure if it's flea bites or bedbugs . and yes, we're 100% sure the bites came from the hotel. we had family who did all the same activities as us but didn't stay at the hotel, and they didn't get any bites.

original_reviews: we stayed here recently for a two-night stay. it is a great location, we were able to walk to much of what we had on our list. and when we needed to book a lyft, it was very easy to get picked up/dropped off. the room, while small, was so cute and quaint, with the brick, star pillows, and nautical theme. and best of all, it was so quiet! i booked a courtyard room and did not hear anything. if you've been in that area, you know there are a ton of tourists, music, etc. so the fact that it was dead silent was amazing. no view, but we don't spend time looking out the windows when we're on vacation so it was worth it lol. service was very nice both on the hotel and blue mermaid next door. we had a deal for a free continental breakfast and the second morning they had run out of pastries. so the server subbed in toast (which we preferred anyway) for free. next time we are in san francisco, will absolutely stay here again! just one suggestion for the front desk staff (who were all very friendly and nice) -- it would be great if they could note the amenities like free bottled water and the $15 credit for the blue mermaid. you have to scan a qr code to see the amenities which guests may or may not do. secondly, there is a lot of stuff in the room. snacks, wine, beverages, stuffed animal for purchase and in various areas of the room. given how small the room is, it was a little annoying to have all that in the way. recommend removing most of it from the desk, and reducing the sheer quantity altogether.
reviews: i thought this place was a cute hotel, but be careful on personal items being left in the room. people from our group had their passports and laptops stolen. the room was a very tight space with very little walking room between the beds and door. after the missing items i decided to no longer have housekeeping come to clean the room.

original_reviews: service is excellent, very friendly folks at the door and the desk. beds are lovely and comfortable with great sheets. the room was great to hang out in. total bonus is having a delicious restaurant attached. and a wine bar! i ordered a bottle of wine, walked over to the restaurant and the staff was very helpful. i ordered food-to-go, sat and had a glass of wine while they prepared my food. extra bonus: the 6-year old loved her fruit and mac-and-cheese. san francisco is not a large town, but i love the location of this hotel. it's easy to walk the entire city (north beach is very close). but if you want to feel safe, this is a good area.
reviews: from checking in to checking out and storing my luggage here while i grabbed a bite to eat before heading out to the airport, my experience was nothing but great. anything the hotel could do to make the stay a little better, they did. i flew in and came straight to the hotel for a conference for work, so i didn't pick this location myself. typically these situations make me a little nervous because i don't get to vet the location i'm staying in myself. but when i checked in early, steven at the front desk made it easy and was super accommodating. me and the other guests were given water bottles each time we stopped by the desk, and that was so thoughtful. the room itself was clean, modern, and comfortable. it had liquor and snacks inside (for a charge). there was even an umbrella for guests to use during their stay. if they want to take it with them, they can let the front desk know and they would be charged for it when checking out.

original_reviews: me and my husband planned to go to a comedy show at cobbs comedy which is about 1/2 mile from argonaut hotel, so this is why we chose this hotel. initially we reserved a king suite but upon arrival management had upgraded up to room #256 which is one of the better suites you can get. and let me tell you it was beautiful! it was very clean and smelled good we had a living room and a bedroom with the king bed and the bathroom had a huge jacuzzi tub and a stand up shower. the toilet had its own room which was nice as i could still get ready while my husband does his thing lol! we loved the hotel and will definitely be staying here every time we come to sf, not to mention it's right on the pier.
reviews: incredibly pleased with our stay at the argonaut hotel. the location was right in the heart of fishermans wharf, and could not have been better situated. we reserved a room with bay view and our view of the golden gate bridge, ghirardelli square and the cable cars was priceless! walking distance to some of the best restaurants, right by hyde,st pier, and right near ghirardelli square. cable car roundabout literally just across from the hotel as well. staff was very friendly and helpful, and hotel felt very safe with keys needed to use the elevator and reach your room floor. we would definitely stay here again!

original_reviews: the argonaut hotel is a very nice hotel with great customer service. my only criticism is that if your room is close to the air conditioning unit you can hear a loud hum. luckily we were able to switch rooms without a problem. overall the argonaut hotel is a very nice luxury hotel in a great location of the wharf.
reviews: this hotel isn't very exciting from the outside, but inside was quite nice. i had a rental car, and the valet immediately greeted me when i drove up. the woman at the front desk was kind, answered all of my questions and was very friendly. the room itself was very narrow, but had enough space for one person. two oddities for me - there is a gigantic mirror at the foot of the bed. as someone that's a very light sleeper, having a reflection of myself all night was a bit odd. second, the shower was quite disappointing - i would have expected a hotel like this to have a nicer bathroom. overall though, nothing specific to complain about. the spa services on the website are actually outsourced and occur in your room. this was a first for me, and i booked a massage during my stay. i've never had an in-room massage before so perhaps its not a fair comparison, but for the price i don't think it was worth it despite the massage therapist being quite wonderful. i'd much rather be in a spa, and wouldn't schedule that a second time. i had a room overlooking the bay. this was nice, but i was expecting to be able to enjoy the outside a bit more and that wasn't possible so i personally don't think it was worth the higher room price for the view alone. to touch on the reviews regarding this hotel being haunted - this was corroborated by a bus driver on a tour that i took, but i didn't personally experience anything out of the ordinary! overall this was a nice hotel, in an excellent location, and i would certainly stay here again.

original_reviews: stunning hotel and unbelievable customer service. from the front desk, to the wine bar, the bellhop, valet and restaurant, we had the most wonderful experience. it's a long story, but i royally screwed up the reservation for my partner's 60th birthday. the hotel was so gracious about it and gave us incredible accommodations in spite of my mistake. can't recommend enough!
reviews: we stayed two nights at the argonaut and were overall pretty happy. it's on a very busy street right in the heart of the waterfront - go left as you exit and you'll be right at the cable car & ghirardelli square, and go right as you exit and you'll be on fisherman's wharf. check in went smoothly - they offer a number of tiers of room when you book and we got exactly what we paid for, which was a partial view of alcatraz and the bay. it was directly over the front entrance though so street noise permeated during the daytime. at night the area was much quieter. the hotel is not new but has been maintained fairly well. we were happy with the in room amenities. we took advantage of the valet parking and our car was available within 10 minutes of our numerous requests. we didn't sample the in house restaurant but it looked pretty good and certainly smelled good (lobby always had a waft of brunch). the little nps exhibit in the lobby was also a nice touch to walk around. overall can't beat the location if you want a classic sf tourist experience.

original_reviews: my husband, dog, and i had a 5-star experience during our 3-night stay at the argonaut hotel a few weeks ago. although the price may be high, it is a true luxury experience. the rooms are exceptional, their attentive staff is top notch, and the location can't be beat. their entire hotel is nautical themed, which fits perfectly with their location near the water. the lobby was extravagant with a beautiful fireplace and a lot of comfortable seating. there is also an intimate, upscale bar adjacent to the hotel lobby. valet parking is available if you have a vehicle. our room was pleasantly spacious with a large bathroom, an open-space bed and desk area, and extremely comfortable beds. the room was more than suitable for two adults and our pup. upon arrival and checking in, we were greeted by the doorman and valet with excitement, especially when they saw our dog. we were happy that the dog fee was a reasonably-priced, flat rate, compared to other hotels, but when checking in, they pulled out a welcoming gift for our pup. the packaging was impressive, though we weren't expecting much. however, when we got to the room and opened the package we were surprised to find a box fully packed with quality items which included a rope toy in the shape of an anchor, cheetah-print tennis ball, a branded argonaut neck scarf, and a treat, all for our dog. she even made the paws of fame board while we were visiting. as noted above, this location can't be beat. located near ghirardelli square and fisherman's wharf, there are plenty of options for dining and shopping close by. we had a great experience during our time at the argonaut hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews: this review has several layers as we hosted an event here, managed a room block for guests, and stayed at this hotel. i will start with the event since that is where our journey begins. we hosted our wedding in december, 2022 at the maritime ballroom at the argonaut. we were planning our wedding for about a year with diem tran. diem is the best event coordinator we have ever worked with. she is extremely friendly, quick to respond to e-mails, and very professional. a big reason we chose this venue is because we felt comfortable with diem. the venue itself takes imagination. when you go on a tour it is an empty brick room. however once the argonaut staff places all the tables put's out the dance floor and up-lights are added the room becomes very charming. there is also the adjacent del monte courtyard available for the cocktail hour and for your guests to mingle during the reception. the catering staff was very professional and the food came out warm and tasting delicious. great service is a theme of this hotel. everyone staying in our room block was extremely happy with the argonaut. the staff was very helpful and nice and even gave our guests welcome gifts that we curated for them. i have stayed at a lot of hotels and have not stayed at one this size where the staff made it feel like i was staying at a friends house. as for the rooms, this is clincher. the views from the hotel rooms are the best in san francisco hands down. our honeymoon suite was a corner suite thatoverlooked ghirardelli square and the golden gate bridge on one side and alcatraz on the other. whether you stay in a basic room or a suite you will be staying in a very nice room for a fair price. i will recommend this hotel to anyone staying in san francisco or anyone in the bay area wanting a staycation.

reviews: we were a group that stayed at this hotel for a work function. initially, the hotel was pretty standard but it was in a good location close to the local sights. the hotel staff was also okay, middle of the road. the reason why i'm giving them one star is because they charged every room minibar fees when none of us used the minibar. when you are travelling for work, you know that your company does not pay for such inflated charges, especially when all meals are planned and prepaid. none of us even knew at the time because we only received the bill under the door that of course didn't include these fees. they never sent us the final bills with these charges. the only way we found out was when we received the credit card statements a month later. i'd understand making an honest mistake for one room, but there were five rooms that were affected by this fraud. this really seems like they make it a regular practice to add minibar fees regardless of it they were actually used. usually we try to stay away from boutique hotels, but thought we'd give this one a shot since they were slightly lower than other. sorry to say we got what we paid for. never going back

original_reviews: we have stayed at the argonaut multiple times. it is very close to the piers and the various activities in the wharf area. the rooms are generally quiet and the top floor rooms have a good view of alcatraz. the lobby is quiet and a great place to hang-out and people watch. the restaurant has a good bar and the food is also great for brunch / breakfast. the rooms are good sized and the bathrooms are relatively modern. the service by the staff is great. very much our favorite hotel in san francisco.

original_reviews: from checking in to checking out and storing my luggage here while i grabbed a bite to eat before heading out to the airport, my experience was nothing but great. anything the hotel could do to make the stay a little better, they did. i flew in and came straight to the hotel for a conference for work, so i didn't pick this location myself. typically these situations make me a little nervous because i don't get to vet the location i'm staying in myself. but when i checked in early, steven at the front desk made it easy and was super accommodating. me and the other guests were given water bottles each time we stopped by the desk, and that was so thoughtful. the room itself was clean, modern, and comfortable. it had liquor and snacks inside (for a charge). there was even an umbrella for guests to use during their stay. if they want to take it with them, they can let the front desk know and they would be charged for it when checking out.

original_reviews: outstanding in every way. great location to see the sights of san francisco. clean, comfortable and the price is a great value.
reviews: our overall stay was okay. tensin at front desk was amazing! super helpful with booking & at check-in. the location is amazing right in the middle of the wharf & close to practically everything down here. our room was great with a partial view of the golden gate but we did have an issue with our tv's connection & netflix a few nights in a row. the wifi isn't the best as it went out a couple times while i was working so just be aware if you're working remotely! most of the employees were helpful (some more than others). it was frustrating to some degree as i felt i was being treated differently due to my age being younger than many of the other guests staying here. there seems to be some confusion with dining as they advertise room service on their website, open until 9:30pm, but when i called at 9 the resturaunt was already closed. when i tried again in the morning, they said they don't offer in-room dining and that i would just pick up my food to-go instead. i'm not entirely sure if i would stay here again solely because of the service i received but if you're just looking for a good location & nearby place to sleep after sightseeing this is your hotel.

original_reviews: incredibly pleased with our stay at the argonaut hotel. the location was right in the heart of fishermans wharf, and could not have been better situated. we reserved a room with bay view and our view of the golden gate bridge, ghirardelli square and the cable cars was priceless! walking distance to some of the best restaurants, right by hyde,st pier, and right near ghirardelli square. cable car roundabout literally just across from the hotel as well. staff was very friendly and helpful, and hotel felt very safe with keys needed to use the elevator and reach your room floor. we would definitely stay here again!
reviews: couldn't be happier. our recent 4 night stay at the argonaut hotel exceeded our expectations .the wonderful staff made us feel welcomed from the moment we first entered the hotel. they were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. the beautiful bay view from our room was amazing. location couldn't have been any better. walking distance to the piers, restaurants, stores and tour locations. it was an amazing experience and will definitely be back.

original_reviews: this hotel isn't very exciting from the outside, but inside was quite nice. i had a rental car, and the valet immediately greeted me when i drove up. the woman at the front desk was kind, answered all of my questions and was very friendly. the room itself was very narrow, but had enough space for one person. two oddities for me - there is a gigantic mirror at the foot of the bed. as someone that's a very light sleeper, having a reflection of myself all night was a bit odd. second, the shower was quite disappointing - i would have expected a hotel like this to have a nicer bathroom. overall though, nothing specific to complain about. the spa services on the website are actually outsourced and occur in your room. this was a first for me, and i booked a massage during my stay. i've never had an in-room massage before so perhaps its not a fair comparison, but for the price i don't think it was worth it despite the massage therapist being quite wonderful. i'd much rather be in a spa, and wouldn't schedule that a second time. i had a room overlooking the bay. this was nice, but i was expecting to be able to enjoy the outside a bit more and that wasn't possible so i personally don't think it was worth the higher room price for the view alone. to touch on the reviews regarding this hotel being haunted - this was corroborated by a bus driver on a tour that i took, but i didn't personally experience anything out of the ordinary! overall this was a nice hotel, in an excellent location, and i would certainly stay here again.
reviews: what a delightful hotel! this is a historic building dating back to the early 1900's. the decor is beautiful and the staff is friendly and eager to help. the hotel is pet friendly and right in the heart of fisherman's wharf.
