original_reviews: excellent location close to the park, the piers, cable car stop, ghirardelli. the rooms were nice, comfortable and had a nautical theme. the staff was friendly and helpful. the restaurant in the hotel is pricey with limited options, but there are a number of restaurants within walking distance. great place to stay if you want to be close to the tourist areas in san francisco.
reviews: unfortunately the walls in the hotel room are paper thin and i could hear my neighbors talking, moving and doing some other physical activity i would prefer not to hear on my solo staycation. i moved hotel rooms so i could have a view of the golden gate bridge versus alcatraz and now i wish i was looking at a former prison than hearing them do the deed. the location is great and i took advantage of the free bike rental. but when i go away on my own for a relaxing staycation i'd prefer to sleep rather than having pillows on top of my head to block out the noise. guess i should've requested to move a second time. sigh.

original_reviews: chose hotel based on reviews and location. we were not disappointed. we were able to walk everywhere and there were incredible views. i loved this hotel, it was super cozy. the staff were all wonderful, cheerful and happy. the room and property were super clean. i loved the aesthetic, with the exposed brick, etc. also, having the blue mermaid restaurant downstairs was super convenient (and the food was really good).
reviews: first, excellent covid-19 safety measurements followed throughout, which includes care packets. the argonaut is the most fantastic historical landmark hotel on the san francisco fisherman's wharf. previously a cannery. a 102 year old building. you will see, and can feel, the historical integrity throughout. a place to have a beautiful and comfortable stay, with the utmost impeccable service. exit and you are truly a stones throw to fisherman's wharf, ghirardelli square, the buena vista (best irish coffee in town), maritime museum, fort trolley service. also, lovely bay area views, walks and parks. hotel is also walking distance to the world famous scoma's restaurant and boudin sourdough bread factory.

original_reviews: we stayed two nights at the argonaut and were overall pretty happy. it's on a very busy street right in the heart of the waterfront - go left as you exit and you'll be right at the cable car & ghirardelli square, and go right as you exit and you'll be on fisherman's wharf. check in went smoothly - they offer a number of tiers of room when you book and we got exactly what we paid for, which was a partial view of alcatraz and the bay. it was directly over the front entrance though so street noise permeated during the daytime. at night the area was much quieter. the hotel is not new but has been maintained fairly well. we were happy with the in room amenities. we took advantage of the valet parking and our car was available within 10 minutes of our numerous requests. we didn't sample the in house restaurant but it looked pretty good and certainly smelled good (lobby always had a waft of brunch). the little nps exhibit in the lobby was also a nice touch to walk around. overall can't beat the location if you want a classic sf tourist experience.
reviews: good location but mediocre overall. paper thin walls and nothing really special about the experience. they sell $6 water bottles in room and that's it. it is communal toiletries which makes me really unsure about cleanliness because of covid. blue mermaid food was nothing special. i probably won't be returning to this hotel.

original_reviews: this review has several layers as we hosted an event here, managed a room block for guests, and stayed at this hotel. i will start with the event since that is where our journey begins. we hosted our wedding in december, 2022 at the maritime ballroom at the argonaut. we were planning our wedding for about a year with diem tran. diem is the best event coordinator we have ever worked with. she is extremely friendly, quick to respond to e-mails, and very professional. a big reason we chose this venue is because we felt comfortable with diem. the venue itself takes imagination. when you go on a tour it is an empty brick room. however once the argonaut staff places all the tables put's out the dance floor and up-lights are added the room becomes very charming. there is also the adjacent del monte courtyard available for the cocktail hour and for your guests to mingle during the reception. the catering staff was very professional and the food came out warm and tasting delicious. great service is a theme of this hotel. everyone staying in our room block was extremely happy with the argonaut. the staff was very helpful and nice and even gave our guests welcome gifts that we curated for them. i have stayed at a lot of hotels and have not stayed at one this size where the staff made it feel like i was staying at a friends house. as for the rooms, this is clincher. the views from the hotel rooms are the best in san francisco hands down. our honeymoon suite was a corner suite thatoverlooked ghirardelli square and the golden gate bridge on one side and alcatraz on the other. whether you stay in a basic room or a suite you will be staying in a very nice room for a fair price. i will recommend this hotel to anyone staying in san francisco or anyone in the bay area wanting a staycation.
reviews: wonderful staff! room was clean, fresh and the bed was comfortable. we opened the window to listen to the rain. the concierge, angela, was so very kind and helpful. she went out of her way to set up our trip to muir woods. thank you for helping and helping us check off my bucket list.

original_reviews: deysa was very helpful after a bad experience with reservation line. our room was large with great view. i do wish they had shower caps in room, and i prefer little single use toiletries versus the reusable bottles they use. we were excited for thanksgiving dinner. however, my daughter and i both got sick after eating it (very disappointing considering it was $75 each and quite honestly not very flavorful). we always choose this hotel because of great service & location to everything. however, a lot of restaurants directly across from hotel have closed down. i really like this hotel, but the hallway carpet desperately needs to be replaced. it was unsightly, stained & smelled. it's very off putting, especially when you trip at seams that are separated. again, 4 stars because of deysa, but definitely wouldn't eat another holiday meal here.

original_reviews: we were a group that stayed at this hotel for a work function. initially, the hotel was pretty standard but it was in a good location close to the local sights. the hotel staff was also okay, middle of the road. the reason why i'm giving them one star is because they charged every room minibar fees when none of us used the minibar. when you are travelling for work, you know that your company does not pay for such inflated charges, especially when all meals are planned and prepaid. none of us even knew at the time because we only received the bill under the door that of course didn't include these fees. they never sent us the final bills with these charges. the only way we found out was when we received the credit card statements a month later. i'd understand making an honest mistake for one room, but there were five rooms that were affected by this fraud. this really seems like they make it a regular practice to add minibar fees regardless of it they were actually used. usually we try to stay away from boutique hotels, but thought we'd give this one a shot since they were slightly lower than other. sorry to say we got what we paid for. never going back
reviews: the argonaut hotel is a beautiful brown stone corner building building next to the shops and eateries of the del monte cannery building. luxurious hotel with impeccable hospitality and sincerely helpful staff.

reviews: two stars for the great location and that's about it. we stayed in a suite which looked like it hadn't been renovated in 30 years. size was great at over 900 sq. feet and the corner view was good. the toilet smelled like a hundred years of flatulence. the kind of smell that only a renovation can address. on top of that, the toilet paper, towels, and pillows are of a grade reserved for cheaper motels, not a $1k a night. the bedding was not hygienic, they take a flat sheet and wrap it around the comforter and it smelled like they only wash the sheet and not the comforter, the smell works as a wake up call. there was mold in the bathroom. if you are looking for luxury, this is not the place. staff was adequate, they do their best with what their employer provides them. it is a historic building that has a good location to fisherman's wharf. if you go with the cheaper rooms you get an inside view of a concrete courtyard which is probably their best value in terms of what they can provide; location without frills. if you want a luxury suite in the same price range and location, there is the hotel fairmont in ghirardelli square.

original_reviews: we stayed here over the long weekend and i thought it was fine. i wouldn't come here again but it wasn't horrible.
reviews: we came here for a staycation and it was great. the rooms were a lot bigger than expected for the location and were pretty comfortable. for this type of hotel, i'd probably expect slightly nicer bathrooms but overall it was good. they are also dog friendly and the dog had a very enjoyable time. the location is great - right by fisherman's warf and ghiradelli square (a bit touristy for me usually but every now and then is nice) and you can easily walk to the water. lots of nice restaurant options around too. the hotel restaurant does have a restaurant with a nice courtyard type area. didn't try the food but did go for cocktails which were good. some stuff could be a bit more efficient (getting stuff brought to the room, bag check, valet etc) but overall had a solid visit and would recommend this hotel if you are visiting san francisco.

original_reviews: horrible bed, coffee, thin walls, sandpaper sheets, $85 for parking! i'm not going to waste more time but $250 for room, $75 online fees plus $30 when you get there plus $85 to park.
reviews: absolutely amazing staff and service, they really saved us from sleeping on the street last night with incredible service. i highly recommend going here above any of the main stream hotels.
cleaned_advanced: absolutely amazing staff service really saved u sleeping street last night incredible service highly recommend going main stream hotel

original_reviews: our overall stay was okay. tensin at front desk was amazing! super helpful with booking & at check-in. the location is amazing right in the middle of the wharf & close to practically everything down here. our room was great with a partial view of the golden gate but we did have an issue with our tv's connection & netflix a few nights in a row. the wifi isn't the best as it went out a couple times while i was working so just be aware if you're working remotely! most of the employees were helpful (some more than others). it was frustrating to some degree as i felt i was being treated differently due to my age being younger than many of the other guests staying here. there seems to be some confusion with dining as they advertise room service on their website, open until 9:30pm, but when i called at 9 the resturaunt was already closed. when i tried again in the morning, they said they don't offer in-room dining and that i would just pick up my food to-go instead. i'm not entirely sure if i would stay here again solely because of the service i received but if you're just looking for a good location & nearby place to sleep after sightseeing this is your hotel.
reviews: this place was terrible. poor service. couldn't check us into our room for several hours after stated 3pm check-in. lobby smells like a dirty cafeteria. there is barely any service staff at all to help with much of anything. awful.
cleaned_advanced: place terrible poor service couldnt check u several hour stated pm checkin lobby smell like dirty cafeteria barely service staff help much anything awful

original_reviews: the staff were all terrific. veronica, corrine and the rest of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. they made our stay perfect. perfect location, good gym and pet friendly. we had dinner at the blue mermaid on-site. mac and cheese with crab, and chowder with crab were both very good. we will definitely stay here again.
reviews: participated in organizing in two professional events here and both times felt the support staff and amenities were good at a price that was palatable. the views (if you do outside seating in the small plaza) are pleasant and calming, even on a saturday. the ballrooms less so but good enough. the provided bar and barstaff were ok, no complaints from our visiting patrons. i wouldn't be against renting a ballroom here again or opting for an outside seating function here.

original_reviews: couldn't be happier. our recent 4 night stay at the argonaut hotel exceeded our expectations .the wonderful staff made us feel welcomed from the moment we first entered the hotel. they were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. the beautiful bay view from our room was amazing. location couldn't have been any better. walking distance to the piers, restaurants, stores and tour locations. it was an amazing experience and will definitely be back.
reviews: the only issue we have with visiting the argonaut is that we don't visit enough. the staff is simply amazing to work with. we have been booking blocks of rooms with the argonaut for years now for our workshops every year. we have multiple workshops and they are our preferred hotel of choice. it's important to note that our company allows us to decide who we want to work with and my team and i consistently choose argonaut. the accommodations are lovely and consistent. the rooms are very cool and always clean. i know this because i've toured the rooms and i ask the attendees how they felt. no complaints to date, always great feedback. this hotel is a special gem - it was once a cannery and they kept the charm of the history with the theme of their decor. also important are the other areas that can be rented for events. there is this very cool outdoor spot that is just gorgeous and perfect for a small workshop. the indoor space is just as grand. our conference numbers have grown otherwise we would book the space they have. from the front desk to the coordinators for room blocks, everyone is super friendly and helpful. we works specifically with ayu and michelle. these two ladies are the absolute best. i honestly cannot say enough good things about our experience here. it's so great we book our room blocks for the year without a single worry about being trapped in a bad situation. they are one of the very best hotel accommodations in san francisco, and they are right on fisherman's wharf. very close to some great bars, restaurants and entertainment. we will continue to book with their awesome team.

original_reviews: what a delightful hotel! this is a historic building dating back to the early 1900's. the decor is beautiful and the staff is friendly and eager to help. the hotel is pet friendly and right in the heart of fisherman's wharf.
reviews: pretty disappointing stay, particularly because the was almost empty due to fears over the coronavirus. when we arrived we were assigned arguably the worst room in the hotel (second floor interior, dark, view of roofing, etc.) after specifically requesting an upper floor and bay view. my guess is that the room assignment may have been because we were able to secure an excellent rate due to march visit and low occupancy. not sure why our request was completely ignored. television was glitchy, turning off at will, and when we request a late checkout, we were told check out is noon, no exceptions, regardless of occupancy, etc. have stayed at this property in the past and enjoyed it very much as it's location is perfect for exploring the fisherman's wharf area, access to cable cars, ghirardelli square, etc. not this time, particularly at this price point. even with a great deal, we still paid $250.00 per night. we had a choice between the fairmont and the argonaut hotel, both at the same price point at this point in time. we made a mistake. it's not the cool, class hotel we've frequented in the past. very dissatisfied and disappointing.

original_reviews: unfortunately the walls in the hotel room are paper thin and i could hear my neighbors talking, moving and doing some other physical activity i would prefer not to hear on my solo staycation. i moved hotel rooms so i could have a view of the golden gate bridge versus alcatraz and now i wish i was looking at a former prison than hearing them do the deed. the location is great and i took advantage of the free bike rental. but when i go away on my own for a relaxing staycation i'd prefer to sleep rather than having pillows on top of my head to block out the noise. guess i should've requested to move a second time. sigh.
reviews: it was a nice hotel, checking in was easy, it was my first time to san francisco and i was tired lol sell the bed sounds great, room service food wasn't that great but i guess you can only expect so much from places.
cleaned_advanced: nice checking easy first time san francisco tired lol sell bed sound great service food wasnt great guess expect much place

original_reviews: first, excellent covid-19 safety measurements followed throughout, which includes care packets. the argonaut is the most fantastic historical landmark hotel on the san francisco fisherman's wharf. previously a cannery. a 102 year old building. you will see, and can feel, the historical integrity throughout. a place to have a beautiful and comfortable stay, with the utmost impeccable service. exit and you are truly a stones throw to fisherman's wharf, ghirardelli square, the buena vista (best irish coffee in town), maritime museum, fort trolley service. also, lovely bay area views, walks and parks. hotel is also walking distance to the world famous scoma's restaurant and boudin sourdough bread factory.
reviews: this hotel was in a prime location and close to pier 39 and all the sites to see at fisherman's warf. the hotel was stylish and clean. the staff was very accommodating and we very much enjoyed our stay there. nice nuances and little nautical designer touches that make this hotel above the rest. we highly recommend and would definitely stay there again or refer this hotel to family and friend!
cleaned_advanced: prime location close pier site see fisherman warf stylish clean staff accommodating much enjoyed nice nuance little nautical designer touch make rest highly recommend would definitely refer family friend

original_reviews: good location but mediocre overall. paper thin walls and nothing really special about the experience. they sell $6 water bottles in room and that's it. it is communal toiletries which makes me really unsure about cleanliness because of covid. blue mermaid food was nothing special. i probably won't be returning to this hotel.
reviews: great location and clean hotel. checkin was a bit slow i think because it was late at night and the front desk guy was having to pull double duty with valet tasks.
cleaned_advanced: great location clean checkin bit slow think late night front desk guy pull double duty valet task

original_reviews: wonderful staff! room was clean, fresh and the bed was comfortable. we opened the window to listen to the rain. the concierge, angela, was so very kind and helpful. she went out of her way to set up our trip to muir woods. thank you for helping and helping us check off my bucket list.
reviews: very difficult customer service. we had a 2-night reservation which we made directly with the hotel. we were forced to cancel due to unforeseen circumstances. we called them directly and cancelled 4 days in advance. their policy is at least 2 days in advance. they said we would get a refund. never got it. called them 10 days later and they said we would not get a refund. when i tried to talk to them on the phone they were rude and dismissive. they finally refunded after we raised bloody hell. all of this through numerous phone calls, etc etc. impossible to know what was going on. this place has really gone downhill since kimpton hotels sold it to this lower-rated group.

original_reviews: such a cute nautical theme hotel! highly recommend! the staff at check in were pleasant and efficient! they have valet parking so you don't have to deal with it in sf! between the comfy beds and pillows, it's the location that we love. near ghirardelli and the pier plus my husband runs the half marathon so it's the best location for his race. the biggest part is check out is at noon. we can enjoy some breakfast and resting after my hubby's race! bonus: gotta love (and take advantage) that wine bar downstairs. daemon at the wine bar is hilarious.
reviews: check in took about 45 minutes and resulted in me getting a room with someone already in it. when i first arrived, the check in line took about 20 minutes for the three people ahead of me. apparently, they are upgrading their system. i don't know why they chose to do this when there was a big conference going on. when i finally got to my room the key wouldn't work. went back down stairs and waited in the line again, another 20 minutes. when i got my new key, i went to the room, opened the door and someone was already in it! i went back down stairs and was told the check in person put in the wrong number. i was finally given a room that worked.

original_reviews: it's a nice location, but attention to detail badly needed.trash still in room,candy or pills in the corner of the east elevator,left with the impression that breakfast would be deliver to room left tip for that then finely picked it up myself needed to move the outside heater to have some warmth was told that it couldn't be moved due to plumbing connections i could see the propane tank inside. dinner napkins well by this point i am doing the staff's job. final note sunday morning i need coffee go down sit at the bar, i may be invisible since the 2 people who came behind the bar did not say a peep. in the end if your going to lie to your paying guests have enough self respect to tell one that sounds good.
reviews: my husband and i were excited to stay here because of it's beautiful location and photos online. it was expensive ($455) but decided to splurge for one night. for the price we were disappointed with the attention to detail. the hotel itself was beautiful. the doorman was very helpful with tips of where to eat and what to do. the bellman/concierge was also very friendly. my reason for a two star rating is that our room, although on the surface was clean as we looked further, it was not. we found a dirty sock in the closet and the creamer was so old and curdled when poured in my coffee. also, the restrooms in the lobby had two stalls with no toilet paper in them. i didn't take a picture as i was already annoyed with the previous two things. it was not a bad experience, but for the price, this was disappointing. we stayed there 01/22/20.

original_reviews: the argonaut hotel is a beautiful brown stone corner building building next to the shops and eateries of the del monte cannery building. luxurious hotel with impeccable hospitality and sincerely helpful staff.
reviews: overpriced for what you get. price of a high end luxury hotel but really bad quality and service all around. they also sneak in extra fees here and there. i'll never come back.
cleaned_advanced: overpriced get price high end luxury really bad quality service around also sneak extra fee ill never come back

original_reviews: two stars for the great location and that's about it. we stayed in a suite which looked like it hadn't been renovated in 30 years. size was great at over 900 sq. feet and the corner view was good. the toilet smelled like a hundred years of flatulence. the kind of smell that only a renovation can address. on top of that, the toilet paper, towels, and pillows are of a grade reserved for cheaper motels, not a $1k a night. the bedding was not hygienic, they take a flat sheet and wrap it around the comforter and it smelled like they only wash the sheet and not the comforter, the smell works as a wake up call. there was mold in the bathroom. if you are looking for luxury, this is not the place. staff was adequate, they do their best with what their employer provides them. it is a historic building that has a good location to fisherman's wharf. if you go with the cheaper rooms you get an inside view of a concrete courtyard which is probably their best value in terms of what they can provide; location without frills. if you want a luxury suite in the same price range and location, there is the hotel fairmont in ghirardelli square.
reviews: the hotel is nice and the basic rooms are clean and comfortable but the staff is so unwelcoming. literally every person we encountered, whether it was the front desk or in room dining, made us feel like we were bothering them for asking basic questions. the night audit guy was particularly unhelpful. typically if you can't accommodate a request, you come up with some sort of solution. in his case though, he couldn't have been less interested in what we were saying. i know people have bad days, but come on; if you can't put on a smile and be helpful you may want to reconsider being in hospitality. everyone at the restaurant and the guy at the valet were nice, pleasant and helpful, though. probably will stay somewhere else next staycation.

original_reviews: 5 stars for location on the wharf and amazing, friendly staff who go above and beyond. note to hotel manager about 356 - clean your jacuzzi tub jets and fix the water pressure in the shower. we'll be back soon!
reviews: the atmosphere is nautical. quality in a minimal style sea charm. love the name, too. the family area downstairs has board games but is very drafty. the decoration was a xmas at sea feel for me. loved the candy the front desk staff shared along with treasures for children from the sea chest (as trader joe's does). two brothers both work the front desk and it's delightful to see the homely style of service. sweet guys! expensive is the nearby restaurant as we only got a spending allowance for breakfast and not a meal. however, staff are nice letting you grab an extra takeaway coffee.

original_reviews: absolutely adorable. pristine clean and terrific walkable location to anything you want/need in sfo. the trolley car turn around is literally across the street so if you can't walk around to what you want to explore, you can ride. they also offer complimentary bikes. we arrived late and tired and the room and reception was perfect. they recommended the in house restaurant which we had not known about, and were so tired we thought well we'll try it. so glad we did. it was excellent. i had the fettuccini alfredo and added grilled chicken. might have been the best chicken i've ever eaten and i've eaten chicken all over the world (except china). daughter had the salmon and some sort of chowder. staff was masked and distanced and very accomodating as well as cheerful, which is especially appreciated in these covid travel times.. and just a 20 minute ride to the airport. i look forward to my return.
reviews: i absolutely love this hotel. we have stayed here several times while visiting sf, and it will now be our hotel of choice every time we come to the city. the location is beyond perfect. walking distance to fisherman's wharf/pier, ghirardelli square, trolleys, tour boats, and so much more. i love that they are pet friendly; and not just friendly, but they genuinely make you feel like your fur babies are welcome, cherished guests. they put your pet's name on a welcome board, say hello to them, offering them treats, and water. so comforting when you have to travel with your pets. the rooms are beautiful, spacious, and clean. i love the exposed wood beams and brick in the rooms. the beds are comfortable, and the provided toiletries are luxurious.

original_reviews: walking by you wouldn't think nothing about thus place but once you walk in you're taken back by the beauty. the ambiance is definitely breathtaking. everything is really right there from the winery next door if you're in the mood to come downstairs or just relax in the chairs in their amazing lobby. great customer service and great experience.
reviews: as a passerby, this hotel is beautiful. but what makes this hotel amazing is the service. zuri, a young lady who works at the front desk, does not resist assistance to those who are not staying at the hotel-- but rather does everything she can to help. i would stay here, simply because of her! thank you, zuri.
cleaned_advanced: passerby beautiful make amazing service zuri young lady work front desk resist assistance staying rather everything help would simply thank zuri

original_reviews: we booked this hotel because i had a surgery in the sf area and we wanted to bring our dog. this hotel went above and beyond to make us comfortable. from giving my dog pets and treats, to helping with luggage, getting me a kettle for tea post-surgery and upgrading us to a fantastic suite ...we were 100% satisfied. we will only stay here from now on. this place is worth the money. the location is also fantastic and so close to literally everything in san francisco. grateful for a stress-free recovery during the 3 days i spent here.
reviews: very nice,clean place to stay. downstairs bar and restaurant, very comfortable with a pleasant staff. one major caveat however; the quoted price is a far cry from the actual cost at checkout. while most of us are accustomed to a few additional charges at departure, these added costs,while probably legal,ethical would be a stretch. there was even a separate "tax" on the 75.00/night car park. ask before committing.

original_reviews: wonderful place. beautiful room and restaurant. kind and caring staff who made me and my daughter feel very special. we will always remember our visit to san francisco because of the argonaut. and oh my gracious--the crab and corn chowder! it was scrumptious!
reviews: the argonaut hotel in san francisco is a great place to stay when you are in san francisco. not only is it right on the wharf the staff is very helpful, friendly, and all around great. when you come please say hi to the doorman with the great yellow and blue shoes.

original_reviews: if you're visiting san francisco and staying at fisherman's wharf this is definitely the place to stay. it's right near the action and it's very clean, and beautifully decorated. the staff are all delightful to interact with. we were offered to upgrade our room so we got a bay view for a little more each night. the only thing i would advise is that they placed an additional $300 hold because i think they wanted me to spend that at their restaurant ( which was the most expensive mediocre breakfast i've ever had ever $73.00 for eggs and toast and meat). other than that, it's an amazing place to stay! i would stay here again.
reviews: excellent location on the wharf. great selection of rooms and delicious restaurant attached to hotel. 20 restaurants with-in 1 mile of the hotel and all of them are worth stopping in and visiting. great seafood and italian around every corner.
cleaned_advanced: excellent location wharf great selection delicious restaurant attached restaurant within mile worth stopping visiting great seafood italian around every corner

original_reviews: we enjoyed our time here. we loved how it was right next to a large park to walk the dog. each room comes with chromecast to easily stream from devices. beds were comfortable. parking was expensive but at least the cars are parked in a secure location.
reviews: we were evacuees from the kincade fire in santa rosa. we will never forget the care extended to us by everyone at the argonaut hotel. we reserved here because they are pet-friendly and were astonished to learn that they offered a substantially discounted rate to fire evacuees. everything is a bit of a blur right now, but i think we were there for four or five nights. the staff is lovely and extremely responsive to every request we had. my husband has limited mobility. we ate all of our meals either at the hotel restaurant, the blue mermaid, or from room service. the food was delicious, very fresh, and plentiful. the menu has lots of healthy options but also some splurges. the salmon dishes were particularly well-prepared. and my nightly mescal margarita was the best i've had. no skimping on the mescal. our room was clean, comfortable, and very quiet. i read the review that down-graded the hotel for the garage they use charging for all three cars. this is not the hotel's choice. the reviewers beef is with the garage, not the hotel, and i wish they would revise their review to reflect that. we will definitely return here, either as vacationers or evacuees. thanks to everyone at the argonaut. you are much appreciated.

original_reviews: such a lovely hotel in a great location! we were blessed with a king suite and honestly, it was amazing! a great jetted tub in our huge bathroom, along with a really comfy king sized bed and a wonderful sitting area. the staff was really nice, especially brandon who helped us to our room with our massive amount of luggage. we were there on the 4th of july and it was so fun to be right next to where the fireworks were. we loved our stay and experience!
reviews: extremely insensitive staff upon check in. we booked this hotel a few weeks ago for a fun trip, however we were evacuated from our home in santa rosa this morning at 5 am, along with a large portion of sonoma county and our homes are currently under threat of perishing. we have three cars instead of the planned single car. we asked being that we are fire evacuees in a declared state of emergency, if we could be given a discount for parking or some help. we were told they don't have control over parking and could self park around the corner got $47 each. all of our valuables and belongings were stuffed into our cars. the only reason i'm giving 2 stars is because the bellboys outside were the only staff who showed some humanity to our situation and were very helpful unpacking our cars and getting our stuff to the room. the desk was extremely cold and unhelpful. it's quite shocking that given the current situation, the hotel desk really could care less about our predicament.

original_reviews: excellent location and very friendly staff. they gave us a free covid protection package at checkin, which is nice. the only minor issues is they don't have their own parking and the nearest parking lot recommended by the door man is full, thus we end up having to find a different parking place (not too far). we will choose valet parking next time instead of self parking to avoid the problem if having to solve the parking lot full problem
reviews: this has been one of my favorite places for many years until now. having made a reservation almost a month ago my family and i arrived at 11pm to find that the hotel was sold out and the only rooms left were a single queen or a handicapped accessible room with no tub and two queens. pretty sure the hotel gave my room to someone who arrived earlier in the evening. didn't get the room i booked and the snarker gentlemen at the front desk let it be known that my family's comfort and interest in staying here again was not his concern. super bummed. was really looking forward to being here but we won't be coming back. room 220

original_reviews: we came here for a staycation and it was great. the rooms were a lot bigger than expected for the location and were pretty comfortable. for this type of hotel, i'd probably expect slightly nicer bathrooms but overall it was good. they are also dog friendly and the dog had a very enjoyable time. the location is great - right by fisherman's warf and ghiradelli square (a bit touristy for me usually but every now and then is nice) and you can easily walk to the water. lots of nice restaurant options around too. the hotel restaurant does have a restaurant with a nice courtyard type area. didn't try the food but did go for cocktails which were good. some stuff could be a bit more efficient (getting stuff brought to the room, bag check, valet etc) but overall had a solid visit and would recommend this hotel if you are visiting san francisco.
reviews: the best thing about this place is the location. i loved that it was in the old del monte cannery, cool detail. the lobby had much nicer style and decor than the rooms. the room looked was a disneyland cruise ship, cheesy nautical. our room was large but the use of space was terrible leaving a large useless area in the center of the room. the bathroom was small, the couch awkwardly faced a blank wall and the desk was touching the bed when there was all this unused space. the tv didn't have movie channels, in fact it had fewer channels than most hotels. granted, we were only in our room to basically sleep but this hotel seriously lacked the amenities that one expects with the rates and additional fees argonaut charges. aside from the housekeeping cleaning everything spotless, there's nothing praise worthy for the staff. going in and out of the hotel, we saw the doormen most frequently and there was only one occasion when they acknowledged us. the rest of the times we passed by them while they stood there doing nothing and helping no one. on day 2, we were walking behind a woman who fell in front of them before entering the hotel and they just watched and chuckled. during my stay, this hotel was publicly advertising breakfast for two with the purchase of a room. all we got was a $10 coupon. i inquired with the front desk about the false advertising and they said the coupon can be used for breakfast. there's nothing on the breakfast menu for $5 or even $10, what a bunch of liars.

original_reviews: absolutely amazing staff and service, they really saved us from sleeping on the street last night with incredible service. i highly recommend going here above any of the main stream hotels.
reviews: we just loved this hotel. great service and location and was quiet. the only disappointment was service during breakfast in the restaurant.

original_reviews: this place was terrible. poor service. couldn't check us into our room for several hours after stated 3pm check-in. lobby smells like a dirty cafeteria. there is barely any service staff at all to help with much of anything. awful.
reviews: once again we had an incredible stay at your hotel! not only are the staff wonderful and accommodating but the overall experience was stellar. the beds are incredibly comfortable and the linens incredibly soft. the interior design is absolutely beautiful i love this hotel. it is one of my favorites in the nation!
cleaned_advanced: incredible staff wonderful accommodating overall experience stellar bed incredibly comfortable linen incredibly soft interior design absolutely beautiful love one favorite nation

original_reviews: participated in organizing in two professional events here and both times felt the support staff and amenities were good at a price that was palatable. the views (if you do outside seating in the small plaza) are pleasant and calming, even on a saturday. the ballrooms less so but good enough. the provided bar and barstaff were ok, no complaints from our visiting patrons. i wouldn't be against renting a ballroom here again or opting for an outside seating function here.
reviews: our hotel options are a bit limited when traveling with our dog. we decided on the argonaut and i'm so glad we did.
cleaned_advanced: option bit limited traveling dog decided argonaut im glad

original_reviews: the only issue we have with visiting the argonaut is that we don't visit enough. the staff is simply amazing to work with. we have been booking blocks of rooms with the argonaut for years now for our workshops every year. we have multiple workshops and they are our preferred hotel of choice. it's important to note that our company allows us to decide who we want to work with and my team and i consistently choose argonaut. the accommodations are lovely and consistent. the rooms are very cool and always clean. i know this because i've toured the rooms and i ask the attendees how they felt. no complaints to date, always great feedback. this hotel is a special gem - it was once a cannery and they kept the charm of the history with the theme of their decor. also important are the other areas that can be rented for events. there is this very cool outdoor spot that is just gorgeous and perfect for a small workshop. the indoor space is just as grand. our conference numbers have grown otherwise we would book the space they have. from the front desk to the coordinators for room blocks, everyone is super friendly and helpful. we works specifically with ayu and michelle. these two ladies are the absolute best. i honestly cannot say enough good things about our experience here. it's so great we book our room blocks for the year without a single worry about being trapped in a bad situation. they are one of the very best hotel accommodations in san francisco, and they are right on fisherman's wharf. very close to some great bars, restaurants and entertainment. we will continue to book with their awesome team.
reviews: kinda cheesy and overdone with the jules verne theme. plus, you would think a brick building would have thicker walls. the woman in the room next door just sneezed, and i wouldn't swear to it, but i think i got a spray from it. and what's with staff ringing doorbell but not waiting for an answer before bathing in? it happened twice, and we were there less than 24 hours. change of review. the company they contact with for parking is awful. for $75, our car should not be held hostage.

original_reviews: pretty disappointing stay, particularly because the was almost empty due to fears over the coronavirus. when we arrived we were assigned arguably the worst room in the hotel (second floor interior, dark, view of roofing, etc.) after specifically requesting an upper floor and bay view. my guess is that the room assignment may have been because we were able to secure an excellent rate due to march visit and low occupancy. not sure why our request was completely ignored. television was glitchy, turning off at will, and when we request a late checkout, we were told check out is noon, no exceptions, regardless of occupancy, etc. have stayed at this property in the past and enjoyed it very much as it's location is perfect for exploring the fisherman's wharf area, access to cable cars, ghirardelli square, etc. not this time, particularly at this price point. even with a great deal, we still paid $250.00 per night. we had a choice between the fairmont and the argonaut hotel, both at the same price point at this point in time. we made a mistake. it's not the cool, class hotel we've frequented in the past. very dissatisfied and disappointing.
reviews: not a bad hotel but not a great hotel. but a decent hotel for the price and the location. i didn't want to spend 1k a night at the fairmont nearby so choices in our price comfort range was slim pickings. it seems like the better choice hotels are in the financial district but that's too far from where my daughter lives in sf. yes the king bed rooms are super narrow, yes the walls are a bit thin, yes there's no fan in the bathroom. but it's clean, the front desk and house cleaners are friendly and efficient and the bed is comfortable enough. this hotel definitely does its job and i will return when i have to stay in the area again.

original_reviews: it was a nice hotel, checking in was easy, it was my first time to san francisco and i was tired lol sell the bed sounds great, room service food wasn't that great but i guess you can only expect so much from places.
reviews: stayed here for two nights on a weekday. awesome hotel, good people, great location. checking in was cool, matthew checked us in. nice guy and was easy process.

original_reviews: this hotel was in a prime location and close to pier 39 and all the sites to see at fisherman's warf. the hotel was stylish and clean. the staff was very accommodating and we very much enjoyed our stay there. nice nuances and little nautical designer touches that make this hotel above the rest. we highly recommend and would definitely stay there again or refer this hotel to family and friend!
reviews: do not stay here! beyond what all the other reviews say about thin walls, lazy wifi, the staff is horrible. the cleaners stole my jewelry and when i called to talk to a manager they just kept redirecting me to the housekeeping staff who lied to me and kept me on hold forever. there are soooooo many better places to stay in sf that have honest staff working for them.

original_reviews: great location and clean hotel. checkin was a bit slow i think because it was late at night and the front desk guy was having to pull double duty with valet tasks.
reviews: great stay at the wharf. rooms with a nautical theme, great food and cozy lobby with a fireplace to relax. front doormen and staff very friendly. concierge matthew was excellent to work with and provided many great recommendations throughout our weekend stay. hotel rooms are quite noisy with screaming kids and slamming doors. bathrooms could use an update and thorough cleaning. location is good with many restaurant options, shopping, bike rentals and the cable car.

original_reviews: very difficult customer service. we had a 2-night reservation which we made directly with the hotel. we were forced to cancel due to unforeseen circumstances. we called them directly and cancelled 4 days in advance. their policy is at least 2 days in advance. they said we would get a refund. never got it. called them 10 days later and they said we would not get a refund. when i tried to talk to them on the phone they were rude and dismissive. they finally refunded after we raised bloody hell. all of this through numerous phone calls, etc etc. impossible to know what was going on. this place has really gone downhill since kimpton hotels sold it to this lower-rated group.
reviews: this hotel is horrible. they charged me in full for my reservation and will not let me cancel. when my wife called to change the reservation, the reservations manager hung up on her! this hotel is mismanaged and has unethical business practice. we will be reporting them to the better business bureau. be aware. do not book here if you don't want to be out the money!

original_reviews: check in took about 45 minutes and resulted in me getting a room with someone already in it. when i first arrived, the check in line took about 20 minutes for the three people ahead of me. apparently, they are upgrading their system. i don't know why they chose to do this when there was a big conference going on. when i finally got to my room the key wouldn't work. went back down stairs and waited in the line again, another 20 minutes. when i got my new key, i went to the room, opened the door and someone was already in it! i went back down stairs and was told the check in person put in the wrong number. i was finally given a room that worked.
reviews: if i could give a zero star i would. booked less than 24 hours ago and realized that the dates of our stay were wrong. called the hotel and they are refusing to refund my credit card for the cost of over $700, even though the charge is so new it is still pending. they even refuse to modify the dates for us. they need to understand that customer service is paramount in the success of a business.

original_reviews: my husband and i were excited to stay here because of it's beautiful location and photos online. it was expensive ($455) but decided to splurge for one night. for the price we were disappointed with the attention to detail. the hotel itself was beautiful. the doorman was very helpful with tips of where to eat and what to do. the bellman/concierge was also very friendly. my reason for a two star rating is that our room, although on the surface was clean as we looked further, it was not. we found a dirty sock in the closet and the creamer was so old and curdled when poured in my coffee. also, the restrooms in the lobby had two stalls with no toilet paper in them. i didn't take a picture as i was already annoyed with the previous two things. it was not a bad experience, but for the price, this was disappointing. we stayed there 01/22/20.
reviews: buyer beware! the accommodations are nice but we booked our room at the same time as our traveling companions via the same method. we paid a premium for a regular room with a view and our friends chose not to. upon arrival, our friends received a free upgrade to a premium room with the same view as ours so they ended up with a nicer room with the same view for about $500 less than our room for a 3 night stay. we were offered no free upgrades or discounts. very uneven and unfair practice! be very cautious!

original_reviews: overpriced for what you get. price of a high end luxury hotel but really bad quality and service all around. they also sneak in extra fees here and there. i'll never come back.
reviews: wow, so nice from the valet to front steak. our pup was loved and played with by all. such a fun location right in the heart of tourist central. it's been a million years since i've been in san francisco but i felt instantly at home
cleaned_advanced: wow nice valet front steak pup loved played fun location right heart tourist central million year since ive san francisco felt instantly home

original_reviews: the hotel is nice and the basic rooms are clean and comfortable but the staff is so unwelcoming. literally every person we encountered, whether it was the front desk or in room dining, made us feel like we were bothering them for asking basic questions. the night audit guy was particularly unhelpful. typically if you can't accommodate a request, you come up with some sort of solution. in his case though, he couldn't have been less interested in what we were saying. i know people have bad days, but come on; if you can't put on a smile and be helpful you may want to reconsider being in hospitality. everyone at the restaurant and the guy at the valet were nice, pleasant and helpful, though. probably will stay somewhere else next staycation.
reviews: "boutique hotel" sure has become a superfluous title thrown around these days... it's really just a way to jack up the pricing for literally everything, with little support to back it up when there's a problem. i won't spend too much time reiterating what others have said: thin walls, so you hear what's going on around you, the "prison yard" esque view of the inside rooms (good one, reviewer), the toilet paper holder beyond reach of the toilet (at least my room did have an extra roll on the back of the toilet), a bed that's rock hard but pillows that are so soft they really can't be called pillows because your head shouldn't be allowed to meld with the mattress when using pillows, etc. upon check-in, the front desk agent gave me a key to the mini bar in case i wanted to refrigerate any of my own stuff. when i got into my room, i noticed it was already unlocked. i flagged this with the desk because i have not consumed anything and will not be paying for it if they try and tell me i have upon checkout. $100/night "hold" for incidentals is ludicrous. as if i'm going to run out of here with the $49 umbrella, $26 small bottle of wine, $14 stuffed plush seal, and the $3.25 two ounce bag of cheetos and not pay for any of it. this is why you keep the card on file, you don't preemptively run a charge for each night. my room has a mirror facing the bed. any designer worth their salt should tell you this is bad feng shui, whether you prescribe to that line of thinking or not, it's just bad practice for sleeping arrangements. sex room/dungeon, okay sure, but just sleeping not so much. my biggest gripe comes from a tech standpoint. i'm in town for a conference, thus need reliable wifi to do work. my first day in, i successfully purchase the $14.95/day upgrade to connect up to three devices - and all worked smoothly. by the time i returned to hotel next day, upgrade expired so i attempted to purchase another. my laptop browser would not automatically open the webpage to allow this. now, being a tech savvy person, i know how to troubleshoot the basics. forget the wifi and try again, clear my browser cache, see if the page auto-loads in another browser, restart the computer. funnily enough, i was able to purchase the upgrade on my phone, but still couldn't get my laptop to open the damn page. so, of course i call front desk to ask for the website that should be loading so i can load it manually. if the way the site recognizes you is to enter your room number and last name, *it should be accessible manually*. front desk person was nice enough, but clueless. she put me on hold to talk to someone else who told me to try all the things above again. thanks but no thanks. tried everything 10+ times already. nada. as i type this i'm still on the slow-as-molasses free wifi that says you get 5mb speeds, but i've never broken 2.6mb the entire time. thankfully it's just fast enough to put in this critical review. management: get your staff educated on the website to enter for manual connection to the paid wifi. this is an option, as i've done so at other hotels. i probably won't be staying here again, but i can't be the only person this has happened to and felt it worth noting for others in town for work and not tourism.

original_reviews: the atmosphere is nautical. quality in a minimal style sea charm. love the name, too. the family area downstairs has board games but is very drafty. the decoration was a xmas at sea feel for me. loved the candy the front desk staff shared along with treasures for children from the sea chest (as trader joe's does). two brothers both work the front desk and it's delightful to see the homely style of service. sweet guys! expensive is the nearby restaurant as we only got a spending allowance for breakfast and not a meal. however, staff are nice letting you grab an extra takeaway coffee.
reviews: despite its location in the heart of a tourist trap, it was rather pleasant. this was mainly to do with the lack of tourists in early april. i suspect that during high season the experience would be like sitting on top of an ant hill. the only major problem was that each day when i ordered an omelette from the restaurant the wrong breakfast item arrived.

original_reviews: i absolutely love this hotel. we have stayed here several times while visiting sf, and it will now be our hotel of choice every time we come to the city. the location is beyond perfect. walking distance to fisherman's wharf/pier, ghirardelli square, trolleys, tour boats, and so much more. i love that they are pet friendly; and not just friendly, but they genuinely make you feel like your fur babies are welcome, cherished guests. they put your pet's name on a welcome board, say hello to them, offering them treats, and water. so comforting when you have to travel with your pets. the rooms are beautiful, spacious, and clean. i love the exposed wood beams and brick in the rooms. the beds are comfortable, and the provided toiletries are luxurious.
reviews: i cant rave about this place enough, the team / staff is extremely on it, they really know how to host a successful event. laura, beth, andrea, juan, dennis the whole team really knows what 5 star service means. they followed through all the way to the very end of our event. the food was great, all of our guest were extremely satisfied with there guestrooms, and the location of this hotel. its in a clean area of sf with tons a great places to eat and shop. i would highly recommend this venue if you are hosting an event.

original_reviews: as a passerby, this hotel is beautiful. but what makes this hotel amazing is the service. zuri, a young lady who works at the front desk, does not resist assistance to those who are not staying at the hotel-- but rather does everything she can to help. i would stay here, simply because of her! thank you, zuri.
reviews: the staff at the argonaut always go above and beyond. matthew at the front desk always has great recommendations and a great attitude. great hotel. highly recommend!

original_reviews: very nice,clean place to stay. downstairs bar and restaurant, very comfortable with a pleasant staff. one major caveat however; the quoted price is a far cry from the actual cost at checkout. while most of us are accustomed to a few additional charges at departure, these added costs,while probably legal,ethical would be a stretch. there was even a separate "tax" on the 75.00/night car park. ask before committing.
reviews: hidden fee, expensive valet. noisy air conditioning, no fan in bathroom. made mistake on the bill.

original_reviews: the argonaut hotel in san francisco is a great place to stay when you are in san francisco. not only is it right on the wharf the staff is very helpful, friendly, and all around great. when you come please say hi to the doorman with the great yellow and blue shoes.
reviews: the hotel itself is nice. the room was clean, great views. the doormen were always friendly and helpful. the only reason it's getting 3 stars is because of the price. i was aware of the $38/night resort fee or whatever, plus taxes, but i was never informed of the price to park. even when they took the car at check in no one said it would be $65/night. it also wasn't in my itinerary with the price breakdown that was emailed in advance. while i understand city parking isn't cheap, it would've been nice to know ahead of time so i could've looked at other parking options. because of all of the extra fees i likely won't stay again. the $245/night ends up being like $800 for two nights. the front desk gave a lot of attitude at check out and acted like it was my fault because i chose the bay view room package instead of the parking package that i didn't even see. the restaurant is also overpriced and the food is mediocre.

original_reviews: excellent location on the wharf. great selection of rooms and delicious restaurant attached to hotel. 20 restaurants with-in 1 mile of the hotel and all of them are worth stopping in and visiting. great seafood and italian around every corner.
reviews: service was good enough. the rooms are small, but it is hard to find spacious rooms in san francisco. the parking when we arrived was terrible. the front entrance only has space for 3 or 4 cars and it was completely full on arrival. it was a bit stressful to check-in due to the parking. the water pressure in the shower was terrible. would not stay again because of the water pressure alone.

original_reviews: we were evacuees from the kincade fire in santa rosa. we will never forget the care extended to us by everyone at the argonaut hotel. we reserved here because they are pet-friendly and were astonished to learn that they offered a substantially discounted rate to fire evacuees. everything is a bit of a blur right now, but i think we were there for four or five nights. the staff is lovely and extremely responsive to every request we had. my husband has limited mobility. we ate all of our meals either at the hotel restaurant, the blue mermaid, or from room service. the food was delicious, very fresh, and plentiful. the menu has lots of healthy options but also some splurges. the salmon dishes were particularly well-prepared. and my nightly mescal margarita was the best i've had. no skimping on the mescal. our room was clean, comfortable, and very quiet. i read the review that down-graded the hotel for the garage they use charging for all three cars. this is not the hotel's choice. the reviewers beef is with the garage, not the hotel, and i wish they would revise their review to reflect that. we will definitely return here, either as vacationers or evacuees. thanks to everyone at the argonaut. you are much appreciated.
reviews: amazing location and a beautiful hotel. we are in san francisco for a major convention and couldn't have founded a better hotel. everyone on staff was amazing and attentive. they executed with precision. we recommend that you have breakfast at the mermaid restaurant in the hotel. the first day we went looking for a breakfast spot thinking that we might want to try something different than the hotel but it turns out their breakfast was pretty amazing!
cleaned_advanced: amazing location beautiful san francisco major convention couldnt founded better everyone staff amazing attentive executed precision recommend breakfast mermaid restaurant first day went looking breakfast spot thinking might want try something different turn breakfast pretty amazing

original_reviews: extremely insensitive staff upon check in. we booked this hotel a few weeks ago for a fun trip, however we were evacuated from our home in santa rosa this morning at 5 am, along with a large portion of sonoma county and our homes are currently under threat of perishing. we have three cars instead of the planned single car. we asked being that we are fire evacuees in a declared state of emergency, if we could be given a discount for parking or some help. we were told they don't have control over parking and could self park around the corner got $47 each. all of our valuables and belongings were stuffed into our cars. the only reason i'm giving 2 stars is because the bellboys outside were the only staff who showed some humanity to our situation and were very helpful unpacking our cars and getting our stuff to the room. the desk was extremely cold and unhelpful. it's quite shocking that given the current situation, the hotel desk really could care less about our predicament.
reviews: absolutely love this hotel. this is our third time staying here. it's great location being in fisherman's wharf and the cable cars are across the street. from the moment we valet our car we are treated with kindness. the rooms are very nice and the hotel itself is absolutely spotless. oh and the in-room dining is a huge 5 star.
cleaned_advanced: absolutely love third time staying great location fisherman wharf cable car across street moment valet car treated kindness nice absolutely spotless oh inroom dining huge star

original_reviews: this has been one of my favorite places for many years until now. having made a reservation almost a month ago my family and i arrived at 11pm to find that the hotel was sold out and the only rooms left were a single queen or a handicapped accessible room with no tub and two queens. pretty sure the hotel gave my room to someone who arrived earlier in the evening. didn't get the room i booked and the snarker gentlemen at the front desk let it be known that my family's comfort and interest in staying here again was not his concern. super bummed. was really looking forward to being here but we won't be coming back. room 220
reviews: stayed here for a super fun extended girls weekend for a 50th birthday and it was absolutely the best place we could have chosen for the tourist things we all wanted to do. it is wonderfully located on the wharf, right down from a trolly pick up location and the famous buena vista and ghirardelli square-but also next to a double deck bus vendor (always changing) that makes the entire downtown loop-including chinatown, little italy, and macy's square. our room was pretty, clean, and roomy and i'd highly recommend the cost for the experience you'll get.

original_reviews: the best thing about this place is the location. i loved that it was in the old del monte cannery, cool detail. the lobby had much nicer style and decor than the rooms. the room looked was a disneyland cruise ship, cheesy nautical. our room was large but the use of space was terrible leaving a large useless area in the center of the room. the bathroom was small, the couch awkwardly faced a blank wall and the desk was touching the bed when there was all this unused space. the tv didn't have movie channels, in fact it had fewer channels than most hotels. granted, we were only in our room to basically sleep but this hotel seriously lacked the amenities that one expects with the rates and additional fees argonaut charges. aside from the housekeeping cleaning everything spotless, there's nothing praise worthy for the staff. going in and out of the hotel, we saw the doormen most frequently and there was only one occasion when they acknowledged us. the rest of the times we passed by them while they stood there doing nothing and helping no one. on day 2, we were walking behind a woman who fell in front of them before entering the hotel and they just watched and chuckled. during my stay, this hotel was publicly advertising breakfast for two with the purchase of a room. all we got was a $10 coupon. i inquired with the front desk about the false advertising and they said the coupon can be used for breakfast. there's nothing on the breakfast menu for $5 or even $10, what a bunch of liars.
reviews: this is not related to the hotel - i was at this charming hotel for a conference and had then unfortunate circumstance of speaking to an individual (matthew) who was very rude, condescending and unpleasant to interact with. i am an event coordinator by trade and i was considering holding an event here and i may reconsider if having to deal with him.

original_reviews: we just loved this hotel. great service and location and was quiet. the only disappointment was service during breakfast in the restaurant.
reviews: the hotel is great. concierge and valet staff are phenomenal and really make this a top rate hotel. the lobby is beautiful and the rooms are decent sized (for san francisco). i recommend that you make time to use the free bicycle vouchers and other amenities as it adds to the experience and value. parking is expensive - which is to be expected due to the location.

original_reviews: once again we had an incredible stay at your hotel! not only are the staff wonderful and accommodating but the overall experience was stellar. the beds are incredibly comfortable and the linens incredibly soft. the interior design is absolutely beautiful i love this hotel. it is one of my favorites in the nation!
reviews: my family of four stayed between christmas and new years. the room was clean, beds were comfortable, and staff were helpful. however, the lobby area and lobby bathrooms were generally ignored by the staff. the bathrooms were in poor shape, and without paper towels or hand soap. in the lobby, trash and empty glasses were not picked up, and games for children were broken and had missing pieces.

original_reviews: our hotel options are a bit limited when traveling with our dog. we decided on the argonaut and i'm so glad we did.
reviews: their price is $25 higher per night than they advertise. this "milk the customer attitude" permeates the experience. when you challenge them on this they have many clearly rehearsed excuses. "that it is priceline's problem," "that all hotels still do this" which as all of us who travel a lot know is simply not true any more - it has been years since this last happened to me. when you ask why they don't just include their "bait and switch" fees in their advertised price you get a look like you are from another planet. knowing that i was being taken advantage of really ruined the experience for me. i did the honest thing and, before checking out told them it was my policy to warn others of deceptive marketing practices with one star reviews. they took advantage anyway.

original_reviews: kinda cheesy and overdone with the jules verne theme. plus, you would think a brick building would have thicker walls. the woman in the room next door just sneezed, and i wouldn't swear to it, but i think i got a spray from it. and what's with staff ringing doorbell but not waiting for an answer before bathing in? it happened twice, and we were there less than 24 hours. change of review. the company they contact with for parking is awful. for $75, our car should not be held hostage.
reviews: my sister and i stayed here for the weekend and i told my boyfriend that when he and i come back to san francisco that we would have to stay here again. to be honest, the room wasn't the greatest. the whole ambiance of the hotel was comforting; it had a rustic nautical theme, and the decor was really cute. the hotel room just could have been nicer, like they could do a little updating. however, it was pretty clean so i'm not complaining there, i just wish they offered hand soap at this hotel! it's the only hotel i've ever been to that doesn't provide any hand soap. the best thing about this hotel though, is the location. i love being on the wharf so close to everything. it can still take a little while to get where you want to go, even on the wharf, but if you don't mind a 30 minute or so walk then it's not a big deal. i personally like to walk and enjoy being able to explore the neighborhood. one thing that does bother me about san francisco that i'm not sure whether or not gets enough attention (and i've noticed this even in the tourist parts of the city) is the homelessness issue. it saddens me to see all of the homeless people that are around the city. i woke up twice in the morning on my last day here to homeless people outside of our window. it's a pretty pricey place (san francisco), and it doesn't seem like the neighborhoods (nor the people) are being taken care of. it's easy to blame homelessness on drugs, laziness, etc., but in a city that's so expensive ($2500+ to rent a studio) and has more than enough money to do something about the issue, it saddens me. the city is also pretty messy, there is trash everywhere, so i loved that this hotel seemed to be so clean, because i'm not sure i'd feel comfortable staying anywhere else! i do recommend visiting san francisco and giving this hotel a try. this hotel will make your trip because of the convenience of the location.

original_reviews: not a bad hotel but not a great hotel. but a decent hotel for the price and the location. i didn't want to spend 1k a night at the fairmont nearby so choices in our price comfort range was slim pickings. it seems like the better choice hotels are in the financial district but that's too far from where my daughter lives in sf. yes the king bed rooms are super narrow, yes the walls are a bit thin, yes there's no fan in the bathroom. but it's clean, the front desk and house cleaners are friendly and efficient and the bed is comfortable enough. this hotel definitely does its job and i will return when i have to stay in the area again.
reviews: great hotel! location, service and family friendly approach was perfect!

original_reviews: stayed here for two nights on a weekday. awesome hotel, good people, great location. checking in was cool, matthew checked us in. nice guy and was easy process.
reviews: this was a very nice hotel perfectly located near the water. from the entrance you can see alcatraz. close to a lot of attractions. also, their restaurant was very very good. all the staff were polite and engaging. would definitely consider staying the next time we are in san francisco.

original_reviews: do not stay here! beyond what all the other reviews say about thin walls, lazy wifi, the staff is horrible. the cleaners stole my jewelry and when i called to talk to a manager they just kept redirecting me to the housekeeping staff who lied to me and kept me on hold forever. there are soooooo many better places to stay in sf that have honest staff working for them.
reviews: do not stay here! $74 for less than 12 hours of parking along with $238 for a room. horrible customer service, took 2 hours to get the valet to even take and park our car and on top of it nobody asked if we needed help or anything. on top of that we had to unload our bags and carry them up to our room ourselves! so disgusted with this place.. take my advice stay at the marriott it's only a block further down with pull up valet service and better service all around. also the manager told us they'd do "something" for us for all the crap they put us through and at check out they said, "sorry, it wasn't our fault we were slammed last night". worst hotel experience i've ever had in my life! horrible!

original_reviews: great stay at the wharf. rooms with a nautical theme, great food and cozy lobby with a fireplace to relax. front doormen and staff very friendly. concierge matthew was excellent to work with and provided many great recommendations throughout our weekend stay. hotel rooms are quite noisy with screaming kids and slamming doors. bathrooms could use an update and thorough cleaning. location is good with many restaurant options, shopping, bike rentals and the cable car.
reviews: all you can ask for. nice staff, luxuriously appointed and guaranteed sweet dreams. i'm a 20 year local, basically grew up here and enjoy the wharf and all it gas to offer. well i should just the tourist enjoy such an incredible cultural offering. i could write a separate post on all the hidden gems of history in this area but this post is for the hotel. don't worry and get obsessed about a room with a view as it really doesn't matter your room will be awesome even if the view is to the wall next door i don't care because it is super comfortable quiet and you want to be roaming around outside anyhow. however if you are not a local pay the extra money to get the view why not go ahead and do it. it's fun to hang out in the lobby get hydrated on lemon water and play all the games sitting by the fire and people watching!

original_reviews: this hotel is horrible. they charged me in full for my reservation and will not let me cancel. when my wife called to change the reservation, the reservations manager hung up on her! this hotel is mismanaged and has unethical business practice. we will be reporting them to the better business bureau. be aware. do not book here if you don't want to be out the money!
reviews: from the minute we pulled up we felt welcome at this terrific boutique hotel. we love the nautical theme and the authentic decor. this is my new favorite hotel in san francisco. it's close enough to the wharf for all the excitement, yet at the same time it feels private. the blue mermaid has great food and we just had a delicious dinner. i will absolutely be back.

original_reviews: if i could give a zero star i would. booked less than 24 hours ago and realized that the dates of our stay were wrong. called the hotel and they are refusing to refund my credit card for the cost of over $700, even though the charge is so new it is still pending. they even refuse to modify the dates for us. they need to understand that customer service is paramount in the success of a business.
reviews: today this late afternoon my husband and i went for a bite to eat at the argonaut hotel and had the pleasure of being served by holly. you're talking about sweet and personable, she's top notch. she believes in making her customers happy and it's genuine. she's not doing it for a nice tip, she just believes in pleasing her customers. beautiful personality, beautiful smile, hard worker and quick on her feet. as we sat there waiting to order, i watched her taking care of her customers and reassuring us she would be right with us. she's quick like step curry. she moves as though she's on a basketball court scoring not 3 points but 5 at each table. she loves her job and her customers too and you can definitely tell she enjoys what she does. i think they should make her the manager of all servers. she should train others to do well too. they'll learn so much from her especially knowing how to serve customers. she reminded us of servers we've seen at the ritz carlton. we hope they realize how blessed they are to have you for an employee.

original_reviews: buyer beware! the accommodations are nice but we booked our room at the same time as our traveling companions via the same method. we paid a premium for a regular room with a view and our friends chose not to. upon arrival, our friends received a free upgrade to a premium room with the same view as ours so they ended up with a nicer room with the same view for about $500 less than our room for a 3 night stay. we were offered no free upgrades or discounts. very uneven and unfair practice! be very cautious!

original_reviews: wow, so nice from the valet to front steak. our pup was loved and played with by all. such a fun location right in the heart of tourist central. it's been a million years since i've been in san francisco but i felt instantly at home
reviews: i do not understand why this hotel is so highly rated. the location was ok and the room clean, but the window was halfway ground level, so all we could see were people't feet. also, i am not convinced about their key room security system. i got back from an excursion, used the key to enter the room and was very surprised to bumped into a men using the toilet. then i realized that i accidentally entered the room next to mine. my room's key opened another room. i went to the reception desk to tell them just as they were getting off the phone with the man who's room i entered. they investigated, and the conclusion was that "i probably did not enter the other room" because their security system did not show that my key was used on the other room. despite the other person confirming my story, they decided it did not happen. i have no confidence in their security system, am not impresses with their patronizing customer service and no intention to return.
