original_reviews: "boutique hotel" sure has become a superfluous title thrown around these days... it's really just a way to jack up the pricing for literally everything, with little support to back it up when there's a problem. i won't spend too much time reiterating what others have said: thin walls, so you hear what's going on around you, the "prison yard" esque view of the inside rooms (good one, reviewer), the toilet paper holder beyond reach of the toilet (at least my room did have an extra roll on the back of the toilet), a bed that's rock hard but pillows that are so soft they really can't be called pillows because your head shouldn't be allowed to meld with the mattress when using pillows, etc. upon check-in, the front desk agent gave me a key to the mini bar in case i wanted to refrigerate any of my own stuff. when i got into my room, i noticed it was already unlocked. i flagged this with the desk because i have not consumed anything and will not be paying for it if they try and tell me i have upon checkout. $100/night "hold" for incidentals is ludicrous. as if i'm going to run out of here with the $49 umbrella, $26 small bottle of wine, $14 stuffed plush seal, and the $3.25 two ounce bag of cheetos and not pay for any of it. this is why you keep the card on file, you don't preemptively run a charge for each night. my room has a mirror facing the bed. any designer worth their salt should tell you this is bad feng shui, whether you prescribe to that line of thinking or not, it's just bad practice for sleeping arrangements. sex room/dungeon, okay sure, but just sleeping not so much. my biggest gripe comes from a tech standpoint. i'm in town for a conference, thus need reliable wifi to do work. my first day in, i successfully purchase the $14.95/day upgrade to connect up to three devices - and all worked smoothly. by the time i returned to hotel next day, upgrade expired so i attempted to purchase another. my laptop browser would not automatically open the webpage to allow this. now, being a tech savvy person, i know how to troubleshoot the basics. forget the wifi and try again, clear my browser cache, see if the page auto-loads in another browser, restart the computer. funnily enough, i was able to purchase the upgrade on my phone, but still couldn't get my laptop to open the damn page. so, of course i call front desk to ask for the website that should be loading so i can load it manually. if the way the site recognizes you is to enter your room number and last name, *it should be accessible manually*. front desk person was nice enough, but clueless. she put me on hold to talk to someone else who told me to try all the things above again. thanks but no thanks. tried everything 10+ times already. nada. as i type this i'm still on the slow-as-molasses free wifi that says you get 5mb speeds, but i've never broken 2.6mb the entire time. thankfully it's just fast enough to put in this critical review. management: get your staff educated on the website to enter for manual connection to the paid wifi. this is an option, as i've done so at other hotels. i probably won't be staying here again, but i can't be the only person this has happened to and felt it worth noting for others in town for work and not tourism.
reviews: loved this hotel. there was a doorman so no one in lobby that shouldn't be. very clean, big rooms, great hotel restaurant, etc. considering it was in the wharf it was quite at night. for sure tourists area but safe and you can walk everywhere

original_reviews: i cant rave about this place enough, the team / staff is extremely on it, they really know how to host a successful event. laura, beth, andrea, juan, dennis the whole team really knows what 5 star service means. they followed through all the way to the very end of our event. the food was great, all of our guest were extremely satisfied with there guestrooms, and the location of this hotel. its in a clean area of sf with tons a great places to eat and shop. i would highly recommend this venue if you are hosting an event.
reviews: the hotel as a whole was great. the bellmen were awesome and accommodating, they were always friendly and helpful! i didn't interact much with the front desk, however they were great with our limited interaction. i was very unimpressed with the blue mermaid. i only patronized the blue mermaid for cocktails and was served the wrong drink, the bartender seemed annoyed to be servicing anyone. housekeeping was amazing and did an incredible job. the bed and pillows on the other had were sub-par. bed was as hard as a rock and pillows were basically useless.

original_reviews: the hotel itself is nice. the room was clean, great views. the doormen were always friendly and helpful. the only reason it's getting 3 stars is because of the price. i was aware of the $38/night resort fee or whatever, plus taxes, but i was never informed of the price to park. even when they took the car at check in no one said it would be $65/night. it also wasn't in my itinerary with the price breakdown that was emailed in advance. while i understand city parking isn't cheap, it would've been nice to know ahead of time so i could've looked at other parking options. because of all of the extra fees i likely won't stay again. the $245/night ends up being like $800 for two nights. the front desk gave a lot of attitude at check out and acted like it was my fault because i chose the bay view room package instead of the parking package that i didn't even see. the restaurant is also overpriced and the food is mediocre.
reviews: this is a wonderful hotel. it is an expedia vip hotel and was lucky enough as a gold expedia member to get a free room upgrade! very happy. big clean rooms, lots of space, fully stocked snacks and bar. nice size washroom. extremely good location near ghiradelli square and pier 39. the guest services were really nice. beautiful hotel had world cup games in the lobby and free water in the lobby as well. connected to blue mermaid which i'll review later. overall a great experience and would stay here again.

original_reviews: service was good enough. the rooms are small, but it is hard to find spacious rooms in san francisco. the parking when we arrived was terrible. the front entrance only has space for 3 or 4 cars and it was completely full on arrival. it was a bit stressful to check-in due to the parking. the water pressure in the shower was terrible. would not stay again because of the water pressure alone.
reviews: awesome hotel, awesome location, great service. totally worth every penny spent to stay at this location. my family and i were pleasantly surprised at how close everything is located within walking distance of this hotel. ghiradeli square is two minutes away, the trolley is 45 seconds away, the harbor is two minutes away and shops and restaurants are within less than 30 seconds away including my favorite, in and out burgers.

original_reviews: amazing location and a beautiful hotel. we are in san francisco for a major convention and couldn't have founded a better hotel. everyone on staff was amazing and attentive. they executed with precision. we recommend that you have breakfast at the mermaid restaurant in the hotel. the first day we went looking for a breakfast spot thinking that we might want to try something different than the hotel but it turns out their breakfast was pretty amazing!
reviews: for a 4-diamond hotel property i expected more. rate was ridiculously expensive, but fails to deliver on many standard items that go a long way in terms of guest experience. there is a 'resort fee' charged, but be aware that this isn't a true resort (no pool) and provides little/no actual amenities. also, if you want sweeping city views this property does not provide them. my room faced an adjacent building and i was told that a 'partial view' of the water would be an additional $75/night! disappointing that there was no attempt to compromise on the upgrade, especially considering i was staying 8 nights. in fact, nothing was complimentary here. complimentary water should be provided in rooms, instead there's a $4 charge. fees to access computers in business center?! who does that in 2018? not very accommodating. also, i experienced bed bug bites on my 5th night at the hotel, so that should be remedied immediately. i found features in the bathroom to rather dated, and the bathroom light continued to flicker on and off during stay (room 409). room service and food was prompt and rather tasty, however $10 food credit should be able to be used for room service as well as dining in the restaurant. after all, the guest is already paying for it. in the end, i felt nickel and dimed to death for everything here. that's not how i want to spend my vacation. i'm not confident i would choose the argonaut on another trip to san francisco.

reviews: great place, good for kids too. free wine at 5:00 everyday, close proximity to lots of history and wharf activities. hotel very clean and very courteous and helpful staff.

original_reviews: stayed here for a super fun extended girls weekend for a 50th birthday and it was absolutely the best place we could have chosen for the tourist things we all wanted to do. it is wonderfully located on the wharf, right down from a trolly pick up location and the famous buena vista and ghirardelli square-but also next to a double deck bus vendor (always changing) that makes the entire downtown loop-including chinatown, little italy, and macy's square. our room was pretty, clean, and roomy and i'd highly recommend the cost for the experience you'll get.
reviews: while it's a good location it is not worth the extra cost a mere one block down from a major chain competitor. the inside no view room at almost $300 where we have listened to a child cry for almost an hour and the amenities of robes were not provided and the extra resort cost is definitely not worth it for a short stay. additionally, we had to pay 45.00 for non valet parking which would have been included with the competitors room and they included breakfast but not here. save your money and book one block up.

original_reviews: this is not related to the hotel - i was at this charming hotel for a conference and had then unfortunate circumstance of speaking to an individual (matthew) who was very rude, condescending and unpleasant to interact with. i am an event coordinator by trade and i was considering holding an event here and i may reconsider if having to deal with him.
reviews: this hotel is very overpriced in my opinion. i didn't see anything that qualified it as a 4-star hotel. the only thing that justifies a somewhat high rate is the location which is pretty awesome. one of the cable car turnarounds is right next door and it's an easy walk to ghiradelli, fisherman's wharf and pier 39. we were there during july 4th and could literally walk 50 yards from the hotel to watch the fireworks. if not for a deal through travelocity i would've never paid the daily rate. then it turned out that on top of the rate through travelocity, we had to pay a daily facilities fee ($25 + tax per day) that covers the use of the wifi, the coffee in the room, the fitness room, the use of bicycles for two hours a day, etc. has to be the first time i've ever seen an extra charge for wifi and coffee. who does that? the beds seemed ok but my son and i both had backaches every morning for some reason. i've seen other reviews complain the thin walls. we did listen to a little kid screaming one morning but otherwise it wasn't an issue for us. the window did crank open a little which was cool. the one staff member at the desk that i dealt with the most didn't seem to know what she was talking about when it came to questions about the public transportation. we had to figure it out for ourselves. other than the location, i can't recommend staying there.

original_reviews: the hotel is great. concierge and valet staff are phenomenal and really make this a top rate hotel. the lobby is beautiful and the rooms are decent sized (for san francisco). i recommend that you make time to use the free bicycle vouchers and other amenities as it adds to the experience and value. parking is expensive - which is to be expected due to the location.
reviews: cute and eclectic hotel across the street from hyde park in the restored brick cannery built in the early 1900s. vintage nautical theme as the name suggests with some odd modern add-ons. weird, artsy wall paper in all the rooms. the nice wooden deck lounge chairs and port hole mirrors made the lobby feel like a ship. the bed is super comfy - not too hard - not too soft. and so quiet! we had a room facing the (very plain) interior courtyard and never heard a door shut or another voice the whole night. lovely bathroom with soft, plush, thirsty towels. feels touristy but all the staff were very friendly and helpful. when we checked in the lady gave us a voucher for 2 drinks in the on-site restaurant and $10 off food.

original_reviews: my family of four stayed between christmas and new years. the room was clean, beds were comfortable, and staff were helpful. however, the lobby area and lobby bathrooms were generally ignored by the staff. the bathrooms were in poor shape, and without paper towels or hand soap. in the lobby, trash and empty glasses were not picked up, and games for children were broken and had missing pieces.
reviews: loved it and would definitely go back! clean rooms, comfortable beds, nice staff, and great location.

original_reviews: their price is $25 higher per night than they advertise. this "milk the customer attitude" permeates the experience. when you challenge them on this they have many clearly rehearsed excuses. "that it is priceline's problem," "that all hotels still do this" which as all of us who travel a lot know is simply not true any more - it has been years since this last happened to me. when you ask why they don't just include their "bait and switch" fees in their advertised price you get a look like you are from another planet. knowing that i was being taken advantage of really ruined the experience for me. i did the honest thing and, before checking out told them it was my policy to warn others of deceptive marketing practices with one star reviews. they took advantage anyway.
reviews: this is probably one of my favorite hotels because of the location. it is close to plenty of shops and restaurants especially the ghirardelli square. it was also very quite for it being a family hotel. i enjoyed the design and layout. i highly recommend this place if you're wanting to be ocean front and a short walk from most tourist things. however, if you're looking for bars and clubs to walk to, this place might be a bit to far. you will need to uber to the nightlife due to the many hills in the area. lastly, it's a pretty pricey hotel but definitely worth it in my opinion.
cleaned_advanced: probably one favorite hotel location close plenty shop restaurant especially ghirardelli square also quite family enjoyed design layout highly recommend place youre wanting ocean front short walk tourist thing however youre looking bar club walk place might bit far need uber nightlife due many hill area lastly pretty pricey definitely worth opinion

original_reviews: my sister and i stayed here for the weekend and i told my boyfriend that when he and i come back to san francisco that we would have to stay here again. to be honest, the room wasn't the greatest. the whole ambiance of the hotel was comforting; it had a rustic nautical theme, and the decor was really cute. the hotel room just could have been nicer, like they could do a little updating. however, it was pretty clean so i'm not complaining there, i just wish they offered hand soap at this hotel! it's the only hotel i've ever been to that doesn't provide any hand soap. the best thing about this hotel though, is the location. i love being on the wharf so close to everything. it can still take a little while to get where you want to go, even on the wharf, but if you don't mind a 30 minute or so walk then it's not a big deal. i personally like to walk and enjoy being able to explore the neighborhood. one thing that does bother me about san francisco that i'm not sure whether or not gets enough attention (and i've noticed this even in the tourist parts of the city) is the homelessness issue. it saddens me to see all of the homeless people that are around the city. i woke up twice in the morning on my last day here to homeless people outside of our window. it's a pretty pricey place (san francisco), and it doesn't seem like the neighborhoods (nor the people) are being taken care of. it's easy to blame homelessness on drugs, laziness, etc., but in a city that's so expensive ($2500+ to rent a studio) and has more than enough money to do something about the issue, it saddens me. the city is also pretty messy, there is trash everywhere, so i loved that this hotel seemed to be so clean, because i'm not sure i'd feel comfortable staying anywhere else! i do recommend visiting san francisco and giving this hotel a try. this hotel will make your trip because of the convenience of the location.
reviews: lovely hotel with tasteful sailor inspired interior. the location close to the piers was perfect for us. when booking we got excellent service at the front desk from ms mari carmen, who also made sure that our needs were taken care of upon arrival. we did not have time to lunch nor dine at the hotel, and therefore we shall not be able review the restaurant.
cleaned_advanced: lovely tasteful sailor inspired interior location close pier perfect u booking got excellent service front desk m mari carmen also made sure need taken care upon arrival time lunch dine therefore shall able review restaurant

original_reviews: great hotel! location, service and family friendly approach was perfect!

original_reviews: this was a very nice hotel perfectly located near the water. from the entrance you can see alcatraz. close to a lot of attractions. also, their restaurant was very very good. all the staff were polite and engaging. would definitely consider staying the next time we are in san francisco.
reviews: beautiful hotel, very clean, excellent location, delicious restaurant.

original_reviews: do not stay here! $74 for less than 12 hours of parking along with $238 for a room. horrible customer service, took 2 hours to get the valet to even take and park our car and on top of it nobody asked if we needed help or anything. on top of that we had to unload our bags and carry them up to our room ourselves! so disgusted with this place.. take my advice stay at the marriott it's only a block further down with pull up valet service and better service all around. also the manager told us they'd do "something" for us for all the crap they put us through and at check out they said, "sorry, it wasn't our fault we were slammed last night". worst hotel experience i've ever had in my life! horrible!
reviews: this was a great spot to stay and be close to cable car, food and souvenir shops. we had a memorable stay! the rooms have a great nautical theme. interior details were so pretty. beds were super comfy! expect to pay a lot if you want to park your car here.
cleaned_advanced: great spot close cable car food souvenir shop memorable great nautical theme interior detail pretty bed super comfy expect pay lot want park car

original_reviews: all you can ask for. nice staff, luxuriously appointed and guaranteed sweet dreams. i'm a 20 year local, basically grew up here and enjoy the wharf and all it gas to offer. well i should just the tourist enjoy such an incredible cultural offering. i could write a separate post on all the hidden gems of history in this area but this post is for the hotel. don't worry and get obsessed about a room with a view as it really doesn't matter your room will be awesome even if the view is to the wall next door i don't care because it is super comfortable quiet and you want to be roaming around outside anyhow. however if you are not a local pay the extra money to get the view why not go ahead and do it. it's fun to hang out in the lobby get hydrated on lemon water and play all the games sitting by the fire and people watching!
reviews: this is a great hotel the bar was nice, parking is pricy $ 75 per day just park.
cleaned_advanced: great bar nice parking pricy per day park

original_reviews: from the minute we pulled up we felt welcome at this terrific boutique hotel. we love the nautical theme and the authentic decor. this is my new favorite hotel in san francisco. it's close enough to the wharf for all the excitement, yet at the same time it feels private. the blue mermaid has great food and we just had a delicious dinner. i will absolutely be back.
reviews: they had extra fees at the end that were not made clear at the booking. and overall was too nautical of theme. just kinda a weird vibe, but at least it was clean.

original_reviews: today this late afternoon my husband and i went for a bite to eat at the argonaut hotel and had the pleasure of being served by holly. you're talking about sweet and personable, she's top notch. she believes in making her customers happy and it's genuine. she's not doing it for a nice tip, she just believes in pleasing her customers. beautiful personality, beautiful smile, hard worker and quick on her feet. as we sat there waiting to order, i watched her taking care of her customers and reassuring us she would be right with us. she's quick like step curry. she moves as though she's on a basketball court scoring not 3 points but 5 at each table. she loves her job and her customers too and you can definitely tell she enjoys what she does. i think they should make her the manager of all servers. she should train others to do well too. they'll learn so much from her especially knowing how to serve customers. she reminded us of servers we've seen at the ritz carlton. we hope they realize how blessed they are to have you for an employee.
reviews: this place is all about location but if you arn't a tourist there isn't much for you here. i was in town for work & luckily only had to stay one night. bed was ok but there was only one source of light in room so i had to get out of bed to turn off light and fumble back in the dark. paper thin walls and blond long hairs in the shower made for a not so private experience. also very limited breakfast option (sad room with complimentary coffee in a lonesome thermos), a slightly wider selection of coffee and some pastries in the down stairs cafe.
cleaned_advanced: place location arnt tourist isnt much town work luckily one night bed ok one source light get bed turn light fumble back dark paper thin wall blond long hair shower made private experience also limited breakfast option sad complimentary coffee lonesome thermos slightly wider selection coffee pastry stair cafe

original_reviews: now this is one of my favorite hotels ever the argonaut it's really beautiful area that it's in is just spectacular you're right in the center of fishing reels worth ghirardelli square is right next to you guys there's a lot of beautiful things that you can do in that area will you will not be bored it's beautiful once again you're right in the center of fisherman's worth you can walk anywhere you want they're if it's a beautiful weather day you can rent yourself a bike or even just walk down wherever you want to walk the food around there is just really nice really good people the staff everybody knows what they're doing then starts if i can give them 10 stars i will be definitely coming back there next time i'm in the area
reviews: this boutique hotel sits at the end of jefferson street. perfect location next to a beautiful green space park, adjacent to the cable car turnaround, the famous buena vista irish coffee bar, and ghirardelli square. pay a little more for the bayside view, it's well worth it to wake up to the sound of seagulls, the sunrise reflecting off the golden gate bridge and the view of the bay!

original_reviews: i do not understand why this hotel is so highly rated. the location was ok and the room clean, but the window was halfway ground level, so all we could see were people't feet. also, i am not convinced about their key room security system. i got back from an excursion, used the key to enter the room and was very surprised to bumped into a men using the toilet. then i realized that i accidentally entered the room next to mine. my room's key opened another room. i went to the reception desk to tell them just as they were getting off the phone with the man who's room i entered. they investigated, and the conclusion was that "i probably did not enter the other room" because their security system did not show that my key was used on the other room. despite the other person confirming my story, they decided it did not happen. i have no confidence in their security system, am not impresses with their patronizing customer service and no intention to return.
reviews: couldn't have been happier with our choice in hotel! the beds were so comfy that it was almost difficult to get up and leave them in the mornings. as much as we love san fran, we also didn't mind hanging out in the room before bed because the nautical theme is adorable, the rooms are spacey, and we had a fun view of the cable cars. the hotel pays attention to detail, and i loved the little pet area near the entrance even though we didn't bring a fur baby. great service and location, too, of course!
cleaned_advanced: couldnt happier choice bed comfy almost difficult get leave morning much love san fran also didnt mind hanging bed nautical theme adorable spacey fun view cable car pay attention detail loved little pet area near entrance even though didnt bring fur baby great service location course

original_reviews: loved this hotel. there was a doorman so no one in lobby that shouldn't be. very clean, big rooms, great hotel restaurant, etc. considering it was in the wharf it was quite at night. for sure tourists area but safe and you can walk everywhere
reviews: upon checking out i was advised that my receipt would be emailed to me. that never happened. so i called the hotel and you are transferred to a recording that hangs up and does not accept your message. this happened 3 different days. i will never stay at this hotel again.

original_reviews: my bucket list hotel. thank you my daughter for my early birthday hotel stay. always wanted to stay here but it was too pricey for me
reviews: we had a great stay at the argonaut. came for husbands birthday and we greeted with a nice card, wine and snacks from the hotel staff. such a sweet gesture and perfect way to kick off the trip. staff was friendly and helpful. our room was a king with a bay view. we had stunning views of the golden gate bridge. can also see the ghirardelli's sign and the cable car station. the room was huge and very clean. the location is was perfect for us. it's at the very end of the pier so you walk all the way up and see everything. lots of shops and restaurants near by. also there's an avis car rental a few blocks away which was perfect as we needed a car to go to napa for just one day. and they let you park in there lot for no charge. hotel charges $75 for parking. there's a great breakfast spot a few blocks away, 8am cafe, worth it. the cable car station is just across the street. over all, would love to stay here again.

original_reviews: the hotel as a whole was great. the bellmen were awesome and accommodating, they were always friendly and helpful! i didn't interact much with the front desk, however they were great with our limited interaction. i was very unimpressed with the blue mermaid. i only patronized the blue mermaid for cocktails and was served the wrong drink, the bartender seemed annoyed to be servicing anyone. housekeeping was amazing and did an incredible job. the bed and pillows on the other had were sub-par. bed was as hard as a rock and pillows were basically useless.
reviews: i have previously stayed here and had a good experience. but this time, not a good experience. we got back after the room after a long day and wanted to relax & watch a movie. but couldn't get the volume turned up to a level we could hear it after paying $30 for the movie. called front desk and they sent up technical support. they said there was nothing they could do about it. so no movie for us! really disappointing! went to bed early with no movie or tv. very poor customer service and not a care that we were unhappy. i have never stayed at a hotel where i can't hear the tv. thought i was paying for a high end classy place but i don't feel that way at all! i would not recommend it!

original_reviews: stay away from this place, the concept of being polite escapes this property. cars left for valet are not moved causing congestion in the front when trying to load or unload. the doorman did not appreciate said comments and at the time of my visit got a bit upset. this included taking pictures of my license plate.
reviews: i do not understand why this hotel has such high ratings. the beds were very firm and not great. the pillows were insanely soft and weird to have with the firm mattress. i asked about whether they had other mattresses and was told no, but they'd call me back to discuss solutions. no one ever called back. we were there for 4 days for my husband to convalesce from some minor surgery so the uncomfortable beds were a pretty significant inconvenience. we didn't need housekeeping for a couple of days but asked for fresh towels. that also did not happen. i really didn't feel the hotel staff had any concerns for us as guests. definitely not a high quality customer service situation, sadly. definitely not worthy of over $1,000 for our 4 day stay. my other major complaint is that the windows have wooden shutters which don't fully close and yet there are lights all around the outside. this meant the room was never completely dark and i found it hard to get to sleep. a minor complaint is that the volume of the tv kept fading in and out irregularly. it wasn't too frequent but the general lack of responsiveness from the hotel staff didn't inspire me to believe they'd fix it promptly- if ever so i didn't bother to request service. there was no market or grocery store terribly close. trader joe's was about a 15 minute walk away so not bad, but not ideal. the restaurants nearby were a mixed bag, but it's a very touristy area so i didn't have high hopes. we could hear yelling in the street on a daily basis and given that the 4th floor we were on was the highest, i imagine all the rooms can hear street sounds too. i wouldn't return here ever nor would i ever recommend it to anyone either.

original_reviews: awesome hotel, awesome location, great service. totally worth every penny spent to stay at this location. my family and i were pleasantly surprised at how close everything is located within walking distance of this hotel. ghiradeli square is two minutes away, the trolley is 45 seconds away, the harbor is two minutes away and shops and restaurants are within less than 30 seconds away including my favorite, in and out burgers.
reviews: this is a great hotel. i love the look and the people. the ambiance is great and fits the area. the staff is very nice and helpful. i would recommend this place to everyone. good job!

original_reviews: for a 4-diamond hotel property i expected more. rate was ridiculously expensive, but fails to deliver on many standard items that go a long way in terms of guest experience. there is a 'resort fee' charged, but be aware that this isn't a true resort (no pool) and provides little/no actual amenities. also, if you want sweeping city views this property does not provide them. my room faced an adjacent building and i was told that a 'partial view' of the water would be an additional $75/night! disappointing that there was no attempt to compromise on the upgrade, especially considering i was staying 8 nights. in fact, nothing was complimentary here. complimentary water should be provided in rooms, instead there's a $4 charge. fees to access computers in business center?! who does that in 2018? not very accommodating. also, i experienced bed bug bites on my 5th night at the hotel, so that should be remedied immediately. i found features in the bathroom to rather dated, and the bathroom light continued to flicker on and off during stay (room 409). room service and food was prompt and rather tasty, however $10 food credit should be able to be used for room service as well as dining in the restaurant. after all, the guest is already paying for it. in the end, i felt nickel and dimed to death for everything here. that's not how i want to spend my vacation. i'm not confident i would choose the argonaut on another trip to san francisco.
reviews: this is a darling hotel in a great location. it gets two stars for all of the outrageous/outlandish extra charges ($81 for parking, fees for using gym facilities that we didn't use $28). we booked using hotels tonight where they charged us the $28 and then were charged again by the hotel, as well as errors they charged for an upgrade for two nights when we were only there one night. trying to figure out all this mess and double dipping was a huge bummer! check your credit charge statements when you leave.

original_reviews: great place, good for kids too. free wine at 5:00 everyday, close proximity to lots of history and wharf activities. hotel very clean and very courteous and helpful staff.
reviews: what a great location. rooms were really nice. i loved the octopus wallpaper and the whole nautical theme. it's definitely worth the extra bucks to stay here. the door men are really nice. one of them had my daughters super pumped on the treasure chest that awaited them in the lobby. great way to start off. my kids were all smiles the whole trip. after walking around seeing the places i avoided i patted my self on the back. i got a lot of your the best dad ever. which is always nice. there's always a lot of decisions when traveling with kids. i am glade i made the one to stay here.

original_reviews: while it's a good location it is not worth the extra cost a mere one block down from a major chain competitor. the inside no view room at almost $300 where we have listened to a child cry for almost an hour and the amenities of robes were not provided and the extra resort cost is definitely not worth it for a short stay. additionally, we had to pay 45.00 for non valet parking which would have been included with the competitors room and they included breakfast but not here. save your money and book one block up.
reviews: it was my brother's birthday and the hotel did try to make it special by leaving a note with a complimentary bottle of wine; however the note stated the wrong name. they simply just took the person who booked the hotel and used their last name when that is not my brother's last name. it was a little uncomfortable as that is not his last name. perhaps they could have reached out to the person who notified them of the birthday and asked what his first name was or even his nickname. nonetheless, they tried. i will give them that!

original_reviews: this hotel is very overpriced in my opinion. i didn't see anything that qualified it as a 4-star hotel. the only thing that justifies a somewhat high rate is the location which is pretty awesome. one of the cable car turnarounds is right next door and it's an easy walk to ghiradelli, fisherman's wharf and pier 39. we were there during july 4th and could literally walk 50 yards from the hotel to watch the fireworks. if not for a deal through travelocity i would've never paid the daily rate. then it turned out that on top of the rate through travelocity, we had to pay a daily facilities fee ($25 + tax per day) that covers the use of the wifi, the coffee in the room, the fitness room, the use of bicycles for two hours a day, etc. has to be the first time i've ever seen an extra charge for wifi and coffee. who does that? the beds seemed ok but my son and i both had backaches every morning for some reason. i've seen other reviews complain the thin walls. we did listen to a little kid screaming one morning but otherwise it wasn't an issue for us. the window did crank open a little which was cool. the one staff member at the desk that i dealt with the most didn't seem to know what she was talking about when it came to questions about the public transportation. we had to figure it out for ourselves. other than the location, i can't recommend staying there.
reviews: this is our second time staying at the argonaut. the first was about 6 years ago and the service and amenities have improved. we have a bay view suite. the bed is comfortable and there were many types of pillows to choose from. the hotel is in a great location. walking distance to some of the most iconic places in the city.
cleaned_advanced: second time staying argonaut first year ago service amenity improved bay view suite bed comfortable many type pillow choose great location walking distance iconic place city

original_reviews: cute and eclectic hotel across the street from hyde park in the restored brick cannery built in the early 1900s. vintage nautical theme as the name suggests with some odd modern add-ons. weird, artsy wall paper in all the rooms. the nice wooden deck lounge chairs and port hole mirrors made the lobby feel like a ship. the bed is super comfy - not too hard - not too soft. and so quiet! we had a room facing the (very plain) interior courtyard and never heard a door shut or another voice the whole night. lovely bathroom with soft, plush, thirsty towels. feels touristy but all the staff were very friendly and helpful. when we checked in the lady gave us a voucher for 2 drinks in the on-site restaurant and $10 off food.
reviews: stayed at the argonaut again for thanksgiving weekend 2015. under new ownership now. the room was a little worn. carpet and bathroom tile needed replacement. they no longer have the complimentary wine hour which was great not just for the free wine, but i always enjoyed chatting with people from other places. the staff wasn't quite as attentive as before the turnover. otherwise, it is still a nice hotel in a great location and reasonably priced for what you get in that area.

original_reviews: loved it and would definitely go back! clean rooms, comfortable beds, nice staff, and great location.
reviews: restaurants all around, ghirardelli 5 minute walk away, inandout burger joint 2 minutes walk. fishermen's wharf right here next to the hotel. great running path and bike path as soon as i walk out the door. i will definitely come back to this lovely hotel.

reviews: i was so excited to stay here, as i had heard great things about this hotel from my manager. i was very much disappointed. i only stayed here one night. thank goodness because the worst thing about this hotel are the paper thin walls. i had a family on one side of me that were very loud and obnoxious. i was able to hear everything they talked about. then on the other side of me was a party going on. needless to say i did not get a great nights sleep. perhaps i was just unlucky in my nearby roommates but regardless i still think the thin walls would be an issue with anybody, no true privacy. the staff at the front desk were nice which is the reason for the 2 stars, but other than that i feel there are better hotels in the area. also, they nickel and dime you for everything. you can have the small in room bottle of wine for $26, purchase the stuffed sea lion on the bed for $22, a liter of water for $6, etc. nothing is complementary. to top it off, i tried to order room service in the morning and when i called i was told my room was vacant and they couldn't deliver to my room. come to find out someone on the morning crew had accidentally checked me out of my room during the night. so when i went to checkout i was told i had already done so. next time i'm in town i will not be staying here. i should have stayed at the hotel i was at before switching to this one. very disappointed.

original_reviews: this place is all about location but if you arn't a tourist there isn't much for you here. i was in town for work & luckily only had to stay one night. bed was ok but there was only one source of light in room so i had to get out of bed to turn off light and fumble back in the dark. paper thin walls and blond long hairs in the shower made for a not so private experience. also very limited breakfast option (sad room with complimentary coffee in a lonesome thermos), a slightly wider selection of coffee and some pastries in the down stairs cafe.
reviews: stayed here twice during november and december and thoroughly enjoyed my stay! lady at the front desk was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. loved the christmas music in the lobby and the beautiful fireplace, rooms were clean and had a lovely nautical theme! location was not too bad, close to the water and tourist shops, and not too far from the alcatraz tour dock. the doorman was very friendly and shared with us about living in philadelphia compared to california which was nice to hear about life in the usa as an australian. would definitely love to come back and stay at the argonaut again.

original_reviews: this boutique hotel sits at the end of jefferson street. perfect location next to a beautiful green space park, adjacent to the cable car turnaround, the famous buena vista irish coffee bar, and ghirardelli square. pay a little more for the bayside view, it's well worth it to wake up to the sound of seagulls, the sunrise reflecting off the golden gate bridge and the view of the bay!
reviews: i have so many wonderful things to say about the argonaut! i stayed at this hotel for 6 nights on business, and i went away with a truly positive experience. years back, i saw the argonaut while on another trip to san francisco, and i always wanted to stay there. something about it just caught my eye. so, when i saw that it had a rate my employer would cover on my recent business trip, i was ready! i tell this tale because i went to the argonaut with high hopes - and they did not let me down. i was not in an upgraded room with a view, but my room was terrific. it was meticulously clean, well-appointed, and very comfortable. my king sized bed offered me a great sleep. the only downer is that the walls did seem a bit thin, and i could hear the neighbors if it was totally silent. fortunately for me, i need to sleep with a fan or white noise of some type, so it was no issue. the staff was also really friendly and accommodating. i wish i could remember everyone that impressed me, but i remember john, frank, matthew, and peter as providing excellent service. best of all? you cannot beat this location! fisherman's wharf is a wonderful location for tourists, and it was just across the street from a beautiful public park, the terminus of one of the cable car lines, and ghirardelli square. there was a huge selection of restaurants nearby, a starbucks around the corner (but you do have a coffee maker in your room), and there were several bus lines within easy walking distance to get all around the city. i have stayed in a lot of locations in san francisco, but this was hands down my favorite.

original_reviews: couldn't have been happier with our choice in hotel! the beds were so comfy that it was almost difficult to get up and leave them in the mornings. as much as we love san fran, we also didn't mind hanging out in the room before bed because the nautical theme is adorable, the rooms are spacey, and we had a fun view of the cable cars. the hotel pays attention to detail, and i loved the little pet area near the entrance even though we didn't bring a fur baby. great service and location, too, of course!
reviews: did a ton of research around fisherman's wharf for a good hotel. the pictures don't lie this hotel is fantastic! the perfect location and the staff is wonderful. we had the standard king room the first night then moved into the king suite with the biggest jacuzzi tub ever for the next two. they moved all our luggage for us as well. everything was clean (which is the most important thing to me) and well stocked. the only negative is the shower - very poor water pressure and shower head stinks! the water pressure in the tub is very strong so it must just be the substandard shower head. however this was a minor inconvenience and we loved our rooms. the theme goes so perfectly with the area and we will definitely stay here again!

original_reviews: upon checking out i was advised that my receipt would be emailed to me. that never happened. so i called the hotel and you are transferred to a recording that hangs up and does not accept your message. this happened 3 different days. i will never stay at this hotel again.
reviews: after a reservation snafu, stefan (the manager) offered to do more research on the situation and provide resolution. if this top notch customer service is any indication of the guest experience, then we're off to a good start!!
cleaned_advanced: reservation snafu stefan manager offered research situation provide resolution top notch customer service indication guest experience good start

original_reviews: we had a great stay at the argonaut. came for husbands birthday and we greeted with a nice card, wine and snacks from the hotel staff. such a sweet gesture and perfect way to kick off the trip. staff was friendly and helpful. our room was a king with a bay view. we had stunning views of the golden gate bridge. can also see the ghirardelli's sign and the cable car station. the room was huge and very clean. the location is was perfect for us. it's at the very end of the pier so you walk all the way up and see everything. lots of shops and restaurants near by. also there's an avis car rental a few blocks away which was perfect as we needed a car to go to napa for just one day. and they let you park in there lot for no charge. hotel charges $75 for parking. there's a great breakfast spot a few blocks away, 8am cafe, worth it. the cable car station is just across the street. over all, would love to stay here again.
reviews: my boyfriend and i had a great stay here. the nautical theme was fun. the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. the room was fairly large and most important, clean! the room was quite too. the wine bar is nice. we ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant, blue mermaid. the food and service at the restaurant was good. my compliant, is the bed wasn't too comfortable. spending the kind of money to stay there, you would think they would have better mattresses. all in all we had a great time and i would stay there again.

original_reviews: i have previously stayed here and had a good experience. but this time, not a good experience. we got back after the room after a long day and wanted to relax & watch a movie. but couldn't get the volume turned up to a level we could hear it after paying $30 for the movie. called front desk and they sent up technical support. they said there was nothing they could do about it. so no movie for us! really disappointing! went to bed early with no movie or tv. very poor customer service and not a care that we were unhappy. i have never stayed at a hotel where i can't hear the tv. thought i was paying for a high end classy place but i don't feel that way at all! i would not recommend it!
reviews: if you are having a wedding of under 100 people, we had the ceremony outside in their courtyard and then cocktail hour and reception in the maritime room. i can't say enough positive things about the wedding coordinator chante, who did an amazing job. she was so incredibly helpful and the rest of the staff was amazing. the food was incredible, venue gorgeous! the food tasted exactly like the food tasting and everyone was so happy with their meals. the venue is just beautiful, get married here! i loved every second of it! our family also loved the rooms and had a very pleasant stay. their restaurant also has delicious food. it's also pet friendly, which allowed us to bring our two pomeranians with us. we will come back for our anniversaries for years to come.

original_reviews: i do not understand why this hotel has such high ratings. the beds were very firm and not great. the pillows were insanely soft and weird to have with the firm mattress. i asked about whether they had other mattresses and was told no, but they'd call me back to discuss solutions. no one ever called back. we were there for 4 days for my husband to convalesce from some minor surgery so the uncomfortable beds were a pretty significant inconvenience. we didn't need housekeeping for a couple of days but asked for fresh towels. that also did not happen. i really didn't feel the hotel staff had any concerns for us as guests. definitely not a high quality customer service situation, sadly. definitely not worthy of over $1,000 for our 4 day stay. my other major complaint is that the windows have wooden shutters which don't fully close and yet there are lights all around the outside. this meant the room was never completely dark and i found it hard to get to sleep. a minor complaint is that the volume of the tv kept fading in and out irregularly. it wasn't too frequent but the general lack of responsiveness from the hotel staff didn't inspire me to believe they'd fix it promptly- if ever so i didn't bother to request service. there was no market or grocery store terribly close. trader joe's was about a 15 minute walk away so not bad, but not ideal. the restaurants nearby were a mixed bag, but it's a very touristy area so i didn't have high hopes. we could hear yelling in the street on a daily basis and given that the 4th floor we were on was the highest, i imagine all the rooms can hear street sounds too. i wouldn't return here ever nor would i ever recommend it to anyone either.
reviews: eh, we have mixed feelings about argonaut. it's a cute hotel in a superb location but, unfortunately, some things were lacking. we were going to on our mini honeymoon and wanted to stay somewhere pleasant and romantic. based on good reviews, we thought argonaut would be an appropriate choice. we booked online and i called to mention that it was our honeymoon and asked whether it was possible for them to do something nice for us. perhaps a room with a pleasant view? i don't know, sometimes hotels do nice things for their guests on special occasions. well, the lady on the phone couldn't care less about our honeymoon. she responded that we had to pay more for a room with a view. ok, that makes sense, but perhaps she could sound less annoyed with our request? or at least she could try looking into what was available and let us know? so, we arrive at the hotel and find a bottle of wine with a greeting card - very nice of them, thank you, argonaut! however, the room is absolutely tiny and shares a thin wall with the room next door. so thin that we could hear every word of a phone conversation next door. our neighbor wasn't even loud. that wall was paper thin. we immediately regretted our choice. certainly not honeymoon-appropriate. the view was terrible as well. our windows were facing other hotel windows into the courtyard. i guess we did have to pay extra for something bigger, better, and more private, perhaps somewhere a bit more accommodating to our special request.

original_reviews: stayed here a few weeks ago and loved it! very nice and comfortable rooms. beds were very comfortable. excellent location right at fisherman's wharf and within walking distance of so many shops, restaurants and activities. great staff! got a package with parking included and valet brings your car right up. i highly recommend staying here! you will love it!
reviews: very friendly staff, and the room is clean. great location, near the wharf. parking is a pain. you're best to valet park it, and not worry about it until the next day.

original_reviews: the location is great, but the rooms are really small and unless you get a view room, don't stay here because you end up looking across the patio into a neighboring room. the musty smell reminds me of mold. lastly, any hotel that has pump shampoo and conditioner in the bathrooms should be avoided. it's super cheap and creepy. who know how long and what's in those containers. sound proofing between rooms is lacking as well.
reviews: had a nice break from the craziness of downtown. fish tacos was pretty decent, west coast style. family had salad and something else that i dont remember. everyone was happy with their food. hostess and waitstaff was pleasant and professional.

original_reviews: this is a great hotel. i love the look and the people. the ambiance is great and fits the area. the staff is very nice and helpful. i would recommend this place to everyone. good job!
reviews: my husband and i stayed at this beautiful hotel for our 40th wedding anniversary on july 20th through the 26th. i can't say enough about this beautiful hotel. the views were amazing and the staff, well what can i say. they made sure our 40th was a beautiful one, had the sweetest notes, wine and snacks included in our stay. i am recommending this hotel to all our family and friends. i can promise you when we come back there will be no other place we would want to stay than the beautiful, top notch argonaut hotel. thank you again!

original_reviews: this is a darling hotel in a great location. it gets two stars for all of the outrageous/outlandish extra charges ($81 for parking, fees for using gym facilities that we didn't use $28). we booked using hotels tonight where they charged us the $28 and then were charged again by the hotel, as well as errors they charged for an upgrade for two nights when we were only there one night. trying to figure out all this mess and double dipping was a huge bummer! check your credit charge statements when you leave.
reviews: wonderful stay! great location! so convenient to everything in the city yet you feel a bit removed from the tourist scene once you step inside. our room was quiet and had a decent view of the courtyard in the cannery. the beds were comfortable and everything was so clean! my only complaint is that the pressure from the shower head is very weak. i figured we were in ca and there was still a drought so i got used to the shower pressure. we enjoyed breakfast at the blue mermaid- service was good there as well. kinda expensive but you have to remember you are in the middle of the tourist area. the hotel gives you a $10 voucher to eat daily there. the cheapest thing on the menu for breakfast is a bagel for $6. coffee is $5. the cost of the hotel was worth the pleasant three night stay in sf. word of advice if you want to save $ during the trip would be to take the muni. the f trolley goes along embarcadero and the 30 stockton goes straight into the heart of chinatown. the 30 bus experience was like an amusement park ride.... (crazy city bus driver trying to keep up with her bus schedule.... ). sf has a great transit system. you get to feel like a local and it's a way better deal than the tourist trap cable car.... $7 versus $2.75. the muni even gives you extra minutes to ride back. on one of our trips we got a return ride included after 4 hours after our initial departure. sweet deal! another money saving tip is to rent a car from sfo and drop it off by closing to the rental agency nearby. we rented from avis and paid only $16 to rent an suv. we arrived early in the morning and drove down to palo alto and returned the car a block away from the hotel by 5pm. parking and driving in the city is so not worth your time or money.

original_reviews: what a great location. rooms were really nice. i loved the octopus wallpaper and the whole nautical theme. it's definitely worth the extra bucks to stay here. the door men are really nice. one of them had my daughters super pumped on the treasure chest that awaited them in the lobby. great way to start off. my kids were all smiles the whole trip. after walking around seeing the places i avoided i patted my self on the back. i got a lot of your the best dad ever. which is always nice. there's always a lot of decisions when traveling with kids. i am glade i made the one to stay here.
reviews: this place is right in the middle of everything! it's such a cute hotel! my husband and i celebrated our 1 year of marriage. we receive a wine bottle, snacks and a cute welcoming note from argonaut hotel. the only thing i didn't like was how expensive parking was. 59 per night!! adds up once you check out! which they did tell me about. besides that, this place is awesome!

original_reviews: it was my brother's birthday and the hotel did try to make it special by leaving a note with a complimentary bottle of wine; however the note stated the wrong name. they simply just took the person who booked the hotel and used their last name when that is not my brother's last name. it was a little uncomfortable as that is not his last name. perhaps they could have reached out to the person who notified them of the birthday and asked what his first name was or even his nickname. nonetheless, they tried. i will give them that!
reviews: ahoy! what a great stay! clean, themed rooms. excellent front desk and bell staff. greeted like royalty ever time i came in and the whole check in was a breeze. great location with everything walkable and would stay again!!

original_reviews: this is our second time staying at the argonaut. the first was about 6 years ago and the service and amenities have improved. we have a bay view suite. the bed is comfortable and there were many types of pillows to choose from. the hotel is in a great location. walking distance to some of the most iconic places in the city.
reviews: my husband and i stayed here for our honeymoon before going to hawaii. we arrive and we were told our room was not ready yet. we had to leave our bags at the front desk while we went to explore the town. i would have liked to go to the room to freshen up first. we were told we were going to be given a great room since it was our honeymoon. well it didn't really seem like anything was special about it. the one lamp didn't work and the tv didn't work at first, we had to play with it to get it to work. yeah great room. the room was smaller than i was expecting. the bathroom is so small you can barely move. the only nice thing is we got a small bottle of champagne. i did like the nautical decor and the happy hour. but definately not worth the $400 more a night cost we paid for a small room. i don't even think our room in hawaii was that much. and the worst part about our trip is that we never received a gift package that a friend dropped off to the hotel. i didn't notice her email until i returned home and my husband tried contacting the hotel. no one knew anything about it and could do anything, we didn't even get an apology either. i guess it either got lost and there was no communication at the hotel or some employee must have stolen it. highly dissapointed.

original_reviews: stayed at the argonaut again for thanksgiving weekend 2015. under new ownership now. the room was a little worn. carpet and bathroom tile needed replacement. they no longer have the complimentary wine hour which was great not just for the free wine, but i always enjoyed chatting with people from other places. the staff wasn't quite as attentive as before the turnover. otherwise, it is still a nice hotel in a great location and reasonably priced for what you get in that area.

original_reviews: restaurants all around, ghirardelli 5 minute walk away, inandout burger joint 2 minutes walk. fishermen's wharf right here next to the hotel. great running path and bike path as soon as i walk out the door. i will definitely come back to this lovely hotel.
reviews: this is an adorable hotel. it's is very close to the water..the theme of the room was sailor/sea.. very charming with expose brick wall and wood beam post in the bedroom and bathroom. the room was a bit small but clean and comfortable. the staff are very friendly and helpful.

original_reviews: favorite among favorites. location perfect for grazing the wharf. service is top-notch and the blue mermaid next door is a great meet up place. happy family memories here. really appreciate the effort to retain the brick architectural charm of years past.
reviews: not sure why this hotel got 4.5 stars. their beds are tiny queens. two adults can barely sleep comfortably on them. also cots cost extra where most hotels are happy to supply one especially if their beds are tiny. location and interior design are the only good things about this place.

original_reviews: i was so excited to stay here, as i had heard great things about this hotel from my manager. i was very much disappointed. i only stayed here one night. thank goodness because the worst thing about this hotel are the paper thin walls. i had a family on one side of me that were very loud and obnoxious. i was able to hear everything they talked about. then on the other side of me was a party going on. needless to say i did not get a great nights sleep. perhaps i was just unlucky in my nearby roommates but regardless i still think the thin walls would be an issue with anybody, no true privacy. the staff at the front desk were nice which is the reason for the 2 stars, but other than that i feel there are better hotels in the area. also, they nickel and dime you for everything. you can have the small in room bottle of wine for $26, purchase the stuffed sea lion on the bed for $22, a liter of water for $6, etc. nothing is complementary. to top it off, i tried to order room service in the morning and when i called i was told my room was vacant and they couldn't deliver to my room. come to find out someone on the morning crew had accidentally checked me out of my room during the night. so when i went to checkout i was told i had already done so. next time i'm in town i will not be staying here. i should have stayed at the hotel i was at before switching to this one. very disappointed.
reviews: great stay! they were overbooked when we arrived and offered to put is in a huge 900 sq ft room for the first night. since we had a lot of stuff and really did not want to move they figured it out and put us in our standard room as expected. the employees were awesome and so understanding. the room itself we had was a 2 queen and it was spacious and clean. service was impeccable and everything in the room was comfy, making for a great stay. he location is perfect as it puts you close to many great restaurants and is right near shopping and cable cars. i cannot imagine a better hotel for our stay

original_reviews: i had a comfortable stay in the hotel. prime location. i am celebrating my honeymoon and the hotel staff was more than willing to accommodate us. the hotel was well maintained and had fun nautical decor. i feel the parking was a bit steep. i definitely recommend this hotel to anybody staying in the san fransico fisherman wharf area.
reviews: the location of this cannery turned boutique hotel couldn't be in a better location if fishermans wharf is your destination. we had a fabulous 2 days exploring all the wharf had to offer. pros of this hotel are the location on jefferson st,the attentive staff, interesting architecture including exposed brick walls and original wood, and nice sized rooms. cons are the awful pancake flat pillows, no extra blankets, very dirty behind bed and nightstand, worn carpets, and no blackout curtains. for the price i'd like to see more attention to details like good pillows and cleanliness. but i would stay here again based on location.

original_reviews: i loved the location of the hotel! perfect to reach anywhere in less than 15 minutes walking. the decor is so refreshing and fun!
reviews: ive found my new replacement to the fairmont hotel. this hotel was unbelievable. i didn't come here to be a tourist of fishermans wharf. i just had always wanted to check out this hotel and i was finally able to. we booked the king suite. one of the most beautiful, comfortable suites ive ever stayed in. better than any suite ive had at the fairmont chain. it over looked a corner of the wharf, which we opened the window up most of the time to the enchanting bay air. the suite had a huge living room with a door that closed to the bedroom that was also giant. the bathroom was also expansive. the bathtub was incredible. its huge. a family of four could comfortably sit in it and actually swim. i couldn't stay out of it. i got in in the middle of the night and i got in as soon as i woke up. i couldn't get enough of this bathtub. i lounged around in my complimentary robe every second i could. the bed was very comfortable. i loved the bedding set. everything was just perfect. going back to the fairmont comparison, this giant suite was $200 cheaper than a regular room at the fairmont. can you believe that?! its so worth it if you can do it. the hotel is wonderful. service is fast and efficient. there are obviously lots of things within walking distance. we walked down by the beach, we walked and got brunch the next day. this hotel has become my happy place every time i reminisce about my stay.

original_reviews: best hotel on the pier, hands down. we had a deluxe king looking over the park and golden gate bridge. friendly staff and beautiful building. excellent upscale boutique hotel. will be back.
reviews: i have stayed in many san franciscan hotels but i think the argonaut may be my favorite. i have always been intrigued and when a good deal presented itself i bit. i was so excited for months and once we arrived it was better than i dreamed. before we walked into the hotel, the doorman was loading our stuff onto a cart and welcoming us. we were very early and didn't expect our room to be ready but marilyn? checked us in and found us a wonderful room with an amazing view. such a small action made such a difference in our vacation because we were able to get settled and enjoy our hotel that much longer, thanks to her. she was super sweet and i can tell she rolls out the red carpet for everyone she helps. the rooms are huge and even have doorbells! the service by all staff members was exceptional and felt like a family environment. the doormen and bell hops seems to genuinely enjoy being at work. we loved the lobby with its fireplace and with complementary citrus infused water. the location is fantastic in touristy fisherman's wharf. if tourist traps aren't your thing, that's ok, the cable car or bus stop is close by and can quickly whisk you away to less visited areas of town, as we prefer to do. one of my favorite things to do when visiting is ride the cable cars at night for stunning views of the city and shorter lines. it was so nice to be staying close to the line. i will most likely stay here again.

reviews: an expensive hotel. it's right smack in the middle of the tourist area called fisherman's wharf. checking in was a breeze. they do give you your room key(s) and then another actual physical key. the front desk was explaining it so fast that i missed what it was for. it's not for the safe. it's actually for cabinet to access the fridge. for the price i paid, i expected some sort of view. my view was of the roof of the 1st floor where the air conditioning units are. wonderful! better off elsewhere.
