original_reviews: stayed here twice during november and december and thoroughly enjoyed my stay! lady at the front desk was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. loved the christmas music in the lobby and the beautiful fireplace, rooms were clean and had a lovely nautical theme! location was not too bad, close to the water and tourist shops, and not too far from the alcatraz tour dock. the doorman was very friendly and shared with us about living in philadelphia compared to california which was nice to hear about life in the usa as an australian. would definitely love to come back and stay at the argonaut again.
reviews: hubby surprised me with a get away here for our anniversary. very conveniently located and service is wonderful. pricey but hey it's san francisco. bed is super comfy and the coffee is delicious.
cleaned_advanced: hubby surprised get away anniversary conveniently located service wonderful pricey hey san francisco bed super comfy coffee delicious

original_reviews: i have so many wonderful things to say about the argonaut! i stayed at this hotel for 6 nights on business, and i went away with a truly positive experience. years back, i saw the argonaut while on another trip to san francisco, and i always wanted to stay there. something about it just caught my eye. so, when i saw that it had a rate my employer would cover on my recent business trip, i was ready! i tell this tale because i went to the argonaut with high hopes - and they did not let me down. i was not in an upgraded room with a view, but my room was terrific. it was meticulously clean, well-appointed, and very comfortable. my king sized bed offered me a great sleep. the only downer is that the walls did seem a bit thin, and i could hear the neighbors if it was totally silent. fortunately for me, i need to sleep with a fan or white noise of some type, so it was no issue. the staff was also really friendly and accommodating. i wish i could remember everyone that impressed me, but i remember john, frank, matthew, and peter as providing excellent service. best of all? you cannot beat this location! fisherman's wharf is a wonderful location for tourists, and it was just across the street from a beautiful public park, the terminus of one of the cable car lines, and ghirardelli square. there was a huge selection of restaurants nearby, a starbucks around the corner (but you do have a coffee maker in your room), and there were several bus lines within easy walking distance to get all around the city. i have stayed in a lot of locations in san francisco, but this was hands down my favorite.
reviews: this is a nice hotel and we really enjoyed the doorman. he made us laugh every time we saw him. this is a great location that is centrally located to most of the attractions that we wanted to visit.
cleaned_advanced: nice really enjoyed doorman made u laugh every time saw great location centrally located attraction wanted visit

original_reviews: did a ton of research around fisherman's wharf for a good hotel. the pictures don't lie this hotel is fantastic! the perfect location and the staff is wonderful. we had the standard king room the first night then moved into the king suite with the biggest jacuzzi tub ever for the next two. they moved all our luggage for us as well. everything was clean (which is the most important thing to me) and well stocked. the only negative is the shower - very poor water pressure and shower head stinks! the water pressure in the tub is very strong so it must just be the substandard shower head. however this was a minor inconvenience and we loved our rooms. the theme goes so perfectly with the area and we will definitely stay here again!
reviews: did a lot of research on best hotels to stay in san francisco prior to our visit. picked argonaut based on great reviews.hotel is conveniently located at the end of fisherman's wharf. unique nautical decor. the beds were very comfortable and rooms quiet. the staff was very helpful and friendly. i would give it a five star but we found the bathrooms a bit small for our liking and the closets need lighting. we will definitely stay here again on our next visit.
cleaned_advanced: lot research best hotel san francisco prior visit picked argonaut based great reviewshotel conveniently located end fisherman wharf unique nautical decor bed comfortable quiet staff helpful friendly would give five star found bathroom bit small liking closet need lighting definitely next visit

original_reviews: after a reservation snafu, stefan (the manager) offered to do more research on the situation and provide resolution. if this top notch customer service is any indication of the guest experience, then we're off to a good start!!
reviews: great location and clean room. friendly staff anytime we asked for anything. our room faced hyde street with a view of the golden gate bridge.
cleaned_advanced: great location clean friendly staff anytime asked anything faced hyde street view golden gate bridge

original_reviews: my boyfriend and i had a great stay here. the nautical theme was fun. the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. the room was fairly large and most important, clean! the room was quite too. the wine bar is nice. we ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant, blue mermaid. the food and service at the restaurant was good. my compliant, is the bed wasn't too comfortable. spending the kind of money to stay there, you would think they would have better mattresses. all in all we had a great time and i would stay there again.
reviews: the location for this hotel can't be better! it was just walking distance to pier 39 and being able to just walk a few steps out your hotel and see alcatraz in the distance was surreal. management at this hotel take there job seriously and make it a point to make sure that guests are well taken care of and have a good experience. i just recently went to this hotel and will be going back as soon as possible. just want to thank guysell and the staff there for making our trip and our first time in san francisco memorable.
cleaned_advanced: location cant better walking distance pier able walk step see alcatraz distance surreal management take job seriously make point make sure guest well taken care good experience recently went going back soon possible want thank guysell staff making trip first time san francisco memorable

original_reviews: if you are having a wedding of under 100 people, we had the ceremony outside in their courtyard and then cocktail hour and reception in the maritime room. i can't say enough positive things about the wedding coordinator chante, who did an amazing job. she was so incredibly helpful and the rest of the staff was amazing. the food was incredible, venue gorgeous! the food tasted exactly like the food tasting and everyone was so happy with their meals. the venue is just beautiful, get married here! i loved every second of it! our family also loved the rooms and had a very pleasant stay. their restaurant also has delicious food. it's also pet friendly, which allowed us to bring our two pomeranians with us. we will come back for our anniversaries for years to come.
reviews: loved this hotel! from the moment we pulled up we were treated like royalty. they found out we were on our honeymoon so the bellhop had wine brought up to our room. they also upgraded us to a room with a great view of the golden gate bridge. they were so sweet and accommodating they made our stay that much better. every time i think of san francisco i'll think of the pleasant experience i had at the argonaut. the blue mermaid was absolutely delicious also which the hotel gave us drink vouchers for. i couldn't be happier.
cleaned_advanced: loved moment pulled treated like royalty found honeymoon bellhop wine brought also upgraded u great view golden gate bridge sweet accommodating made much better every time think san francisco ill think pleasant experience argonaut blue mermaid absolutely delicious also gave u drink voucher couldnt happier

original_reviews: eh, we have mixed feelings about argonaut. it's a cute hotel in a superb location but, unfortunately, some things were lacking. we were going to on our mini honeymoon and wanted to stay somewhere pleasant and romantic. based on good reviews, we thought argonaut would be an appropriate choice. we booked online and i called to mention that it was our honeymoon and asked whether it was possible for them to do something nice for us. perhaps a room with a pleasant view? i don't know, sometimes hotels do nice things for their guests on special occasions. well, the lady on the phone couldn't care less about our honeymoon. she responded that we had to pay more for a room with a view. ok, that makes sense, but perhaps she could sound less annoyed with our request? or at least she could try looking into what was available and let us know? so, we arrive at the hotel and find a bottle of wine with a greeting card - very nice of them, thank you, argonaut! however, the room is absolutely tiny and shares a thin wall with the room next door. so thin that we could hear every word of a phone conversation next door. our neighbor wasn't even loud. that wall was paper thin. we immediately regretted our choice. certainly not honeymoon-appropriate. the view was terrible as well. our windows were facing other hotel windows into the courtyard. i guess we did have to pay extra for something bigger, better, and more private, perhaps somewhere a bit more accommodating to our special request.
reviews: we decided to go to hawaii for our honeymoon and my wife planned her dream vacation. we thought it would be a long commute from the philadelphia area, so we should cut our flight in half and stop by san francisco for a few days before we reach hawaii. i took it upon myself to surprise my wife and found what i thought would be a great hotel, the argonaut, near the wharf. when we arrived, our room wasn't ready and the front desk clerk was extremely friendly. she assured us that they had a perfect room for us on the top floor as requested and it would just be a bit longer. we decided to walk around the city for a bit and when we got back to the hotel our "room" was finally ready. we were given keys to the third floor though. i tried to inquire why, but they assured me that was the room they had for us. waiting in our room was a nice bottle of champagne and candy from ghirardelli. there was a card wishing us a happy honeymoon, but on the back of the card was a three digit number starting with 4, so i'm assuming that was the room we were supposed to have. the room looked similar to the photos of the room we wanted, so who really cared? we were on our honeymoon. in the room, a lamp didn't work and the television wasn't plugged in. we had the light fixed quickly and i plugged the television in myself. the hotel had a nice happy hour, where we could grab some free beer and wine. most of the staff were incredibly friendly until after we checked out and i had to contact them. my wife knows the daughter of a woman at her work and she lives in the san francisco area. this woman personally dropped off a gift basket/wedding gift at the hotel. we didn't find this out until we were in hawaii and the woman asked if we received the gift. i still had the card with the other room number, so i contacted the hotel to see if they had the gift and possibly delivered it to our original room. the hotel told me that they didn't have the gift and they were pretty cold to me. i emailed and tried contacting them again to get a hold of another person who could possibly help me and no one could. the manager tried to cover it up by saying they weren't sure why we were moved, but they wouldn't have delivered anything if we weren't in the room. as i mentioned in my final email to them: although our stay wasn't bad, we are put in the position where we have to decide if a close friend, who asked us if we got the gift she personally delivered to the hotel to surprise us with, lied to us or if someone at the hotel kept the gift for themselves. update: our stay was prior to the argonaut being taken over by a new ownership group. i have been contacted by a representative from the new company and he has assured me that there are a lot of new employees. i have no way of knowing if the employees we had issues with are still there or not. i have been assured that our experience would be better the next time, but we still have no desire to return. i have also been told that the happy hour that we enjoyed is no longer available. when i inquired what replaced that, i was basically told to experience it for myself and to contact them for the best rates. that's not a great selling point to me, so i'm not sure if there is anything that special there other than the great location.

original_reviews: very friendly staff, and the room is clean. great location, near the wharf. parking is a pain. you're best to valet park it, and not worry about it until the next day.
reviews: my husband and i celebrated our anniversary here. from check in to check out, we loved everything about this hotel. every single member of the staff we had any contact with was friendly and helpful. our room was comfortable and cozy. the fisherman's wharf area is a sentimental favorite of ours so this hotel is perfectly located. we were within walking distance of everything we wanted to do and see on this quick visit. we're already making plans to come back and are looking forward to another stay in this lovely hotel.

original_reviews: had a nice break from the craziness of downtown. fish tacos was pretty decent, west coast style. family had salad and something else that i dont remember. everyone was happy with their food. hostess and waitstaff was pleasant and professional.
reviews: we were disappointed this time staying here, we stay here a couple times a year. first, requested room close to elevators, i recently had knee surgery and needed something close, got room down the hall not close to elevator. when checking out, requested to stay 1 hour later, was denied. not great with customer service. one would think a repeat customer of several years, they would honor customer loyalty, they didn't. and we stayed during the week, so it wasn't peak times or weekend. very disappointed.

original_reviews: my husband and i stayed at this beautiful hotel for our 40th wedding anniversary on july 20th through the 26th. i can't say enough about this beautiful hotel. the views were amazing and the staff, well what can i say. they made sure our 40th was a beautiful one, had the sweetest notes, wine and snacks included in our stay. i am recommending this hotel to all our family and friends. i can promise you when we come back there will be no other place we would want to stay than the beautiful, top notch argonaut hotel. thank you again!
reviews: stayed here recently on the recommendation of a friend, and so happy that we did! we splurged on a bay view queen room that looked out on the trolley turnaround and the sf bay and golden gate bridge. the room was clean, spacious, comfortable, and quiet. i loved that we could go downstairs for a full breakfast in the restaurant (good breakfasts) and then just walk to everything from the hotel--over to fort mason, down fisherman's wharf, down the embarcadero to the ferry building. splendid!. barring that, it's so easy to take an uber and avoid driving and parking. staff was very friendly, including the concierge who booked us at green's in 5 minutes and drew us a map of the walk to get there. i can't wait to visit again and stay at the argonaut! it's pricey, but worth it!

original_reviews: wonderful stay! great location! so convenient to everything in the city yet you feel a bit removed from the tourist scene once you step inside. our room was quiet and had a decent view of the courtyard in the cannery. the beds were comfortable and everything was so clean! my only complaint is that the pressure from the shower head is very weak. i figured we were in ca and there was still a drought so i got used to the shower pressure. we enjoyed breakfast at the blue mermaid- service was good there as well. kinda expensive but you have to remember you are in the middle of the tourist area. the hotel gives you a $10 voucher to eat daily there. the cheapest thing on the menu for breakfast is a bagel for $6. coffee is $5. the cost of the hotel was worth the pleasant three night stay in sf. word of advice if you want to save $ during the trip would be to take the muni. the f trolley goes along embarcadero and the 30 stockton goes straight into the heart of chinatown. the 30 bus experience was like an amusement park ride.... (crazy city bus driver trying to keep up with her bus schedule.... ). sf has a great transit system. you get to feel like a local and it's a way better deal than the tourist trap cable car.... $7 versus $2.75. the muni even gives you extra minutes to ride back. on one of our trips we got a return ride included after 4 hours after our initial departure. sweet deal! another money saving tip is to rent a car from sfo and drop it off by closing to the rental agency nearby. we rented from avis and paid only $16 to rent an suv. we arrived early in the morning and drove down to palo alto and returned the car a block away from the hotel by 5pm. parking and driving in the city is so not worth your time or money.
reviews: my husband and i love this hotel we got engaged at this hotel about 2 years ago so we can't see ourselves staying anywhere else. we just stayed here again his weekend and it was what we remembered from our fond memories. from the outside service to the front desk, the service is impeccable. they are all very friendly, accommodating and professional. my husband spoils me so we stay in the suite with the hot tub and love love love it! the room is extremely nice and we feel right at home when we come here. the best part is is the hotel is located within walking distance to fisherman's wharf which we love. i highly recommend staying here.
cleaned_advanced: husband love got engaged year ago cant see staying anywhere else stayed weekend remembered fond memory outside service front desk service impeccable friendly accommodating professional husband spoil suite hot tub love love love extremely nice feel right home come best part located within walking distance fisherman wharf love highly recommend staying

original_reviews: this place is right in the middle of everything! it's such a cute hotel! my husband and i celebrated our 1 year of marriage. we receive a wine bottle, snacks and a cute welcoming note from argonaut hotel. the only thing i didn't like was how expensive parking was. 59 per night!! adds up once you check out! which they did tell me about. besides that, this place is awesome!
reviews: my wife and i stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and we couldnt have had a better time. the hotel staff for polite and friendly and always willing to help with anything. the rooms were very clean and comfortable. the location cannot be beaten and we had a great view of the bay from our room. i would recommend this place to anyone who wants to visit san francisco.

original_reviews: ahoy! what a great stay! clean, themed rooms. excellent front desk and bell staff. greeted like royalty ever time i came in and the whole check in was a breeze. great location with everything walkable and would stay again!!
reviews: super happy with our stay here!! after getting checked in they offered to upgrade us to a room with a view. the location and views are absolutely gorgeous! we are literally steps from the beach and steps from fisherman wharf. the hotel itself had a nautical feel decor. the rooms are spacious and the staff was amazing. overall i would stay here again!
cleaned_advanced: super happy getting checked offered upgrade u view location view absolutely gorgeous literally step beach step fisherman wharf nautical feel decor spacious staff amazing overall would

original_reviews: my husband and i stayed here for our honeymoon before going to hawaii. we arrive and we were told our room was not ready yet. we had to leave our bags at the front desk while we went to explore the town. i would have liked to go to the room to freshen up first. we were told we were going to be given a great room since it was our honeymoon. well it didn't really seem like anything was special about it. the one lamp didn't work and the tv didn't work at first, we had to play with it to get it to work. yeah great room. the room was smaller than i was expecting. the bathroom is so small you can barely move. the only nice thing is we got a small bottle of champagne. i did like the nautical decor and the happy hour. but definately not worth the $400 more a night cost we paid for a small room. i don't even think our room in hawaii was that much. and the worst part about our trip is that we never received a gift package that a friend dropped off to the hotel. i didn't notice her email until i returned home and my husband tried contacting the hotel. no one knew anything about it and could do anything, we didn't even get an apology either. i guess it either got lost and there was no communication at the hotel or some employee must have stolen it. highly dissapointed.
reviews: this time we reserved our room through expedia and couldn't have been happier. price was reasonable. we had a deluxe king room with a view of ghirardelli square, the cable cars and a peek of the bay. don't waste your money on the overpriced view rooms (unless you can get a good price) this was perfect! room 238 was big, clean and comfortable! everyone was super friendly and nice and again the location is fabulous! will definitely be going back! too much fun!

original_reviews: a very beautiful hotel located in famous fishermans wharf. the blue mermaid restaurant has delicious chowder in a sourdough bread bowl you must try.
reviews: stayed here for my first trip to san francisco because of location and reviews. very pleased with the choice! the staff was welcoming and friendly--especially marilyn at the front desk who gave us great suggestions for site seeing and restaurants. the location is right in the heart of fisherman's wharf and the building is historical. i would return without hesitation!

original_reviews: this is an adorable hotel. it's is very close to the water..the theme of the room was sailor/sea.. very charming with expose brick wall and wood beam post in the bedroom and bathroom. the room was a bit small but clean and comfortable. the staff are very friendly and helpful.
reviews: this is a nice boutique hotel with excellent access to fisherman's wharf. it's overpriced and the rooms are a little too small and uncomfortable. i'm glad we stayed here once, but i don't think we'll be back unless we can find a really low rate. not a bad experience overall.

original_reviews: not sure why this hotel got 4.5 stars. their beds are tiny queens. two adults can barely sleep comfortably on them. also cots cost extra where most hotels are happy to supply one especially if their beds are tiny. location and interior design are the only good things about this place.
reviews: kitschy but cool nautical theme. nice lobby space with a fireplace and several seating areas for hanging out or playing games. rooms are spacious and some have exposed brick and beams. reasonable but not cheap. right in the heart of the tourist attractions along fisherman's wharf so plenty to do within walking distance.

original_reviews: great stay! they were overbooked when we arrived and offered to put is in a huge 900 sq ft room for the first night. since we had a lot of stuff and really did not want to move they figured it out and put us in our standard room as expected. the employees were awesome and so understanding. the room itself we had was a 2 queen and it was spacious and clean. service was impeccable and everything in the room was comfy, making for a great stay. he location is perfect as it puts you close to many great restaurants and is right near shopping and cable cars. i cannot imagine a better hotel for our stay
reviews: so i've stayed here a number of times. it's a nice hotel but i'm 2 starring it because of the pretentious bs. i've booked rooms from their website and from discount sites. the regular rooms are great. they keep what i can only assume are rooms for chumps who rent on third party websites. here's my experience today. i'm driving into the city from work so i can catch a flight tomorrow. i check their website and the discount sites. discount sites are 50$ cheaper. out of courtesy because i like the hotel, i call them direct and see if they will honor the rate i found on every other third party site. the lady who answers checks her third party rates and claims she doesn't see the same and declines to match. i triple checked to make sure all of the sites had the same. she makes no counter offer for what she allegedly sees. so i say thank you and book thru a third party. this is the second time i've done this and they have done this. the hotel has no idea who i am. i arrive and a new guy checks me in. he's gracious polite and efficient. i head to the room. yup they shoved me all the way in the back, and it's a long slog from the elevators. which would be ok if the room weren't a deliberately under-furnished pos. the other rooms have a lovely couch and desk arrangement. i have the same sized room with a desk and a single tiny sad dirty little chair. there is a giant gap on the wall where the couch should be. and the bathroom has hair in it. plus the bath mat is scummy with mold. so tell me management? how sad is it that you actually keep rooms that you refused to put the normal furniture in and don't maintain as well just for third party bookings? i know the hotel isn't full tonight. i checked the vacancy level. when these guys have their a game on it's nice but they actually train their desk staff to lie. you will actually have a better stay at a hampton or a holiday inn.

original_reviews: awesome hotel conveniently located in the fisherman's wharf area! love the staff and the nautical themed rooms! perfect place to stay in san francisco!
reviews: this hotel is ahhhhmazing! we stayed for 3 nights and didn't want to leave. the staff starting from the gentleman in a uniform were all so pleasantly helpful and sincere. the location is wonderful. my husband and i walked to the alcatraz ferry, pier 39, cable cars and gheredelli square. the walls are paper thin that will be my only complaint. our next door neighbor liked to leave his tv on all day and all night. they came back to their hotel room with 2 other people (no biggie) at 2am and their conversation which was not loud but sounded like they were standing at the end of my bed. i knew i could count on the staff to address the concern with a phone call away but i decided to not bother. the food, hospitality and decor is top notch and will always be my go to place in the fishermans warf area.

original_reviews: the location of this cannery turned boutique hotel couldn't be in a better location if fishermans wharf is your destination. we had a fabulous 2 days exploring all the wharf had to offer. pros of this hotel are the location on jefferson st,the attentive staff, interesting architecture including exposed brick walls and original wood, and nice sized rooms. cons are the awful pancake flat pillows, no extra blankets, very dirty behind bed and nightstand, worn carpets, and no blackout curtains. for the price i'd like to see more attention to details like good pillows and cleanliness. but i would stay here again based on location.
reviews: as our tickets to san francisco were nearing, i urged my boyfriend to book at the argonaut for our fun trip in the city. when it comes to location, this place to rocks! i think fisherman's wharf is the ultimate place to stay in the city! this way, you can be close to attractions like alcatraz, pier 39, and epic views of the golden gate bridge. growing up, my dad would always book at the argonaut. our stays at this venue are particularly nostalgic for me because some of my favorite family memories were spent here. i remember being infatuated with the aquatic style decor and outfits worn by staff. as a child, this place was wonderland! returning as a now, 23-year-old, i saw the hotel much differently. it is still spectacular but for the price, it didn't exactly meet the mark for me. now the style of the hotel looked a little bit tired and in need of a revamp. the staff seemed less cheery than i remembered too, in fact, they all seemed a bit disgruntled. it was a hard pill for me to swallow that the hotel was not as magical as i had remembered! this is not to say that this isn't a fabulous hotel! i just believe it is a bit tired in its theme and lacking in effort.

original_reviews: ive found my new replacement to the fairmont hotel. this hotel was unbelievable. i didn't come here to be a tourist of fishermans wharf. i just had always wanted to check out this hotel and i was finally able to. we booked the king suite. one of the most beautiful, comfortable suites ive ever stayed in. better than any suite ive had at the fairmont chain. it over looked a corner of the wharf, which we opened the window up most of the time to the enchanting bay air. the suite had a huge living room with a door that closed to the bedroom that was also giant. the bathroom was also expansive. the bathtub was incredible. its huge. a family of four could comfortably sit in it and actually swim. i couldn't stay out of it. i got in in the middle of the night and i got in as soon as i woke up. i couldn't get enough of this bathtub. i lounged around in my complimentary robe every second i could. the bed was very comfortable. i loved the bedding set. everything was just perfect. going back to the fairmont comparison, this giant suite was $200 cheaper than a regular room at the fairmont. can you believe that?! its so worth it if you can do it. the hotel is wonderful. service is fast and efficient. there are obviously lots of things within walking distance. we walked down by the beach, we walked and got brunch the next day. this hotel has become my happy place every time i reminisce about my stay.
reviews: i've been coming to the argonaut for years, in fact i got married here! they have always been super friendly and accommodating. they love our dogs and always give them treats! the front desk always makes sure i get the room we love. the hotel itself is located in an old canning factory. it's gorgeous and they gave it a sophisticated nautical feel. plus, it's always spotless. rates have always been very reasonable. it changed hands recently and now noble house runs it. it's exactly the same, maybe even slightly better! book a room here. you will be thrilled!
cleaned_advanced: ive coming argonaut year fact got married always super friendly accommodating love dog always give treat front desk always make sure get love located old canning factory gorgeous gave sophisticated nautical feel plus always spotless rate always reasonable changed hand recently noble house run exactly maybe even slightly better book thrilled

original_reviews: i have stayed in many san franciscan hotels but i think the argonaut may be my favorite. i have always been intrigued and when a good deal presented itself i bit. i was so excited for months and once we arrived it was better than i dreamed. before we walked into the hotel, the doorman was loading our stuff onto a cart and welcoming us. we were very early and didn't expect our room to be ready but marilyn? checked us in and found us a wonderful room with an amazing view. such a small action made such a difference in our vacation because we were able to get settled and enjoy our hotel that much longer, thanks to her. she was super sweet and i can tell she rolls out the red carpet for everyone she helps. the rooms are huge and even have doorbells! the service by all staff members was exceptional and felt like a family environment. the doormen and bell hops seems to genuinely enjoy being at work. we loved the lobby with its fireplace and with complementary citrus infused water. the location is fantastic in touristy fisherman's wharf. if tourist traps aren't your thing, that's ok, the cable car or bus stop is close by and can quickly whisk you away to less visited areas of town, as we prefer to do. one of my favorite things to do when visiting is ride the cable cars at night for stunning views of the city and shorter lines. it was so nice to be staying close to the line. i will most likely stay here again.
reviews: this was one of the best hotel experiences i have ever had! upon arriving in mid afternoon in the hustle and bustle of fisherman's wharf, we were a bit flustered with traffic and where to park. when we pulled out in front of the hotel, the staff instantly warmly greeted us and gave us directions on where to park. although they do offer valet parking for $50 per night, we opted to self park behind the hotel (that is not affiliated with the hotel). they grabbed our luggage for us while we parked which helped us from lugging all our heavy baggage across the street. check-in was easy, and we were amazed by our nautical themed room. it was very spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated. we were stunned that every room even had their own doorbell! the lobby was also cozy with a fireplace, plenty of sitting room, and had an attached restaurant. although we did not eat at the restaurant, the menu looked appetizing and it was nice to know it was a place we could go to for a snack if needed. we loved this hotel not only for the ambience, but also because it is in the best location in fisherman's wharf. unfortunately, the location is probably why it was on the pricer end. it is located right on the main street across from the piers between ghirardelli square and all the wharf's shops/restaurants, so you have easy access to eating and entertainment without taking transportation. we were sad to leave this hotel, but we will be back!
cleaned_advanced: one best experience ever upon arriving mid afternoon hustle bustle fisherman wharf bit flustered traffic park pulled front staff instantly warmly greeted u gave u direction park although offer valet parking per night opted self park behind affiliated grabbed luggage u parked helped u lugging heavy baggage across street checkin easy amazed nautical themed spacious clean beautifully decorated stunned every even doorbell lobby also cozy fireplace plenty sitting attached restaurant although eat restaurant menu looked appetizing nice know place could go snack needed loved ambience also best location fisherman wharf unfortunately location probably pricer end located right main street across pier ghirardelli square wharf shopsrestaurants easy access eating entertainment without taking transportation sad leave back

original_reviews: an expensive hotel. it's right smack in the middle of the tourist area called fisherman's wharf. checking in was a breeze. they do give you your room key(s) and then another actual physical key. the front desk was explaining it so fast that i missed what it was for. it's not for the safe. it's actually for cabinet to access the fridge. for the price i paid, i expected some sort of view. my view was of the roof of the 1st floor where the air conditioning units are. wonderful! better off elsewhere.
reviews: the argonaut has beautiful architecture and stylish decor. the beds are firm but comfortable. at first i was disappointed about our lack of view, but quickly realized we had a much quieter room than one on the street. there is even a doorbell to our room, which i've never seen before, though minus one star for the bright blue light it shone into the room all night. i think it was a great idea that the refrigerator with snacks for purchase has a lock, in case any youngsters get left in a room alone for a spell. it is a quick walk to the water and the maritime museum across the street is a highlight. the staff were very friendly and helpful. we enjoyed our breakfast from the blue mermaid located right beside the hotel. i appreciated the use of refillable soap dispensers rather than wasteful single use ones. i would definitely come here again.
cleaned_advanced: argonaut beautiful architecture stylish decor bed firm comfortable first disappointed lack view quickly realized much quieter one street even doorbell ive never seen though minus one star bright blue light shone night think great idea refrigerator snack purchase lock case youngster get left alone spell quick walk water maritime museum across street highlight staff friendly helpful enjoyed breakfast blue mermaid located right beside appreciated use refillable soap dispenser rather wasteful single use one would definitely come

original_reviews: hubby surprised me with a get away here for our anniversary. very conveniently located and service is wonderful. pricey but hey it's san francisco. bed is super comfy and the coffee is delicious.
reviews: reservations were easy to get. room looked recently remodeled. very cool nautical theme. room was very clean. staff was very friendly and genuinely interested in our satisfaction. beware, parking in the area is very expensive, and the hotel is no exception. the hotel charges parking by the day, $50 per day, but you are allowed to take your car and drop it off as much as you like without additional charge. we left our car at the hotel for the entire duration of the trip. we walked, took uber, and got tickets for the "hop on hop off" tour. i'm sure we saved money that way. everywhere we went, parking looked scarce, and driving seems very stressful. the best part of the hotel is the location. so much to do within 1 mile of the hotel, it can even seem overwhelming. but throughout the entire trip, we did not see a hotel in a better location compared to argonaut hotel. on our next visit, we will be returning to this hotel.
cleaned_advanced: reservation easy get looked recently remodeled cool nautical theme clean staff friendly genuinely interested satisfaction beware parking area expensive exception charge parking day per day allowed take car drop much like without additional charge left car entire duration trip walked took uber got ticket hop hop tour im sure saved money way everywhere went parking looked scarce driving seems stressful best part location much within mile even seem overwhelming throughout entire trip see better location compared argonaut next visit returning

original_reviews: this is a nice hotel and we really enjoyed the doorman. he made us laugh every time we saw him. this is a great location that is centrally located to most of the attractions that we wanted to visit.
reviews: actually was quite disappointed. after reading the hotel reviews, i was confident i'd made a wise choice in making my reservation at the argonaut. arrived at the hotel at approximately 10:30 pm and there was no assistance with luggage, nor any luggage carts for self use. there is no reception area with any available coffee or tea. even holiday inns make coffe and tea available. room was small but clean. washcloth had holes in it making for another poor impression. the first morning we went to the blue mermaid for breakfast. the restaurant had very few patrons yet service was slow. food was delivered to the table cold. had no interest in dining there again after that experience. the evening prior to our departure, i stood at the concierge desk while the woman went about her business without so much as an acknowledgment that i was there. i have to admit the reason i'd return is because of its location. within reasonable walking distance to all the piers and shopping and any water excursions. trams are approx 3 blocks from hotel. if you don't expect much in the way if service then i highly recommend the argonaut, however i will be looking for another hotel in the fishermans wharf area for my next visit to this fabulous city.
cleaned_advanced: actually quite disappointed reading review confident id made wise choice making reservation argonaut arrived approximately pm assistance luggage luggage cart self use reception area available coffee tea even holiday inn make coffe tea available small clean washcloth hole making another poor impression first morning went blue mermaid breakfast restaurant patron yet service slow food delivered table cold interest dining experience evening prior departure stood concierge desk woman went business without much acknowledgment admit reason id return location within reasonable walking distance pier shopping water excursion tram approx block dont expect much way service highly recommend argonaut however looking another fisherman wharf area next visit fabulous city

original_reviews: did a lot of research on best hotels to stay in san francisco prior to our visit. picked argonaut based on great reviews.hotel is conveniently located at the end of fisherman's wharf. unique nautical decor. the beds were very comfortable and rooms quiet. the staff was very helpful and friendly. i would give it a five star but we found the bathrooms a bit small for our liking and the closets need lighting. we will definitely stay here again on our next visit.
reviews: boutique hotel with extremely clean rooms and classy, unique decor. i stayed here for a weekend away with my husband and we loved that our room looked out on the bay and the cable car turnaround. our room furnishings were perfectly comfortable and very unique with a brick wall on one side of the room, very quiet. super slow service at the concierge desk and the concierge was absent much of the time we were there. the free bikes to borrow were especially appealing! personally, i don't love fisherman's wharf but this hotel is at the far end of the madness, next to a very pretty park and a short, flat distance to some interesting bars and the ferry building. i would stay here again.
cleaned_advanced: boutique extremely clean classy unique decor stayed weekend away husband loved looked bay cable car turnaround furnishing perfectly comfortable unique brick wall one side quiet super slow service concierge desk concierge absent much time free bike borrow especially appealing personally dont love fisherman wharf far end madness next pretty park short flat distance interesting bar ferry building would

original_reviews: great location and clean room. friendly staff anytime we asked for anything. our room faced hyde street with a view of the golden gate bridge.
reviews: loved this hotel and it had been updated when we visited in summer 2016. lovely room, but beware the room service. it is slow and forgetful. we would stay again, though due to its location, style, museum, and looks.
cleaned_advanced: loved updated visited summer lovely beware service slow forgetful would though due location style museum look

original_reviews: the location for this hotel can't be better! it was just walking distance to pier 39 and being able to just walk a few steps out your hotel and see alcatraz in the distance was surreal. management at this hotel take there job seriously and make it a point to make sure that guests are well taken care of and have a good experience. i just recently went to this hotel and will be going back as soon as possible. just want to thank guysell and the staff there for making our trip and our first time in san francisco memorable.
reviews: absolutely wonderful fantastic hotel! great location! this was my first trip to san francisco, but my husband has been a few times for conferences and he said he always walked by this hotel and wanted to stay here. so we did! we got a room with a view of the bridge and alcatraz island. so beautiful! the area was busy with lots of vacationers. not a lot of kids at the hotel, mostly couples. we asked the concierge desk to help us a couple of times. once to rent a car so we could drive to muir woods, sausalito & golden gate park; and she gave us great info for a day we walked around to coit tower...such as don't miss the food market at the ferry building. and a second time for transportation back to the airport. we reserved a towncar and it was only a few dollars more than uber but less hassle. we took the cable car to union square one day and ate at sears diner and after some shopping, went to china town and ate lunch and bought some tea. then walked to coit tower and down the filbert steps to levi park and walked back along the piers. another day we took bikes down to fort point. took lots of pictures, the fort has beautiful architecture and an interesting history. then we rode across the golden gate bridge to sausalito and ate lunch and ice cream and then biked back across the bridge in the fog (very cold and it was july!) and went to the palace of fine arts before returning the bikes. (there was a ferry from sausalito but the line was so long, we chose to ride back) we did go tour alcatraz island (get your tickets online as early as u can!) and hung out at pier 39 afterwards. this hotel is close to the cable car station, ghirardelli square, great restaurants, museums, bike rental shops, alcatraz pier, shopping, pier 39, lombard street...well almost everything. we ate at the blue mermaid a few times for breakfast and once for dinner. all our food was good especially the chowder flight.
cleaned_advanced: absolutely wonderful fantastic great location first trip san francisco husband time conference said always walked wanted got view bridge alcatraz island beautiful area busy lot vacationer lot kid mostly couple asked concierge desk help u couple time rent car could drive muir wood sausalito golden gate park gave u great info day walked around coit towersuch dont miss food market ferry building second time transportation back airport reserved towncar dollar uber less hassle took cable car union square one day ate sears diner shopping went china town ate lunch bought tea walked coit tower filbert step levi park walked back along pier another day took bike fort point took lot picture fort beautiful architecture interesting history rode across golden gate bridge sausalito ate lunch ice cream biked back across bridge fog cold july went palace fine art returning bike ferry sausalito line long chose ride back go tour alcatraz island get ticket online early hung pier afterwards close cable car station ghirardelli square great restaurant museum bike rental shop alcatraz pier shopping pier lombard streetwell almost everything ate blue mermaid time breakfast dinner food good especially chowder flight

original_reviews: loved this hotel! from the moment we pulled up we were treated like royalty. they found out we were on our honeymoon so the bellhop had wine brought up to our room. they also upgraded us to a room with a great view of the golden gate bridge. they were so sweet and accommodating they made our stay that much better. every time i think of san francisco i'll think of the pleasant experience i had at the argonaut. the blue mermaid was absolutely delicious also which the hotel gave us drink vouchers for. i couldn't be happier.
reviews: we stayed here while on the first half of our honeymoon. the hotel was great, clean, convenient. the staff even left a surprise bottle of champagne to congratulate us on our honeymoon, which was really kind. the only thing that bothered us was that we felt the concierge (we met with two separate staff members) were less than helpful. they seemed to give us quick answers and acted rushed. you can imagine that a couple who are visiting san francisco for the first time might have a lot of questions about what to do and how to get there. we felt uncomfortable asking all our questions there.
cleaned_advanced: stayed first half honeymoon great clean convenient staff even left surprise bottle champagne congratulate u honeymoon really kind thing bothered u felt concierge met two separate staff member less helpful seemed give u quick answer acted rushed imagine couple visiting san francisco first time might lot question get felt uncomfortable asking question

original_reviews: we decided to go to hawaii for our honeymoon and my wife planned her dream vacation. we thought it would be a long commute from the philadelphia area, so we should cut our flight in half and stop by san francisco for a few days before we reach hawaii. i took it upon myself to surprise my wife and found what i thought would be a great hotel, the argonaut, near the wharf. when we arrived, our room wasn't ready and the front desk clerk was extremely friendly. she assured us that they had a perfect room for us on the top floor as requested and it would just be a bit longer. we decided to walk around the city for a bit and when we got back to the hotel our "room" was finally ready. we were given keys to the third floor though. i tried to inquire why, but they assured me that was the room they had for us. waiting in our room was a nice bottle of champagne and candy from ghirardelli. there was a card wishing us a happy honeymoon, but on the back of the card was a three digit number starting with 4, so i'm assuming that was the room we were supposed to have. the room looked similar to the photos of the room we wanted, so who really cared? we were on our honeymoon. in the room, a lamp didn't work and the television wasn't plugged in. we had the light fixed quickly and i plugged the television in myself. the hotel had a nice happy hour, where we could grab some free beer and wine. most of the staff were incredibly friendly until after we checked out and i had to contact them. my wife knows the daughter of a woman at her work and she lives in the san francisco area. this woman personally dropped off a gift basket/wedding gift at the hotel. we didn't find this out until we were in hawaii and the woman asked if we received the gift. i still had the card with the other room number, so i contacted the hotel to see if they had the gift and possibly delivered it to our original room. the hotel told me that they didn't have the gift and they were pretty cold to me. i emailed and tried contacting them again to get a hold of another person who could possibly help me and no one could. the manager tried to cover it up by saying they weren't sure why we were moved, but they wouldn't have delivered anything if we weren't in the room. as i mentioned in my final email to them: although our stay wasn't bad, we are put in the position where we have to decide if a close friend, who asked us if we got the gift she personally delivered to the hotel to surprise us with, lied to us or if someone at the hotel kept the gift for themselves. update: our stay was prior to the argonaut being taken over by a new ownership group. i have been contacted by a representative from the new company and he has assured me that there are a lot of new employees. i have no way of knowing if the employees we had issues with are still there or not. i have been assured that our experience would be better the next time, but we still have no desire to return. i have also been told that the happy hour that we enjoyed is no longer available. when i inquired what replaced that, i was basically told to experience it for myself and to contact them for the best rates. that's not a great selling point to me, so i'm not sure if there is anything that special there other than the great location.
reviews: although the location is supremely ideal, the valet parking is a long wait, and is overall not a good price for what you get.
cleaned_advanced: although location supremely ideal valet parking long wait overall good price get

original_reviews: my husband and i celebrated our anniversary here. from check in to check out, we loved everything about this hotel. every single member of the staff we had any contact with was friendly and helpful. our room was comfortable and cozy. the fisherman's wharf area is a sentimental favorite of ours so this hotel is perfectly located. we were within walking distance of everything we wanted to do and see on this quick visit. we're already making plans to come back and are looking forward to another stay in this lovely hotel.
reviews: just arrived, and so far it's great! the staff is was extremely helpful from the bellman/doorman, front desk, a great choice in a perfect location. the concierge gave us a great place to eat in north beach, and it was excellent. it was also kid friendly, a good mix of guests!
cleaned_advanced: arrived far great staff extremely helpful bellmandoorman front desk great choice perfect location concierge gave u great place eat north beach excellent also kid friendly good mix guest

original_reviews: we were disappointed this time staying here, we stay here a couple times a year. first, requested room close to elevators, i recently had knee surgery and needed something close, got room down the hall not close to elevator. when checking out, requested to stay 1 hour later, was denied. not great with customer service. one would think a repeat customer of several years, they would honor customer loyalty, they didn't. and we stayed during the week, so it wasn't peak times or weekend. very disappointed.
reviews: beautifully decorated and great location. tip: don't stay on bottom two floors they can be loud with sidewalk at window level.
cleaned_advanced: beautifully decorated great location tip dont bottom two floor loud sidewalk window level

original_reviews: stayed here recently on the recommendation of a friend, and so happy that we did! we splurged on a bay view queen room that looked out on the trolley turnaround and the sf bay and golden gate bridge. the room was clean, spacious, comfortable, and quiet. i loved that we could go downstairs for a full breakfast in the restaurant (good breakfasts) and then just walk to everything from the hotel--over to fort mason, down fisherman's wharf, down the embarcadero to the ferry building. splendid!. barring that, it's so easy to take an uber and avoid driving and parking. staff was very friendly, including the concierge who booked us at green's in 5 minutes and drew us a map of the walk to get there. i can't wait to visit again and stay at the argonaut! it's pricey, but worth it!
reviews: cute little boutique. awesome service. room was clean and smell fresh. reasonable price for a great view of the bay.
cleaned_advanced: cute little boutique awesome service clean smell fresh reasonable price great view bay

original_reviews: my husband and i love this hotel we got engaged at this hotel about 2 years ago so we can't see ourselves staying anywhere else. we just stayed here again his weekend and it was what we remembered from our fond memories. from the outside service to the front desk, the service is impeccable. they are all very friendly, accommodating and professional. my husband spoils me so we stay in the suite with the hot tub and love love love it! the room is extremely nice and we feel right at home when we come here. the best part is is the hotel is located within walking distance to fisherman's wharf which we love. i highly recommend staying here.
reviews: the argonaut is a beautiful hotel in a great location in san francisco. the staff is amazing and couldn't be more accommodating. the room oversaw the action packed jefferson street and we had a wonderful view of alcatraz island. the room was spotless. the cleaning staff did a great job. we enjoyed the restaurant downstairs, the blue mermaid. we'll stay at the argonaut when we come visit again! thanks!
cleaned_advanced: argonaut beautiful great location san francisco staff amazing couldnt accommodating oversaw action packed jefferson street wonderful view alcatraz island spotless cleaning staff great job enjoyed restaurant downstairs blue mermaid well argonaut come visit thanks

original_reviews: my wife and i stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and we couldnt have had a better time. the hotel staff for polite and friendly and always willing to help with anything. the rooms were very clean and comfortable. the location cannot be beaten and we had a great view of the bay from our room. i would recommend this place to anyone who wants to visit san francisco.
reviews: this was our second visit to the argonaut we had an amazing stay in january 2013 and had been eagerly awaiting our return visit whilst the room location and staff remain fantastic the changeover from a kimpton hotel to noble house has stripped away those little extras that made the hotel so welcoming and took it into the great category no longer is there hot chocolate available in the lobby on a cold afternoon and no evening wine reception which made the lobby such a social environment the childrens treasure hunt and babysit a goldfish programs have also been ceased the room and beds are comfortable even for a family of 4 with plenty of luggage however this trip we suffered the problem of thin walls one night with a crying baby on one side and two yapping dogs on the other other nights were no problem so probably just luck of the draw that particular night we enjoyed our stay mainly due to the staff and location but hope noble house consider reinstating some of those special touches in the future

original_reviews: super happy with our stay here!! after getting checked in they offered to upgrade us to a room with a view. the location and views are absolutely gorgeous! we are literally steps from the beach and steps from fisherman wharf. the hotel itself had a nautical feel decor. the rooms are spacious and the staff was amazing. overall i would stay here again!
reviews: very nice and comfortable property great beds and pillows no fan in the bathroom so mirror fogs when you take a shower the toiletries are large bottles that you pump it would be nice to have individual ones beware they charge a ridiculous resort fee and the only amenity is a workout room that we never used
cleaned_advanced: nice comfortable property great bed pillow fan bathroom mirror fog take shower toiletry large bottle pump would nice individual one beware charge ridiculous resort fee amenity workout never used

original_reviews: this time we reserved our room through expedia and couldn't have been happier. price was reasonable. we had a deluxe king room with a view of ghirardelli square, the cable cars and a peek of the bay. don't waste your money on the overpriced view rooms (unless you can get a good price) this was perfect! room 238 was big, clean and comfortable! everyone was super friendly and nice and again the location is fabulous! will definitely be going back! too much fun!
reviews: we had planned many months ago to stay at fishermans wharf because we wanted easy access to fishermans wharf for our daily walks we switched to the argonaut at the last minute when ta reviewers alerted us to the fact that our previously booked hyatt at fishermans wharf was undergoing noisy disruptive renovations we are very glad we made the change we knew it would be more expensive but this was a special trip for us as we were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary there is much to admire about this hotel the front desk staff were very welcoming and knowledgeable when we checked in in fact all the employees we met in the halls at the front door and everywhere were unusually friendly and pleasant when we arrived in our room we found a lovely congratulatory note from marc with a complimentary bottle of good wine very nice touch our room was small but adequate and we loved its excellent view of the wharf the waterfront and alcatraz we were pleased we had paid extra for a bay view room and recommend room 446 to you we also enjoyed two different breakfasts at the hotels blue mermaid restaurant and service by christa but were too busy to use the free chowder coupons they gave us three problems 1 this was the worst business center we have ever been in and we regularly use them in hotels all over the world they charged 795 for 15 minutes usage and most of that time was spent waiting for slower than oldfashioned dialup service and reading unwanted popup ads not at all worthy of a firstclass hotel like the argonaut in fairness we must say that they took one of those charges off our bill when we complained 2 the shampoo conditioner and liquid soap all are so high on the shower wall that they are not reachable by anyone preferring a bath 3 there is only one chair in the room making it difficult to dress watch tv read and chat if you are a couple

original_reviews: stayed here for my first trip to san francisco because of location and reviews. very pleased with the choice! the staff was welcoming and friendly--especially marilyn at the front desk who gave us great suggestions for site seeing and restaurants. the location is right in the heart of fisherman's wharf and the building is historical. i would return without hesitation!
reviews: although the hotel itself is nicely done and the rooms are big much bigger than we thought the value for money is at the lower end also the lobby and bar area are somewhat not inviting its really more a place to sleep but not hang around in the evening and for this the price is too high then one rather choses a nice hotel in the business district for the same money
cleaned_advanced: although nicely done big much bigger thought value money lower end also lobby bar area somewhat inviting really place sleep hang around evening price high one rather choses nice business district money

original_reviews: this is a nice boutique hotel with excellent access to fisherman's wharf. it's overpriced and the rooms are a little too small and uncomfortable. i'm glad we stayed here once, but i don't think we'll be back unless we can find a really low rate. not a bad experience overall.
reviews: the hotel is in a former manufacturing facility they have preserved some of the 4x4 beams and ibeams etc and try to integrate with the decor however the nautical theme is tacky and poorly down rooms c just about enough space for a king bed and your luggage a bit rundown staff d surly and unhelpful location b+ in the heart of waterfront along the piers
cleaned_advanced: former manufacturing facility preserved beam ibeams etc try integrate decor however nautical theme tacky poorly enough space king bed luggage bit rundown staff surly unhelpful location heart waterfront along pier

original_reviews: kitschy but cool nautical theme. nice lobby space with a fireplace and several seating areas for hanging out or playing games. rooms are spacious and some have exposed brick and beams. reasonable but not cheap. right in the heart of the tourist attractions along fisherman's wharf so plenty to do within walking distance.
reviews: we stayed here primarily to be close to the wharf and cruise ship terminal areas since we knew wed be doing a great deal of walking we chose a suite with a jacuzzi tub the room was enormous a spacious living area that had a large dining room table couch and chairs as well as a large bedroom area one of our favorite features of the room was that it was a corner unit and we had a lot of windows we could open to get some fresh air the tub was a bit difficult to get in and out of but a welcome respite at the end of our long days the staff were very knowledgeable and helpful any time we had questions or sought restaurantbar recommendations overall we had a fantastic stay and will most likely consider staying here again in the future

original_reviews: so i've stayed here a number of times. it's a nice hotel but i'm 2 starring it because of the pretentious bs. i've booked rooms from their website and from discount sites. the regular rooms are great. they keep what i can only assume are rooms for chumps who rent on third party websites. here's my experience today. i'm driving into the city from work so i can catch a flight tomorrow. i check their website and the discount sites. discount sites are 50$ cheaper. out of courtesy because i like the hotel, i call them direct and see if they will honor the rate i found on every other third party site. the lady who answers checks her third party rates and claims she doesn't see the same and declines to match. i triple checked to make sure all of the sites had the same. she makes no counter offer for what she allegedly sees. so i say thank you and book thru a third party. this is the second time i've done this and they have done this. the hotel has no idea who i am. i arrive and a new guy checks me in. he's gracious polite and efficient. i head to the room. yup they shoved me all the way in the back, and it's a long slog from the elevators. which would be ok if the room weren't a deliberately under-furnished pos. the other rooms have a lovely couch and desk arrangement. i have the same sized room with a desk and a single tiny sad dirty little chair. there is a giant gap on the wall where the couch should be. and the bathroom has hair in it. plus the bath mat is scummy with mold. so tell me management? how sad is it that you actually keep rooms that you refused to put the normal furniture in and don't maintain as well just for third party bookings? i know the hotel isn't full tonight. i checked the vacancy level. when these guys have their a game on it's nice but they actually train their desk staff to lie. you will actually have a better stay at a hampton or a holiday inn.
reviews: great staff amenities the lobby is cool the rooms offer nice decor with red brick walls and a large bed we had a view overlooking the bay street and the room was quiet with the traffic below would recommend to others to stay
cleaned_advanced: great staff amenity lobby cool offer nice decor red brick wall large bed view overlooking bay street quiet traffic would recommend others

original_reviews: this hotel is ahhhhmazing! we stayed for 3 nights and didn't want to leave. the staff starting from the gentleman in a uniform were all so pleasantly helpful and sincere. the location is wonderful. my husband and i walked to the alcatraz ferry, pier 39, cable cars and gheredelli square. the walls are paper thin that will be my only complaint. our next door neighbor liked to leave his tv on all day and all night. they came back to their hotel room with 2 other people (no biggie) at 2am and their conversation which was not loud but sounded like they were standing at the end of my bed. i knew i could count on the staff to address the concern with a phone call away but i decided to not bother. the food, hospitality and decor is top notch and will always be my go to place in the fishermans warf area.
reviews: first stop on our honeymoon was san francisco the argonaut hotel is situated perfectly for sightseeing in the city rooms were tidy and of okay size no honeymoon champagne thoughboo although theres an hour of free wine and beer in the hotel lobby loved the theming would stay again
cleaned_advanced: first stop honeymoon san francisco argonaut situated perfectly sightseeing city tidy okay size honeymoon champagne thoughboo although there hour free wine beer lobby loved theming would

original_reviews: as our tickets to san francisco were nearing, i urged my boyfriend to book at the argonaut for our fun trip in the city. when it comes to location, this place to rocks! i think fisherman's wharf is the ultimate place to stay in the city! this way, you can be close to attractions like alcatraz, pier 39, and epic views of the golden gate bridge. growing up, my dad would always book at the argonaut. our stays at this venue are particularly nostalgic for me because some of my favorite family memories were spent here. i remember being infatuated with the aquatic style decor and outfits worn by staff. as a child, this place was wonderland! returning as a now, 23-year-old, i saw the hotel much differently. it is still spectacular but for the price, it didn't exactly meet the mark for me. now the style of the hotel looked a little bit tired and in need of a revamp. the staff seemed less cheery than i remembered too, in fact, they all seemed a bit disgruntled. it was a hard pill for me to swallow that the hotel was not as magical as i had remembered! this is not to say that this isn't a fabulous hotel! i just believe it is a bit tired in its theme and lacking in effort.
reviews: my partner and i visited argonaut while we were in california in september 2016 we arrived the hotel late afternoon with our hired car the valet service was excellent quick and efficient they took care our luggages and sent them straight to the room the checkin was seamlessly quick and we got offer an upgrade to a suite and we took it it was the best choice ever the room was spacious clean and beautiful the naval style design with excellent fabric and a warm mixture of colours made you feel like home my favourite parts of the suite were the bathroom and the view from the suite the suite has a walk in shower and a huge bathtub with the view of fisherman wharf from our suite we can see alcatraz and golden gate bridge it was breathtaking the concierge lady was extremely helpful she helped us to get a table in a local well known restaurant gary danko which apparently the reservation for a table can be demanding as it always fully booked we were very pleased with that if i have to pick on the downside of the hotel i would say the price and the noise insulation you can clearly hear the conversation and people walking down the hallway from your bed i would recommend argonaut hotel to any travellers that visit san francisco for the first time or a frequent travellers that been many times well done
cleaned_advanced: partner visited argonaut california september arrived late afternoon hired car valet service excellent quick efficient took care luggage sent straight checkin seamlessly quick got offer upgrade suite took best choice ever spacious clean beautiful naval style design excellent fabric warm mixture colour made feel like home favourite part suite bathroom view suite suite walk shower huge bathtub view fisherman wharf suite see alcatraz golden gate bridge breathtaking concierge lady extremely helpful helped u get table local well known restaurant gary danko apparently reservation table demanding always fully booked pleased pick downside would say price noise insulation clearly hear conversation people walking hallway bed would recommend argonaut traveller visit san francisco first time frequent traveller many time well done

original_reviews: i've been coming to the argonaut for years, in fact i got married here! they have always been super friendly and accommodating. they love our dogs and always give them treats! the front desk always makes sure i get the room we love. the hotel itself is located in an old canning factory. it's gorgeous and they gave it a sophisticated nautical feel. plus, it's always spotless. rates have always been very reasonable. it changed hands recently and now noble house runs it. it's exactly the same, maybe even slightly better! book a room here. you will be thrilled!
reviews: booked the hotel several months ago as part of a 6 week usa trip the rooms and all public areas were kept really clean and all the cleaning staff always had a smile for you the other staff were all very pleasant but there seemed to be some resentment about handling your own bags which i had not come across in the 20 or 25 or so other hotels i had stayed in during our 9 state trip i asked to use a trolley which again have been available in all the other hotels but was told they are only for the bell boys use i dont mind paying for a service but i dont being pushed towards it im sure the management are going to come up with some excuse like health and safety rather than it being a way for staff to make up their low wages the other thing i was not aware of is that it is a pet friendly hotel which in our case meant being woken up 3 morning in a row by the people in the next rooms dog barking the resturant was ok as was the bar but quite costly certainly a great location for the wharf area but that said this was my first time back in 20 years and its not the clean historic place it used to be
cleaned_advanced: booked several month ago part week usa trip public area kept really clean cleaning staff always smile staff pleasant seemed resentment handling bag come across hotel stayed state trip asked use trolley available hotel told bell boy use dont mind paying service dont pushed towards im sure management going come excuse like health safety rather way staff make low wage thing aware pet friendly case meant woken morning row people next dog barking resturant ok bar quite costly certainly great location wharf area said first time back year clean historic place used

original_reviews: this was one of the best hotel experiences i have ever had! upon arriving in mid afternoon in the hustle and bustle of fisherman's wharf, we were a bit flustered with traffic and where to park. when we pulled out in front of the hotel, the staff instantly warmly greeted us and gave us directions on where to park. although they do offer valet parking for $50 per night, we opted to self park behind the hotel (that is not affiliated with the hotel). they grabbed our luggage for us while we parked which helped us from lugging all our heavy baggage across the street. check-in was easy, and we were amazed by our nautical themed room. it was very spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated. we were stunned that every room even had their own doorbell! the lobby was also cozy with a fireplace, plenty of sitting room, and had an attached restaurant. although we did not eat at the restaurant, the menu looked appetizing and it was nice to know it was a place we could go to for a snack if needed. we loved this hotel not only for the ambience, but also because it is in the best location in fisherman's wharf. unfortunately, the location is probably why it was on the pricer end. it is located right on the main street across from the piers between ghirardelli square and all the wharf's shops/restaurants, so you have easy access to eating and entertainment without taking transportation. we were sad to leave this hotel, but we will be back!
reviews: we stayed as a family in july 2022 what can i say right next door to the cable car a short walk from ghirardellis close to fishermans wharf and alcatraz is literally the first thing you see as you walk out of the lobby extremely comfortable great service gorgeous styling i come from the uk and very much hope ill get to stay here again one day
cleaned_advanced: stayed family july say right next door cable car short walk ghirardellis close fisherman wharf alcatraz literally first thing see walk lobby extremely comfortable great service gorgeous styling come uk much hope ill get one day

original_reviews: the argonaut has beautiful architecture and stylish decor. the beds are firm but comfortable. at first i was disappointed about our lack of view, but quickly realized we had a much quieter room than one on the street. there is even a doorbell to our room, which i've never seen before, though minus one star for the bright blue light it shone into the room all night. i think it was a great idea that the refrigerator with snacks for purchase has a lock, in case any youngsters get left in a room alone for a spell. it is a quick walk to the water and the maritime museum across the street is a highlight. the staff were very friendly and helpful. we enjoyed our breakfast from the blue mermaid located right beside the hotel. i appreciated the use of refillable soap dispensers rather than wasteful single use ones. i would definitely come here again.
reviews: charged double for room once they have got advance payment then they carched same amount from creditcard and caused costs for telefon calls with austrian bank raiffeisen and our travel agency to refund the ammount carparking charged usd 8050 overnight whithout informing the guest before check in this is not acceptable even in bellagio las vegas tehy charged only usd 30
