original_reviews: reservations were easy to get. room looked recently remodeled. very cool nautical theme. room was very clean. staff was very friendly and genuinely interested in our satisfaction. beware, parking in the area is very expensive, and the hotel is no exception. the hotel charges parking by the day, $50 per day, but you are allowed to take your car and drop it off as much as you like without additional charge. we left our car at the hotel for the entire duration of the trip. we walked, took uber, and got tickets for the "hop on hop off" tour. i'm sure we saved money that way. everywhere we went, parking looked scarce, and driving seems very stressful. the best part of the hotel is the location. so much to do within 1 mile of the hotel, it can even seem overwhelming. but throughout the entire trip, we did not see a hotel in a better location compared to argonaut hotel. on our next visit, we will be returning to this hotel.
reviews: we were welcomed to the argonaut the moment we stepped out of the cab until the moment we left it was our 45 wedding anniversary so the young lady at the desk gave us an upgrade and had a bottle of wine delivered to our room the room was clean charming and most comfortable
cleaned_advanced: welcomed argonaut moment stepped cab moment left wedding anniversary young lady desk gave u upgrade bottle wine delivered clean charming comfortable

original_reviews: actually was quite disappointed. after reading the hotel reviews, i was confident i'd made a wise choice in making my reservation at the argonaut. arrived at the hotel at approximately 10:30 pm and there was no assistance with luggage, nor any luggage carts for self use. there is no reception area with any available coffee or tea. even holiday inns make coffe and tea available. room was small but clean. washcloth had holes in it making for another poor impression. the first morning we went to the blue mermaid for breakfast. the restaurant had very few patrons yet service was slow. food was delivered to the table cold. had no interest in dining there again after that experience. the evening prior to our departure, i stood at the concierge desk while the woman went about her business without so much as an acknowledgment that i was there. i have to admit the reason i'd return is because of its location. within reasonable walking distance to all the piers and shopping and any water excursions. trams are approx 3 blocks from hotel. if you don't expect much in the way if service then i highly recommend the argonaut, however i will be looking for another hotel in the fishermans wharf area for my next visit to this fabulous city.
reviews: fantastic hotel in the best possible location pier 39 alcatraz tours restaurantseverything you want to see is within easy walking distance of the argonauts front door inside the rooms are well appointed clean and the beds are super comfortable very quiet at night wifi worked perfectly recommended for those who are willing to spend a little more to be within walking range of everything
cleaned_advanced: fantastic best possible location pier alcatraz tour restaurantseverything want see within easy walking distance argonaut front door inside well appointed clean bed super comfortable quiet night wifi worked perfectly recommended willing spend little within walking range everything

original_reviews: boutique hotel with extremely clean rooms and classy, unique decor. i stayed here for a weekend away with my husband and we loved that our room looked out on the bay and the cable car turnaround. our room furnishings were perfectly comfortable and very unique with a brick wall on one side of the room, very quiet. super slow service at the concierge desk and the concierge was absent much of the time we were there. the free bikes to borrow were especially appealing! personally, i don't love fisherman's wharf but this hotel is at the far end of the madness, next to a very pretty park and a short, flat distance to some interesting bars and the ferry building. i would stay here again.
reviews: i dont understand the positive reviews my room was full of mold and mildew the furniture was worn way beyond shabby chic there were holes in the carpets and there were stains on the bed skirt no soundproofing i could hear coughing talking and worse i dont often write reviews but i feel compelled to warn others especially because i love sf and hate that some tourists will leave embittered by their experience at this hotel

original_reviews: loved this hotel and it had been updated when we visited in summer 2016. lovely room, but beware the room service. it is slow and forgetful. we would stay again, though due to its location, style, museum, and looks.
reviews: my girlfriend and i stayed here a week and had a nice comfortable and relaxing stay every night staff was prompt and excellent and so was housekeeping will definitely come back to this hotel next visit
cleaned_advanced: girlfriend stayed week nice comfortable relaxing every night staff prompt excellent housekeeping definitely come back next visit

original_reviews: absolutely wonderful fantastic hotel! great location! this was my first trip to san francisco, but my husband has been a few times for conferences and he said he always walked by this hotel and wanted to stay here. so we did! we got a room with a view of the bridge and alcatraz island. so beautiful! the area was busy with lots of vacationers. not a lot of kids at the hotel, mostly couples. we asked the concierge desk to help us a couple of times. once to rent a car so we could drive to muir woods, sausalito & golden gate park; and she gave us great info for a day we walked around to coit tower...such as don't miss the food market at the ferry building. and a second time for transportation back to the airport. we reserved a towncar and it was only a few dollars more than uber but less hassle. we took the cable car to union square one day and ate at sears diner and after some shopping, went to china town and ate lunch and bought some tea. then walked to coit tower and down the filbert steps to levi park and walked back along the piers. another day we took bikes down to fort point. took lots of pictures, the fort has beautiful architecture and an interesting history. then we rode across the golden gate bridge to sausalito and ate lunch and ice cream and then biked back across the bridge in the fog (very cold and it was july!) and went to the palace of fine arts before returning the bikes. (there was a ferry from sausalito but the line was so long, we chose to ride back) we did go tour alcatraz island (get your tickets online as early as u can!) and hung out at pier 39 afterwards. this hotel is close to the cable car station, ghirardelli square, great restaurants, museums, bike rental shops, alcatraz pier, shopping, pier 39, lombard street...well almost everything. we ate at the blue mermaid a few times for breakfast and once for dinner. all our food was good especially the chowder flight.
reviews: from my pov after a few stays best hotel for that area even if you are not anymore into fishermans wharf you are close to cable car end point which goes directly to city centerunion square very authentic very nice
cleaned_advanced: pov stay best area even anymore fisherman wharf close cable car end point go directly city centerunion square authentic nice

original_reviews: we stayed here while on the first half of our honeymoon. the hotel was great, clean, convenient. the staff even left a surprise bottle of champagne to congratulate us on our honeymoon, which was really kind. the only thing that bothered us was that we felt the concierge (we met with two separate staff members) were less than helpful. they seemed to give us quick answers and acted rushed. you can imagine that a couple who are visiting san francisco for the first time might have a lot of questions about what to do and how to get there. we felt uncomfortable asking all our questions there.
reviews: we chose the argonaut from the lonely planet guidebook for a twonight stay in san francisco to break the trip from the uk back home to nz it had friendly helpful knowledgeable staff is in a great location and features guest rooms of high quality i wouldnt hesitate to recommend it

original_reviews: beautifully decorated and great location. tip: don't stay on bottom two floors they can be loud with sidewalk at window level.
reviews: from the moment that we checked in to our sad departure didnt want to leave the staff was exceptional our room was perfect spacious clean comfortable and quiet restaurant nice lobby area had room to sit by the fireplace play chess and board games or read a book loved that we could open our window in our room and hear the sounds of fishermans wharf we were serenaded every evening by a very talented sax musician i would highly recommend to all to book this hotel for their next trip to san francisco excellent location

original_reviews: cute little boutique. awesome service. room was clean and smell fresh. reasonable price for a great view of the bay.
reviews: a perfectly located hotel for visitors looking to spend time in the city of san francisco just across the street from hyde street pier near fishermans wharf ghirardelli square buena vista caf piers 39 to the hyde street pier the cable car pickup and cable car museum if you are a walker chinatown is not too far away but remember that the streets in san francisco are hilly so you will get a great hamstring workout walking up those hills and a great quadriceps workout walking down the service at the hotel was really wonderful with the doormen eager to greet help and find you transportation if need be we were glad we did not rent a car as parking is difficult to find and expensive too but really not necessary due to easy walking share ride shuttles cable cars bart subway taxis uber lyft and even some pedicabs the fun nauticalthemed dcor rich in blues creams reds and whites with exposed brick wide planked floors and interesting marine and boating accessories the room and lobby did not disappoint as they looked even better than in the pictures posted online we even noticed how the wallpaper in our 4th floor room had been hung matched the pattern perfectly and we could not even find the seams clean linens covered comfortable highseated beds in the lobby cozy chairs flank a warm fireplace and a fruitinfused water dispenser invited thirsty guests paula our favorite concierge knew the where hows and whats of the city the wellequipped workout facility on the second floor got very little use from us due to all the walking we did in the city dogs were seen but not heard nor smelled a wine bar attached to one side of the hotel invited us in for happy hour and adjoining the other side the free maritime museum part of the national park encourages visitors to learn about pacific coast maritime history although the blue mermaid restaurant tempted our taste buds we elected to explore the myriad of restaurants and food booths at the docks we reserved our 4th floor room about three months in advance and although the cost for one roomtwo people for three nights ran about 1100 including tax but we discovered that that prices for most places in san francisco were that or more expensive remember to ask for veterans aaa or other discounts when booking the only drawback we had was that we requested a room with a view as advertised but when we arrived the only room they offered was a room with a view of another building with a small courtyardunless we wanted to upgrade for 150night it made no difference as we enjoyed all the other amenities the closeness of the activities and the service provided tripdvisor will send information on deals to your email if you sign up i would definitely stay here again

original_reviews: the argonaut is a beautiful hotel in a great location in san francisco. the staff is amazing and couldn't be more accommodating. the room oversaw the action packed jefferson street and we had a wonderful view of alcatraz island. the room was spotless. the cleaning staff did a great job. we enjoyed the restaurant downstairs, the blue mermaid. we'll stay at the argonaut when we come visit again! thanks!
reviews: hotel is dated and kind of dingy bc of it room was on ground floor with no space btwn active tourist street nice to be close to water but it was way too hokey for our taste i recommend finding a newer hotel

original_reviews: this was our second visit to the argonaut we had an amazing stay in january 2013 and had been eagerly awaiting our return visit whilst the room location and staff remain fantastic the changeover from a kimpton hotel to noble house has stripped away those little extras that made the hotel so welcoming and took it into the great category no longer is there hot chocolate available in the lobby on a cold afternoon and no evening wine reception which made the lobby such a social environment the childrens treasure hunt and babysit a goldfish programs have also been ceased the room and beds are comfortable even for a family of 4 with plenty of luggage however this trip we suffered the problem of thin walls one night with a crying baby on one side and two yapping dogs on the other other nights were no problem so probably just luck of the draw that particular night we enjoyed our stay mainly due to the staff and location but hope noble house consider reinstating some of those special touches in the future
reviews: the hotel is in a beautiful and very coinvent location however when we arrived our room was dirty there was dust on everything almonds on the floor the usb device was filthy dusty and sticky the concierge sent us the wrong way on the bus which ruined one entire day for us the bartender was excellent and provided us with great restaurant recommendations

original_reviews: very nice and comfortable property great beds and pillows no fan in the bathroom so mirror fogs when you take a shower the toiletries are large bottles that you pump it would be nice to have individual ones beware they charge a ridiculous resort fee and the only amenity is a workout room that we never used
reviews: this is a boutique hotel the building has a rich historyworth checking out the free tour given by park ranger was very informative everyone was quite friendly and helpful the hotel is situated across the street from fishermans wharf and an easy walk to pier 39 and many restaurants our room faced a courtyard full of windows to the next hallway of roomswouldnt do that againwe thought it would be quieterturns out that we were incorrect our room was well appointed albeit very narrow i had a huge problem with my asthma in this roomwhich means either mold or dust its an old hotel so it could have been either we didnt spend much time in the room anywaybut if you have allergies beware

original_reviews: we had planned many months ago to stay at fishermans wharf because we wanted easy access to fishermans wharf for our daily walks we switched to the argonaut at the last minute when ta reviewers alerted us to the fact that our previously booked hyatt at fishermans wharf was undergoing noisy disruptive renovations we are very glad we made the change we knew it would be more expensive but this was a special trip for us as we were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary there is much to admire about this hotel the front desk staff were very welcoming and knowledgeable when we checked in in fact all the employees we met in the halls at the front door and everywhere were unusually friendly and pleasant when we arrived in our room we found a lovely congratulatory note from marc with a complimentary bottle of good wine very nice touch our room was small but adequate and we loved its excellent view of the wharf the waterfront and alcatraz we were pleased we had paid extra for a bay view room and recommend room 446 to you we also enjoyed two different breakfasts at the hotels blue mermaid restaurant and service by christa but were too busy to use the free chowder coupons they gave us three problems 1 this was the worst business center we have ever been in and we regularly use them in hotels all over the world they charged 795 for 15 minutes usage and most of that time was spent waiting for slower than oldfashioned dialup service and reading unwanted popup ads not at all worthy of a firstclass hotel like the argonaut in fairness we must say that they took one of those charges off our bill when we complained 2 the shampoo conditioner and liquid soap all are so high on the shower wall that they are not reachable by anyone preferring a bath 3 there is only one chair in the room making it difficult to dress watch tv read and chat if you are a couple
reviews: i stayed at this hotel 12 nights if you are looking for a unique boutique tourist hotel in the middle of the fishermans wharf this is a fantastic choice the positives are that it has an incredible location and is easy walking distance to everything touristy near fishermans wharf the decor is completely nautical but is tastefully done the rooms are also very unique and finished well the restaurant and full bar are good choices the only downsides are that you will generally pay the prices associated with a highend luxury hotel and if you are a business traveler the location is far from most businesses but still an easy uber ride away overall i would highly recommend this hotel

original_reviews: although the hotel itself is nicely done and the rooms are big much bigger than we thought the value for money is at the lower end also the lobby and bar area are somewhat not inviting its really more a place to sleep but not hang around in the evening and for this the price is too high then one rather choses a nice hotel in the business district for the same money
reviews: stayed 4 nights at this lovely hotel we had booked in at the hilton but transferred here and it was a very good decision lovely privately run hotel great staff comfy rooms and a brilliant location to explore fishermans wharf couldnt recommend it highly enough

original_reviews: the hotel is in a former manufacturing facility they have preserved some of the 4x4 beams and ibeams etc and try to integrate with the decor however the nautical theme is tacky and poorly down rooms c just about enough space for a king bed and your luggage a bit rundown staff d surly and unhelpful location b+ in the heart of waterfront along the piers
reviews: the hotel was only for one night we had a meeting to attend the next morning and didnt want to have to drive super early we arrived late and the original room had quite the party going on next door after a quick consult with one of the staff members we were moved the new room was amazing this hotel is smack in the middle of some of the best sights in sf you have the wharf alcatraz the gg bridge and ghiradellis we had a lovely time and definitely added this place to our list of hotels that well use in the future

original_reviews: we stayed here primarily to be close to the wharf and cruise ship terminal areas since we knew wed be doing a great deal of walking we chose a suite with a jacuzzi tub the room was enormous a spacious living area that had a large dining room table couch and chairs as well as a large bedroom area one of our favorite features of the room was that it was a corner unit and we had a lot of windows we could open to get some fresh air the tub was a bit difficult to get in and out of but a welcome respite at the end of our long days the staff were very knowledgeable and helpful any time we had questions or sought restaurantbar recommendations overall we had a fantastic stay and will most likely consider staying here again in the future
reviews: great hotel right across from the wharf district walk to si many restaurants hop on bus start and cable car all 1 block away views to alcatraz friendly staff and very nice rooms would stay here again

original_reviews: first stop on our honeymoon was san francisco the argonaut hotel is situated perfectly for sightseeing in the city rooms were tidy and of okay size no honeymoon champagne thoughboo although theres an hour of free wine and beer in the hotel lobby loved the theming would stay again
reviews: the best hotel in fishermans heart area excellent customer service by both management and staff tenzin and steven at the front desk were wonderful all staff were wonderful the rooms are inviting and clean location is awesome the hotel goes above and beyond to ensure guest satisfaction blue mermaid chowder house has the best chowder in the city thank you for a memorable stay we will for sure return again and recommend it to everyone for both business and leisure

original_reviews: my partner and i visited argonaut while we were in california in september 2016 we arrived the hotel late afternoon with our hired car the valet service was excellent quick and efficient they took care our luggages and sent them straight to the room the checkin was seamlessly quick and we got offer an upgrade to a suite and we took it it was the best choice ever the room was spacious clean and beautiful the naval style design with excellent fabric and a warm mixture of colours made you feel like home my favourite parts of the suite were the bathroom and the view from the suite the suite has a walk in shower and a huge bathtub with the view of fisherman wharf from our suite we can see alcatraz and golden gate bridge it was breathtaking the concierge lady was extremely helpful she helped us to get a table in a local well known restaurant gary danko which apparently the reservation for a table can be demanding as it always fully booked we were very pleased with that if i have to pick on the downside of the hotel i would say the price and the noise insulation you can clearly hear the conversation and people walking down the hallway from your bed i would recommend argonaut hotel to any travellers that visit san francisco for the first time or a frequent travellers that been many times well done
reviews: i chose the argonaut for a friday night stay when i picked my girlfriend up from the airport and planned to make my proposal for marriage the staff went above and beyond to make our stay special and we were able to be upgraded to a wonderful room view on the top floor the hotel is in an awesome location so theres a ton of stuff to see and do all within easy walking distance we had a fantastic experience and were both grateful for the friendly staff and beautiful room well done and thank you all
cleaned_advanced: chose argonaut friday night picked girlfriend airport planned make proposal marriage staff went beyond make special able upgraded wonderful view top floor awesome location there ton stuff see within easy walking distance fantastic experience grateful friendly staff beautiful well done thank

original_reviews: booked the hotel several months ago as part of a 6 week usa trip the rooms and all public areas were kept really clean and all the cleaning staff always had a smile for you the other staff were all very pleasant but there seemed to be some resentment about handling your own bags which i had not come across in the 20 or 25 or so other hotels i had stayed in during our 9 state trip i asked to use a trolley which again have been available in all the other hotels but was told they are only for the bell boys use i dont mind paying for a service but i dont being pushed towards it im sure the management are going to come up with some excuse like health and safety rather than it being a way for staff to make up their low wages the other thing i was not aware of is that it is a pet friendly hotel which in our case meant being woken up 3 morning in a row by the people in the next rooms dog barking the resturant was ok as was the bar but quite costly certainly a great location for the wharf area but that said this was my first time back in 20 years and its not the clean historic place it used to be
reviews: extremely thin walls where i could hear the conversation next door perfectly the staff was nice overall a bit expensive for what you get in terms of finishes and views my window looked directly into another room staff was nice
cleaned_advanced: extremely thin wall could hear conversation next door perfectly staff nice overall bit expensive get term finish view window looked directly another staff nice

original_reviews: we stayed as a family in july 2022 what can i say right next door to the cable car a short walk from ghirardellis close to fishermans wharf and alcatraz is literally the first thing you see as you walk out of the lobby extremely comfortable great service gorgeous styling i come from the uk and very much hope ill get to stay here again one day

reviews: this is our go to hotel in san fransico hands down some of the best service from valet bell staff and front desk this hotel hires great service minded staff alway friendly and welcoming the hotel is located in the perfect spot for us as we travel with our dog and dont have to walk him to far for a park your in the city but less foot traffic and riffraff the rooms are spacious and the beds are so comfy it can be hard to get up in the morning we always opt for a room with a view also included in your stay is their wine and beer reception free anchor steam yes please i have stayed at hotels all over san francisco and always return to the argonaut cant wait to return

reviews: we returned to this hotel to celebrate our anniversary and were not disappointed the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful the hotel is clean and well kept up the location in relation to tourist attractions is perfectmost things are walkable or there is access to public transportation we ate in the restaurant twice once for dinner and once for breakfast dinner was very dimly lit and loud breakfast was brighter and quieter the food was good we cant wait to return for another visit

original_reviews: i dont understand the positive reviews my room was full of mold and mildew the furniture was worn way beyond shabby chic there were holes in the carpets and there were stains on the bed skirt no soundproofing i could hear coughing talking and worse i dont often write reviews but i feel compelled to warn others especially because i love sf and hate that some tourists will leave embittered by their experience at this hotel
reviews: i loved this hotel the location was amazing right by the beach with easy access to everywhere the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly the food was lovely also i loved wine hour and our room was gorgeous i could have slept in the bed forever free wifi a huge bonus in san fran was also really good the only downside was the really expensive parking but everything else was amazing i am normally pretty critical of hotels but this one really ticked all the boxes

reviews: you just cannot go wrong with this hotel location and the quiet little maritime museum at the foreground of their lobby is a must see for san fransisco enthusiasts great staff wonderful maritime themed lobby and rooms good grub at the blue mermaid linked to the hotel definitely will miss the wine receptions but all in all a must stay in the city

reviews: we have stayed here on several trips to san francisco love the proximity to fishermans wharf and the cable cars lovely evening social hour in the lobby valet parking historic building national park maritime museum in the lobby and actual museum ships on display just across the street from the hotel great service unique rooms

original_reviews: from the moment that we checked in to our sad departure didnt want to leave the staff was exceptional our room was perfect spacious clean comfortable and quiet restaurant nice lobby area had room to sit by the fireplace play chess and board games or read a book loved that we could open our window in our room and hear the sounds of fishermans wharf we were serenaded every evening by a very talented sax musician i would highly recommend to all to book this hotel for their next trip to san francisco excellent location
reviews: this hotel did not disappoint we ended our spring break vacation 1st stop napa with a two night stay in a king one bedroom suite at the argonaut and it was lovely from the valet to the front desk guest service was wonderful they offered us fiji water and guest wellness kits with face masks sanitizer wipes and spray hand sanitizer upon arrival the one bedroom suite was described on the website as approximately 600 sq ft but it seemed much bigger perhaps we were upgrade it had a comfortable living room with pull out sofa bed which we used for our kids and a nice dining table perfect for a family the suite had exposed brick walls giant wood beams and beautiful white wood window shutters the nautical theme was tastefully done to our surprise they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine and welcome note on our first night the hotel is in a perfect location on the quieter end of the wharf but close enough to walk to pier 39 and ghirardelli square lots to do and plenty of food options and souvenir stores the bay company across the street has quality clothing and souvenirs with great customer service highly recommend the argonaut
cleaned_advanced: disappoint ended spring break vacation st stop napa two night king one bedroom suite argonaut lovely valet front desk guest service wonderful offered u fiji water guest wellness kit face mask sanitizer wipe spray hand sanitizer upon arrival one bedroom suite described website approximately sq ft seemed much bigger perhaps upgrade comfortable living pull sofa bed used kid nice dining table perfect family suite exposed brick wall giant wood beam beautiful white wood window shutter nautical theme tastefully done surprise sent complimentary bottle wine welcome note first night perfect location quieter end wharf close enough walk pier ghirardelli square lot plenty food option souvenir store bay company across street quality clothing souvenir great customer service highly recommend argonaut

original_reviews: a perfectly located hotel for visitors looking to spend time in the city of san francisco just across the street from hyde street pier near fishermans wharf ghirardelli square buena vista caf piers 39 to the hyde street pier the cable car pickup and cable car museum if you are a walker chinatown is not too far away but remember that the streets in san francisco are hilly so you will get a great hamstring workout walking up those hills and a great quadriceps workout walking down the service at the hotel was really wonderful with the doormen eager to greet help and find you transportation if need be we were glad we did not rent a car as parking is difficult to find and expensive too but really not necessary due to easy walking share ride shuttles cable cars bart subway taxis uber lyft and even some pedicabs the fun nauticalthemed dcor rich in blues creams reds and whites with exposed brick wide planked floors and interesting marine and boating accessories the room and lobby did not disappoint as they looked even better than in the pictures posted online we even noticed how the wallpaper in our 4th floor room had been hung matched the pattern perfectly and we could not even find the seams clean linens covered comfortable highseated beds in the lobby cozy chairs flank a warm fireplace and a fruitinfused water dispenser invited thirsty guests paula our favorite concierge knew the where hows and whats of the city the wellequipped workout facility on the second floor got very little use from us due to all the walking we did in the city dogs were seen but not heard nor smelled a wine bar attached to one side of the hotel invited us in for happy hour and adjoining the other side the free maritime museum part of the national park encourages visitors to learn about pacific coast maritime history although the blue mermaid restaurant tempted our taste buds we elected to explore the myriad of restaurants and food booths at the docks we reserved our 4th floor room about three months in advance and although the cost for one roomtwo people for three nights ran about 1100 including tax but we discovered that that prices for most places in san francisco were that or more expensive remember to ask for veterans aaa or other discounts when booking the only drawback we had was that we requested a room with a view as advertised but when we arrived the only room they offered was a room with a view of another building with a small courtyardunless we wanted to upgrade for 150night it made no difference as we enjoyed all the other amenities the closeness of the activities and the service provided tripdvisor will send information on deals to your email if you sign up i would definitely stay here again
reviews: great hotel in wonderful location at fishermans wharf nice spacious rooms with bridgealcatraz views good tv free wifi courteous attentive staff free winebeer reception for 1 hour each day was a welcome bonus
cleaned_advanced: great wonderful location fisherman wharf nice spacious bridgealcatraz view good tv free wifi courteous attentive staff free winebeer reception hour day welcome bonus

reviews: this is a great place for getting the feel of san francisco there is a need doggie welcome in the foyer the furnishings by the fireplace are comfortable a welcoming happy hour is fun my room was furnished with a maritime motif the window opened a rarity with most hotels the blue mermaid next door has a great breakfast menu housekeeping is only soso but you cant have everything there is one strange workerstephen the bellman does little besides cavorting around the sidewalk not much help in getting cabs

original_reviews: the hotel is in a beautiful and very coinvent location however when we arrived our room was dirty there was dust on everything almonds on the floor the usb device was filthy dusty and sticky the concierge sent us the wrong way on the bus which ruined one entire day for us the bartender was excellent and provided us with great restaurant recommendations
reviews: we stayed for 6 nights in a corner suite on the top floorthe suite was very large with a fantastic bathroom the bed was comfortable and the sofa bed was better than average the room along with the whole hotel was spotlessly clean and very professionally run all of the staff were great and the concierge zakhida was very helpful before my arrival in sorting out a really good itinerary of trips the view from the room was of alcatraz and the gg bridge we enjoyed breakfast most mornings and had one dinner in the restaurant all were very good as were the staff free water is available and there is availability of coffee in the rooms we asked for a kettle and tea bags and these were provided the only negative for me was that someone used the street as a race track each night to rev their motorbike luckily it didnt go on beyond about 11pm but did go on all late afternoon and evening which was very annoying obviously not the hotels fault and beyond their control there are lots of restaurants and cafes close by as well as shops and transport we enjoyed our stay and would like to thank the staff for their hard work and can recommend the argonaut as a great place to stay
cleaned_advanced: stayed night corner suite top floorthe suite large fantastic bathroom bed comfortable sofa bed better average along whole spotlessly clean professionally run staff great concierge zakhida helpful arrival sorting really good itinerary trip view alcatraz gg bridge enjoyed breakfast morning one dinner restaurant good staff free water available availability coffee asked kettle tea bag provided negative someone used street race track night rev motorbike luckily didnt go beyond pm go late afternoon evening annoying obviously hotel fault beyond control lot restaurant cafe close well shop transport enjoyed would like thank staff hard work recommend argonaut great place

original_reviews: this is a boutique hotel the building has a rich historyworth checking out the free tour given by park ranger was very informative everyone was quite friendly and helpful the hotel is situated across the street from fishermans wharf and an easy walk to pier 39 and many restaurants our room faced a courtyard full of windows to the next hallway of roomswouldnt do that againwe thought it would be quieterturns out that we were incorrect our room was well appointed albeit very narrow i had a huge problem with my asthma in this roomwhich means either mold or dust its an old hotel so it could have been either we didnt spend much time in the room anywaybut if you have allergies beware
reviews: we loved our stay at the argonaut where so many iconic san francisco attractions were right outside our door we indulged in the blue mermaid restaurant twice for convenience and quality but more economic options were also in easy walking distance the concierge was most helpful in assisting us to make the right choices for our stay and see the things we most wanted to see

original_reviews: i stayed at this hotel 12 nights if you are looking for a unique boutique tourist hotel in the middle of the fishermans wharf this is a fantastic choice the positives are that it has an incredible location and is easy walking distance to everything touristy near fishermans wharf the decor is completely nautical but is tastefully done the rooms are also very unique and finished well the restaurant and full bar are good choices the only downsides are that you will generally pay the prices associated with a highend luxury hotel and if you are a business traveler the location is far from most businesses but still an easy uber ride away overall i would highly recommend this hotel
reviews: arguably the best location in san francisco end of the cable car line minutes walk to the alcatraz port pier 39 lombard street and a fantastic views of the bay nautical themed rooms were well designed and gave a homely feel with all of the above taken into account the best thing about the hotel is the happy hour which is in fact free beer and wine tasting it turns the bustling foyer into a mecca of wine and beer connoisseurs who share their tourists experiences highly recommend staying here and will be revisiting san francisco

original_reviews: stayed 4 nights at this lovely hotel we had booked in at the hilton but transferred here and it was a very good decision lovely privately run hotel great staff comfy rooms and a brilliant location to explore fishermans wharf couldnt recommend it highly enough
reviews: i rate the argonaut as average as i thought that the hotel is ok starting with the pros in that check in was smooth with the staff being polite they provide 10 vouchers to the blue mermaid for each of the days you stay upon entering my room which was a standard room decor is nice while accommodations were clean and tidy rooms arent large which is fine for those that are alone no so much for families the walls in the rooms are thin i hear everything people coughing to the movement of the bed in the room next door this part for me made it a poor experience overall the argonaut is a good hotel id stay again given its price and proximity to a number of things to do in the area

original_reviews: the hotel was only for one night we had a meeting to attend the next morning and didnt want to have to drive super early we arrived late and the original room had quite the party going on next door after a quick consult with one of the staff members we were moved the new room was amazing this hotel is smack in the middle of some of the best sights in sf you have the wharf alcatraz the gg bridge and ghiradellis we had a lovely time and definitely added this place to our list of hotels that well use in the future
reviews: stayed in early oct including the fleet weekend although booked a year ago was given a room on 2nd floor as was told that higher floors given to those only here for a day or two and we could move to a higher floor tomorrow why not just preallocate rooms as a lot easier price very high and aligned to top hotels in london eg the ritz but dont feel you get same level of quality love the sustainability of hotel but toiletries dont feel local nor do the have any aroma of citrus or tea tree feel like they have been in bottle too long why not just put enough in for the stay and keep it fresh also on sustainability why not put free water in rooms charging 5 for evian how is evian in a sf hotel room sustainable i know fresh water in lobby but that in a small jug in each room would have been a bit of a wow rooms are so comfortable and very clean had pillows changed and a little issue with shower was fixed with no fuss the hotel has such friendly charming staff they cant do enough for you just be honest and polite and they are the same back including those who park the cars was the one chance to blow me away with quality as not likely to be back in the bay area for a number of years but sadly it missed the chance it is an amazing location for quality of its staff match the price but sadly not the quality of the hotel

original_reviews: fantastic location fantastic decor we loved our stay in one of the suites the linens beds are super comfy service was great we cant wait to return we loved the national parks mmuseum hyde pier crab walk away and much much more
reviews: between location value room size and service this was one of family of fives favorite hotel stays in comparison to jw marriott four seasons hotel del coronado and similar hotels we stayed in a one bedroom bay view suite at the end of march even with a king bed queen sofabed and a rollaway we had more than enough space no one was tripping over suitcases or felt like they couldnt move around it was like an ideal first apartment just without a kitchen what we loved besides the space location right between ghiradelli square and fishermans wharf you can walk or take public transportation to all the major tourist or business spots in the city beautiful view of the bay plenty of restaurant options nearby right next to the cable car stop concierge bernadette paula and michael were so knowledgeable and helpful and hooked us up with great ideas and discounts they also arranged our airport transfer for our arrival with five of us plus luggage it was more economical for us to take a private van service they arranged for a go lorries van to meet us 85 total bikes the hotel has 14 total passes per day for two hour complimentary bike rental at blazing saddles just up the hill on hyde street you do need to line up early in the morning to get them but its worth it with the hotels location you can get right on the bike path and ride out to the golden gate bridge lobby the lobby was warm and inviting with a fireplace plenty of seating and table games service everyone we encountered was so helpful and friendly marvin the bellman stood out in particular the only downside about the location is that you get some noise from the bars nearby if youre traveling with small kids who need to get to bed early ask for a room on the hyde street corner the side closer to ghiradelli sq tip for families even though youll want to ride the cable car for the experience take the streetcar around the city for 10 total our family rode all over getting on off several times with free transfers the argonaut was the first of four hotels we stayed at during our trip through california from sf to coronado and by far our favorite of this vacation we would love to come back and highly recommend it

original_reviews: this is our go to hotel in san fransico hands down some of the best service from valet bell staff and front desk this hotel hires great service minded staff alway friendly and welcoming the hotel is located in the perfect spot for us as we travel with our dog and dont have to walk him to far for a park your in the city but less foot traffic and riffraff the rooms are spacious and the beds are so comfy it can be hard to get up in the morning we always opt for a room with a view also included in your stay is their wine and beer reception free anchor steam yes please i have stayed at hotels all over san francisco and always return to the argonaut cant wait to return
reviews: hotel was fine concierge gave terrible recommendations nicest guy but bad advice front desk not so helpful location was great near fishermans wharf room was adequate sized and clean restaurant was fine

original_reviews: we returned to this hotel to celebrate our anniversary and were not disappointed the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful the hotel is clean and well kept up the location in relation to tourist attractions is perfectmost things are walkable or there is access to public transportation we ate in the restaurant twice once for dinner and once for breakfast dinner was very dimly lit and loud breakfast was brighter and quieter the food was good we cant wait to return for another visit
reviews: hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly great location centrally located to many restaurants ghirardelli square hop on hop off tour bus and cable cars definitely would stay there again
cleaned_advanced: clean staff friendly great location centrally located many restaurant ghirardelli square hop hop tour bus cable car definitely would

original_reviews: we loved the argonaut hotel the location cant be beat we walked down to pier 39 and to the alcatraz tour dock the views of the bay are amazing the staff was very sweet and surprised us on our birthday trip the rooms were clean and very spacious we would definitely stay here again
reviews: the argonaut hotel is perfectly located for many of the sites within walking distance across the street is the cable car turn around and it is within walking distance to pier 39 and all the shops and restaurants in between bikes are available for guests to use at no charge and it is close enough to the golden gate bridge to ride across the staff especially brook who works in the concierge department could not of been more helpful she was able to pull a rabbit out of the hat and get us tickets for the sold out trip to alcatraz the rooms are clean and roomy we stayed in the standard king and although it was nice when i got a peek in the deluxe king rooms i wished i had spent more and booked one of them nice brick details in the room and it was larger we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant most mornings called the blue mermaid chowder house the food was good and comparable in price to other breakfast places in the area i would definitely stay at the argonaut again on our next trip to san francisco

original_reviews: i loved this hotel the location was amazing right by the beach with easy access to everywhere the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly the food was lovely also i loved wine hour and our room was gorgeous i could have slept in the bed forever free wifi a huge bonus in san fran was also really good the only downside was the really expensive parking but everything else was amazing i am normally pretty critical of hotels but this one really ticked all the boxes
reviews: great location close to fishermans wharf and trolley station staff very friendly and the room was very nice bar and restaurant has a lot of local flavor we totally enjoyed our stay and recommend the argonaut as probably the best place to stay at fishermans wharf
cleaned_advanced: great location close fisherman wharf trolley station staff friendly nice bar restaurant lot local flavor totally enjoyed recommend argonaut probably best place fisherman wharf

original_reviews: you just cannot go wrong with this hotel location and the quiet little maritime museum at the foreground of their lobby is a must see for san fransisco enthusiasts great staff wonderful maritime themed lobby and rooms good grub at the blue mermaid linked to the hotel definitely will miss the wine receptions but all in all a must stay in the city
reviews: we wanted a quick weekend getaway we chose the argonaut for the location and were pleased with all that it had to offer definitely would stay there again all of the staff that we encountered were super friendly and helpful room service was super accommodating
cleaned_advanced: wanted quick weekend getaway chose argonaut location pleased offer definitely would staff encountered super friendly helpful service super accommodating

original_reviews: we usually stay closer to union square but decided on a change of direction everyone at the hotel was very helpful the room was great we looked out over the courtyard which was probably the quieter side i imagine the sides that faced the street were much louder we never heard any street trafficthe only available king room when i made our reservation was a handicapped room but i so no problem with it the only minor complaint was not much counter space in the bathroom plus it is just across the street from buena vista so i definately got my irish coffee fix
reviews: very much enjoyed our stay in this hotel in great part due to the wonderful view over alcatraz and the bay its location was just perfect for us being at the quieter end of fishermans wharf but within easy walking to restaurants cable cars and the golden gate bridge is only a flat 4 mile walk away we did walk back from union square one day which was fairly flat through china town although this maybe too far for some the rooms were lovely and the staff very helpful wed definitely stay here again be aware this is no longer a kimpton hotel so the free afternoon wine is no longer provided
cleaned_advanced: much enjoyed great part due wonderful view alcatraz bay location perfect u quieter end fisherman wharf within easy walking restaurant cable car golden gate bridge flat mile walk away walk back union square one day fairly flat china town although maybe far lovely staff helpful wed definitely aware longer kimpton free afternoon wine longer provided

original_reviews: we thoroughly enjoyed staying at the hotel save for the slightly cheesy decor service so sotherefore its really all about the location down on the waterfront dont eat in house try to venture further out and about to enjoy the location
reviews: great hotel on wharf quiet friendly beautiful historically designed building close to cool sites for the whole family schooner museums minigolf trolly ghirardelli chocolates clean quaint hotel with class

original_reviews: what a great place this is right in the middle of things down in fishermans wharf the rooms were set out in a sailor kind of theme which was great they were always kept so tidy also they had a wine an beer hour every afternoon at 5 i think an that was great to just relax an have some free drinks an taste some of there amazing clam chowder the restaurant there is exceptional i dined there twice in my 3 night stay the location is good with views of the bridge right outside it would definitely stay here again
reviews: this was our second stay and we are so glad we were able to come back special thanks to marc he is just amazing and made our stay something to remember our room was with a bay view and its worth it very interesting watching the street come alive in the morning the room was fantastic super comfortable bed and just the right temperature the bathroom is lovely i took the time to have a bath this stay and it was really nice to be able to sit back and relax we had breakfast at the blue mermaid chowder house bar which was delicious and filling just what we needed with excellent service the front of house staff were all lovely too the hotel location was ideal for us it was easy to get around to the sites we were visiting and is only a short bus ride the f bus from town for shopping again the gym was working well and clean this hotel is just plain amazing and we cant wait to come back again next year

original_reviews: we have stayed here on several trips to san francisco love the proximity to fishermans wharf and the cable cars lovely evening social hour in the lobby valet parking historic building national park maritime museum in the lobby and actual museum ships on display just across the street from the hotel great service unique rooms
reviews: loved staying here the location is fantastic the rooms are very comfortable with all conveniences and the history of the building cant be beat there are lots of surcharges on the bill though these cover the extras like a tour of the historic site bike rental and and andjust make sure you are informed up front
cleaned_advanced: loved staying location fantastic comfortable convenience history building cant beat lot surcharge bill though cover extra like tour historic site bike rental andjust make sure informed front

original_reviews: this hotel did not disappoint we ended our spring break vacation 1st stop napa with a two night stay in a king one bedroom suite at the argonaut and it was lovely from the valet to the front desk guest service was wonderful they offered us fiji water and guest wellness kits with face masks sanitizer wipes and spray hand sanitizer upon arrival the one bedroom suite was described on the website as approximately 600 sq ft but it seemed much bigger perhaps we were upgrade it had a comfortable living room with pull out sofa bed which we used for our kids and a nice dining table perfect for a family the suite had exposed brick walls giant wood beams and beautiful white wood window shutters the nautical theme was tastefully done to our surprise they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine and welcome note on our first night the hotel is in a perfect location on the quieter end of the wharf but close enough to walk to pier 39 and ghirardelli square lots to do and plenty of food options and souvenir stores the bay company across the street has quality clothing and souvenirs with great customer service highly recommend the argonaut
reviews: yes this was on my bucket list because it is located in the cannery near fishermans wharf the building is about a century old or so loved the nautical theme we stayed in a inner room which was very quiet the room was spacious and very clean the beds were comfortable also there are robes and a yoga matt it is located in a quieter part of fishermans wharf next to the maritime park the only downside was the windows did not open in our room and i felt the room air was very dry just know the staff does not seem to be able to multi task for example we were in the elevator with the bellhop who let the door shut on us and ignore us because he was so into a conversation with another couple about which entertainers they both knew he did not even push the button for the floor we were all going too also the front desk ignores you when they are on the phone they do not even smile to acknowledge that you are there
cleaned_advanced: yes bucket list located cannery near fisherman wharf building century old loved nautical theme stayed inner quiet spacious clean bed comfortable also robe yoga matt located quieter part fisherman wharf next maritime park downside window open felt air dry know staff seem able multi task example elevator bellhop let door shut u ignore u conversation another couple entertainer knew even push button floor going also front desk ignores phone even smile acknowledge

original_reviews: great hotel in wonderful location at fishermans wharf nice spacious rooms with bridgealcatraz views good tv free wifi courteous attentive staff free winebeer reception for 1 hour each day was a welcome bonus
reviews: the rooms are great youre looking out at the golden gate bridge and alcatraz while being able to walk to fishermans wharf pier 39 buena vista irish coffeehouse the hyde street trolley car turnaround and the blue mermaid restaurant which is really great and on the premises i love going for fleet week 4th of july new years anniversary and my birthday i fully recommend the argonaut youll be back
cleaned_advanced: great youre looking golden gate bridge alcatraz able walk fisherman wharf pier buena vista irish coffeehouse hyde street trolley car turnaround blue mermaid restaurant really great premise love going fleet week th july new year anniversary birthday fully recommend argonaut youll back

original_reviews: this is a great place for getting the feel of san francisco there is a need doggie welcome in the foyer the furnishings by the fireplace are comfortable a welcoming happy hour is fun my room was furnished with a maritime motif the window opened a rarity with most hotels the blue mermaid next door has a great breakfast menu housekeeping is only soso but you cant have everything there is one strange workerstephen the bellman does little besides cavorting around the sidewalk not much help in getting cabs
reviews: great location at fishermans wharf with views of the harbour and easy to walk to local restaurants pleasant room attentive staff and convenient onsite restaurant hotel is a converted warehouse so quirky
cleaned_advanced: great location fisherman wharf view harbour easy walk local restaurant pleasant attentive staff convenient onsite restaurant converted warehouse quirky

original_reviews: we stayed for 6 nights in a corner suite on the top floorthe suite was very large with a fantastic bathroom the bed was comfortable and the sofa bed was better than average the room along with the whole hotel was spotlessly clean and very professionally run all of the staff were great and the concierge zakhida was very helpful before my arrival in sorting out a really good itinerary of trips the view from the room was of alcatraz and the gg bridge we enjoyed breakfast most mornings and had one dinner in the restaurant all were very good as were the staff free water is available and there is availability of coffee in the rooms we asked for a kettle and tea bags and these were provided the only negative for me was that someone used the street as a race track each night to rev their motorbike luckily it didnt go on beyond about 11pm but did go on all late afternoon and evening which was very annoying obviously not the hotels fault and beyond their control there are lots of restaurants and cafes close by as well as shops and transport we enjoyed our stay and would like to thank the staff for their hard work and can recommend the argonaut as a great place to stay
reviews: it is the staff that make this hotel they were really friendly and bent over backwards to help us my husband had a broken ankle and was on crutches the staff could not have done more to make our stay comfortable they upgraded us to an accessible room and also gave us a later check out time so we could prepare for our journey home the doormen were lovely and greeted us like old friends every time we returned to the hotel especially the fantastic donovan who insisted on wheeling my husband all the way to our room while regaling us with some great stories he is a gifted storyteller and a really nice man thank you donovan also a special mention for brooke on the concierge desk for some outstanding restaurant recommendations verbena and amarena nice touches in the hotel including free wifi if you join the kimpton reward scheme and a happy hour with free drinks every day to be fair the hotel decor could do with a bit of an upgrade as it is looking a bit dated and tired now not up to the standard of one of the kimpton hotels we have stayed in in new york however i would recommend this hotel because of the staff also very convenient for boat trips and the powell hyde cable car but bear in mind that fishermans wharf is quite touristy so may not suit everyone as a location

original_reviews: we loved our stay at the argonaut where so many iconic san francisco attractions were right outside our door we indulged in the blue mermaid restaurant twice for convenience and quality but more economic options were also in easy walking distance the concierge was most helpful in assisting us to make the right choices for our stay and see the things we most wanted to see
reviews: location of this a hotel is excellent rooms are very small but decorated very tastefully our room was in the basement and window was at floor level facing directly into street so not very private we needed to keep shutters closed at all times

original_reviews: arguably the best location in san francisco end of the cable car line minutes walk to the alcatraz port pier 39 lombard street and a fantastic views of the bay nautical themed rooms were well designed and gave a homely feel with all of the above taken into account the best thing about the hotel is the happy hour which is in fact free beer and wine tasting it turns the bustling foyer into a mecca of wine and beer connoisseurs who share their tourists experiences highly recommend staying here and will be revisiting san francisco
reviews: we stayed in this hotel because the zoe nee tuscan did not honor our reservation that was made in january 2017 and confirmed two weeks before our arrival it was actually a blessing we really like the argonaut and it is now our go to hotel in san francisco it is very friendly clean and convenient
cleaned_advanced: stayed zoe nee tuscan honor reservation made january confirmed two week arrival actually blessing really like argonaut go san francisco friendly clean convenient

original_reviews: i rate the argonaut as average as i thought that the hotel is ok starting with the pros in that check in was smooth with the staff being polite they provide 10 vouchers to the blue mermaid for each of the days you stay upon entering my room which was a standard room decor is nice while accommodations were clean and tidy rooms arent large which is fine for those that are alone no so much for families the walls in the rooms are thin i hear everything people coughing to the movement of the bed in the room next door this part for me made it a poor experience overall the argonaut is a good hotel id stay again given its price and proximity to a number of things to do in the area
reviews: having made the decision to stay at fishermans wharf on this trip to san francisco we decided to stay at the argonaut based on tripadvisor recommendations we were very happy with our stay great service great room wonderful bed plenty of room close to everything it was perfect for our stay and while not cheap nothing is in san fran we will definitely stay there again
cleaned_advanced: made decision fisherman wharf trip san francisco decided argonaut based tripadvisor recommendation happy great service great wonderful bed plenty close everything perfect cheap nothing san fran definitely

original_reviews: stayed in early oct including the fleet weekend although booked a year ago was given a room on 2nd floor as was told that higher floors given to those only here for a day or two and we could move to a higher floor tomorrow why not just preallocate rooms as a lot easier price very high and aligned to top hotels in london eg the ritz but dont feel you get same level of quality love the sustainability of hotel but toiletries dont feel local nor do the have any aroma of citrus or tea tree feel like they have been in bottle too long why not just put enough in for the stay and keep it fresh also on sustainability why not put free water in rooms charging 5 for evian how is evian in a sf hotel room sustainable i know fresh water in lobby but that in a small jug in each room would have been a bit of a wow rooms are so comfortable and very clean had pillows changed and a little issue with shower was fixed with no fuss the hotel has such friendly charming staff they cant do enough for you just be honest and polite and they are the same back including those who park the cars was the one chance to blow me away with quality as not likely to be back in the bay area for a number of years but sadly it missed the chance it is an amazing location for quality of its staff match the price but sadly not the quality of the hotel
reviews: came to san francisco for my daughters august wedding she selected the hotel and i looked it up on the website before visiting im not including any of my photos of the room or lobby because the website very accurately portrays all the details my suggestion is to go to the argonaut hotel site and all the photos will delight you the hotel has exposed brick on the wall in the rooms which makes it very charming and large slat window shutters also very charming the windows from my room gave a nice view of the courtyard around the hotel it was fun to open my 4th story window and look down at the people walking by enjoying san francisco my room was very comfortable i had two queen size beds each night id fall asleep immediately the bed is that comfortable the bathroom is roomy and very clean it has amenities that assure youll want for nothing a hairdryer is hung in a bag by the shower i missed it the first day very subtle the way this hotel places things for the guests use in the closet there is an iron ironing board a safe for valuables and something that came in so handy one day a good sized umbrella downstairs is the blue mermaid restaurant on the morning of the wedding i ordered room service for breakfast i was surprised and pleased at how quickly my order was filled it arrived within 15 minutes and it was delicious my room had a coffeemaker with coffee packets that made hot delicious coffee there is a large comfortable lobby area to sit and relax or wait for familyfriends iced water is available and a fireplace that is very cozy to sit next to every single staff member was genuinely friendly and niceone day i sat for a while in the lobby and they were consistently happy and pleasant to everyone they encountered and although its a very busy hotel there is never a rushed feeling from the staff the doormen are very helpful and so polite in a very welcoming way since this was my daughters wedding i was constantly looking for tissues for my happy tearsand while waiting for the wedding shuttle i had used all of my own the doorman had a box at his station and was so happy to give me some and chat with me to calm me down this hotel has clearly thought of everything a guest might need i recommend this hotel for your san francisco vacation being right on fishermans wharf is a perfect spot food a pleasant park to walk about a trolley stop and shops are nearby i had an excellent time my daughter had suggested i stay an extra couple of days after the wedding to relax and im so glad i did im not a huge tourist sightseeing person and this location allowed me to enjoy san francisco in a quiet way just walking and eating and enjoying my favorite pasttme people watching for those who do enjoy sightseeing this is a perfect hotel to be your base enjoy

original_reviews: we stay at the argonaut every year during fleet week in a great location located near fishermans wharf and ghirardelli square the staff is always helpful and attentive we look forward to our next trip to sf and the argonaut
reviews: we loved our stay from the moment we stepped in the door the history of this building is unbelievable and we were treated wonderfully our room was a bay view suite that was beautiful the exposed brick is the way to go you can see the golden gate bridge from your room as well as alcatraz you are around everything on fishermans wharf so fun

original_reviews: the argonaut was perfect for my husband and i it was our first time in san francisco and the location and atmosphere were great it takes about 10 minutes to walk to pier 39 but its a great walk with bay views its also close to ghirardelli square and there are tons of restaurants right outside the hotel doors well definitely be back one day
reviews: we had an awesome experience at the argonaut hotel i cant think of one negative aspect of our four day visit therewould love to return to not only san francisco but also the argonaut if possible book a room with the view of alcatraz you would not regret that decision

original_reviews: this hotel with its great nautical decor is in a perfect location opposite fishermans wharf despite being on the tourist strip it would have been remarkably quiet at night if only the family in the room next to us didnt have their tv blaring all night till 3am when we finally called guest services and asked that they do something about it it required a second call to get anything done and finally it was quiet despite the lack of sleep we would return
reviews: we stayed there over four nights in august and really enjoyed the hotel the two beds in our room were very comfortable and still left us with plenty of room to move around the decor was pleasant and fun it was reasonably quiet considering the area it is very centrally located and there is going to be a certain amount of chaos going on outside arrange for a higher floor if you can the attached restaurant and patio is very nice and we ate there twice on check in you will be given a 10 credit for the restaurantbar which is a nice touch they have a bike rental for free as well i believe staff were pleasant and accommodating
cleaned_advanced: stayed four night august really enjoyed two bed comfortable still left u plenty move around decor pleasant fun reasonably quiet considering area centrally located going certain amount chaos going outside arrange higher floor attached restaurant patio nice ate twice check given credit restaurantbar nice touch bike rental free well believe staff pleasant accommodating

original_reviews: beautiful rooms and very welcoming concierge and checkin they also appear to be dogfriendly the hotel is located central to all the essential piers and walking distance from buena vistas renowned irish ciffees
reviews: while san francisco is deteriorating by the minute this hotel is an oasis ky was our front desk manager he was instrumental in our trip being a success the hotel is beautifully appointed and kid friendly but with adult options everywhere the room service is fast put your sign out before 2am and it will arrive when you asked ky showed my son the treasure box which was such a treat as we checked out he also helped tremendously with our room the food at the blue mermaid is fantastic and the hotel gives you a 10 per night credit you must charge to the room and it does not work with room service the views of hyde park and ghiradelli square are fantastic ask for the hyde park room view the powell hyde turn around is literally next door get there by 8am and there are no lines the famous ghiradelli chocolate factory is up one block there are three incredible ships to tour 15 for adults free for kids under 15 right across the street the old fashioned trolley lines are two blocks down on a budget go to in out burger a half a block away lombard street up 5 blocks the pier and all it has to offer is right down the street you simply cant go wrong with this hotel its the third time ive stayed there safe convenient quiet and expensive and worth it ky thank you

original_reviews: great location near fishermans wharf with a view of golden gate bridge from our window the hotels restaurant the blue mermaid is excellent with good food and very helpful and efficient staff we found reception to be brusque though offering no guidance about the area and no water when we arrived though other guests received bottles from other reception staff water in the room is priced at 8 for a litre bottle also there is no actual living breathing onsite concierge except on one day a week fridays we were told i find that extraordinary for a hotel in this price range
reviews: i love that this hotel is close to everywhere i want to be ghiradelli square cable cars go cart rentals fishermans wharf pier 39 are all walking distance i love the exposed brick in the rooms it was built on the site of the old historic cannery the bluemermaid restaurant has the best crab corn chowder you must have a bowl the staff has always been superior the rooms clean im a clean freak and quiet my fave is the king suite with the jacuzzi bath tub because after walking all day youll need it im not a wine drinker but there is a wine and cheese hour every evening some rooms have a view of alcatraz and the golden gate bridge
cleaned_advanced: love close everywhere want ghiradelli square cable car go cart rental fisherman wharf pier walking distance love exposed brick built site old historic cannery bluemermaid restaurant best crab corn chowder must bowl staff always superior clean im clean freak quiet fave king suite jacuzzi bath tub walking day youll need im wine drinker wine cheese hour every evening view alcatraz golden gate bridge

original_reviews: between location value room size and service this was one of family of fives favorite hotel stays in comparison to jw marriott four seasons hotel del coronado and similar hotels we stayed in a one bedroom bay view suite at the end of march even with a king bed queen sofabed and a rollaway we had more than enough space no one was tripping over suitcases or felt like they couldnt move around it was like an ideal first apartment just without a kitchen what we loved besides the space location right between ghiradelli square and fishermans wharf you can walk or take public transportation to all the major tourist or business spots in the city beautiful view of the bay plenty of restaurant options nearby right next to the cable car stop concierge bernadette paula and michael were so knowledgeable and helpful and hooked us up with great ideas and discounts they also arranged our airport transfer for our arrival with five of us plus luggage it was more economical for us to take a private van service they arranged for a go lorries van to meet us 85 total bikes the hotel has 14 total passes per day for two hour complimentary bike rental at blazing saddles just up the hill on hyde street you do need to line up early in the morning to get them but its worth it with the hotels location you can get right on the bike path and ride out to the golden gate bridge lobby the lobby was warm and inviting with a fireplace plenty of seating and table games service everyone we encountered was so helpful and friendly marvin the bellman stood out in particular the only downside about the location is that you get some noise from the bars nearby if youre traveling with small kids who need to get to bed early ask for a room on the hyde street corner the side closer to ghiradelli sq tip for families even though youll want to ride the cable car for the experience take the streetcar around the city for 10 total our family rode all over getting on off several times with free transfers the argonaut was the first of four hotels we stayed at during our trip through california from sf to coronado and by far our favorite of this vacation we would love to come back and highly recommend it
reviews: fabulous location clean and neat hotel i would stay here again beware of extra charges resort fee and 85 for parking with parking tax instead of feeling like they nickel and dime you i wish the extra charges were included in the nightly rate as a total
cleaned_advanced: fabulous location clean neat would beware extra charge resort fee parking parking tax instead feeling like nickel dime wish extra charge included nightly rate total

original_reviews: hotel was fine concierge gave terrible recommendations nicest guy but bad advice front desk not so helpful location was great near fishermans wharf room was adequate sized and clean restaurant was fine
reviews: we received great rates and an upgrade for what i still consider some of the best designed hotels in the west they are not pseudo luxury but good quality fun and the attention to detail is still great i love the overthetop nautical themed decor the building itself is in a refurbished historical building and alone it is a satisfying place to be with exposed brick and old beams the warf location is still a bit tacky and not to my taste but it is near the water walkable to the park and other points if interest i think this area is slowly changing for the better easy access for jogging along the water front and close to a trolly pick up spot the bed was comfy and the location is quiet the shower is not amazing but i rarely find amazing bathroom in cities without paying a premium price it was clean and nice enough though we received a ten dollar voucher for the restaurantabout equal to 34 of one persons breakfast all in all a really solid choice for the city

original_reviews: hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly great location centrally located to many restaurants ghirardelli square hop on hop off tour bus and cable cars definitely would stay there again
reviews: we decided to spend our anniversary in san francisco so why not try the argonaut hotel first time here and most certainly not the last great service fantastic rooms with comfortable decor and very spacious we only stayed one night due to our schedules but that didnt matter well worth it highly encourage this hotel as its close to everything and if you want to get to the piers hop on the trolly just one block away and your there in 5 min
cleaned_advanced: decided spend anniversary san francisco try argonaut first time certainly last great service fantastic comfortable decor spacious stayed one night due schedule didnt matter well worth highly encourage close everything want get pier hop trolly one block away min

original_reviews: the argonaut hotel is perfectly located for many of the sites within walking distance across the street is the cable car turn around and it is within walking distance to pier 39 and all the shops and restaurants in between bikes are available for guests to use at no charge and it is close enough to the golden gate bridge to ride across the staff especially brook who works in the concierge department could not of been more helpful she was able to pull a rabbit out of the hat and get us tickets for the sold out trip to alcatraz the rooms are clean and roomy we stayed in the standard king and although it was nice when i got a peek in the deluxe king rooms i wished i had spent more and booked one of them nice brick details in the room and it was larger we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant most mornings called the blue mermaid chowder house the food was good and comparable in price to other breakfast places in the area i would definitely stay at the argonaut again on our next trip to san francisco
reviews: spent 4 days 3 nights in this modern well furnished hotel situated along the north shore it is located in the tourist belt with many shops and eateries the rooms were modern clean and had two large queen beds the staff were kind to give my family of 6 adjoining rooms although they were the furthest from the lift lobby they were also next to the street behind the hotel and often we would here people talking and cars zooming by in the middle of the night the toilet was large and fitted with modern toiletries the shower was powerful and provided a nice hot shower which was nice when coming in from the cold winter the only but significant shortfall was the lack or parking facilities a valet service was available at us60 day i managed to get round this by parking at the street side lots for free but this takes good timing and a bit of effort to find a lot near the hotel so unless you have to dont drive to this hotel
