original_reviews: this hotel is perfectly situated for a visit to sfo it is at the quiet end of fishermans wharf next to and part of the national park service property the service is friendly helpful and accessible without being overbearing rooms are adequate in size and well and very comfortably furnished reading lights are good desk is comfortable and adequate to do work maritime themed decor is fresh and comfortable beds and pillows are great we didnt take advantage of it but dogs are welcome
reviews: great location if you like the wharf area and we had a suite was very nice lots of room very well decorated and modern lessons learned however when we checked in we had a bay view room had an early check in which was great but there was a street musician playing right outside our room which was loud and we all agree needed to move us hotel did so promptly the problem began that night with the people above us for almost two hour straight there was a continuous thumping or stomping noise i called the front desk and they indicated they would contact them next morning at 730 it began again this went on for two more nights and two mornings i probably called the front desk 6 more times and they continued to apologize and try to get the people to stop i also thought the person above us was checking out sooner lessons learned we probably should have moved the first day secondly i would have liked the hotel to have been more aggressive in some way with the people above and lastly people who are that inconsiderate to other people in hotels should learn that we are all sharing some space here and to be more considerate of others the hotel did offer a small compensation which i really didnt care because it was more important to us to enjoy the very nice suite we had reserved 6 months ago anyway just words of advice if you have issues get them resolved immediately and to what you want
cleaned_advanced: great location like wharf area suite nice lot well decorated modern lesson learned however checked bay view early check great street musician playing right outside loud agree needed move u promptly problem began night people u almost two hour straight continuous thumping stomping noise called front desk indicated would contact next morning began went two night two morning probably called front desk time continued apologize try get people stop also thought person u checking sooner lesson learned probably moved first day secondly would liked aggressive way people lastly people inconsiderate people hotel learn sharing space considerate others offer small compensation really didnt care important u enjoy nice suite reserved month ago anyway word advice issue get resolved immediately want

original_reviews: lovely stay at this very neatly appointed hotel decor is nautical theme they offer a cute plush toy sea lion on the beds when you arrive nicely located next to the starting point of the hyde line of cable cars that take you to lombard street and union square also at one end of all the shopping and restaurants near fishermans wharf good food at the restaurant but just across the street are more options and the maritime national historic park is adjacent
reviews: nice big rooms and very comfy beds given its location you get very little noise from the street fishermans wharf is the touristy side of sf theres plenty other places to enjoy to be honest however for the area this is the best in the vicinity
cleaned_advanced: nice big comfy bed given location get little noise street fisherman wharf touristy side sf there plenty place enjoy honest however area best vicinity

original_reviews: we booked this hotel because it was within walking distance of a wedding venue we were attending we booked the argonaut suite and were pleasantly surprised at how large this suite was we had plenty of room for the two of us plus visitors the bathroom was massive there were a lot of windows giving as a 180 degree view of fishermans wharf and ghirardelli squaretrolley area we loved that the wc was behind its own door so that if someone want to utilize the rest of the bathroom while someone needed the wc both could be easily accommodated the shower and sunken tub were separate the tub had a wonderful view of fishermans wharf i just cannot say enough things about this property and its location we checked in around 11pm and it was breeze the front desk and bell desk personal were super friendly and inviting the hotel is conveniently located in fishermans wharf near ghirardelli square you can easily get on the tolley or muni to get around if you dont want to walk or catch a ride from our 5 days here we noticed that all of the staff were super friendly and accommodating should we need to stay in this part of san francisco again we will stay at this property the hotel decor is nautical theme with octopus tentacle wallpaper in the bathroom they even have deck chairs to lounge on in the lobby port holes near the elevators part of a boat in the lobby etc super cute
reviews: this hotel was recommended by our travel agent so we chose it the location is excellent with stunning views of the bay the bridge and alcatraz the staff were welcoming and friendly and we checked in no problem the room was larger than average with a lovely decor and thats all the good no free water in the room 8 for 1l i didnt even look at the prices for the chocolate and spirits the bathroom was quite small and the shower not the best although the toiletries were nice and plentiful there were children in the room next door and we could hear every cry and howl until they dropped off to sleep so the walls seemed paper thin fortunately they checked out the following day so we had quiet nights the rest of our stay on checking in we had had a long day so decided to eat in the adjoining restaurant blue mermaid a nice building a small menu with a special of a turkish starter main course i was told the chef was turkish so was looking forward to my kebab what a disappointment it was awful one thin pitta bread with some tzatziki and a relish and a plain kebab plonked on the bread no salad no chips no side i shouldve taken a photo it just looked like something you find in a toilet im british so very rarely complain but i refused to eat it and sent it back i was offered an alternative but declined we tried breakfast my wife likes her tea in the morning she was offered jasmine earl grey and camomile no breakfast tea no mint the food was ok but with better places within a 5 min walk i wouldnt choose here checkout was midday an extra 100 to keep the room til 1500 after that full room rate no room to freshen up change and with a night flight this was a little disheartening to park your car was 60 but if you planned on using it would cost an extra 10 a lot of places had similar charges not just this hotel would i recommend this hotel 6040 yes but definitely eat out and sort out your own parking nearby
cleaned_advanced: recommended travel agent chose location excellent stunning view bay bridge alcatraz staff welcoming friendly checked problem larger average lovely decor thats good free water didnt even look price chocolate spirit bathroom quite small shower best although toiletry nice plentiful child next door could hear every cry howl dropped sleep wall seemed paper thin fortunately checked following day quiet night rest checking long day decided eat adjoining restaurant blue mermaid nice building small menu special turkish starter main course told chef turkish looking forward kebab disappointment awful one thin pitta bread tzatziki relish plain kebab plonked bread salad chip side shouldve taken photo looked like something find toilet im british rarely complain refused eat sent back offered alternative declined tried breakfast wife like tea morning offered jasmine earl grey camomile breakfast tea mint food ok better place within min walk wouldnt choose checkout midday extra keep til full rate freshen change night flight little disheartening park car planned using would cost extra lot place similar charge would recommend yes definitely eat sort parking nearby

original_reviews: just a fyi and this may be one you already know this hotel is right by the wharf and is in great walking distances of a lot of cool places and shops however it is very touristy and busy the early morning is the only time there isnt a crowd around this area the inside of the hotel is very nice customer service check in and check out wasnt the best but the nice gentleman that brought up our room service was very polite they hotel is very nice on the inside but we were able to hear our neighbors some we didnt have a view at all so if you want one even of the city make sure to book with a view the beds were very comfortable the bathroom was very nice too and i loved their soap it smelled wonderful they also have battery powered bikes that you can rent and its attached to part of the maritime museum all in all i liked this hotel
reviews: we had a wonderful experience at the argonaut you could say they went a little overboard with the nautical theme however the furnishings and decor were upscale and they pulled it off the staff was courteous efficient and handled several outoftheordinary issues promptly only one of which was hoteloriented we were given a complimentary upgrade the rooms are spacious and the bedding is extremely comfortable as a matter of fact im getting ready to buy a new mattress and id like to know the brand the argonaut has the lounge area is huge with plenty of seating areas the coziest of which is next to the fireplace the patio is a great place to hang out the heaters and fire providing plenty of warmth on chilly windy days while i hadnt planned on staying in a touristy area we opted for fishermans wharf because we didnt want to rent a car but i have to say for being on the main drag youd never know it once you are inside
cleaned_advanced: wonderful experience argonaut could say went little overboard nautical theme however furnishing decor upscale pulled staff courteous efficient handled several outoftheordinary issue promptly one hoteloriented given complimentary upgrade spacious bedding extremely comfortable matter fact im getting ready buy new mattress id like know brand argonaut lounge area huge plenty seating area coziest next fireplace patio great place hang heater fire providing plenty warmth chilly windy day hadnt planned staying touristy area opted fisherman wharf didnt want rent car say main drag youd never know inside

original_reviews: we were here 3 nights on a hotwire deal it was a great price for the area i do feel that the cheaper rooms are given in the noisiest areas on friday night it was very loud outside due to crowds in fishermans wharf area thankfully i had earplugs the other two weekend nights were not as bad we were on 4th floor and could also still hear traffic noise beds were comfortable room very clean staff very helpful and efficient we had oversized pickup truck so daily parking was almost 70 with taxes we knew this going in so were not surprised but it does seem very excessive
reviews: we stayed in the argonaut for 2 nights in june the hotel itself is in a beautiful waterfront location at fishermans wharf with every sort of restaurant you could possibly want within walking distance the room was lovely with a nautical theme and we especially enjoyed the animal print bathrobes in room facilities were above average filter coffee minibar exclusive complimentary toiletries usb charging points in room safe cordless telephone large flat scren tv the list goes on
cleaned_advanced: stayed argonaut night june beautiful waterfront location fisherman wharf every sort restaurant could possibly want within walking distance lovely nautical theme especially enjoyed animal print bathrobe facility average filter coffee minibar exclusive complimentary toiletry usb charging point safe cordless telephone large flat scren tv list go

original_reviews: stayed at the argonaut hotel for the third time the location is outstanding the property is very well kept and the staff is very professional and friendly there is no better place to stay in the fishmans wharf area
reviews: stayed at this hotel on the first leg of our honeymoon and really enjoyed it it was nice and clean when we arrived and we had the end room on the top floor which meant we have a view of golden gate bridge the room layout was slightly narrow but not a deal breaker i found it interesting that they actively welcome pets namely dogs to the hotel by greeting them with the little sign and free dog treats i found out on a tour that the city loves dogs and caters for them in their hotels location was great for easy access to the many eateries on the wharf the only thing i feel that the hotel is missing is a bar area also we had to call down to reception to ask the cleaners to clean our room despite them being near our room from early on
cleaned_advanced: stayed first leg honeymoon really enjoyed nice clean arrived end top floor meant view golden gate bridge layout slightly narrow deal breaker found interesting actively welcome pet namely dog greeting little sign free dog treat found tour city love dog caters hotel location great easy access many eatery wharf thing feel missing bar area also call reception ask cleaner clean despite near early

original_reviews: we book a standard room and when we came in our room i was very surprised the room is very big and nice there is mini bar which is ful 2 bottles of water for free free wifi stuff on reception are very nice and help always the position is close to the sea perfect u can find a lot of shops for tourists and a lot of restaurants also in the hotel there is a restaurant we didnt eat there but we saw menu and prices are good than behind hotel there is a starbucks where u can have breakfast or there is also breakfast in restaurant at 45 pm in lobby everybody drinking beer and wine nice atmosphere hotel is big room is nice just they have very strange bathrobe it was leopard and giraffe
reviews: i highly suggest the argonaut hotel it has many unique architectural feathers and is very well kept and the staff is friendly and accommodating the location is perfect right across the street from starbucks
cleaned_advanced: highly suggest argonaut many unique architectural feather well kept staff friendly accommodating location perfect right across street starbucks

original_reviews: great location great service concierge was extremely helpful i am handicapped and have mobility issues she recommended tours that were easy for me the tour was amazing we saw things i never would have been able to see without her services close to cable cars too would definitely recommend and would definitely stay here again
reviews: family of four with teenage kids stayed in a corner suite 345 beautiful room views of bridge and alcatraz right in the heart of the action 3 mins walk to fisher mans wharf right outside bottom of cable car bike to bridge and ghiradellis ice cream could not recommend this hotel and room highly enough if you are looking to visit sf as tourists
cleaned_advanced: family four teenage kid stayed corner suite beautiful view bridge alcatraz right heart action min walk fisher man wharf right outside bottom cable car bike bridge ghiradellis ice cream could recommend highly enough looking visit sf tourist

original_reviews: unique nautical hotel a great stay in sf near pier 39 however parking is 65 per night ugh we enjoyed the mermaid restaurant and the wine bar on site the staff was very helpful and it is walking distance to many great areas
reviews: this was my first visit to argonaut with our office in ghe presidio there really arent any great options nearby so i end up in fishermans wharf usually argonaut is fully booked i must have now tried at least 4 different hotels in the neighborhood and argonaut is nicer with its brick walls and more authentic feel to it
cleaned_advanced: first visit argonaut office ghe presidio really arent great option nearby end fisherman wharf usually argonaut fully booked must tried least different hotel neighborhood argonaut nicer brick wall authentic feel

original_reviews: wonderful hotel near of all the attractions amazing restaurant and the rooms so comfortable pet friendly parking a bit expensive but worth it location is the best we will be back next year property manager was so nice too with an incident that we had
reviews: beautiful hotel built in a historical building with excellent service close to pier 39 shops and restaurants we had a nice large king room with a street side view of the waterfront and alcatraz the room was beautifully decorated and quiet parking can be hard to find in the area but using their valet parking was great and we just walked from there or used the trolley service
cleaned_advanced: beautiful built historical building excellent service close pier shop restaurant nice large king street side view waterfront alcatraz beautifully decorated quiet parking hard find area using valet parking great walked used trolley service

original_reviews: perfect location near pier 39 and all the attractions staff very efficient they printed our boarding passes no problem room quirky and comfortable we would definitely stay here again when we return
reviews: my husband and i stayed at the argonaut for the first time a few weeks ago location perfect buena vista just up the block ghirardelli square one block away beautiful aquatic park across the street view of golden gate bridge located right at the waters edge at fishermans wharf upper west end the restaurant in the argonaut hotel is wonderful food very fresh and excellent service from beginning to end from stepping out of the taxi from the airport being greeted by john who walked us in with our bags he walked us all the way to the front desk to make sure we were taken care of we felt special then we met eddie lopez at the front desk what an incredible worker he is truly committed to his job handling a busy front desk with ease and with such a great customer service attitude we felt so special he made us feel so welcome we stayed for 5 nights every day we checked in with him he would offer suggestions on where to go etc i have never met a more committed and happy worker i highly recommend the argonaut hotel the room was spotless and modern updated the maid service was excellent as well maid staff very friendly and hard working it just seems like all staff really enjoy their position are 100 committed to a great guest experience the location is the best walking distance to cable car right just up the block we cant wait to return
cleaned_advanced: husband stayed argonaut first time week ago location perfect buena vista block ghirardelli square one block away beautiful aquatic park across street view golden gate bridge located right water edge fisherman wharf upper west end restaurant argonaut wonderful food fresh excellent service beginning end stepping taxi airport greeted john walked u bag walked u way front desk make sure taken care felt special met eddie lopez front desk incredible worker truly committed job handling busy front desk ease great customer service attitude felt special made u feel welcome stayed night every day checked would offer suggestion go etc never met committed happy worker highly recommend argonaut spotless modern updated maid service excellent well maid staff friendly hard working seems like staff really enjoy position committed great guest experience location best walking distance cable car right block cant wait return

original_reviews: love this hotel it is in the perfect location close to the cable car pickup and right on the water staff is very friendly and always willing to help shoutout to the doorman who always asks if we need something great job team argonaut
reviews: team is amazing making my stay very special its location is at the quieter end of fishermans wharf the location is perfect for any activity restaurants and the cable cars simply fantastic i would highly recommend this hotel for anyone
cleaned_advanced: team amazing making special location quieter end fisherman wharf location perfect activity restaurant cable car simply fantastic would highly recommend anyone

original_reviews: june 2024 celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary with some very special friends also celebrating 25th anniversary we chose the argonaut for its location close to fishermans wharf the hotel was lovely spacious and clean if a little on the expensive side but we found out that we had picked a time that coincided with a major event locally escape from alcatraz triathlon so the prices were much higher than at other times note to selfcheck for local events next time our room was great very spacious and clean breakfast wasnt included but a limited menu was available in their in house restaurant but we found it expensive blue mermaid ill do a separate review for the meals here we went hunting and out the back of the hotel was an amazing place called 8am brunch 5 minute walk away would go back to sf just for that the wharf itself was very clean and very well looked after but we felt it had a seaside town feel about it with so many souvenir shops there
reviews: we enjoyed very much our stay in the argonaut hotel in san francisco besides the confortable room the excellent position and the delicious cuisine we really appreciated the kindness and the precious advise and help of concierge joana which allowed us to fully enjoy our discovery of san francisco thanks beppe and lilli mazzoni
cleaned_advanced: enjoyed much argonaut san francisco besides confortable excellent position delicious cuisine really appreciated kindness precious advise help concierge joana allowed u fully enjoy discovery san francisco thanks beppe lilli mazzoni

original_reviews: great location spacious rooms and friendly staff definitely recommend staying at this hotel blue mermaid food was delicious their breakfasts are the best i enjoy my stay and i look forward to coming back
reviews: stunning hotel in a fantastic location fishermans wharf to the right and the hydepowell cable car and ghirardelli chocolate factory to the left staff were friendly and helpful free bike hire to cycle the bay and bridge cant sing the praises enough
cleaned_advanced: stunning fantastic location fisherman wharf right hydepowell cable car ghirardelli chocolate factory left staff friendly helpful free bike hire cycle bay bridge cant sing praise enough

original_reviews: from a canning factory to an upscale hotel this hotel provides all the amenities anyone could ask for from the doorman in uniform to the special pillows on the bed this hotel is an example of turning something old into something new the rooms are large beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are modern the staff is friendly and efficient
reviews: we started at 2 hotels during our trip a work event was based at the other hotel if i had the choice i would have stayed at the argonaut the whole time the hotel is in a great spot at the end of fishermans wharf we paid for a bay view room and could see the bay and the golden gate bridge from our room since it is at the end of the wharf its a bit quieter while still being close enough to make everything readily accessible the cable car turntable is right next to the hotel though we didnt realise at first because we didnt hear a sound from it there are also some bicycle rentals just a few doors down id highly recommend grabbing a bike and cycling across the bridge you can get the ferry back to the wharf as for the rooms themselves ours looked very modern and the nautical theme continues throughout the entire hotel we had all the amenities we needed and the staff were all very helpful on leaving we told a member of staff that we were moving over to the grand hyatt for a work event thats a nice hotel very classy he replied in my opinion the argonaut is a much nicer and classier hotel there was not a piece of 70s style wooden panelling in sight and the staff were far more courteous at the argonaut if we come back to sf in future the argonaut will definitely be our first choice
cleaned_advanced: started hotel trip work event based choice would stayed argonaut whole time great spot end fisherman wharf paid bay view could see bay golden gate bridge since end wharf bit quieter still close enough make everything readily accessible cable car turntable right next though didnt realise first didnt hear sound also bicycle rental door id highly recommend grabbing bike cycling across bridge get ferry back wharf looked modern nautical theme continues throughout entire amenity needed staff helpful leaving told member staff moving grand hyatt work event thats nice classy replied opinion argonaut much nicer classier piece style wooden panelling sight staff far courteous argonaut come back sf future argonaut definitely first choice

original_reviews: this is the place for the air show 4th of july or anything else you might want to do in the heart of the fishermans warf area we are from the bay area we come up to the argonaut once or twice a year and its always a perfect stay
reviews: san francisco is a wonderful place to visit hotels in general are expensive so pick wisely so you are not too far away from the main attractions we chose the argonaut a 4 star hotel right on the fishermans wharf this is a perfect position ideal to walk the warf visit local restaurants or go to alcatraz or even jump on a tram we spent five nights at this wonderful hotel there is so much character to this hotel the rooms are of a good size and well furnished and a lovely well price restaurant a nice touch from the hotel was complimentary wine beer or soft drinks for an hour from 5pm another tip is to purchase an onoff bus ticket from the kiosk just along from the hotel negotiate the price definitely recommend this hotel
cleaned_advanced: san francisco wonderful place visit hotel general expensive pick wisely far away main attraction chose argonaut star right fisherman wharf perfect position ideal walk warf visit local restaurant go alcatraz even jump tram spent five night wonderful much character good size well furnished lovely well price restaurant nice touch complimentary wine beer soft drink hour pm another tip purchase onoff bus ticket kiosk along negotiate price definitely recommend

original_reviews: this property had great views and outstanding service nice touch to give a 10 credit for the restaurant splurge and get room with view of golden gate its well worth it they made it easy to add on wine for our arrival and even had a souvenir for purchase in the room my son loved his argonaut sea otter
reviews: the argonauts unique looks its bold almost cartoonish maritime theme and easy walker location lured me in for a 2 day solo stay while visiting old friends in sf my stay followed a trip with my husband to wine country so i was still basking in memory of other upscale hotels when i arrived at the argonaut in that light the argonaut selling itself as a luxury hotel at luxury hotel prices was a definite disappointment here is what i did and didnt like about this hotel the good 1 walking location if the crowds drive you mad turn away from fishermans wharf craziness and go left you can take a wonderful walk to the pier up into the marina and as far as you like towards golden gate bridge beautiful 2 fun theming i rather liked the brash decor and im sure it is thrilling for kids visiting with family although that giant boat wheel mirror directly facing the bed was a bit much particularly for a solitary traveler 3 housekeeping hotel and room were very clean when i left requests for certain items a replacement for the broken pen and a robe since one was missing they were delivered and staged nicely the bad 1 price i paid almost 1000 for 2 nights in a room that did not have a luxury setting or approach see below for more details my king deluxe was comfortable but rather shotgun in its narrowness and my only view was of a courtyard where folks drank talked and occasionally howled at the moon really all day and night i have paid far less for much better spaces in similarly desirable locations often a luxury hotel will make up a less than perfect room for you with extra benefits and service but that did not happen here 2 seals minibars and itty bitty bottles of booze show me a luxury hotel where you have to ask for a robe to be delivered how about a room with a small cute madeinchinafor15cents plush seal with argonaut stitched on the side left prominently on the bed and on closer examination with a price tag of 22 the mini bar list said only 14 what a bargain a large minibar that looked like the food concessions at a movie theater minus the helpful glass barrier was just as expensive i couldnt help but wonder how quickly the tab would ring up when a small child entered and grabbed the cute seal giant pack of mms cranberry banana chips etc i didnt have to wonder what an adult would think of the 26 bottles of bad wine i still had a free bottle one of two of good wine our cheaper healdsburg hotel had given us as a courtesy the night before just to be clear ive seen such seals and minibars before at other hotelsmotels but at a true luxury hotel this price point the seal is free to take home to your kid and so are the snacks if not the alcohol management really needs to think this one through set up a snack shack in the lobby if you need too but dont turn my room into a luxury tourista minimart 3 front desk service after exploring muir woods earlier in the day i arrived at checkin in clean jeans a tshirt and black anorak definitely not a street urchin but not direct from tiffanys either the clients in front of me were dressed in business attire and receiving prompt attentive service on my turn the blonde front desk lady looked me over gave me a one minute finger signal and spent 45 minutes answering the phone talking to a coworker and casting glances perhaps to see if the other agent or the totally unoccupied also watching concierge had welcomed andor taken me yet when that failed she handed me over to a new relatively untrained staffer without a further word perhaps if i had been dressed more nicely i would have gotten faster friendlier service or perhaps not either way this does not speak well for service first impressions or the hotel 4 not a driving location i mentioned walking as a benefit driving is much less so when one of my friends tried to pick me up from the hotel it was nigh impossible for her to get there and the parking rates when she did were extraordinary there are so many amazing things to do and see in san francisco frankly this hotel is a much pricer attraction than it is currently worth if you can get a room with a view guarantee maybe it would be better but make sure to tell them to hide the seal and candy bars from your kid first

walk pier marina far like towards golden gate bridge beautiful fun theming rather liked brash decor im sure thrilling kid visiting family although giant boat wheel mirror directly facing bed bit much particularly solitary traveler housekeeping clean left request certain item replacement broken pen robe since one missing delivered staged nicely bad price paid almost night luxury setting approach see detail king deluxe comfortable rather shotgun narrowness view courtyard folk drank talked occasionally howled moon really day night paid far less much better space similarly desirable location prominently bed closer examination price tag mini bar list said bargain large minibar looked like food concession movie theater minus helpful glass barrier expensive couldnt help wonder quickly tab would ring small child entered grabbed cute seal giant pack mm cranberry banana chip etc didnt wonder adult would think bottle bad wine still free bottle one two good wine cheaper healdsburg given u courtesy night clear ive seen seal minibar hotelsmotels true luxury price point seal free take home kid snack alcohol management really need think one set snack shack lobby need dont turn luxury tourista minimart front desk service exploring muir wood earlier day arrived checkin clean jean tshirt black anorak definitely street urchin direct tiffany either client front dressed business attire receiving prompt attentive service turn blonde front desk lady looked gave one minute finger signal spent minute answering phone talking coworker casting glance perhaps see agent totally unoccupied also watching concierge welcomed andor taken yet failed handed new relatively untrained staffer without word perhaps dressed nicely would gotten faster friendlier service perhaps either way speak well service first impression driving location mentioned walking benefit driving much less one friend tried pick nigh impossible get parking rate extraordinary many amazing thing see san francisco frankly original_reviews: nice and cool place to spend time in san francisco near fishermans wharf the staff is very helpful in any situation even if they towed my car be careful and take care for colored marks on the street even if they are washed and look like from 100 years ago the high towing costs for my car peter compensated with a good rebate in the restaurant we highly appreciated this complementary gesture thank you peter
reviews: we were completely blown away by everything at this hotel including our view of alcatraz from out window the staff couldnt have been nicer champagne for my mums birthday and wine and a restaurant voucher after an error during check in the rooms were huge and beautifully decorated as were the common areas the location was very handy for the cable car and all of fishermans wharf

original_reviews: very average hotel nothing extraordinary about it would probably never stay again unless it was discounted 50 off not having any type of breakfast service at all except from the restaurant attached was frustrating
reviews: they had some glitches the day we arrived because their computer system had crashed but otherwise a great pretty hotel right on fishermans wharf in an old brick building retrofitted with all new everything
cleaned_advanced: glitch day arrived computer system crashed otherwise great pretty right fisherman wharf old brick building retrofitted new everything

original_reviews: san fransisco is best experienced at fishermans wharf right next to historic cable cars is the equally historic unique and beautiful argonaut hotel the front desk and concierge are world class with amazing insight to activities and restaurants in the bay area and beyond staff are incredibly sincere and helpful they upgraded my room free of charge gave us free gifts to celebrate our engagement and even assisted in coordinating parts of it i would not stay anywhere else
reviews: i stayed in the argonaut several times last year and most recently beginning of february 2019 san francisco is a difficult place to find good hotels eg if you compare to nyc or european hotels and in regards to the location size of rooms the argonaut is certainly one of the better ones considering the price unfortunately the service is poor although a returning customer the would not recognize me would ask to do all the paper work again and again if you come back to the hotel in the evenings you will find rubbish from roomservice in the halls and it will not change until the morning also security is not up to date located in a very busy tourist location you see many non residents entering the hotel during the day they can go up to the rooms as they is no security on elevators or video surveillance in the halls feels sometimes a bit scary

original_reviews: just stayed for a long weekend getaway and loved this place the location is great the building is beautiful and the staff was excellent everyone there was friendly and helpful sad to see the current state of fishermans wharf with all the closures but still a wonderful place to visit
reviews: beautiful location well designed and well appointed large roomsvery friendly efficient hospitable staffbrilliant base for exploring san franciscogood food and restaurant we hope to return from the uk thank you for helping to make our visit to san francisco so memorable
cleaned_advanced: beautiful location well designed well appointed large roomsvery friendly efficient hospitable staffbrilliant base exploring san franciscogood food restaurant hope return uk thank helping make visit san francisco memorable

original_reviews: the hotel was perfect right next to the cable car and the wharf completely remodeled and clean staff was very friendly and efficient you can walk just about anywhere you need to go valet parking for your car and many restaurants and shops within walking distance we ate at fog harbor fish house and it was great for breakfast we went to caf 8am for breakfast and that was fabulous
reviews: a very contemporary yet nostalgic nauticalstyle hotel in a prime location in fishermans wharf near ghirardelli square the argonaut hotel is in a beautiful red brick building which looks like an old wharf warehouse this was our first stop on our coviddelayed honeymoon and it was a lovely hotel to start it off we were originally meant to be staying around union square but the quieter fishermans wharf location was perfect for us the initial impression was good the open fire in the lobby was inviting for such cool weather and receptionists and bell men were friendly and attentive we were upgraded to a room with 2 double beds the room was very spacious and had a great walkin closet i loved the plantation shutters and exposed beams and brickwork very classic in style the hotel acknowledged our honeymoon with a lovely card and bottle of californian red wine thank you so much we stayed here for 3 nights and it was a great stay the only sour note is that since leaving the hotel on 20th may our 300 incidentals charge still hasnt returned to my credit card it is showing as pending almost 4 weeks later the hotel has informed me that the hold had been lifted at checkout and that it was a likely problem with my bank we stayed at 5 hotels on this usa trip using the same card and this is the only one where weve encountered this problem this otherwise wouldve been a 5star review
cleaned_advanced: contemporary yet nostalgic nauticalstyle prime location fisherman wharf near ghirardelli square argonaut beautiful red brick building look like old wharf warehouse first stop coviddelayed honeymoon lovely start originally meant staying around union square quieter fisherman wharf location perfect u initial impression good open fire lobby inviting cool weather receptionist bell men friendly attentive upgraded double bed spacious great walkin closet loved plantation shutter exposed beam brickwork classic style acknowledged honeymoon lovely card bottle californian red wine thank much stayed night great sour note since leaving th may incidental charge still hasnt returned credit card showing pending almost week later informed hold lifted checkout likely problem bank stayed hotel usa trip using card one weve encountered problem otherwise wouldve star review

original_reviews: i am a fan of the kimpton hotel group and have stayed at other kimptons in sf and across the us i wanted to give the argonaut a try since the rooms looked visually appealing and the reviews were on par with my experiences at other kimptons overall i would actually say that our stay was disappointing for several reasons most on the part of the argonaut the rest on myself disappointing aspects in no specific order the staff i felt it was rather nonexistent aside from the gentlemen working the front door checkin was fine but not overly welcoming this was unusual for a kimpton checkout well even though we stood in line we waited longer since a person just sauntered up to ask questions and the the guest relations representative allowed this to happen my usually experience at a kimpton is you are often greeted warmly throughout your stay and there is a large staff presence in the hotel any other kimpton i have stayed at i would constantly see and be greeted by staff members at all hours of the day this was not the case here the wine hour was packed and seemed to be filled with people who knew about it but were actually not staying at the hotel in fact i often saw people walking away from the hotel with wine glasses this seems like a real liability issue i am not even sure there are people managing the wine hour there was no complimentary or tea or coffee service as you would find at other kimptons in the morning sure there was a coffee maker in the room but in the bathroom and that was uncomfortable at best they probably didnt want to deal with another round of people coming in for the free items logical but not really a kimpton experience the rooms the rooms are visually appealing and spacious but the beds were so hard that we barely slept in hindsight we wish we would have check out and tried another hotel because all of us 3 stayed in one room found we were in pain a week after traveling this is something another guest noted the beds in the double rooms are way too hard i actually prefer a firmer bed but these beds were so hard that one of us actually decided to try sleeping in the arm chair in the room they were that uncomfortable i cant convey how much this impacted our stay and the days after our stay i really felt awful and i am very sorry that i didnt saying anything about it at the time because i paid financially physically and mentally for it cleanliness the room was mostly clean but there were a lot of inconsistencies in the cleaning from day one to day two and three i also found it frustrating that the carpets were not vacuumed daily this seems like basic room service to me i felt there was a disconnect in this area that could be easily managed we left tips daily which were taken but the items we specifically requested more towels floor vacuumed were not provided the restaurant is terrible dont go there are much better places to eat in sf and i highly recommend that you by bypass it at all cost our breakfast was terrible the service was careless and lackadaisical our server actually told us he spaced out while taking our order the food was served cold without any condiments and it was expensive for what you get skip it the location this is my fault i wanted to try something different and get out of downtown but i felt this location was too much on the fringe of everything sure it was within walking distance to many things but they were not things i am that interested in if you want to stay on the wharf note that this is on the fringe of it not the heart of it if you dont want to be in a touristy location with the ding ding ding of the trolley nearby and the hoots and shouts of the duck boats then stay away from this location at all costs it will make you mad while not a big deal the hotel is also fully of families at all hours children were running up and down the halls there are also only two elevators and you often had to wait a short wait not a big deal to get to your room at all hours after thinking about it after the fact i would stay this stay was rather poor if i had to do it all over again i would really consider bringing it up the the management but i checked in on christmas day and i heard them tell someone inquiring about a room that they only had two left i knew it would be fruitless to complain about the beds when there was clearly no comparable room we could be moved to when we left the doorman asked us how our stay was and we mentioned the how terrible the beds were and his response was everyone says that its been a real problem and management is looking into it this actually made everything worse really you know this is a problem but youre just looking into it the really frustrating aspect is that its very hard to find many rooms in the sf area with two queen beds most of the rooms offer only two full beds while this is find for two people its challenging for three adults this was the main reason we selected this hotel because it was important for all of us to be together in the same room during the holidays i wouldnt stay again and i would suggest others look elsewhere when in the area there are many great hotels in sf its perhaps one of the most competitive hotel markets in any city ive traveled to and in dont sell yourself short make sure you select a hotel that really fits what you are looking for in regards to location comfort cleanliness friendliness price and room parameters its possible that this hotel will meet your needs but dont be fooled by all of the positive praise it has received it was just okay
reviews: the argonaut will always have a spot in my heart its not a chain its a friendly local hotel that ahs the vibe of warmth and welcome that i seek i dont want a huge hotel where i am just a number and the argonaut is definitively a quality hotel the location is the best in the wharf staff are awesome food is great and well i always return there
cleaned_advanced: argonaut always spot heart chain friendly local ahs vibe warmth welcome seek dont want huge number argonaut definitively quality location best wharf staff awesome food great well always return

original_reviews: great location if you like the wharf area and we had a suite was very nice lots of room very well decorated and modern lessons learned however when we checked in we had a bay view room had an early check in which was great but there was a street musician playing right outside our room which was loud and we all agree needed to move us hotel did so promptly the problem began that night with the people above us for almost two hour straight there was a continuous thumping or stomping noise i called the front desk and they indicated they would contact them next morning at 730 it began again this went on for two more nights and two mornings i probably called the front desk 6 more times and they continued to apologize and try to get the people to stop i also thought the person above us was checking out sooner lessons learned we probably should have moved the first day secondly i would have liked the hotel to have been more aggressive in some way with the people above and lastly people who are that inconsiderate to other people in hotels should learn that we are all sharing some space here and to be more considerate of others the hotel did offer a small compensation which i really didnt care because it was more important to us to enjoy the very nice suite we had reserved 6 months ago anyway just words of advice if you have issues get them resolved immediately and to what you want
reviews: we stayed in this splendid hotel located in the fishermans wharf area for 3 nights by booking two double rooms and we had a very good time the staff is very professional and kind the red brick building which was historically a delmonte warehouse is truly charming and furnished in a nautical style the excellent location a few minutes walk from pier 39 but in the quietest and most decorous area service impeccable laundry and at normal prices expensive parking 65+tax and valet parking however all the car parks in the area are expensive around 50 a day but where you risk finding your car windows broken by thieves san francisco has become dangerous worth the money they ask for and i would stay here again
cleaned_advanced: stayed splendid located fisherman wharf area night booking two double good time staff professional kind red brick building historically delmonte warehouse truly charming furnished nautical style excellent location minute walk pier quietest decorous area service impeccable laundry normal price expensive parking tax valet parking however car park area expensive around day risk finding car window broken thief san francisco become dangerous worth money ask would

original_reviews: nice big rooms and very comfy beds given its location you get very little noise from the street fishermans wharf is the touristy side of sf theres plenty other places to enjoy to be honest however for the area this is the best in the vicinity
reviews: what a way to celebrate my 50th birthday if you are going to stay in the fishermans wharf area then this hotel is a must we were very warmly greeted and the bedroom was tip top quite luxurious and very comgirtable we opened the blinds and had a perfect view of alcatraz island it couldnt be better the hotel is in a perfect location with cable car into town just round the corner or a nice walk to town as we did a few times the piers and other attractions are close by so never a dull moment no hesitation in recommending
cleaned_advanced: way celebrate th birthday going fisherman wharf area must warmly greeted bedroom tip top quite luxurious comgirtable opened blind perfect view alcatraz island couldnt better perfect location cable car town round corner nice walk town time pier attraction close never dull moment hesitation recommending

original_reviews: this hotel was recommended by our travel agent so we chose it the location is excellent with stunning views of the bay the bridge and alcatraz the staff were welcoming and friendly and we checked in no problem the room was larger than average with a lovely decor and thats all the good no free water in the room 8 for 1l i didnt even look at the prices for the chocolate and spirits the bathroom was quite small and the shower not the best although the toiletries were nice and plentiful there were children in the room next door and we could hear every cry and howl until they dropped off to sleep so the walls seemed paper thin fortunately they checked out the following day so we had quiet nights the rest of our stay on checking in we had had a long day so decided to eat in the adjoining restaurant blue mermaid a nice building a small menu with a special of a turkish starter main course i was told the chef was turkish so was looking forward to my kebab what a disappointment it was awful one thin pitta bread with some tzatziki and a relish and a plain kebab plonked on the bread no salad no chips no side i shouldve taken a photo it just looked like something you find in a toilet im british so very rarely complain but i refused to eat it and sent it back i was offered an alternative but declined we tried breakfast my wife likes her tea in the morning she was offered jasmine earl grey and camomile no breakfast tea no mint the food was ok but with better places within a 5 min walk i wouldnt choose here checkout was midday an extra 100 to keep the room til 1500 after that full room rate no room to freshen up change and with a night flight this was a little disheartening to park your car was 60 but if you planned on using it would cost an extra 10 a lot of places had similar charges not just this hotel would i recommend this hotel 6040 yes but definitely eat out and sort out your own parking nearby
reviews: adorable boutique hotel right in the middle of the action of the wharf trolley pick up right outside so close to the action tourist traps restaurants very close by great mini coffeecroissant breakfast rooms are small but well appointed loved the decor and theme helpful staff
cleaned_advanced: adorable boutique right middle action wharf trolley pick right outside close action tourist trap restaurant close great mini coffeecroissant breakfast small well appointed loved decor theme helpful staff

original_reviews: we had a wonderful experience at the argonaut you could say they went a little overboard with the nautical theme however the furnishings and decor were upscale and they pulled it off the staff was courteous efficient and handled several outoftheordinary issues promptly only one of which was hoteloriented we were given a complimentary upgrade the rooms are spacious and the bedding is extremely comfortable as a matter of fact im getting ready to buy a new mattress and id like to know the brand the argonaut has the lounge area is huge with plenty of seating areas the coziest of which is next to the fireplace the patio is a great place to hang out the heaters and fire providing plenty of warmth on chilly windy days while i hadnt planned on staying in a touristy area we opted for fishermans wharf because we didnt want to rent a car but i have to say for being on the main drag youd never know it once you are inside
reviews: you could not ask for a better location the accommodations are phenomenal and the staff very friendly if youre one who loves the usual big chain hotelsresorts this will not disappoint this is now our new goto when staying in san francisco
cleaned_advanced: could ask better location accommodation phenomenal staff friendly youre one love usual big chain hotelsresorts disappoint new goto staying san francisco

original_reviews: we stayed in the argonaut for 2 nights in june the hotel itself is in a beautiful waterfront location at fishermans wharf with every sort of restaurant you could possibly want within walking distance the room was lovely with a nautical theme and we especially enjoyed the animal print bathrobes in room facilities were above average filter coffee minibar exclusive complimentary toiletries usb charging points in room safe cordless telephone large flat scren tv the list goes on
reviews: friendly staffexcellent large room and facilties restaurant partly closed for renovation but plenty of restaurants nearby well placed for all transportferriestour buses etc and taxis plentiful and reasonably priced approx 4050 dollars to airport would also recommend a visit to ghiradellistwo blocks away a must for chocolate lovers and the restaurant mccormick schmicks overlooking the bay both within short walk from hotel trolley ride with terminus for union square around corner would recommend visit to alcatraz but would suggest prebooking essential due to popularity at least one month ahead to be sure of required date and time

original_reviews: stayed at this hotel on the first leg of our honeymoon and really enjoyed it it was nice and clean when we arrived and we had the end room on the top floor which meant we have a view of golden gate bridge the room layout was slightly narrow but not a deal breaker i found it interesting that they actively welcome pets namely dogs to the hotel by greeting them with the little sign and free dog treats i found out on a tour that the city loves dogs and caters for them in their hotels location was great for easy access to the many eateries on the wharf the only thing i feel that the hotel is missing is a bar area also we had to call down to reception to ask the cleaners to clean our room despite them being near our room from early on
reviews: easy to get to pulled up outside to be told by the door men that we had to pay extra for them to park the car for us we explained that we had pre booked a deal which included the parking they were sceptical to start with but checked with reception whilst the car was unloaded and all was fine the desk staff were great and were very apologetic they sorted our room and made sure we knew where everything was the rooms are long and quite narrow but are perfect they are decorated really well and we immediately felt comfortable the facilities included a sofa fridge desk safe and hair dryer there is wifi included too all the staff were really helpful we walked from here to a wide selection of goodgreat restaurants the ferry to alcatraz and up the steep hill of hyde to lombard street beyond if you are driving i would definitely book the parking package as it is much cheaper and easier can not fault the facilities staff or location will definitely go back when in sf

reviews: this nautical inspired hotel is a wonderful place to be by san franciscos fishermans wharf all the ships details throughout the halls and rooms the steel and the wood beams the sea glass by your room number the nautical beautiful plank floors and seaside concept carpeting the staff is fabulous and very helpful comfy cozy beds great shower and ambiance everywhere do not forget to visit the mermaid the museum right in the hotel the winery tasting room not to be missed lemon water in the lobby for you to enjoy i love the seasalt aroma in the air sit by a cozy fire during the day in a great plush velvet chair with brass nailhead detail and enjoy some delicious wine from next door wonderful hotel incredible service extremely knowledgeable and helpful five star service and atmosphere they even have a wii game in lobby to keep the younger ones occupied interesting concept

original_reviews: beautiful hotel built in a historical building with excellent service close to pier 39 shops and restaurants we had a nice large king room with a street side view of the waterfront and alcatraz the room was beautifully decorated and quiet parking can be hard to find in the area but using their valet parking was great and we just walked from there or used the trolley service
reviews: hotel is great nautical theme tons of history directly across the street is the bay on one side is a very nice park with the start of the cablecar line the people in the hotel did a great job of making us feel athome even though we were strangers when we checked in john with the helmet and danny helped us get in and marilyn behind the desk even helped our family up to our room made sure we were comfortable and even helped us plan our exploring our room overlooked the street and bay so we felt inthemix the room was spacious enough to play around and stash our bags to the side plenty of pics online already not sure if the folks saw we were stressed from the plane ride or what but they made this hotel the place to be

original_reviews: my husband and i stayed at the argonaut for the first time a few weeks ago location perfect buena vista just up the block ghirardelli square one block away beautiful aquatic park across the street view of golden gate bridge located right at the waters edge at fishermans wharf upper west end the restaurant in the argonaut hotel is wonderful food very fresh and excellent service from beginning to end from stepping out of the taxi from the airport being greeted by john who walked us in with our bags he walked us all the way to the front desk to make sure we were taken care of we felt special then we met eddie lopez at the front desk what an incredible worker he is truly committed to his job handling a busy front desk with ease and with such a great customer service attitude we felt so special he made us feel so welcome we stayed for 5 nights every day we checked in with him he would offer suggestions on where to go etc i have never met a more committed and happy worker i highly recommend the argonaut hotel the room was spotless and modern updated the maid service was excellent as well maid staff very friendly and hard working it just seems like all staff really enjoy their position are 100 committed to a great guest experience the location is the best walking distance to cable car right just up the block we cant wait to return
reviews: made a second trip to the argonaut despite reservations of the previous trip didnt like the neighborhood or the crowds but stayed again because 1 the rooms are comfortable and clean 2 it is possible to get connecting rooms for families 3 other kimptons in sf didnt seem better appreciated the acces to public transportation a real plus

original_reviews: we started at 2 hotels during our trip a work event was based at the other hotel if i had the choice i would have stayed at the argonaut the whole time the hotel is in a great spot at the end of fishermans wharf we paid for a bay view room and could see the bay and the golden gate bridge from our room since it is at the end of the wharf its a bit quieter while still being close enough to make everything readily accessible the cable car turntable is right next to the hotel though we didnt realise at first because we didnt hear a sound from it there are also some bicycle rentals just a few doors down id highly recommend grabbing a bike and cycling across the bridge you can get the ferry back to the wharf as for the rooms themselves ours looked very modern and the nautical theme continues throughout the entire hotel we had all the amenities we needed and the staff were all very helpful on leaving we told a member of staff that we were moving over to the grand hyatt for a work event thats a nice hotel very classy he replied in my opinion the argonaut is a much nicer and classier hotel there was not a piece of 70s style wooden panelling in sight and the staff were far more courteous at the argonaut if we come back to sf in future the argonaut will definitely be our first choice
reviews: we had a great stay and a wonderful meal at the on site restaurant the blue mermaid hotel is very clean beds are comfy cannot beat the view from the bay view rooms we could see the golden gate bridge and the cable car turn around staff is friendly the lobby is very welcoming with a large fireplace and games you can borrow fun beer fountain too large rooms especially for san francisco try the crab chowder at the blue mermaid its amazing
cleaned_advanced: great wonderful meal site restaurant blue mermaid clean bed comfy cannot beat view bay view could see golden gate bridge cable car turn around staff friendly lobby welcoming large fireplace game borrow fun beer fountain large especially san francisco try crab chowder blue mermaid amazing

original_reviews: san francisco is a wonderful place to visit hotels in general are expensive so pick wisely so you are not too far away from the main attractions we chose the argonaut a 4 star hotel right on the fishermans wharf this is a perfect position ideal to walk the warf visit local restaurants or go to alcatraz or even jump on a tram we spent five nights at this wonderful hotel there is so much character to this hotel the rooms are of a good size and well furnished and a lovely well price restaurant a nice touch from the hotel was complimentary wine beer or soft drinks for an hour from 5pm another tip is to purchase an onoff bus ticket from the kiosk just along from the hotel negotiate the price definitely recommend this hotel
reviews: nice hotel great location have stayed at the argonaut several timesmy first choice when in san francisco jr at the front was helpful and kind the blue mermaid has great food and service will stay again
cleaned_advanced: nice great location stayed argonaut several timesmy first choice san francisco jr front helpful kind blue mermaid great food service

original_reviews: the argonauts unique looks its bold almost cartoonish maritime theme and easy walker location lured me in for a 2 day solo stay while visiting old friends in sf my stay followed a trip with my husband to wine country so i was still basking in memory of other upscale hotels when i arrived at the argonaut in that light the argonaut selling itself as a luxury hotel at luxury hotel prices was a definite disappointment here is what i did and didnt like about this hotel the good 1 walking location if the crowds drive you mad turn away from fishermans wharf craziness and go left you can take a wonderful walk to the pier up into the marina and as far as you like towards golden gate bridge beautiful 2 fun theming i rather liked the brash decor and im sure it is thrilling for kids visiting with family although that giant boat wheel mirror directly facing the bed was a bit much particularly for a solitary traveler 3 housekeeping hotel and room were very clean when i left requests for certain items a replacement for the broken pen and a robe since one was missing they were delivered and staged nicely the bad 1 price i paid almost 1000 for 2 nights in a room that did not have a luxury setting or approach see below for more details my king deluxe was comfortable but rather shotgun in its narrowness and my only view was of a courtyard where folks drank talked and occasionally howled at the moon really all day and night i have paid far less for much better spaces in similarly desirable locations often a luxury hotel will make up a less than perfect room for you with extra benefits and service but that did not happen here 2 seals minibars and itty bitty bottles of booze show me a luxury hotel where you have to ask for a robe to be delivered how about a room with a small cute madeinchinafor15cents plush seal with argonaut stitched on the side left prominently on the bed and on closer examination with a price tag of 22 the mini bar list said only 14 what a bargain a large minibar that looked like the food concessions at a movie theater minus the helpful glass barrier was just as expensive i couldnt help but wonder how quickly the tab would ring up when a small child entered and grabbed the cute seal giant pack of mms cranberry banana chips etc i didnt have to wonder what an adult would think of the 26 bottles of bad wine i still had a free bottle one of two of good wine our cheaper healdsburg hotel had given us as a courtesy the night before just to be clear ive seen such seals and minibars before at other hotelsmotels but at a true luxury hotel this price point the seal is free to take home to your kid and so are the snacks if not the alcohol management really needs to think this one through set up a snack shack in the lobby if you need too but dont turn my room into a luxury tourista minimart 3 front desk service after exploring muir woods earlier in the day i arrived at checkin in clean jeans a tshirt and black anorak definitely not a street urchin but not direct from tiffanys either the clients in front of me were dressed in business attire and receiving prompt attentive service on my turn the blonde front desk lady looked me over gave me a one minute finger signal and spent 45 minutes answering the phone talking to a coworker and casting glances perhaps to see if the other agent or the totally unoccupied also watching concierge had welcomed andor taken me yet when that failed she handed me over to a new relatively untrained staffer without a further word perhaps if i had been dressed more nicely i would have gotten faster friendlier service or perhaps not either way this does not speak well for service first impressions or the hotel 4 not a driving location i mentioned walking as a benefit driving is much less so when one of my friends tried to pick me up from the hotel it was nigh impossible for her to get there and the parking rates when she did were extraordinary there are so many amazing things to do and see in san francisco frankly this hotel is a much pricer attraction than it is currently worth if you can get a room with a view guarantee maybe it would be better but make sure to tell them to hide the seal and candy bars from your kid first
reviews: me and my partner staying in this hotel in san francisco as part of a trip to america we was amazing with the size of the whole place rooms were massive very happy with the location walking distance to everywhere would recommend this place to anybody has everything in a hotel you are looking for with excellent customer service
cleaned_advanced: partner staying san francisco part trip america amazing size whole place massive happy location walking distance everywhere would recommend place anybody everything looking excellent customer service

original_reviews: we were completely blown away by everything at this hotel including our view of alcatraz from out window the staff couldnt have been nicer champagne for my mums birthday and wine and a restaurant voucher after an error during check in the rooms were huge and beautifully decorated as were the common areas the location was very handy for the cable car and all of fishermans wharf
reviews: firstly i want to thank the reviewers who wrote about argonaut as they were quite spot on the location is perfect its not as noisy as you would expect it to be as it is further up north from pier39 and most of the hustle and bustle of fishermans wharf make sure you dont miss the powell hyde turnaround right by the side before you reach ghiradelli square the maritime national historical park is a great place to walk about make sure you visit the maritime museum and the hyde street pier i was a little bit disappointed not all the exhibit areas of the museum was open i think it was maintenance work walk out on the municipal pier for a view of the sf golden gate bridge as for the hotel the staff are very friendly and very helpful we had to pay extra 50bucks to check in earlier than 3pm but we were upgraded to a bigger room so no complaints there the bathtub faucet diverter was really tight and difficult to use but the service was excellent the guy came almost immediately after we reported it note that because of the pandemic you do need to inform them if you want the room serviced otherwise you can ask for fresh towels and more coffee any time bring your own tea satchets though if you want a cuppa we tried asking but they didnt supply that if you have kids just be aware the cute soft toy on the bed is not a freebie the rooms are clean check out the mini museum just straight on from the reception its so cool to be in an historical building the nautical theme interior design is in line with the location maritime national historical park and when you head out for the day the staff was so kind they offered us bottled water if you need them back to location its close to the muni f line if the cable car proves a tad pricey with the muni mobile app you can buy a day pass for the cable car and ride them all for the experience its fun otherwise walking around this area is delightful

original_reviews: they had some glitches the day we arrived because their computer system had crashed but otherwise a great pretty hotel right on fishermans wharf in an old brick building retrofitted with all new everything
reviews: this beautiful historic gem in the heart of fishermans wharf easy access to ghirardelli square the wharf shopping just across the street alcatraz tours trolley station bicycle rentals and the golden gate bridge you can get everywhere from here the hotel is located as part of a restored cannery and keeps all the best features exposed brick walls massive beams and doors but adds all the modern amenities while we had miraculously good weather on our early february visit we still had moments where we appreciated the lobby fireplace we dined at the blue mermaid al fresco to the soft sounds of very talented street musicians first a saxophonist followed by a bluesy jazzy vocalist the quintessential chowder in a bread bowl was perfect the wine a perfect accompaniment after a long travel day from the east coast and the service was attentive this was truly a sublime vacation for us we saw new things in san francisco that we had not seen before always a possibility in san francisco we played hard and were so grateful for our gorgeous and comfortable room to return to

original_reviews: i stayed in the argonaut several times last year and most recently beginning of february 2019 san francisco is a difficult place to find good hotels eg if you compare to nyc or european hotels and in regards to the location size of rooms the argonaut is certainly one of the better ones considering the price unfortunately the service is poor although a returning customer the would not recognize me would ask to do all the paper work again and again if you come back to the hotel in the evenings you will find rubbish from roomservice in the halls and it will not change until the morning also security is not up to date located in a very busy tourist location you see many non residents entering the hotel during the day they can go up to the rooms as they is no security on elevators or video surveillance in the halls feels sometimes a bit scary
reviews: i would give this hotel three and a half stars but i am giving them 4 for the benefit of the doubt it is simply too expensive for what you get we booked two connecting rooms one a suite and the other to my recollection i was told a suite facing the water that is why we selected this hotel when we arrived the record showed differently and both of our suite and room were facing the street the building is old and the windows small although i know the management can do little about that another big surprise upon arrival was that the concierge worked remotely most of the time that was our first visit to san francisco and although the concierge responded to our calls quickly it would have been easier if she was live sometimes only one person was at the front and we could not ask lengthy questions and have others waiting in line behind us several positive things about this hotel one main item is the excellent location it is close to all the tourist areas they had a very nice staff and they tried to be helpful the surroundings were very quiet even though we were very close to all the action the beds were very comfortable they had a very nice restaurant attached to the hotel
