original_reviews: beautiful location well designed and well appointed large roomsvery friendly efficient hospitable staffbrilliant base for exploring san franciscogood food and restaurant we hope to return from the uk thank you for helping to make our visit to san francisco so memorable
reviews: the location is dynamite right by the water and next to ghirardelli the staff is so friendly and anticipates your needs the rooms are very clean and we had a stunning view of alcatraz i highly recommend and will definitely be back
cleaned_advanced: location dynamite right water next ghirardelli staff friendly anticipates need clean stunning view alcatraz highly recommend definitely back

original_reviews: a very contemporary yet nostalgic nauticalstyle hotel in a prime location in fishermans wharf near ghirardelli square the argonaut hotel is in a beautiful red brick building which looks like an old wharf warehouse this was our first stop on our coviddelayed honeymoon and it was a lovely hotel to start it off we were originally meant to be staying around union square but the quieter fishermans wharf location was perfect for us the initial impression was good the open fire in the lobby was inviting for such cool weather and receptionists and bell men were friendly and attentive we were upgraded to a room with 2 double beds the room was very spacious and had a great walkin closet i loved the plantation shutters and exposed beams and brickwork very classic in style the hotel acknowledged our honeymoon with a lovely card and bottle of californian red wine thank you so much we stayed here for 3 nights and it was a great stay the only sour note is that since leaving the hotel on 20th may our 300 incidentals charge still hasnt returned to my credit card it is showing as pending almost 4 weeks later the hotel has informed me that the hold had been lifted at checkout and that it was a likely problem with my bank we stayed at 5 hotels on this usa trip using the same card and this is the only one where weve encountered this problem this otherwise wouldve been a 5star review
reviews: first of all the location was more than we hoped for hotel is located 15 min walk from the pier 39 and 3 min walk from both cable car turnaround and ghirardelli square there are plenty of restaurants and pubs near the hotel so it was good to relax and enjoy at the same time the hotel also allowed us to keep our luggage 4 days prior to check in which made our road trip easier the room is well furnished and i loved the bay view it could be a bit noisy during the weekend afternoon but i thoguht that was also the part of the touristy atmosphere
cleaned_advanced: first location hoped located min walk pier min walk cable car turnaround ghirardelli square plenty restaurant pub near good relax enjoy time also allowed u keep luggage day prior check made road trip easier well furnished loved bay view could bit noisy weekend afternoon thoguht also part touristy atmosphere

original_reviews: the argonaut will always have a spot in my heart its not a chain its a friendly local hotel that ahs the vibe of warmth and welcome that i seek i dont want a huge hotel where i am just a number and the argonaut is definitively a quality hotel the location is the best in the wharf staff are awesome food is great and well i always return there
reviews: we were right around the corner from the trolley turnaround stop ghirardelli and the golden gate park great view of alcatraz and bridge room was beautiful bed were beyond comfortable and we even had robes dont bother to bring soap because they provide the best smelling soap and shampoo mini bar was a hit with kids a little pricy but so is everything else in san fran we did not eat there we decided to eat where the locals go first night we stay at a cheaper hotel what a mistake that was dont over think you wont regret staying at the arganout
cleaned_advanced: right around corner trolley turnaround stop ghirardelli golden gate park great view alcatraz bridge beautiful bed beyond comfortable even robe dont bother bring soap provide best smelling soap shampoo mini bar hit kid little pricy everything else san fran eat decided eat local go first night cheaper mistake dont think wont regret staying arganout

original_reviews: we stayed in this splendid hotel located in the fishermans wharf area for 3 nights by booking two double rooms and we had a very good time the staff is very professional and kind the red brick building which was historically a delmonte warehouse is truly charming and furnished in a nautical style the excellent location a few minutes walk from pier 39 but in the quietest and most decorous area service impeccable laundry and at normal prices expensive parking 65+tax and valet parking however all the car parks in the area are expensive around 50 a day but where you risk finding your car windows broken by thieves san francisco has become dangerous worth the money they ask for and i would stay here again
reviews: this hotel always pops up on travel sights when searching san francisco while its not a fivestar destination its a very nice property the rooms are clean and very comfortable great beds we had a room without a view basically an internal alley facing other rooms but who stays in their room in san francisco there are countless restaurants and attractions in walking distance it is right next to the cable car turnstile making it very convenient to get to chinatown or just go for a ride after stays in the business district as well as union square i find this area nice and i surprisingly dont have a sense of tourist overload i will absolutely stay here again
cleaned_advanced: always pop travel sight searching san francisco fivestar destination nice property clean comfortable great bed without view basically internal alley facing stay san francisco countless restaurant attraction walking distance right next cable car turnstile making convenient get chinatown go ride stay business district well union square find area nice surprisingly dont sense tourist overload absolutely

original_reviews: what a way to celebrate my 50th birthday if you are going to stay in the fishermans wharf area then this hotel is a must we were very warmly greeted and the bedroom was tip top quite luxurious and very comgirtable we opened the blinds and had a perfect view of alcatraz island it couldnt be better the hotel is in a perfect location with cable car into town just round the corner or a nice walk to town as we did a few times the piers and other attractions are close by so never a dull moment no hesitation in recommending
reviews: pretty disappointing stay particularly because the was almost empty due to fears over the coronavirus when we arrived we were assigned by a disinterested employee arguably the worst room in the hotel second floor interior dark view of roofing etc after specifically requesting an upper floor and bay view my guess is that the room assignment may have been because we were able to secure an excellent rate due to march visit and low occupancy not sure why our request was completely ignored television was glitchy turning off at will and when we request a late checkout we were told check out is noon no exceptions regardless of occupancy etc have stayed at this property in the past and enjoyed it very much as its location is perfect for exploring the fishermans wharf area access to cable cars ghirardelli square etc not this time particularly at this price point even with a great deal we still paid 25000 per night we had a choice between the fairmont and the argonaut hotel both at the same price point at this point in time we made a mistake its not the cool class hotel weve frequented in the past very dissatisfied and disappointing

original_reviews: adorable boutique hotel right in the middle of the action of the wharf trolley pick up right outside so close to the action tourist traps restaurants very close by great mini coffeecroissant breakfast rooms are small but well appointed loved the decor and theme helpful staff
reviews: my husband and i are from the east coast and spent 3 nights at the argonaut hotel this hotel was fabulous the standard room is very spacious and the nautical decor is ideal for its fishermans wharf setting the bed was extremely comfortable the location is absolutely perfect you have access to everything from that location including the powell hyde street cable car trolleys lombard street ghirardelli square alcatraz and amazing restaurants the concierge desk staff were extremely helpful in planning our trips so we got the most out of the area in the short time we were there take advantage of the complimentary bikes and ride over the golden gate bridge book this hotel you wont be disappointed
cleaned_advanced: husband east coast spent night argonaut fabulous standard spacious nautical decor ideal fisherman wharf setting bed extremely comfortable location absolutely perfect access everything location including powell hyde street cable car trolley lombard street ghirardelli square alcatraz amazing restaurant concierge desk staff extremely helpful planning trip got area short time take advantage complimentary bike ride golden gate bridge book wont disappointed

original_reviews: you could not ask for a better location the accommodations are phenomenal and the staff very friendly if youre one who loves the usual big chain hotelsresorts this will not disappoint this is now our new goto when staying in san francisco
reviews: jo d than you so much for the raving review the argonaut is definitely the ultimate destination as we are located on the waterfront in the heart of all local attractions the cable car turn is next to the hotel ghirardelli square is a block away lombard street is two blocks away both the aquatic park and hyde street pier is across the street and pier 39 is just steps away please come see us again when your in san francisco best wishes keith hotel operations manger
cleaned_advanced: jo much raving review argonaut definitely ultimate destination located waterfront heart local attraction cable car turn next ghirardelli square block away lombard street two block away aquatic park hyde street pier across street pier step away please come see u san francisco best wish keith operation manger

original_reviews: friendly staffexcellent large room and facilties restaurant partly closed for renovation but plenty of restaurants nearby well placed for all transportferriestour buses etc and taxis plentiful and reasonably priced approx 4050 dollars to airport would also recommend a visit to ghiradellistwo blocks away a must for chocolate lovers and the restaurant mccormick schmicks overlooking the bay both within short walk from hotel trolley ride with terminus for union square around corner would recommend visit to alcatraz but would suggest prebooking essential due to popularity at least one month ahead to be sure of required date and time
reviews: the argonaut hotel is in the historic cannery in san francisco the rooms are very nice but try to get a room facing out if possible the hotels blue mermaid restaurant is excellent the hotel is close to all the restaurants and attractions on fishermans wharf it is a bit pricey but it is a great hotel in a great location
cleaned_advanced: argonaut historic cannery san francisco nice try get facing possible hotel blue mermaid restaurant excellent close restaurant attraction fisherman wharf bit pricey great great location

original_reviews: easy to get to pulled up outside to be told by the door men that we had to pay extra for them to park the car for us we explained that we had pre booked a deal which included the parking they were sceptical to start with but checked with reception whilst the car was unloaded and all was fine the desk staff were great and were very apologetic they sorted our room and made sure we knew where everything was the rooms are long and quite narrow but are perfect they are decorated really well and we immediately felt comfortable the facilities included a sofa fridge desk safe and hair dryer there is wifi included too all the staff were really helpful we walked from here to a wide selection of goodgreat restaurants the ferry to alcatraz and up the steep hill of hyde to lombard street beyond if you are driving i would definitely book the parking package as it is much cheaper and easier can not fault the facilities staff or location will definitely go back when in sf
reviews: the argonaut was awesome to say the least right on fishermans wharf there was always something to do our room had a bay view and also the girardelli sign the room was always clean and had a lot of character
cleaned_advanced: argonaut awesome say least right fisherman wharf always something bay view also girardelli sign always clean lot character

original_reviews: amazing view and great cleaning staff customer service from the front was less than great and didnt seem like management really care about discrepancies however the view the rooms and location were all absolutely amazing
reviews: we booked this room for two days prior to a cruise the location was fantastic close to fishermans wharf but far enough from the craziness of that area we dined at the restaurant several times and were impressed with the quality of the food and the friendly waitstaff everyone in the hotel was friendly helpful without being in your face and very knowledgeable about the area we would stay there again in a heartbeat
cleaned_advanced: booked two day prior cruise location fantastic close fisherman wharf far enough craziness area dined restaurant several time impressed quality food friendly waitstaff everyone friendly helpful without face knowledgeable area would heartbeat

original_reviews: this nautical inspired hotel is a wonderful place to be by san franciscos fishermans wharf all the ships details throughout the halls and rooms the steel and the wood beams the sea glass by your room number the nautical beautiful plank floors and seaside concept carpeting the staff is fabulous and very helpful comfy cozy beds great shower and ambiance everywhere do not forget to visit the mermaid the museum right in the hotel the winery tasting room not to be missed lemon water in the lobby for you to enjoy i love the seasalt aroma in the air sit by a cozy fire during the day in a great plush velvet chair with brass nailhead detail and enjoy some delicious wine from next door wonderful hotel incredible service extremely knowledgeable and helpful five star service and atmosphere they even have a wii game in lobby to keep the younger ones occupied interesting concept
reviews: rooms kind of small i called and told them it was our anniversary and they offered to upgrade to bay view when we checked in was given non view room called office and was told no notification so no upgradenice place but rooms are small and there is zero view from the non view rooms except a wall overall nice stay
cleaned_advanced: kind small called told anniversary offered upgrade bay view checked given non view called office told notification upgradenice place small zero view non view except wall overall nice

original_reviews: after a whirlwind weekend on the west coast in sonoma with some good friends we needed a place to relax and recover before heading back east the argonaut hotel provided just what we needed a clean and quiet room and a place to store our bags the next day while we explored the city before hopping on the red eye to boston all the staff members were very welcoming and accommodating and the location was great for being tourists for the day
reviews: my wife and i stayed here for the first 3 nights of our us road trip the argonaut was 50 in a cab and about 45mins from the airport in evening rush hour traffic we upgraded to a suite on the top floor room 411 which had a side view over the bay and was incredibly spacious with a big bed and roomy shower just what we needed after a long flight the breakfast at the blue mermaid next door was decent but we found more choice and better value at joanies and black pojnt nearby the hotel was well situated for exploring fishermans wharf including the vibrant pier 39 and getting to the alcatraz ferry at pier 33 many great eating options nearby and next door to the cable car which is a great option for getting up the hills and into the city only 6 very easy to get to the gg bridge from here too would definitely recommend staying here over some of more well known but pricier hotels in the city value parking at 50 plus tax per night was steep but perhaps typical of sf
cleaned_advanced: wife stayed first night u road trip argonaut cab min airport evening rush hour traffic upgraded suite top floor side view bay incredibly spacious big bed roomy shower needed long flight breakfast blue mermaid next door decent found choice better value joanies black pojnt nearby well situated exploring fisherman wharf including vibrant pier getting alcatraz ferry pier many great eating option nearby next door cable car great option getting hill city easy get gg bridge would definitely recommend staying well known pricier hotel city value parking plus tax per night steep perhaps typical sf

original_reviews: hotel is great nautical theme tons of history directly across the street is the bay on one side is a very nice park with the start of the cablecar line the people in the hotel did a great job of making us feel athome even though we were strangers when we checked in john with the helmet and danny helped us get in and marilyn behind the desk even helped our family up to our room made sure we were comfortable and even helped us plan our exploring our room overlooked the street and bay so we felt inthemix the room was spacious enough to play around and stash our bags to the side plenty of pics online already not sure if the folks saw we were stressed from the plane ride or what but they made this hotel the place to be
reviews: great location for a first time trip as you are right by fishermans wharf lots of restaurants and places to eat blue mermaid restaurant next door which does great chowder cycle hire icecream shop a few doors away starbucks behind hotel if you like chocolate the hotel is just across from ghirardelli square with its restaurants and chocolateice cream parlour is just a 5 minutes walk across and being hotel the hotel in also right by the beach so you can do some nice walks we walked all the way to golden gate bridge and back which took about 2 and half hours but you can cycle it quicker powell and hyde tram stop is just next door to the hotel although it does get busy at peak times i am in two minds about the hotel itself its very stylish and boutique but just did not have the wow factor which for the price was disappointing felt a bit to business like
cleaned_advanced: great location first time trip right fisherman wharf lot restaurant place eat blue mermaid restaurant next door great chowder cycle hire icecream shop door away starbucks behind like chocolate across ghirardelli square restaurant chocolateice cream parlour minute walk across also right beach nice walk walked way golden gate bridge back took half hour cycle quicker powell hyde tram stop next door although get busy peak time two mind stylish boutique wow factor price disappointing felt bit business like

original_reviews: made a second trip to the argonaut despite reservations of the previous trip didnt like the neighborhood or the crowds but stayed again because 1 the rooms are comfortable and clean 2 it is possible to get connecting rooms for families 3 other kimptons in sf didnt seem better appreciated the acces to public transportation a real plus
reviews: i have really mixed feelings about this hotel parts i absolutely love and somethings just want to make you go arrghhh we loved its location its right opposite a trolley stop and a short walk to fishermans walk and all the main attractions the room was lovely spacious and spotlessly cleanoverlooked the golden gate bridgeso whats not to love we arrived at 1am in the morning struggling with three large cases after a 16 hr flight the security guard just said hi no offer of help night receptionist was lovely and very polite we got a really great room however the noise from the air conditioning was just so loudso we switched it offstill really loud noise also came from the fridge switching on and off very loud spoke to the lovely reception staff in the morning who said oh its probably because the air conditioning equipment is on the roof but we will check it came back a few hours later it has been reported fixed at 110pm nothing had changed at all for 4 days it just made a loud noise on several days i asked if the concierge was available to be told oh we do not have one today one arrived on our check out day we were really looking forward to dining in the restaurant having read the reviewsthe food was lovelythe staff were really poor and it was the worst service we received in our whole stay in the usa after dinner we went to the lovely hotel lounge and i asked at reception where the bar was to get a nightcap by the lovely fireplace oh the only bar is in the restaurant and it closes at 9pmif you go outside of the hotel turn left and there is a bar up the street we have never stayed in a hotel with a bar that closes at 9pm leaving was a little like arriving reception staff lovely really helpfultwo members of staff on the door let me struggle with three large bags offering no help at all so overall if you want a funky hotel close to the wharf and if you are prepared to put up with noisy rooftop air conditioning have no bar after 9pm and some really helpful staff and some really unhelpful staff its for you personally we would think twice as the little bits which would have made the stay magical were just missing i am afraid which is sad to saybut eh it might just me me

original_reviews: this was a great location you can walk to everything and the trolley car is right next to the hotel we had two rooms and they both were beautifully decorated and very comfortable we wish the museum inside the hotel had longer hours we never had a chance to visit it we traveled with a bus tour the only disappointment was the breakfast it was not a very good buffet
reviews: we stayed here on our family vacation to ca in june and it was top notch all the way around of all the properties we visited while in ca expensive national park properties included the argonaut hotel was our absolute favorite their attention to detail both in cleaning and in decorhotel furnishings is remarkable the property is located at a terrific spot along the pier area and is walking distance to all the major tourist spots there is also a parking garage just behind the hotel that is super convenient if you have a vehicle the staff was extremely hospitable and i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to san francisco

original_reviews: this is more than a place to lay your head it is a destination the bay view rooms are beautifully charming and the location is perfect i highly recommend this hotel for couples or families kids ben jerrys right next door
reviews: the argonaut is well positioned at the end of the strip about 15 minutes walk from pier 39 and with views over the golden gate bridge its an old converted warehouse so the rooms retain some industrialnautical fittings they are spacious and well appointed there are plenty of restaurants close by to stagger back from and a beach to sit and watch the sunset san francisco is worth a visit and the argonaut is a comfortable clean and handy hotel to explore it from we recommend a tour by extranomical tours and ask for guide tony he brought a personal touch to site seeing the city

original_reviews: i would book again at the argonaut ditto the noble house chain staff there very helpful pleasantsan francisco very expensive and depressing lots of younger homeless obviously on drugsvery sad ca is no longer the land of milk honey
reviews: loved the argonaut staff were friendly rooms comfortablerestaurant was excellent we really liked the decorthe mix of old and new the location was ideal i would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends

original_reviews: we had a great stay and a wonderful meal at the on site restaurant the blue mermaid hotel is very clean beds are comfy cannot beat the view from the bay view rooms we could see the golden gate bridge and the cable car turn around staff is friendly the lobby is very welcoming with a large fireplace and games you can borrow fun beer fountain too large rooms especially for san francisco try the crab chowder at the blue mermaid its amazing
reviews: we spent three nights at the argonaut while sightseeing around the city the staff was professional friendly and very helpful in planning tours during our stay we were in town for fleet week and it was the perfect location for seeing the fantastic airshow highly recommend this hotel a long weekend stay in sf
cleaned_advanced: spent three night argonaut sightseeing around city staff professional friendly helpful planning tour town fleet week perfect location seeing fantastic airshow highly recommend long weekend sf

original_reviews: nice hotel great location have stayed at the argonaut several timesmy first choice when in san francisco jr at the front was helpful and kind the blue mermaid has great food and service will stay again
reviews: we decided to stay at the argonaut for the start of our trip to the states the hotel concierge was great and helpful and the check in was fast and good we didnt have a car but parking is very expensive the whole of san francisco is expensive in every way so the hotel was no exception great location to visit the wharf and plenty of places to eat and busestrams to catch would thoroughly recommend the hotel
cleaned_advanced: decided argonaut start trip state concierge great helpful check fast good didnt car parking expensive whole san francisco expensive every way exception great location visit wharf plenty place eat busestrams catch would thoroughly recommend

original_reviews: me and my partner staying in this hotel in san francisco as part of a trip to america we was amazing with the size of the whole place rooms were massive very happy with the location walking distance to everywhere would recommend this place to anybody has everything in a hotel you are looking for with excellent customer service
reviews: on arriving at the hotel it was exactly what was expected we had read up visited the site seeing in person was so much better room was lovely and so boutique we honestly couldnt have asked for a better room even the view we opened the blinds to see the golden gate bridge honestly this is an amazing hotel however dont get taken in by the free breakfast offers they arent worth it 4 pieces of toast 2 slices of bread and not enough jam and the service is absolutely terrible from waiting at the door for 5 minutes to not being served or forgotten about fortunately plenty of other places to eat
cleaned_advanced: arriving exactly expected read visited site seeing person much better lovely boutique honestly couldnt asked better even view opened blind see golden gate bridge honestly amazing however dont get taken free breakfast offer arent worth piece toast slice bread enough jam service absolutely terrible waiting door minute served forgotten fortunately plenty place eat

original_reviews: firstly i want to thank the reviewers who wrote about argonaut as they were quite spot on the location is perfect its not as noisy as you would expect it to be as it is further up north from pier39 and most of the hustle and bustle of fishermans wharf make sure you dont miss the powell hyde turnaround right by the side before you reach ghiradelli square the maritime national historical park is a great place to walk about make sure you visit the maritime museum and the hyde street pier i was a little bit disappointed not all the exhibit areas of the museum was open i think it was maintenance work walk out on the municipal pier for a view of the sf golden gate bridge as for the hotel the staff are very friendly and very helpful we had to pay extra 50bucks to check in earlier than 3pm but we were upgraded to a bigger room so no complaints there the bathtub faucet diverter was really tight and difficult to use but the service was excellent the guy came almost immediately after we reported it note that because of the pandemic you do need to inform them if you want the room serviced otherwise you can ask for fresh towels and more coffee any time bring your own tea satchets though if you want a cuppa we tried asking but they didnt supply that if you have kids just be aware the cute soft toy on the bed is not a freebie the rooms are clean check out the mini museum just straight on from the reception its so cool to be in an historical building the nautical theme interior design is in line with the location maritime national historical park and when you head out for the day the staff was so kind they offered us bottled water if you need them back to location its close to the muni f line if the cable car proves a tad pricey with the muni mobile app you can buy a day pass for the cable car and ride them all for the experience its fun otherwise walking around this area is delightful
reviews: an absolutely well led and beautiful hotel with an extraordinary good breakfast restaurant the barista and his capuccino just a blast friendly staff allover the closeness to pier 41 and 39 and specially to the turning point of the cable car makes the hotel an ideal one to explore and enjoy san francisco we will come back
cleaned_advanced: absolutely well led beautiful extraordinary good breakfast restaurant barista capuccino blast friendly staff allover closeness pier specially turning point cable car make ideal one explore enjoy san francisco come back

original_reviews: this beautiful historic gem in the heart of fishermans wharf easy access to ghirardelli square the wharf shopping just across the street alcatraz tours trolley station bicycle rentals and the golden gate bridge you can get everywhere from here the hotel is located as part of a restored cannery and keeps all the best features exposed brick walls massive beams and doors but adds all the modern amenities while we had miraculously good weather on our early february visit we still had moments where we appreciated the lobby fireplace we dined at the blue mermaid al fresco to the soft sounds of very talented street musicians first a saxophonist followed by a bluesy jazzy vocalist the quintessential chowder in a bread bowl was perfect the wine a perfect accompaniment after a long travel day from the east coast and the service was attentive this was truly a sublime vacation for us we saw new things in san francisco that we had not seen before always a possibility in san francisco we played hard and were so grateful for our gorgeous and comfortable room to return to
reviews: rooms good restaurant prices mid range beds very comfy rooms super spacious very handy for fishermans wharf area wifi not the best but workable discount vouchers for food and beverage offered on arrival make eating in hotel very competitive would go back
cleaned_advanced: good restaurant price mid range bed comfy super spacious handy fisherman wharf area wifi best workable discount voucher food beverage offered arrival make eating competitive would go back

original_reviews: i would give this hotel three and a half stars but i am giving them 4 for the benefit of the doubt it is simply too expensive for what you get we booked two connecting rooms one a suite and the other to my recollection i was told a suite facing the water that is why we selected this hotel when we arrived the record showed differently and both of our suite and room were facing the street the building is old and the windows small although i know the management can do little about that another big surprise upon arrival was that the concierge worked remotely most of the time that was our first visit to san francisco and although the concierge responded to our calls quickly it would have been easier if she was live sometimes only one person was at the front and we could not ask lengthy questions and have others waiting in line behind us several positive things about this hotel one main item is the excellent location it is close to all the tourist areas they had a very nice staff and they tried to be helpful the surroundings were very quiet even though we were very close to all the action the beds were very comfortable they had a very nice restaurant attached to the hotel
reviews: we took our 2 boys to san francisco for spring break and stayed here for 5 nights first of all the location could not be better we had a view of the golden gate bridge from our window and a view of the cable cars getting ready for the day everything you want to do is walking distance or a short uber ride in the lobby there is a maritime museum run by the national parks service that is really well done and my boys earned a park service badge there is also a beach across the street that we could walk on if you are doing a family trip to san francisco this is the place food was excellent at the blue mermaid too
cleaned_advanced: took boy san francisco spring break stayed night first location could better view golden gate bridge window view cable car getting ready day everything want walking distance short uber ride lobby maritime museum run national park service really well done boy earned park service badge also beach across street could walk family trip san francisco place food excellent blue mermaid

original_reviews: the location is dynamite right by the water and next to ghirardelli the staff is so friendly and anticipates your needs the rooms are very clean and we had a stunning view of alcatraz i highly recommend and will definitely be back
reviews: we really enjoyed our stay at the argonaut hotel perfectly located near all the sites we wanted to enjoy while in san francisco we had an interior room with no view but the comfort of the room and bed made up for it its decorated super cute blue mermaid attached to the hotel was yummy love the bread bowl corn and crab chowder would definitely stay here again
cleaned_advanced: really enjoyed argonaut perfectly located near site wanted enjoy san francisco interior view comfort bed made decorated super cute blue mermaid attached yummy love bread bowl corn crab chowder would definitely

original_reviews: first of all the location was more than we hoped for hotel is located 15 min walk from the pier 39 and 3 min walk from both cable car turnaround and ghirardelli square there are plenty of restaurants and pubs near the hotel so it was good to relax and enjoy at the same time the hotel also allowed us to keep our luggage 4 days prior to check in which made our road trip easier the room is well furnished and i loved the bay view it could be a bit noisy during the weekend afternoon but i thoguht that was also the part of the touristy atmosphere
reviews: i was aware of the daily 25 resort fee but please tell me how the word resort applies upon arrival at our floor there were 2 trays of half eaten meals on the floor and 2 additional empty cocktail glasses at the foot of my room and there they remained for the next 2 days getting a single additional bar of soap proved quite the challenge with your staffregardless of asking no extra soap bar to be found in our bathroom and so we remained one little square of soap for my wife and i for our 6 night stayby day 3 i bought my own i enjoy music as much as anyone but i dont care to hear that disco beat pounding through the lobby and on the elevators at 56 am why 5am because thats the time i left my room every morning to walk to a local starbucks to get coffee 10 for your pot of 2 small cups did i mention the 25 daily resort fee oh that must mean the restaurant area deck chairs against the back wall adjacent to the restrooms shower curtains must be expensive to replace as evidenced by the mold along the bottom of mine there is some good to be said excellent locationyour desk staff is quite nice and friendlyyour blue mermaid restaurant staff were extremely pleasant and attentive and i was more than happy to leave them generous tips its the little thingsget your stuff together

original_reviews: we were right around the corner from the trolley turnaround stop ghirardelli and the golden gate park great view of alcatraz and bridge room was beautiful bed were beyond comfortable and we even had robes dont bother to bring soap because they provide the best smelling soap and shampoo mini bar was a hit with kids a little pricy but so is everything else in san fran we did not eat there we decided to eat where the locals go first night we stay at a cheaper hotel what a mistake that was dont over think you wont regret staying at the arganout
reviews: this hotel in in a great place very close to everything pier 39 the golden gate bridge and alcatraz the rooms had enough space and so was the bathroom nice lounge area just off the foyer which had a fire there and water staff couldnt be more helpful value for money for sure
cleaned_advanced: great place close everything pier golden gate bridge alcatraz enough space bathroom nice lounge area foyer fire water staff couldnt helpful value money sure

original_reviews: this hotel always pops up on travel sights when searching san francisco while its not a fivestar destination its a very nice property the rooms are clean and very comfortable great beds we had a room without a view basically an internal alley facing other rooms but who stays in their room in san francisco there are countless restaurants and attractions in walking distance it is right next to the cable car turnstile making it very convenient to get to chinatown or just go for a ride after stays in the business district as well as union square i find this area nice and i surprisingly dont have a sense of tourist overload i will absolutely stay here again
reviews: best place to be if you want sf bay front lots to visit do this historical hotel it self is beautiful clean rooms beautifully decorated hotel staff very friendly hospitality cable cars 1 block tour buses 2 blocks highly recommend pier 39 10 minute walk view of golden state bridge ghirardelli chocolate factory 5 minute walk and the famous irish coffee at the buena vista cafe one block walk lots of restaurants shops parks we had our car valet which was a little pricy but our car was safe brought to us when needed it one time this historical hotel is a safe place for walking around nite time too
cleaned_advanced: best place want sf bay front lot visit historical self beautiful clean beautifully decorated staff friendly hospitality cable car block tour bus block highly recommend pier minute walk view golden state bridge ghirardelli chocolate factory minute walk famous irish coffee buena vista cafe one block walk lot restaurant shop park car valet little pricy car safe brought u needed one time historical safe place walking around nite time

original_reviews: pretty disappointing stay particularly because the was almost empty due to fears over the coronavirus when we arrived we were assigned by a disinterested employee arguably the worst room in the hotel second floor interior dark view of roofing etc after specifically requesting an upper floor and bay view my guess is that the room assignment may have been because we were able to secure an excellent rate due to march visit and low occupancy not sure why our request was completely ignored television was glitchy turning off at will and when we request a late checkout we were told check out is noon no exceptions regardless of occupancy etc have stayed at this property in the past and enjoyed it very much as its location is perfect for exploring the fishermans wharf area access to cable cars ghirardelli square etc not this time particularly at this price point even with a great deal we still paid 25000 per night we had a choice between the fairmont and the argonaut hotel both at the same price point at this point in time we made a mistake its not the cool class hotel weve frequented in the past very dissatisfied and disappointing
reviews: lovely hotel with no surprises compared to their website friendly staff all round and comfortable rustic rooms close to all the good stuff our only complaint was that the rooms did suffer quite a bit from external noise cars party goers etc but all part of the atmosphere of the area i guess
cleaned_advanced: lovely surprise compared website friendly staff round comfortable rustic close good stuff complaint suffer quite bit external noise car party goer etc part atmosphere area guess

original_reviews: my husband and i are from the east coast and spent 3 nights at the argonaut hotel this hotel was fabulous the standard room is very spacious and the nautical decor is ideal for its fishermans wharf setting the bed was extremely comfortable the location is absolutely perfect you have access to everything from that location including the powell hyde street cable car trolleys lombard street ghirardelli square alcatraz and amazing restaurants the concierge desk staff were extremely helpful in planning our trips so we got the most out of the area in the short time we were there take advantage of the complimentary bikes and ride over the golden gate bridge book this hotel you wont be disappointed
reviews: we had an incredible stay here the front desk staff was beyond helpful and generous and the lobby is really fun and unique we loved our room we loved the ammenities and we loved the location the wharf is very touristy and busy but it has a charm to it and you can walk to tons of restaurants and bars our 4 year old had a blast and the hotel took great care to make sure he was taken care of we will definitely be coming back
cleaned_advanced: incredible front desk staff beyond helpful generous lobby really fun unique loved loved ammenities loved location wharf touristy busy charm walk ton restaurant bar year old blast took great care make sure taken care definitely coming back

original_reviews: jo d than you so much for the raving review the argonaut is definitely the ultimate destination as we are located on the waterfront in the heart of all local attractions the cable car turn is next to the hotel ghirardelli square is a block away lombard street is two blocks away both the aquatic park and hyde street pier is across the street and pier 39 is just steps away please come see us again when your in san francisco best wishes keith hotel operations manger
reviews: we stayed at this hotel in san francisco from 26 to 29 may 2019 the hotel is brilliantly located in the very popular fishermans wharf and close to pier 39 the interior is very modern yet authentic to its location i requested a room as high as possible with a view of golden gate and they accommodated our request we were also surprised with a bottle of wine in our room upon arrival checking in was made a pleasant experience by zuri at reception we toured the usa for 4 weeks and this was by far the best checkin of all the hotels what a pleasant lady the room was extremely big and equipped with every luxury you could wish for the restaurant at the hotel the blue mermaid is a must visit when staying at this hotel the food and service were fantastic and the firepits outside were perfect for late afternoon cocktails thanks to our server mikael awesome service parking was available right behind the hotel at very affordable rates being faced as south africans with an extremely negative exchange rate of rand to dollar we were happy with all the discounts provided by the hotel regarding drinks bicycle rental etc just take care that bicycle rental is free but as always there is a but to this privilege when we requested to take advantage of the offer at 17hoo we were told all the vouchers were finished for the day luckily the bicycle rental place accommodated us we enjoyed our stay very much and i would stay at this hotel again without any doubt we can highly recommend it the only negative aspect regarding this hotel was concierge it felt like this gentleman was doing us a huge favour asking for information and help we experienced this on all three occasions we asked for assistance after all that is his job and privilege to help us this was really the only negative aspect about this hotel its concierge service
cleaned_advanced: stayed san francisco may brilliantly located popular fisherman wharf close pier interior modern yet authentic location requested high possible view golden gate accommodated request also surprised bottle wine upon arrival checking made pleasant experience zuri reception toured usa week far best checkin hotel pleasant lady extremely big equipped every luxury could wish restaurant blue mermaid must visit staying food service fantastic firepits outside perfect late afternoon cocktail thanks server mikael awesome service parking available right behind affordable rate faced south african extremely negative exchange rate rand dollar happy discount provided regarding drink bicycle rental etc take care bicycle rental free always privilege requested take advantage offer hoo told voucher finished day luckily bicycle rental place accommodated u enjoyed much would without doubt highly recommend negative aspect regarding concierge felt like gentleman u huge favour asking information help experienced three occasion asked assistance job privilege help u really negative aspect concierge service

original_reviews: the argonaut hotel is in the historic cannery in san francisco the rooms are very nice but try to get a room facing out if possible the hotels blue mermaid restaurant is excellent the hotel is close to all the restaurants and attractions on fishermans wharf it is a bit pricey but it is a great hotel in a great location
reviews: the location is absolutely unbeatable and so are the views you are minutes away from almost all of san franciscos major sights the building itself is stunning historic it is very well maintained and clean we loved the obvious fishing theme throughout ultimately what made it phenomenal was the service every person we came in contact with was super nice they knew everything and gave great recommendations i highly recommend staying here when visiting san francisco
cleaned_advanced: location absolutely unbeatable view minute away almost san franciscos major sight building stunning historic well maintained clean loved obvious fishing theme throughout ultimately made phenomenal service every person came contact super nice knew everything gave great recommendation highly recommend staying visiting san francisco

original_reviews: the argonaut was awesome to say the least right on fishermans wharf there was always something to do our room had a bay view and also the girardelli sign the room was always clean and had a lot of character
reviews: the argonaut hotel is a great place to stay while in san francisco its walking distance to lots of things to see in the city and its a good value too i would encourage anyone to stay there good for business and family travel
cleaned_advanced: argonaut great place san francisco walking distance lot thing see city good value would encourage anyone good business family travel

original_reviews: we booked this room for two days prior to a cruise the location was fantastic close to fishermans wharf but far enough from the craziness of that area we dined at the restaurant several times and were impressed with the quality of the food and the friendly waitstaff everyone in the hotel was friendly helpful without being in your face and very knowledgeable about the area we would stay there again in a heartbeat
reviews: argonaut is a lovely hotel clean and comfortable the staff are friendly and helpful it is conveniently located at the end of jefferson street by the hydepowell cable car terminal it is within walking distance to the famous pier 39 and all the hoponhopoff bus terminalsoffices there are tons of eating places close by we used lyft to get to and from the airport and it cost about 35
cleaned_advanced: argonaut lovely clean comfortable staff friendly helpful conveniently located end jefferson street hydepowell cable car terminal within walking distance famous pier hoponhopoff bus terminalsoffices ton eating place close used lyft get airport cost

original_reviews: rooms kind of small i called and told them it was our anniversary and they offered to upgrade to bay view when we checked in was given non view room called office and was told no notification so no upgradenice place but rooms are small and there is zero view from the non view rooms except a wall overall nice stay
reviews: first trip to san francisco we found this hotel by chance when researching districts as we were only in the area for 4 days and wanted to be central for everything the hotel lived up to our expectations room and dcor lovely fantastic view from our room of alcatraz bar and restaurant were great too staff very helpful and friendly we would not hesitate to recommending this hotel
cleaned_advanced: first trip san francisco found chance researching district area day wanted central everything lived expectation dcor lovely fantastic view alcatraz bar restaurant great staff helpful friendly would hesitate recommending

original_reviews: my wife and i stayed here for the first 3 nights of our us road trip the argonaut was 50 in a cab and about 45mins from the airport in evening rush hour traffic we upgraded to a suite on the top floor room 411 which had a side view over the bay and was incredibly spacious with a big bed and roomy shower just what we needed after a long flight the breakfast at the blue mermaid next door was decent but we found more choice and better value at joanies and black pojnt nearby the hotel was well situated for exploring fishermans wharf including the vibrant pier 39 and getting to the alcatraz ferry at pier 33 many great eating options nearby and next door to the cable car which is a great option for getting up the hills and into the city only 6 very easy to get to the gg bridge from here too would definitely recommend staying here over some of more well known but pricier hotels in the city value parking at 50 plus tax per night was steep but perhaps typical of sf
reviews: i booked this hotel for a fun trip with my son for his birthday the location was perfect walking distance to everything we wanted to do every staff member went out of their way to make us feel right at home they went above and beyond from the beautiful birthday surprise for my son to giving us the most spectacular room and always asking if we need anything everyone was always happy to see us and we felt right at home we loved waking up and getting the bicycles from the concierge we biked over the golden gate bridge and it was spectacular the location was ideal for us to walk to fabulous restaurants and sightsee but was far away from the tourist area it was quiet i loved waking up early the streets were so quiet it was like a movie set i enjoyed sitting on the beach by the swim club across the way i love the green lawn by ghirardelli and who wouldnt want to be able to walk right to the choctaw factory we didnt want to leave and decided to make it an annual trip thank you to everyone for making our stay so memorable we loved the hotel if i could give it six stars i would thats how happy i was i cant wait to see you again
cleaned_advanced: booked fun trip son birthday location perfect walking distance everything wanted every staff member went way make u feel right home went beyond beautiful birthday surprise son giving u spectacular always asking need anything everyone always happy see u felt right home loved waking getting bicycle concierge biked golden gate bridge spectacular location ideal u walk fabulous restaurant sightsee far away tourist area quiet loved waking early street quiet like movie set enjoyed sitting beach swim club across way love green lawn ghirardelli wouldnt want able walk right choctaw factory didnt want leave decided make annual trip thank everyone making memorable loved could give six star would thats happy cant wait see

original_reviews: great location for a first time trip as you are right by fishermans wharf lots of restaurants and places to eat blue mermaid restaurant next door which does great chowder cycle hire icecream shop a few doors away starbucks behind hotel if you like chocolate the hotel is just across from ghirardelli square with its restaurants and chocolateice cream parlour is just a 5 minutes walk across and being hotel the hotel in also right by the beach so you can do some nice walks we walked all the way to golden gate bridge and back which took about 2 and half hours but you can cycle it quicker powell and hyde tram stop is just next door to the hotel although it does get busy at peak times i am in two minds about the hotel itself its very stylish and boutique but just did not have the wow factor which for the price was disappointing felt a bit to business like
reviews: wow we just checked out of argonaut this morning and i wish we couldve stayed longer the service was impeccable so welcoming and friendly at every encounter jeremiah and jason helped us with our car and luggage at check in and we needed help we are in the middle of a move and had plenty in tow with us we ordered from the restaurant for pickup and they brought it up to us instead the front desk team even watched my daughters fish for us while we walked to get coffee after check out the room was easily the best weve stayed at in sf super spacious and clean location of this hotel cant be beat for proximity to all things to do
cleaned_advanced: wow checked argonaut morning wish couldve stayed longer service impeccable welcoming friendly every encounter jeremiah jason helped u car luggage check needed help middle move plenty tow u ordered restaurant pickup brought u instead front desk team even watched daughter fish u walked get coffee check easily best weve stayed sf super spacious clean location cant beat proximity thing

original_reviews: i have really mixed feelings about this hotel parts i absolutely love and somethings just want to make you go arrghhh we loved its location its right opposite a trolley stop and a short walk to fishermans walk and all the main attractions the room was lovely spacious and spotlessly cleanoverlooked the golden gate bridgeso whats not to love we arrived at 1am in the morning struggling with three large cases after a 16 hr flight the security guard just said hi no offer of help night receptionist was lovely and very polite we got a really great room however the noise from the air conditioning was just so loudso we switched it offstill really loud noise also came from the fridge switching on and off very loud spoke to the lovely reception staff in the morning who said oh its probably because the air conditioning equipment is on the roof but we will check it came back a few hours later it has been reported fixed at 110pm nothing had changed at all for 4 days it just made a loud noise on several days i asked if the concierge was available to be told oh we do not have one today one arrived on our check out day we were really looking forward to dining in the restaurant having read the reviewsthe food was lovelythe staff were really poor and it was the worst service we received in our whole stay in the usa after dinner we went to the lovely hotel lounge and i asked at reception where the bar was to get a nightcap by the lovely fireplace oh the only bar is in the restaurant and it closes at 9pmif you go outside of the hotel turn left and there is a bar up the street we have never stayed in a hotel with a bar that closes at 9pm leaving was a little like arriving reception staff lovely really helpfultwo members of staff on the door let me struggle with three large bags offering no help at all so overall if you want a funky hotel close to the wharf and if you are prepared to put up with noisy rooftop air conditioning have no bar after 9pm and some really helpful staff and some really unhelpful staff its for you personally we would think twice as the little bits which would have made the stay magical were just missing i am afraid which is sad to saybut eh it might just me me
reviews: the door man john is amazing everyone was very nice i would recommend for everyone to stay here the location was perfect had a wonderful view of alcatraz island within walking distance of the entire wharf
cleaned_advanced: door man john amazing everyone nice would recommend everyone location perfect wonderful view alcatraz island within walking distance entire wharf

original_reviews: we stayed here on our family vacation to ca in june and it was top notch all the way around of all the properties we visited while in ca expensive national park properties included the argonaut hotel was our absolute favorite their attention to detail both in cleaning and in decorhotel furnishings is remarkable the property is located at a terrific spot along the pier area and is walking distance to all the major tourist spots there is also a parking garage just behind the hotel that is super convenient if you have a vehicle the staff was extremely hospitable and i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to san francisco
reviews: this hotel was wonderful i love the ambiance and decor with exposed brick walls and large wooden beams the location couldnt have been more idealright in the heart of fishermans wharf and just a few minutes walk from pier 39 and ghiradelli square we could see the water from our room and watch the fishing boats leave each morning i also love how the shuttered windows actually opened so we could enjoy the cool breeze and sounds of the citya luxury not many hotels afford we reserved three rooms for our trip and had several requests including a pack n play the staff was very accommodating and pleasant our room had two doubles so our daughter could have her own bed and our son slept in a pack n play there was plenty of room for the portable crib suitcases accommodating a family of four and a stroller we did not fee cramped at all i also enjoyed the wonderfully comfy robes we put the lovely lobby to good use and finished each night of our stay with a drink from the blue mermaid and conversation around the fireplace it was a great spot for a nightcap and room for the kids to stretch their legs and play we did have an issue after our stay with our credit card being charged several times for additional rooms even thought we had paid upfront for a package deal but with one short phone call everything was swiftly cleared up and apologies made overall i would highly recommend this darling boutique hotel to anyone staying in the heart of san fran we thoroughly enjoyed our stay
cleaned_advanced: wonderful love ambiance decor exposed brick wall large wooden beam location couldnt idealright heart fisherman wharf minute walk pier ghiradelli square could see water watch fishing boat leave morning also love shuttered window actually opened could enjoy cool breeze sound citya luxury many hotel afford reserved three trip several request including pack play staff accommodating pleasant two double daughter could bed son slept pack play plenty portable crib suitcase accommodating family four stroller fee cramped also enjoyed wonderfully comfy robe put lovely lobby good use finished night drink blue mermaid conversation around fireplace great spot nightcap kid stretch leg play issue credit card charged several time additional even thought paid upfront package deal one short phone call everything swiftly cleared apology made overall would highly recommend darling boutique anyone staying heart san fran thoroughly enjoyed

original_reviews: the argonaut is well positioned at the end of the strip about 15 minutes walk from pier 39 and with views over the golden gate bridge its an old converted warehouse so the rooms retain some industrialnautical fittings they are spacious and well appointed there are plenty of restaurants close by to stagger back from and a beach to sit and watch the sunset san francisco is worth a visit and the argonaut is a comfortable clean and handy hotel to explore it from we recommend a tour by extranomical tours and ask for guide tony he brought a personal touch to site seeing the city
reviews: love the argonaut very personable staff which go out of their way to accommodate their guests ive stayed there before my last stay will stay there again it is located in the perfect spot between the buena vista the gold dust scomas my favorite places in s f
cleaned_advanced: love argonaut personable staff go way accommodate guest ive stayed last located perfect spot buena vista gold dust scomas favorite place

original_reviews: loved the argonaut staff were friendly rooms comfortablerestaurant was excellent we really liked the decorthe mix of old and new the location was ideal i would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends
reviews: firstly a great location if you are a first timer in sfan easy walk along the fisherman wharf area to pier 39 and to the alcatraz ferries what was dissapointing and not the argonauts fault was the very large number of homeless people in that area which made it too uncomfortable for a pleasure walk we paid 900 for two nights room only not inexpensive in any country but we expected sheer luxury and was happy to pay unfortunately in my opinion the luxury fell way short we had an inside room that looked into all the other inside rooms looking into our room so not great the decor was basic so all in dissapointing the connected blue marlin bar continued our dissapointment as we had breakfast but the restaurant was not immaculate and the staff dressed in jeans and casual shirts that didnt exude quality we know sf is a very expensive city but this didnt stack up they do offer complementary basic drinks of beer wine between 5pm and 6pm call me a tight scotsman but at maybe 10 each this didnt make a 3 star hotel worth 5 star prices could do better to ensure guests return

original_reviews: we spent three nights at the argonaut while sightseeing around the city the staff was professional friendly and very helpful in planning tours during our stay we were in town for fleet week and it was the perfect location for seeing the fantastic airshow highly recommend this hotel a long weekend stay in sf
reviews: it was our third time at the argonaut its a good choice great location but still quiet the room is large and clean unfortunately carpeting which i dont like what we didnt like and remembered differently was breakfast there are various dishes to choose from from from the menu next time wed go somewhere else for breakfast
cleaned_advanced: third time argonaut good choice great location still quiet large clean unfortunately carpeting dont like didnt like remembered differently breakfast various dish choose menu next time wed go somewhere else breakfast

original_reviews: we decided to stay at the argonaut for the start of our trip to the states the hotel concierge was great and helpful and the check in was fast and good we didnt have a car but parking is very expensive the whole of san francisco is expensive in every way so the hotel was no exception great location to visit the wharf and plenty of places to eat and busestrams to catch would thoroughly recommend the hotel
reviews: the location of this hotel is a+ and a very classy place to stay easy walk to lots of attractions in san francisco the hotel room was a good size and comfortable very cute ocean themed room including octopus wallpaper in the bathroom which i would love in my home the only downsides were that i wish there was more staffguest interaction which would make it feel more welcoming the shower wasnt very hot and reception took quite a large deposit upon check in more than the total amount of my accommodation and it took 2 weeks to clear which hurt my credit card for future hotel deposits however these werent huge issues and i would 100 return on my next trip
cleaned_advanced: location classy place easy walk lot attraction san francisco good size comfortable cute ocean themed including octopus wallpaper bathroom would love home downside wish staffguest interaction would make feel welcoming shower wasnt hot reception took quite large deposit upon check total amount accommodation took week clear hurt credit card future deposit however werent huge issue would return next trip

original_reviews: on arriving at the hotel it was exactly what was expected we had read up visited the site seeing in person was so much better room was lovely and so boutique we honestly couldnt have asked for a better room even the view we opened the blinds to see the golden gate bridge honestly this is an amazing hotel however dont get taken in by the free breakfast offers they arent worth it 4 pieces of toast 2 slices of bread and not enough jam and the service is absolutely terrible from waiting at the door for 5 minutes to not being served or forgotten about fortunately plenty of other places to eat
reviews: we are taking a road trip around west coast and sf is first stop argonaut gives a flavour of the bygone fishing industry but with modern take loved it especially our first taste of chowder great location for fishermans wharf outside eating at the mermaid was a delight even when slightly chilly with heaters everywhere
cleaned_advanced: taking road trip around west coast sf first stop argonaut give flavour bygone fishing industry modern take loved especially first taste chowder great location fisherman wharf outside eating mermaid delight even slightly chilly heater everywhere

original_reviews: an absolutely well led and beautiful hotel with an extraordinary good breakfast restaurant the barista and his capuccino just a blast friendly staff allover the closeness to pier 41 and 39 and specially to the turning point of the cable car makes the hotel an ideal one to explore and enjoy san francisco we will come back
reviews: we totally enjoyed our 7 night stay at the argonaut hotel when we got to the room i found a complimentary bottle of dry red wine its like they knew thats my favorite wine the front desk employees were so friendly and helpful if i go back to san francisco id definitely stay there again
cleaned_advanced: totally enjoyed night argonaut got found complimentary bottle dry red wine like knew thats favorite wine front desk employee friendly helpful go back san francisco id definitely

original_reviews: rooms good restaurant prices mid range beds very comfy rooms super spacious very handy for fishermans wharf area wifi not the best but workable discount vouchers for food and beverage offered on arrival make eating in hotel very competitive would go back
reviews: we loved this place the room was beautiful bright and clean location was perfect short walk to pier 39 and the alcatraz tours close to ghiradelli square less than a 5 minute walk to the stop for the hop onoff bus and 2 mins from the cable car station it suited us perfectly the room was decorated beautifully the staff were all super friendly and the hotel is gorgeous wouldnt stay anywhere else in san fran
cleaned_advanced: loved place beautiful bright clean location perfect short walk pier alcatraz tour close ghiradelli square less minute walk stop hop onoff bus min cable car station suited u perfectly decorated beautifully staff super friendly gorgeous wouldnt anywhere else san fran

original_reviews: we took our 2 boys to san francisco for spring break and stayed here for 5 nights first of all the location could not be better we had a view of the golden gate bridge from our window and a view of the cable cars getting ready for the day everything you want to do is walking distance or a short uber ride in the lobby there is a maritime museum run by the national parks service that is really well done and my boys earned a park service badge there is also a beach across the street that we could walk on if you are doing a family trip to san francisco this is the place food was excellent at the blue mermaid too
reviews: on our last trip to san fran 10 years ago we passed the argonaut and said well stay there the next time well it took a decade but we did it and im glad we did great location excellent staff perfect kimpton experience dont think twice just book it

original_reviews: we really enjoyed our stay at the argonaut hotel perfectly located near all the sites we wanted to enjoy while in san francisco we had an interior room with no view but the comfort of the room and bed made up for it its decorated super cute blue mermaid attached to the hotel was yummy love the bread bowl corn and crab chowder would definitely stay here again
reviews: great hotel great location if a little expensive i would definitely recommend sf cycle the golden gate bridge and see alcatraz the hotel bar offers great cocktails and bat snacks we had a suite which was plenty of room for a family of five
cleaned_advanced: great great location little expensive would definitely recommend sf cycle golden gate bridge see alcatraz bar offer great cocktail bat snack suite plenty family five

original_reviews: i was aware of the daily 25 resort fee but please tell me how the word resort applies upon arrival at our floor there were 2 trays of half eaten meals on the floor and 2 additional empty cocktail glasses at the foot of my room and there they remained for the next 2 days getting a single additional bar of soap proved quite the challenge with your staffregardless of asking no extra soap bar to be found in our bathroom and so we remained one little square of soap for my wife and i for our 6 night stayby day 3 i bought my own i enjoy music as much as anyone but i dont care to hear that disco beat pounding through the lobby and on the elevators at 56 am why 5am because thats the time i left my room every morning to walk to a local starbucks to get coffee 10 for your pot of 2 small cups did i mention the 25 daily resort fee oh that must mean the restaurant area deck chairs against the back wall adjacent to the restrooms shower curtains must be expensive to replace as evidenced by the mold along the bottom of mine there is some good to be said excellent locationyour desk staff is quite nice and friendlyyour blue mermaid restaurant staff were extremely pleasant and attentive and i was more than happy to leave them generous tips its the little thingsget your stuff together
reviews: we stayed during our recent trip to celebrate our 39th wedding anniversary nice hotel nice rooms of a good size we booked a suite but in hindsight we would have been fine without the extra room because the bedroom was spacious definitely worth staying

original_reviews: this hotel in in a great place very close to everything pier 39 the golden gate bridge and alcatraz the rooms had enough space and so was the bathroom nice lounge area just off the foyer which had a fire there and water staff couldnt be more helpful value for money for sure
reviews: nice friendly hotel ideally situated near fishermans wharf standard boutique fair its a great base for exploring wasnt noisy was well equipped and very near the cable car stop long term stay might get expensive but for a long weekend to blitz san fran it is perfect
