original_reviews: lovely hotel with no surprises compared to their website friendly staff all round and comfortable rustic rooms close to all the good stuff our only complaint was that the rooms did suffer quite a bit from external noise cars party goers etc but all part of the atmosphere of the area i guess
reviews: this is a really fun hotel in a great location we arrived a bit late in the day and since we missed the wine tasting happy hour were given vouchers for cocktails at the restaurant connected to the hotel when this happens you know it is going to be a good stay the hotel decoration is nautical themed nicely done and just a tiny bit over the top but memorable the rooms very nice and spacious comfy beds and linens a great bathroom and quiet the restaurant is very good the location is awesome walking distance to the piers with plenty of restaurants nearby highly recommended
cleaned_advanced: really fun great location arrived bit late day since missed wine tasting happy hour given voucher cocktail restaurant connected happens know going good decoration nautical themed nicely done tiny bit top memorable nice spacious comfy bed linen great bathroom quiet restaurant good location awesome walking distance pier plenty restaurant nearby highly recommended

original_reviews: we had an incredible stay here the front desk staff was beyond helpful and generous and the lobby is really fun and unique we loved our room we loved the ammenities and we loved the location the wharf is very touristy and busy but it has a charm to it and you can walk to tons of restaurants and bars our 4 year old had a blast and the hotel took great care to make sure he was taken care of we will definitely be coming back
reviews: we have stayed here multiple times the location of this hotel cannot be beat it is right next to fishermans wharf but it is at the very end by beach street so you dont get all of the crowds and commotion beach street is the terminus of the cable car line so you can hop on and be to union square or market street in no time the trolley line is also close by so you can get down to the embarcadero or att park the hotel itself is in the old cannery building the brick and exposed beams give it a very unique feel they usually have a wine and cheese reception in the lobby in the late afternoon it is on the above average end of the price range but you get what you pay for and it often prices out the noisy kids in the am and the partying young adults in the evening you can walk to excellent restaurants along the wharf great place for a romantic weekend
cleaned_advanced: stayed multiple time location cannot beat right next fisherman wharf end beach street dont get crowd commotion beach street terminus cable car line hop union square market street time trolley line also close get embarcadero att park old cannery building brick exposed beam give unique feel usually wine cheese reception lobby late afternoon average end price range get pay often price noisy kid partying young adult evening walk excellent restaurant along wharf great place romantic weekend

original_reviews: we stayed at this hotel in san francisco from 26 to 29 may 2019 the hotel is brilliantly located in the very popular fishermans wharf and close to pier 39 the interior is very modern yet authentic to its location i requested a room as high as possible with a view of golden gate and they accommodated our request we were also surprised with a bottle of wine in our room upon arrival checking in was made a pleasant experience by zuri at reception we toured the usa for 4 weeks and this was by far the best checkin of all the hotels what a pleasant lady the room was extremely big and equipped with every luxury you could wish for the restaurant at the hotel the blue mermaid is a must visit when staying at this hotel the food and service were fantastic and the firepits outside were perfect for late afternoon cocktails thanks to our server mikael awesome service parking was available right behind the hotel at very affordable rates being faced as south africans with an extremely negative exchange rate of rand to dollar we were happy with all the discounts provided by the hotel regarding drinks bicycle rental etc just take care that bicycle rental is free but as always there is a but to this privilege when we requested to take advantage of the offer at 17hoo we were told all the vouchers were finished for the day luckily the bicycle rental place accommodated us we enjoyed our stay very much and i would stay at this hotel again without any doubt we can highly recommend it the only negative aspect regarding this hotel was concierge it felt like this gentleman was doing us a huge favour asking for information and help we experienced this on all three occasions we asked for assistance after all that is his job and privilege to help us this was really the only negative aspect about this hotel its concierge service
reviews: best choice i never made the office executive assistant booked this for me and i was pleasantly surprised the staff were all very helpful and friendly i needed help printing out something late on my first night and the front desk was more than happy to help me obtain what i needed the room was very clean and comfortable i actually was given free wifi i am not certain if that is some arrangement my executive assistant made or something they offered for the conference i was there for but it was free i did eat at the restaurant attached to the hotel one evening it is a pretty good choice if you do not feel like venturing out however the hotel is within walking distance to some tourist attractions and several very good restaurants when i return for the conference this year i will request to stay here
cleaned_advanced: best choice never made office executive assistant booked pleasantly surprised staff helpful friendly needed help printing something late first night front desk happy help obtain needed clean comfortable actually given free wifi certain arrangement executive assistant made something offered conference free eat restaurant attached one evening pretty good choice feel like venturing however within walking distance tourist attraction several good restaurant return conference year request

original_reviews: the location is absolutely unbeatable and so are the views you are minutes away from almost all of san franciscos major sights the building itself is stunning historic it is very well maintained and clean we loved the obvious fishing theme throughout ultimately what made it phenomenal was the service every person we came in contact with was super nice they knew everything and gave great recommendations i highly recommend staying here when visiting san francisco
reviews: we stayed on the 4th floor in a bay view room which was incredible the views of the bridge and the bay awesome great breakfast and service will definately stay here again the next time we are in san francisco
cleaned_advanced: stayed th floor bay view incredible view bridge bay awesome great breakfast service definately next time san francisco

original_reviews: the argonaut hotel is a great place to stay while in san francisco its walking distance to lots of things to see in the city and its a good value too i would encourage anyone to stay there good for business and family travel
reviews: the hotel is located in the heart of fishermans wharf with lots of tourist but the rooms are very quiet and nicely renovated we loved the spacious room for san francisco and we had a partial ocean view too because the parking was more than we wanted to pay we didnt rent a car while we stayed here taxis were readily available and the staff were all very friendly and helpful
cleaned_advanced: located heart fisherman wharf lot tourist quiet nicely renovated loved spacious san francisco partial ocean view parking wanted pay didnt rent car stayed taxi readily available staff friendly helpful

original_reviews: argonaut is a lovely hotel clean and comfortable the staff are friendly and helpful it is conveniently located at the end of jefferson street by the hydepowell cable car terminal it is within walking distance to the famous pier 39 and all the hoponhopoff bus terminalsoffices there are tons of eating places close by we used lyft to get to and from the airport and it cost about 35
reviews: charming ambiance and beautifully kept our room was perfect for our trip with 2 teenage boys plenty of space and truly impeccable service located just a few blocks for everything on fishermans wharf theres no need to drive the furthest attraction was the ferry to alcatraz and it was less than a mile away convenient lovely and a perfect landing spot for our trip thank you to the staff of the argonaut for making our stay in san francisco absolutely perfect
cleaned_advanced: charming ambiance beautifully kept perfect trip teenage boy plenty space truly impeccable service located block everything fisherman wharf there need drive furthest attraction ferry alcatraz less mile away convenient lovely perfect landing spot trip thank staff argonaut making san francisco absolutely perfect

original_reviews: first trip to san francisco we found this hotel by chance when researching districts as we were only in the area for 4 days and wanted to be central for everything the hotel lived up to our expectations room and dcor lovely fantastic view from our room of alcatraz bar and restaurant were great too staff very helpful and friendly we would not hesitate to recommending this hotel
reviews: argonaut is at the end of the embarcadero road and youre right in and on the action the rooms are comfortable and very clean the housestaff is superb front desk and concierge were very helpful only drawback is the onsite dining facility which is mediocre at best if you want an over the top breakfast experience walk three short blocks to the hollywood cafe the short wait is worth it
cleaned_advanced: argonaut end embarcadero road youre right action comfortable clean housestaff superb front desk concierge helpful drawback onsite dining facility mediocre best want top breakfast experience walk three short block hollywood cafe short wait worth

original_reviews: i booked this hotel for a fun trip with my son for his birthday the location was perfect walking distance to everything we wanted to do every staff member went out of their way to make us feel right at home they went above and beyond from the beautiful birthday surprise for my son to giving us the most spectacular room and always asking if we need anything everyone was always happy to see us and we felt right at home we loved waking up and getting the bicycles from the concierge we biked over the golden gate bridge and it was spectacular the location was ideal for us to walk to fabulous restaurants and sightsee but was far away from the tourist area it was quiet i loved waking up early the streets were so quiet it was like a movie set i enjoyed sitting on the beach by the swim club across the way i love the green lawn by ghirardelli and who wouldnt want to be able to walk right to the choctaw factory we didnt want to leave and decided to make it an annual trip thank you to everyone for making our stay so memorable we loved the hotel if i could give it six stars i would thats how happy i was i cant wait to see you again
reviews: we found this hotel after walking out of a reservation that same day this was a perfect location spacious room very comfy beds delicious restaurant and friendly staff we highly recommend this and weee so glad we left the other and found this gem
cleaned_advanced: found walking reservation day perfect location spacious comfy bed delicious restaurant friendly staff highly recommend weee glad left found gem

original_reviews: wow we just checked out of argonaut this morning and i wish we couldve stayed longer the service was impeccable so welcoming and friendly at every encounter jeremiah and jason helped us with our car and luggage at check in and we needed help we are in the middle of a move and had plenty in tow with us we ordered from the restaurant for pickup and they brought it up to us instead the front desk team even watched my daughters fish for us while we walked to get coffee after check out the room was easily the best weve stayed at in sf super spacious and clean location of this hotel cant be beat for proximity to all things to do
reviews: the argonaut is right by everything san francisco has to offer you can use cable cars that connect to muni to really get around town we found the room comfortable with a friendly staff that worked hard to meet expectations
cleaned_advanced: argonaut right everything san francisco offer use cable car connect muni really get around town found comfortable friendly staff worked hard meet expectation

original_reviews: the door man john is amazing everyone was very nice i would recommend for everyone to stay here the location was perfect had a wonderful view of alcatraz island within walking distance of the entire wharf
reviews: the argonaut is located right on the water front just a few steps from pier 39 lots of tourist attractions etc in the area location wise you cant beat it the hotel itself is what i will call eclectic elegance with a rustic charm service is wonderful the restaurant is also top notch beds are super comfortable with great pillows my review is based on staying in one of the suites but ive seen the rooms and they appear to be just as nice in short this is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in
cleaned_advanced: argonaut located right water front step pier lot tourist attraction etc area location wise cant beat call eclectic elegance rustic charm service wonderful restaurant also top notch bed super comfortable great pillow review based staying one suite ive seen appear nice short one best hotel ever stayed

original_reviews: this hotel was wonderful i love the ambiance and decor with exposed brick walls and large wooden beams the location couldnt have been more idealright in the heart of fishermans wharf and just a few minutes walk from pier 39 and ghiradelli square we could see the water from our room and watch the fishing boats leave each morning i also love how the shuttered windows actually opened so we could enjoy the cool breeze and sounds of the citya luxury not many hotels afford we reserved three rooms for our trip and had several requests including a pack n play the staff was very accommodating and pleasant our room had two doubles so our daughter could have her own bed and our son slept in a pack n play there was plenty of room for the portable crib suitcases accommodating a family of four and a stroller we did not fee cramped at all i also enjoyed the wonderfully comfy robes we put the lovely lobby to good use and finished each night of our stay with a drink from the blue mermaid and conversation around the fireplace it was a great spot for a nightcap and room for the kids to stretch their legs and play we did have an issue after our stay with our credit card being charged several times for additional rooms even thought we had paid upfront for a package deal but with one short phone call everything was swiftly cleared up and apologies made overall i would highly recommend this darling boutique hotel to anyone staying in the heart of san fran we thoroughly enjoyed our stay
reviews: we loved the argonaut it is in a perfect location and is so comfortable just what we needed as travellers from the uk the room was perfect the beds were a dream and the bathroom was stunning the whole hotel has such characterand the first thing you see as you walk out of the door is alcatraz and its right next to the famous cable car wed love to return one day
cleaned_advanced: loved argonaut perfect location comfortable needed traveller uk perfect bed dream bathroom stunning whole characterand first thing see walk door alcatraz right next famous cable car wed love return one day

original_reviews: love the argonaut very personable staff which go out of their way to accommodate their guests ive stayed there before my last stay will stay there again it is located in the perfect spot between the buena vista the gold dust scomas my favorite places in s f
reviews: we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the argonaut great room great service quiet and easily walkable to great restaurants the alcatraz launch and all of fishermans wharf and trolleys and the cable car hub were close as well making it easy to get from the airport as well as to other sights downtown
cleaned_advanced: thoroughly enjoyed argonaut great great service quiet easily walkable great restaurant alcatraz launch fisherman wharf trolley cable car hub close well making easy get airport well sight downtown

original_reviews: firstly a great location if you are a first timer in sfan easy walk along the fisherman wharf area to pier 39 and to the alcatraz ferries what was dissapointing and not the argonauts fault was the very large number of homeless people in that area which made it too uncomfortable for a pleasure walk we paid 900 for two nights room only not inexpensive in any country but we expected sheer luxury and was happy to pay unfortunately in my opinion the luxury fell way short we had an inside room that looked into all the other inside rooms looking into our room so not great the decor was basic so all in dissapointing the connected blue marlin bar continued our dissapointment as we had breakfast but the restaurant was not immaculate and the staff dressed in jeans and casual shirts that didnt exude quality we know sf is a very expensive city but this didnt stack up they do offer complementary basic drinks of beer wine between 5pm and 6pm call me a tight scotsman but at maybe 10 each this didnt make a 3 star hotel worth 5 star prices could do better to ensure guests return
reviews: would definitely stay here again ideal location right on the pier staff were very friendly and accommodating the restaurant was reasonably priced especially with the daily 10 residents discount
cleaned_advanced: would definitely ideal location right pier staff friendly accommodating restaurant reasonably priced especially daily resident discount

original_reviews: it was our third time at the argonaut its a good choice great location but still quiet the room is large and clean unfortunately carpeting which i dont like what we didnt like and remembered differently was breakfast there are various dishes to choose from from from the menu next time wed go somewhere else for breakfast
reviews: amazing location close to everything that you might want not a huge amount in the way of facilities at the hotel but clean comfortable rooms with good beds and sound insulation most of rooms do not have any kind of view despite the location

original_reviews: the location of this hotel is a+ and a very classy place to stay easy walk to lots of attractions in san francisco the hotel room was a good size and comfortable very cute ocean themed room including octopus wallpaper in the bathroom which i would love in my home the only downsides were that i wish there was more staffguest interaction which would make it feel more welcoming the shower wasnt very hot and reception took quite a large deposit upon check in more than the total amount of my accommodation and it took 2 weeks to clear which hurt my credit card for future hotel deposits however these werent huge issues and i would 100 return on my next trip
reviews: my husband and i have been to sf many times but have never stayed on the wharf we chose this hotel from expedia and were not disappointed the location is great for all sf has to offer the hotel door is right next to ben and jerrys and the waffle cone smell greeted us each morning the hotel is very clean the beds comfy and the decor wowed me every detail was thought outthe chandeliers in the lobby the colors the chairs the fixturesloved it our room was nice and quiet and we had room service twice which was yummy check out the adjoining wine bar

reviews: understanding that we are i san francisco and that the hotel is very well positioned i still think there are better value for money options around or more luxury options if money is not a problem the rooms are nice but small many with no views on the bay the lobby is nice and there is a lively atmosphere and becomes very busy for the happy hour around 5 with wine and beer offered parking around is very complicated so the almost 60usd valet is almost a bargain

original_reviews: we loved this place the room was beautiful bright and clean location was perfect short walk to pier 39 and the alcatraz tours close to ghiradelli square less than a 5 minute walk to the stop for the hop onoff bus and 2 mins from the cable car station it suited us perfectly the room was decorated beautifully the staff were all super friendly and the hotel is gorgeous wouldnt stay anywhere else in san fran
reviews: im staying at the argonaut for a few days for a conference its in a terrific location on fishermans whart but i wouldnt rate it as a luxury hotel despite the luxury hotel price tag our room on the second floor has no view at all and is a bit short on amenities no turn down service no complementary bottles of water its really just an average hotel in a great location the concierge and front desk staff are friendly and helpful but our room had coffee grounds in the bathroom sink when we arrived so the cleaning left a bit to be desired and its either the walls that are thin or just bad design but you can hear what is going on in the room next to you next time ill book a hotel in the downtown area and enjoy the walk to fishermans wharf as opposed to staying in this hotel

reviews: this is undoubtedly one of the best hotels i have stayed in the rooms are enormous and beautifully appointed the staff were very friendly and helpful there is a large lounge area with relaxing chairs and an open fire a good restaurant and an outside eating area with fire pits no expense has been spared in the refurbishment making it a much sought after location parking is by valet service and quite expensive at 59 per day but the location close to fishermans wharf and the trolleybus terminus makes it very convenient we did not use our car during the four day stay

reviews: we really liked the argonaut during our four day stay the location is just perfect the staff were very helpful and housekeeping were excellent good sized rooms and ours had a view of the golden gate bridge just we would have given the argonaut an unreserved five star rating but it is terribly let down by the shambles which is their blue mermaid restaurant poor service and poor food on our last day there were evidently staffing problems and we were asked to wait 20 mins for a table in fairness when i told peter at reception he did say the management were aware of the problems and were working to resolve them the sooner the better we highly recommend the argonaut and hope that the catering issues are resolved by the time you arrive

original_reviews: the argonaut is right by everything san francisco has to offer you can use cable cars that connect to muni to really get around town we found the room comfortable with a friendly staff that worked hard to meet expectations
reviews: definitely a 4 star hotel nice rooms clean and well maintained it looks like they converted an old post and beam factory there were a couple of 14 wood beams in our room they do have a wonderful hour of wine tasting between 5 and 600 where you actually meet some of your fellow guests the only faults they charge 50day for parking which is horrendous it does include unlimited valet parking but really several nearby hotels offer the same service for 32day you are in the middle of tourist country and it is very busy and intense if this bothers you try somewhere further away you only have to be about blocks from fishermans wharf to be out of the crowds
cleaned_advanced: definitely star nice clean well maintained look like converted old post beam factory couple wood beam wonderful hour wine tasting actually meet fellow guest fault charge day parking horrendous include unlimited valet parking really several nearby hotel offer service day middle tourist country busy intense bother try somewhere away block fisherman wharf crowd

original_reviews: the argonaut is located right on the water front just a few steps from pier 39 lots of tourist attractions etc in the area location wise you cant beat it the hotel itself is what i will call eclectic elegance with a rustic charm service is wonderful the restaurant is also top notch beds are super comfortable with great pillows my review is based on staying in one of the suites but ive seen the rooms and they appear to be just as nice in short this is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in
reviews: the argonaut is not at all corporate it has quirky interiors that work well the staff are friendly and efficient the hotel is an easy walk to all fishermans wharf attractions and only about 30 minute stroll to down town sf rooms are bright and well furnished with usb charging points and wifi
cleaned_advanced: argonaut corporate quirky interior work well staff friendly efficient easy walk fisherman wharf attraction minute stroll town sf bright well furnished usb charging point wifi

original_reviews: we loved the argonaut it is in a perfect location and is so comfortable just what we needed as travellers from the uk the room was perfect the beds were a dream and the bathroom was stunning the whole hotel has such characterand the first thing you see as you walk out of the door is alcatraz and its right next to the famous cable car wed love to return one day
reviews: much better than the downtown hotels very friendly staff well maintained the location is unbeatable close to everything but at the same time in the calmer part of fishermans wharf at the end of jefferson st
cleaned_advanced: much better downtown hotel friendly staff well maintained location unbeatable close everything time calmer part fisherman wharf end jefferson st

original_reviews: we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the argonaut great room great service quiet and easily walkable to great restaurants the alcatraz launch and all of fishermans wharf and trolleys and the cable car hub were close as well making it easy to get from the airport as well as to other sights downtown
reviews: while i have tended to shy away from fishermans wharf the argonaut has changed my mind the staff are exceptionally friendly helpful and just full of good cheer the hotel is well appointed terrifically clean the room is very comfortable and well laid out its quiet its a haven compared to areas of town where many of the big hotels are its certainly everything i need and more on a business trip as other reviewers say it must also be great for vacationers my expectations for this family of hotels is always high but the argonaut has exceeded even those give this place a try its great value and a wonderful experience all around

original_reviews: would definitely stay here again ideal location right on the pier staff were very friendly and accommodating the restaurant was reasonably priced especially with the daily 10 residents discount
reviews: this hotel is very nice i had the room shown in the pictures the bed was very comfortable with luxury linens the hotel is located in the middle of fishermans wharf area and the cannery building lots of restaurants and shops in the immediate area hotel security is well done and i felt safe as a female solo traveler the restaurant in the lobby chowder house was very good service was professional and friendly prices were reasonable the only complaint i have is the 30 plus taxes daily resort fee

original_reviews: amazing location close to everything that you might want not a huge amount in the way of facilities at the hotel but clean comfortable rooms with good beds and sound insulation most of rooms do not have any kind of view despite the location
reviews: we are repeat guests at this hotel this was our first visit since it has been run by noble house group and while the hotel is still as beautiful as ever we were disappointed to notice the usual personalization in service missing this trip i hope that it was just a fluke during past visits weve been greeted by name and friendly commentsquestions about our day by the bellmen as we walked in and out of the front door which made us feel so welcomed and appreciated as guests this trip we were celebrating a very special milestone birthday and it wasnt even really acknowledged nor were we really it doesnt need to be much but the ultimate reason we booked here for this trip was for the personalized service to have it missing was very disappointing especially given we considered two of our favorite hotels and ultimately chose to stay here and paid a higher rate thinking it was worth it for that personalization reason

original_reviews: my husband and i have been to sf many times but have never stayed on the wharf we chose this hotel from expedia and were not disappointed the location is great for all sf has to offer the hotel door is right next to ben and jerrys and the waffle cone smell greeted us each morning the hotel is very clean the beds comfy and the decor wowed me every detail was thought outthe chandeliers in the lobby the colors the chairs the fixturesloved it our room was nice and quiet and we had room service twice which was yummy check out the adjoining wine bar
reviews: we chose the argonaut to be close to san francisco bay for a 1 night stay following a medical appointment the doorman and reception staff were very friendly and professional all covid precautions were observed our room was excellent very comfortable beds quiet with a direct view of the golden gate bridge delicious food at the hotels blue mermaid rates are in line with 4+ and 5 star hotels that we have stayed at in san francisco at the quieter end of fishermans wharf we will recommend to anyone seeking a san francisco experience in a beautiful location on the bay

original_reviews: understanding that we are i san francisco and that the hotel is very well positioned i still think there are better value for money options around or more luxury options if money is not a problem the rooms are nice but small many with no views on the bay the lobby is nice and there is a lively atmosphere and becomes very busy for the happy hour around 5 with wine and beer offered parking around is very complicated so the almost 60usd valet is almost a bargain
reviews: hotel was clean spacious and comfortable we didnt spend time in the lobby or bar but it looked nice location was great and area around the hotel felt pretty safe fairly close to great food in chinatown and north beach area overall had a good stay

original_reviews: im staying at the argonaut for a few days for a conference its in a terrific location on fishermans whart but i wouldnt rate it as a luxury hotel despite the luxury hotel price tag our room on the second floor has no view at all and is a bit short on amenities no turn down service no complementary bottles of water its really just an average hotel in a great location the concierge and front desk staff are friendly and helpful but our room had coffee grounds in the bathroom sink when we arrived so the cleaning left a bit to be desired and its either the walls that are thin or just bad design but you can hear what is going on in the room next to you next time ill book a hotel in the downtown area and enjoy the walk to fishermans wharf as opposed to staying in this hotel
reviews: we enjoyed the ambience at the argonaut hotel the staff was very friendly and the location is great too unfortunately there were no kingsized beds available we spent 3 nights there and my husband and i joked that we were sleeping in ricky and lucy beds we recently traveled to italy with our children and found that most of the hotels there simply moved two beds together or separated them accommodating the needs of their guests easily the elevators were slow but otherwise it was quite comfortable
cleaned_advanced: enjoyed ambience argonaut staff friendly location great unfortunately kingsized bed available spent night husband joked sleeping ricky lucy bed recently traveled italy child found hotel simply moved two bed together separated accommodating need guest easily elevator slow otherwise quite comfortable

original_reviews: i booked this hotel for two reasons 1 i had stayed here before and liked that it is so close to everything along the pier 2 second time was for the shark fest that was right a cross the street from the hotel this place is comfortable and the staff has always been very friendly
reviews: our 3rd stay in the hotel this time for 3 nights from the hotel straight on fishermans wharf next to the hotel the maritime museum ghirardelli park and the cable cars the hotel itself is very luxurious blue mermaid barrestaurant and a fitness center its an old warehouse and beautiful elements are still visible in the rooms
cleaned_advanced: rd time night straight fisherman wharf next maritime museum ghirardelli park cable car luxurious blue mermaid barrestaurant fitness center old warehouse beautiful element still visible

original_reviews: stepping into the argonaut at fishermans wharf was like stepping into a dream i frequent san francisco annually for my daughters birthday and had requested other hotels to offer her something for her birthday but no one remembered the argonaut remembered and delivered sharon the front desk staff is extremely helpful kind and accommodating i appreciate how she listened and helped us the whole staff from the valet to thebelman to the front desk was amazing the restaurant is delicious true cuisine thank you aragonout for accommodating my daughter and i for her 14th birthday i appreciate you all and we will be coming back
reviews: we spent the night here this month while visiting california the people are sooooo sweet and friendly they ended up giving us free drink coupons free appetizer coupons and let us keep our car there most of the next day while we were sight seeing the city very clean and excellent location

original_reviews: this is undoubtedly one of the best hotels i have stayed in the rooms are enormous and beautifully appointed the staff were very friendly and helpful there is a large lounge area with relaxing chairs and an open fire a good restaurant and an outside eating area with fire pits no expense has been spared in the refurbishment making it a much sought after location parking is by valet service and quite expensive at 59 per day but the location close to fishermans wharf and the trolleybus terminus makes it very convenient we did not use our car during the four day stay
reviews: hello josephine1996 thank you for providing us with such a kind review we are giving some high fives over here at the argonaut after hearing that we made your bucket list what a great idea please come back and see us again soon warm regards marc

original_reviews: this hotel is a nice hotel in a great location for activities with kids great places to walk you can ride over the golden gate bridge there is a beach head down all the piers catch the hyde st cable carthe hotel itself is nice but the walls seemed a little thin as we could hear the rooms next door tv at night and doorbell in the morning quite well staff were great as well as the wine hour and fruit water would stay here again with kids
reviews: wish we had a longer trip to san francisco so that we could have spent more time at this hotel quaint quiet beautiful property with extremely helpful and friendly staff the cleanliness of the rooms was impeccable very welcoming and enjoyable experience

original_reviews: we really liked the argonaut during our four day stay the location is just perfect the staff were very helpful and housekeeping were excellent good sized rooms and ours had a view of the golden gate bridge just we would have given the argonaut an unreserved five star rating but it is terribly let down by the shambles which is their blue mermaid restaurant poor service and poor food on our last day there were evidently staffing problems and we were asked to wait 20 mins for a table in fairness when i told peter at reception he did say the management were aware of the problems and were working to resolve them the sooner the better we highly recommend the argonaut and hope that the catering issues are resolved by the time you arrive
reviews: great location within walking distance to so many sites and close to cable car station concierge very helpful with planning how to fit the most fun into a short stay valet parking was great room was an interior room and quite small but tastefully decorated and we didnt spend much time there anyway inside rooms are much quieter
cleaned_advanced: great location within walking distance many site close cable car station concierge helpful planning fit fun short valet parking great interior quite small tastefully decorated didnt spend much time anyway inside much quieter

original_reviews: when i traveled to san francisco ive always used sir francisco drake under total renovation or hotel vital closed during pandemic so i had to find a new option my requirements are 1 pet friendly 2 close to grassy area 3 fun and safe location ive found this cute hotel on bringfidocom and checked google map and found its at the end of fishermans village area and is right next to the maritime park with huge grass area though i wish they didnt have a pet fee like sir francis drake or vital its 75pet per stay hotel staff are super friendly and nice decor is cute and rooms are spacious and comfortable overall it was a very good choice for us id come back to stay here with my dogs again
reviews: we also stayed here three years ago and im happy to say that the upkeep of the hotel has been great as everything seemed just as it should be this time the staff are friendly rooms large clean and very comfortable considering the hotel is in a very busy location and our room was facing fishermans wharf it was very quiet just around the corner from the argonaut are the cable cars which can get you easily into the city in a very picturesque way
cleaned_advanced: also stayed three year ago im happy say upkeep great everything seemed time staff friendly large clean comfortable considering busy location facing fisherman wharf quiet around corner argonaut cable car get easily city picturesque way

original_reviews: we stayed here while in the city for a wedding the location was great as everyone had access to the main tourist areas and great dining i found the atmosphere fun and the decor eclectic bedding was comfortable and clean we had a great view from our room as did others in our party but some felt their rooms had too much street noise it was not peaceful at night but not to be expected in a setting such as this
reviews: we stayed here for a girls trip we asked where we could go for happy hour and they told us to check in with the concierge by the time we went up to the room they called with three options for us the beds were super comfortable rooms were very nice the hotel is right across from the beach and the ghiradelli square and right by the embarcadero so we walked everywhere although uber would always be an option the only disappointing thing was when we checked out they charged us a 25 resort fee which i thought was ridiculous because we were not told about it until we checked out however i would stay there again and their staff was extremely helpful we bought our room through groupon but i would not do that again as it would have been cheaper with the triple a discount of twenty percent

original_reviews: the argonaut used to be a kimpton and was bummed out to hear that it was not this is not my first trip but upon arriving i noticed things were the same if not better if you want a hotel with about as good a location as you can get to the piers this is it the rooms are a great size and clean and cool as always
reviews: my wife and i have been to san francisco several times over the past 20 years and found the argonaut was a great fit of us and our two teenage daughters the location is right at the end of fishermans wharf in a former 100 year old warehouse it looks like a warehouse with exposed brick and steel beams that looks more than tough enough to survive an earthquake the front desk and the concierge were both helpful with our stay and they easily accommodated us when our flight was cancelled due to bad weather back east down the hallway is a little office area in case you need to jump online and print tickets or other tripbusiness related chores we had an inside room and it was one of the quietest rooms ive ever stayed in most probably due to the brick walls i cant make a comment on the street facing rooms as far as the noise coming from the street the location was very convenient to take a walk down fishermans wharf or to pick up the powellhyde cable car which has a end of the line turnaround right across the side street from 56 pm they have a nightly wine tasting and it changes here and there because i saw beer available and one chilly night they offered hot toddies i didnt hit the onsite gym but i understand its available if you want to get a workout in i almost forgot to mention that theres free wifi throughout the facility if we get a chance to travel to san francisco again i will make the argonaut my first choice

original_reviews: loved the location close to all the major sites to see and very convenient for us to pop in and out of the hotel during the day also liked that the hotel was a bit removed from the major crowds dont think you need to get a bay view room as youre hardly spending time in your room during the day save your money to use on excursions
reviews: we decided on taking a quick trip to san fransisco for 1 night we decided on the argonaut hotel because of its central location on the wharf and nob hill hotel is quaint pet friendly and clean prices were a bit high for what we got which was 1 king room with no view staff was friendlyfor some reason there were lots of kids running about the hallways and main entrance of the hotel you could hear them running up and downthats a negative i would recommend this place if you are interested in hanging out on the wharf best thing to do is purchase tickets to the sightseeing double decker buses and do hop ons and offs during the day that way you can see the city and not get caught up in the heavy parking and congestion of the city

original_reviews: we stayed here for 4 nights we had a bay view room which was large and comfortable with a view of the golden gate bridge the hotel is ideally located to explore the city the cable car starts just outside the hotel so we were able to ride the cable car early before the crowds came along
reviews: i loved the warehouse feel clever decor with all the steel strapping at baseboards and other areas friendly staff and very helpful with entertainment recommendations great seafood at most restaurants within walking distance we never had to use our car in the two days we were there

original_reviews: we booked a large suite with jacuzzi tub and it was extremely spacious and wellmaintained we had a dining table as well as sofachairs in living area bathroom included jacuzzi tub shower stall and toilet in separate closet we did not request a waterbay view and had a view of the street which was not a problem except for the noise at night the kids slept in the living room pullout sofa so they werent affected by the noise in the main bedroom the staff was super friendly and helpful the hotel location was great for exploring fishermans wharf and alcatraz and for hopping onoff the cable cars we did not eat at the hotel at all during our stay but we would definitely come back to stay here again

reviews: spent a few days in this hotel late september 2016 its a great location and about a 1 minute walk to the cable car turnaround station where you can hop on and enjoy the world famous clang clang clang went the trolley the f line street car that runs all the way up to castro is at the end of the block also a walgreens store is a short walk complimentary bikes from the bike the bridge shop next door are available the hotel room was ok a little bigger would have been good staff at the hotel were all very friendly helpful and professional we had breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant sat outside in the sun which was the only positive about the experience find somewhere else for breakfast plenty of choice around

reviews: have stayed at the argonaut a kimpton hotel on a number of occasions if you want a fishermans wharf location this is an ideal hotel to stay with easy access to the attractions of the wharf and easy access to the tramcar to take you into the centre of the city the rooms are very spacious with all expected amenities one great drawcard is the happy hour each evening when you can attend a wine tasting and have a chat with other guests from various parts of the world would always stay here again if we go to san francisco the restaurant onsite blue mermaid is accessible from the front foyer and serves a good breakfast and a great menu for dinner

original_reviews: found the location and facilities excellent staff professional and friendly we were referred by previous guests who are friends of ours i in turn have since told many others of your hotel one family of which will be booking soon
reviews: this is a great hotel in a historic building with lots of character retained from its previous life as a fruit packing warehouse the spacious and long rooms are tastefully done to maintain the character with exposed brick and beams with a nautical twist the hotel building is recessed into a steep hill so if you are in a room at the back of the hotel on the third floor it will still seem like you are almost on ground level so for a higher view ask to be closer to the front of the hotel we were about half way back on the third floor and when looking out of our window it seemed we were almost street level we did have a view of the park and the golden gate bridge in the distance the room had lovely toiletries and bathrobes and a very comfortable bed the wine tasting next to the hotel is worth a visit we had 5 different tasters for 15 with a sparkling and an extra glass thrown in for free the blue mermaid bar and restaurant connected to the hotel is also very good nice dcor and the award winning crab chowder was delicious the free bikes offered by the hotel were all gone by the time we tried to get them which was fine as we walked over the bridge but if this is something you want to do then book early my only negative is just thats its really expensive for a 4 star hotel i suppose it is a lovely hotel right in the tourist area and we were staying over a weekend but our bill for 3 nights without breakfast was nearly 1800ouch it was more expensive than our 5 star apartment room in vegas so although i loved this hotel the price wasnt really justified and i would only stay again if i could get a cheaper deal

original_reviews: we enjoyed the ambience at the argonaut hotel the staff was very friendly and the location is great too unfortunately there were no kingsized beds available we spent 3 nights there and my husband and i joked that we were sleeping in ricky and lucy beds we recently traveled to italy with our children and found that most of the hotels there simply moved two beds together or separated them accommodating the needs of their guests easily the elevators were slow but otherwise it was quite comfortable
reviews: we enjoyed our trip to san francisco and in part do to the great hotel and its location to all sorts of great things to do the rooms are nice and quiet not once were we disturbed by noises coming from the hall or any place we will be back

original_reviews: our 3rd stay in the hotel this time for 3 nights from the hotel straight on fishermans wharf next to the hotel the maritime museum ghirardelli park and the cable cars the hotel itself is very luxurious blue mermaid barrestaurant and a fitness center its an old warehouse and beautiful elements are still visible in the rooms
reviews: we are going to try elsewhere this next time because the 1 bedroom has just gotten too expensive on most days it is nearly 500 and that is not including the parking i understand that this hotel is immaculate and the location is hard to beat near the bay and ghiradelli however they have priced us out

original_reviews: we spent the night here this month while visiting california the people are sooooo sweet and friendly they ended up giving us free drink coupons free appetizer coupons and let us keep our car there most of the next day while we were sight seeing the city very clean and excellent location
reviews: really enjoyed our stay walking distance to pier 39 and the alcatraz tour right near tram stop room service never seemed to be available unless it was during restaurant hours which kind of defeats the purpose of needing room service

original_reviews: hello josephine1996 thank you for providing us with such a kind review we are giving some high fives over here at the argonaut after hearing that we made your bucket list what a great idea please come back and see us again soon warm regards marc
reviews: the argonaut is a really great hotel in the perfect location in fishermans wharf san francisco its suitable for couples and familys in among the action but in the quieter end of the strip the authentic decor has a real historic feel the rooms are a little snug but again are very comfortable with a design in keeping with the history of the area hire bikes ride over the golden gate bridge into sausalito grab some lunch and catch the ferry back past alcatraz dont bike back the hill coming down off the bridge would be really tough and you would miss out on the ferry experience the argonaut provided a great leg on our california road trip

original_reviews: wish we had a longer trip to san francisco so that we could have spent more time at this hotel quaint quiet beautiful property with extremely helpful and friendly staff the cleanliness of the rooms was impeccable very welcoming and enjoyable experience
reviews: we booked because of tripadvisor reviews the location was amazing beyond that not worth the money the hotel is dog friendly but maybe they should tell people after 2 miserable nights wheezing and coughing my daughter figured out the problem 2 room moves later the second smelled of smoke we were told we were on a pet fee floor although better i continued to wheeze and wake up with swollen eyes the last night the dog next door barked all night so much for animal free rooms

original_reviews: great location within walking distance to so many sites and close to cable car station concierge very helpful with planning how to fit the most fun into a short stay valet parking was great room was an interior room and quite small but tastefully decorated and we didnt spend much time there anyway inside rooms are much quieter
reviews: it was a first time visit for one of us and the argonaut did not disappoint we had wonderful service proximity to restaurants and places we needed to see and a great concierge who helped us reserve tickets

original_reviews: we also stayed here three years ago and im happy to say that the upkeep of the hotel has been great as everything seemed just as it should be this time the staff are friendly rooms large clean and very comfortable considering the hotel is in a very busy location and our room was facing fishermans wharf it was very quiet just around the corner from the argonaut are the cable cars which can get you easily into the city in a very picturesque way
reviews: i knew this hotel was going to be wonderful and it exceed my expectations we had a bay view king room with a spot on view of alcatraz and some of the golden gate bridge the bed was super comfortable and the location of the room right near the elevator was great it was my birthday and our anniversary so they greeted us in the room with a bottle of wine and snacks with a nice hand written card the lobby was great for kids and adults theres a big warm fireplace that is always on and we met people from out of town just by sitting there there was a tv with kid friendly video games going as well there was even a table with dog treats and poop bags for the dog people you walk out the front door and you are on fishermans wharf and right next to the start of the cable cars right behind the hotel is an early open starbucks and around the corner ghiradelli square could not have asked for a better place to stay oh and theres a restaurant attached as well for meals

original_reviews: we stayed here for a girls trip we asked where we could go for happy hour and they told us to check in with the concierge by the time we went up to the room they called with three options for us the beds were super comfortable rooms were very nice the hotel is right across from the beach and the ghiradelli square and right by the embarcadero so we walked everywhere although uber would always be an option the only disappointing thing was when we checked out they charged us a 25 resort fee which i thought was ridiculous because we were not told about it until we checked out however i would stay there again and their staff was extremely helpful we bought our room through groupon but i would not do that again as it would have been cheaper with the triple a discount of twenty percent
reviews: this hotel smells just like a dog kennel which i love dogs but i do not like the smell on my cloths and the whole hotel smells like wet dogs my stay was not pleasant at all i told them i do not want to be put in a room with prior dogs in it i am very allergic to dogsi get hives i did not expect the place to be like this at all the hotel is located in a perfect spot main street and closed to cable cars views of the golden gate bridge because of this i think the hotel gets too many great reviews and if i saw anything about the wet dog smells i would not have booked this hotel at all the worst part was my expensive cloths smelled of dogs all week its was awful

original_reviews: this is simply one of the best hotels weve ever stayed at the friendliness and impeccable service of all the staff ranks this hotel above the other boutique name brands we used to always stay at four seasons hotels i now look for kimpton
reviews: from the moment we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff and the checkin was as smooth as it could be the lobby common areas and rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated our room faced the courtyard and to our surprise it wasnt noisy
cleaned_advanced: moment arrived greeted friendly staff checkin smooth could lobby common area clean tastefully decorated faced courtyard surprise wasnt noisy

original_reviews: my wife and i have been to san francisco several times over the past 20 years and found the argonaut was a great fit of us and our two teenage daughters the location is right at the end of fishermans wharf in a former 100 year old warehouse it looks like a warehouse with exposed brick and steel beams that looks more than tough enough to survive an earthquake the front desk and the concierge were both helpful with our stay and they easily accommodated us when our flight was cancelled due to bad weather back east down the hallway is a little office area in case you need to jump online and print tickets or other tripbusiness related chores we had an inside room and it was one of the quietest rooms ive ever stayed in most probably due to the brick walls i cant make a comment on the street facing rooms as far as the noise coming from the street the location was very convenient to take a walk down fishermans wharf or to pick up the powellhyde cable car which has a end of the line turnaround right across the side street from 56 pm they have a nightly wine tasting and it changes here and there because i saw beer available and one chilly night they offered hot toddies i didnt hit the onsite gym but i understand its available if you want to get a workout in i almost forgot to mention that theres free wifi throughout the facility if we get a chance to travel to san francisco again i will make the argonaut my first choice
reviews: we needed a local long weekend destination that could cater to my 2 boys imagination and interests and decided that we would brave fishermans wharf in sf which in only about 40 minutes from where we live while searching for hotels near the wharf i got a little concerned none of them quite fit the standards and style we typically prefer when traveling as a family then i found the argonaut lets start with the location it is so close to the wharf and pier and within steps from many family friendly restaurants cafes ice cream shops and stores we were greeted by the most friendly doorman who entertained my boys while we checked in the lobby is beautiful spacious and a perfect place to sit down for a quick drink we were able to stay at one of the suites which was decently spacious and adorable furnished in nautical theme room was clean and the window looked out to the bustling wharf the jacuzzi didnt work but its ok it wanted to avoid it anyways since if my boys got in they wont ever want to get out 45 minutes after we settled into our room we were greeted with a complimentary bottle of wine what a lovely surprise they know tired parents we found the staff extremely kids friendly which is always a relief i loved that even being family friendly they still cared about the little nice luxury details id highly recommend this for anyone looking for a highend but also family appropriate hotel spot wed definitely come back

original_reviews: we decided on taking a quick trip to san fransisco for 1 night we decided on the argonaut hotel because of its central location on the wharf and nob hill hotel is quaint pet friendly and clean prices were a bit high for what we got which was 1 king room with no view staff was friendlyfor some reason there were lots of kids running about the hallways and main entrance of the hotel you could hear them running up and downthats a negative i would recommend this place if you are interested in hanging out on the wharf best thing to do is purchase tickets to the sightseeing double decker buses and do hop ons and offs during the day that way you can see the city and not get caught up in the heavy parking and congestion of the city
reviews: the location of the hotel is perfect to walk down fishermans wharf and visit san franciscos piers its near to the platform of powellhyde cable car line which can bring you directly to lombard street
cleaned_advanced: location perfect walk fisherman wharf visit san franciscos pier near platform powellhyde cable car line bring directly lombard street

original_reviews: i loved the warehouse feel clever decor with all the steel strapping at baseboards and other areas friendly staff and very helpful with entertainment recommendations great seafood at most restaurants within walking distance we never had to use our car in the two days we were there
reviews: we stayed at this hotel for 6 days and five nights in mid april the argonaut hotel is located in the perfect location right at the end of fishermans wharf on the main strip upon checkin the staff was friendly and attentive especially with the lobby being pretty busy we arrived early 4 hours before checkin time and were told they could have our room ready early that it would just be a little wait they secured our bags to the side took down our cell phone number and called us within 40 minutes our room was clean updated and comfortable we had the best nights sleep our mini bar was constantly stocked with liter bottles of water daily for us at a price of course this is big for us as we are always having to go out and buy water when on vacation so this was a nice convenience our room was cleaned every morning by the fast and efficient cleaning staff the hotel has an adjacent bar and restaurant there is a complimentary happy hour daily with wine beer connected to the hotel is a maritime museum the hotel has a nautical historical feel which was really cool we used the fitness facilities almost daily while there and it was never over crowded from the hotel there are endless activities and attractions within an easy walking distance ghiraradelli square a starbucks the buena vista restaurant the trolley pick up endless shops and restaurants pier 39 the boat to alcatraz are just some of them there are various bike rentals locally making biking the golden gate very convenient san fran is a beautiful city and we will be sure to return and stay at the argonaut again

original_reviews: really enjoyed our time at argonaut awesome location literally across the road from the pier fishermans wharf starbucks and ghirardelli square service was fantastic and the room was huge with a great feel to it the building is historic and has an awesome vibe to it
reviews: our family of four 2 teenage boys stayed in a deluxe room with 2 queen sized beds the room was pretty comfortable not the biggest weve stayed in but this is an old building that has to accommodate a hotel so that is understandable we had a great stay and the hotel is in the perfect location for a family pluses location easy walk to cable car terminus bike hire for gg bridge lots of family friendly restaurants shops ghirardelli square pier 39 fishermans wharf nice restaurant bar attached comfy lounge area with board games wii great concierge service quiet bedroom minuses lack of clothes storage in bedroom for family of 4 just a small chest of drawers + 2 other drawers a wardrobe nowhere to hang clothes in bathroom when taking a shower pretty low powered shower over the bath restaurant is small for the size of the hotel takes non residents so we faced a 1 hour wait for a breakfast table on checkout day not end of world as other options out of hotel but no warning that we should book either

original_reviews: spent a few days in this hotel late september 2016 its a great location and about a 1 minute walk to the cable car turnaround station where you can hop on and enjoy the world famous clang clang clang went the trolley the f line street car that runs all the way up to castro is at the end of the block also a walgreens store is a short walk complimentary bikes from the bike the bridge shop next door are available the hotel room was ok a little bigger would have been good staff at the hotel were all very friendly helpful and professional we had breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant sat outside in the sun which was the only positive about the experience find somewhere else for breakfast plenty of choice around
reviews: we live in the bay area and had a special evening planned so we decided to stay in the city we had not stayed here before but we cant wait to go back the nautical dcor was really well done and did not feel gimmicky the winebeer happy hour was well attended and fun from the front door to the front desk and the housekeepers the staff was friendly welcoming and attentive the bed was comfortable i love the kimpton whimsical touches in the room including the animal print robes and yoga mat oh and the umbrella on a practical note the multiplugs at the desk allowed us to plug in several devices for charging at one time brilliant join the kimpton karma program and you will get wifi and a chance to eat some munchies out of the mini bar included this is hotel is really well located for visitors to san francisco you can walk to the wharf ghirardelli square the cannery be sure to stop at the buena vista for an irish coffee

original_reviews: from check in to check out an unbelievable experience in the heart of the wharf we had the best room and view in the city corinne and steven on check in were fantastic rose the concierge was great help room was clean large and the views were fantastic we will be back on our leaving the doorman was more than helpful in assisting us with our scenic route out of the city beautiful hotel great history not a generic look to it

original_reviews: i was a challenge at first but the front desk attendant kumar was a pro realizing that it was my cab driver not the hotel irritating me i was treated like a valued guest right away and attention to detail was apparent throughout the hotel the guest receptions in the evening are also a nice touch the lobby is inviting and relaxing and we loved that the rooms draw on their cannery history no complaints here i would totally stay here again

reviews: stayed here on our last night of our road trip in the us on great ta reviews and i can only agree actually i think it could be the best us hotel i have stayed in not cheap and i agree that breakfast could have been included although that is unusual anywhere these days but i have paid this for a matchbox in london with second hand furniture all the staff were super friendly not just american false if you know what i mean and we were upgraded to a room with a great view of the harbour but still quiet tasteful seaside theme and superfast wifi my only problem was that we only had one night here and had spent many in below par hotels on our trip i wouldnt hesitate to stay here again when in san francisco

original_reviews: have stayed at the argonaut a kimpton hotel on a number of occasions if you want a fishermans wharf location this is an ideal hotel to stay with easy access to the attractions of the wharf and easy access to the tramcar to take you into the centre of the city the rooms are very spacious with all expected amenities one great drawcard is the happy hour each evening when you can attend a wine tasting and have a chat with other guests from various parts of the world would always stay here again if we go to san francisco the restaurant onsite blue mermaid is accessible from the front foyer and serves a good breakfast and a great menu for dinner
reviews: loved most everything about our two night stay parking was priced too high took the free tour which was an nice amenity the lobby should have more plugs to charge phones as the only ones were located on the high table with stools
cleaned_advanced: loved everything two night parking priced high took free tour nice amenity lobby plug charge phone one located high table stool

original_reviews: we had a wonderful rime staying at the argonaut so much was within walking distance and if we needed a cab the doorman jason put us in the hands of a truly awesome cab driver the rooms are clean the restaurant has really good food and the wait staff were very friendly and accomodating i will recommend your hotel to anyone i know that plans to visit san fran thank you again
reviews: i stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate my 30th birthday it cost us around 1300 the hotel is spotlessly clean and really nicely decorated our room had a view of the golden gate bridge and upon arrival a note to wish me a happy birthday and a bottle of wine were in the roomive no idea how the hotel knew it was my birthday my boyfriend is adamant he didnt mention it so i can only assume this is how much attention to detail is given for booking that they noticed the date all the staff we came across throughout the stay were really friendly and went out of the way to ensure our stay was perfect the wine hour is great the free bicycle hire would have been fantastic if i could ride a bike however after borrowing one from the hotel it became evident very quickly that i lost that ability somewhere in the last 15 years haha the restaurant in the hotel is lovely but there are some really great ones in the courtyard next door too especially the mexican which was excellent the location is perfect easy to get a cab close to sightseeing buses cable car turn table and a short walk to pier 39 easy to walk to the alcatraz landing from here too room was warm and cosy bathrobes were super cute and all the staff we came across were super friendly the only negative point i have about the hotel is that our room whilst lovely was tiny perhaps it was because we had just arrived there after a week in caesars palace lv but im pretty sure we must have had one of the smallest rooms in the hotel it wasnt a problem as we didnt spend long in the room anyway but if you arent planning on exploring and want to stay in the room i would recommend upgrading to a larger room

original_reviews: this is a great hotel in a historic building with lots of character retained from its previous life as a fruit packing warehouse the spacious and long rooms are tastefully done to maintain the character with exposed brick and beams with a nautical twist the hotel building is recessed into a steep hill so if you are in a room at the back of the hotel on the third floor it will still seem like you are almost on ground level so for a higher view ask to be closer to the front of the hotel we were about half way back on the third floor and when looking out of our window it seemed we were almost street level we did have a view of the park and the golden gate bridge in the distance the room had lovely toiletries and bathrobes and a very comfortable bed the wine tasting next to the hotel is worth a visit we had 5 different tasters for 15 with a sparkling and an extra glass thrown in for free the blue mermaid bar and restaurant connected to the hotel is also very good nice dcor and the award winning crab chowder was delicious the free bikes offered by the hotel were all gone by the time we tried to get them which was fine as we walked over the bridge but if this is something you want to do then book early my only negative is just thats its really expensive for a 4 star hotel i suppose it is a lovely hotel right in the tourist area and we were staying over a weekend but our bill for 3 nights without breakfast was nearly 1800ouch it was more expensive than our 5 star apartment room in vegas so although i loved this hotel the price wasnt really justified and i would only stay again if i could get a cheaper deal
reviews: first off its a great boutique hotel fairly large with a pretty cool nautical theme the bar at the restaurant downstairs was cool as well everyone was helpful it was clean and upkept very well best part however was the location it is literally across the street from the maritime museum and about a block from fishermans wharf everything youd like to see in a long weekend is in walking distance ie no rental car needed i was at a conference so i didnt have all of the free time in the world but id definitely stay there again for pleasure

original_reviews: we enjoyed our trip to san francisco and in part do to the great hotel and its location to all sorts of great things to do the rooms are nice and quiet not once were we disturbed by noises coming from the hall or any place we will be back
reviews: clean warm and comfortable but a long walk from reception to our room friendly staff but once again no free wifi no breakfast included or else they forgot to mention it and the most annoying they even charged for the bottled water in the room certainly americans like to milk every penny they can from tourists but that was pure meanness

reviews: i was told a late checkout was not available but was available for 100 bucks more pretty shady also the walls were pretty thin and if you face the east window the sunlight is pretty strong great location though
