original_reviews: really enjoyed our stay walking distance to pier 39 and the alcatraz tour right near tram stop room service never seemed to be available unless it was during restaurant hours which kind of defeats the purpose of needing room service
reviews: this is the fourth kimpton we have stayed in and one of the best we are loyal to the brand and always try and find a kimpton wherever we go the location of the argonaut is perfect you are on the edge of one of the biggest tourist areas in the world but barely notice having the buena vista next door for breakfast is a huge plus staff at this hotel was hands down friendly courteous and helpful doormen went to great lengths to hail cabs at times running down the street and yelling front desk was super nice on check inout even honoring a rewards perk when they did not have to only real complaint is we never got our fish we noted that this hotel is pet friendly and met some nice dogs in the lobby at times found this to be a plus even though we dont travel with our cats we never heard a bark growl or anything else negative in this regard had a deluxe king room and was very impressed the rawexposed building elements brick wall wood beams etc were a very nice touch bed was super comfy with excellent linens room was large for big city standards and overall very comfortable we would certainly recommend this hotel as well as stay here on our next visit although there are other nice looking kimpton properties in sf that look fun as well
cleaned_advanced: fourth kimpton stayed one best loyal brand always try find kimpton wherever go location argonaut perfect edge one biggest tourist area world barely notice buena vista next door breakfast huge plus staff hand friendly courteous helpful doorman went great length hail cab time running street yelling front desk super nice check inout even honoring reward perk real complaint never got fish noted pet friendly met nice dog lobby time found plus even though dont travel cat never heard bark growl anything else negative regard deluxe king impressed rawexposed building element brick wall wood beam etc nice touch bed super comfy excellent linen large big city standard overall comfortable would certainly recommend well next visit although nice looking kimpton property sf look fun well

original_reviews: the argonaut is a really great hotel in the perfect location in fishermans wharf san francisco its suitable for couples and familys in among the action but in the quieter end of the strip the authentic decor has a real historic feel the rooms are a little snug but again are very comfortable with a design in keeping with the history of the area hire bikes ride over the golden gate bridge into sausalito grab some lunch and catch the ferry back past alcatraz dont bike back the hill coming down off the bridge would be really tough and you would miss out on the ferry experience the argonaut provided a great leg on our california road trip
reviews: it is a nice hotel friendly staff and great location i would recommend this hotel for business or personal stays location is convenient to attractions and great restaurants and the front desk personnel were very accommodating
cleaned_advanced: nice friendly staff great location would recommend business personal stay location convenient attraction great restaurant front desk personnel accommodating

original_reviews: we booked because of tripadvisor reviews the location was amazing beyond that not worth the money the hotel is dog friendly but maybe they should tell people after 2 miserable nights wheezing and coughing my daughter figured out the problem 2 room moves later the second smelled of smoke we were told we were on a pet fee floor although better i continued to wheeze and wake up with swollen eyes the last night the dog next door barked all night so much for animal free rooms
reviews: we stayed for a second time in this historic in american terms hotel quirky maritime theme may not suit all tastes but the room was large with a view of the golden gate bridge staff were very friendly and helpful spent all day on a wine tasting tour and returning to find free wine being served by the fire was a nice touch as was the free bottle presented in the room when they found out we were celebrating a birthday far better than the usual corporate fair in sf
cleaned_advanced: stayed second time historic american term quirky maritime theme may suit taste large view golden gate bridge staff friendly helpful spent day wine tasting tour returning find free wine served fire nice touch free bottle presented found celebrating birthday far better usual corporate fair sf

original_reviews: it was a first time visit for one of us and the argonaut did not disappoint we had wonderful service proximity to restaurants and places we needed to see and a great concierge who helped us reserve tickets
reviews: the location was great the staff were very helpful and the room was also very nice i was amazed with how quiet the rooms were at night we slept great the water pressure was good and we never ran out of hot water the amenities were nice including the attached restaurant and the games and comfortable chairs in the lobby we never utilized the concierge service but it was available just a great experience and we would definitely stay here again in the future
cleaned_advanced: location great staff helpful also nice amazed quiet night slept great water pressure good never ran hot water amenity nice including attached restaurant game comfortable chair lobby never utilized concierge service available great experience would definitely future

original_reviews: i knew this hotel was going to be wonderful and it exceed my expectations we had a bay view king room with a spot on view of alcatraz and some of the golden gate bridge the bed was super comfortable and the location of the room right near the elevator was great it was my birthday and our anniversary so they greeted us in the room with a bottle of wine and snacks with a nice hand written card the lobby was great for kids and adults theres a big warm fireplace that is always on and we met people from out of town just by sitting there there was a tv with kid friendly video games going as well there was even a table with dog treats and poop bags for the dog people you walk out the front door and you are on fishermans wharf and right next to the start of the cable cars right behind the hotel is an early open starbucks and around the corner ghiradelli square could not have asked for a better place to stay oh and theres a restaurant attached as well for meals
reviews: the argonaut is charming loved the old bones of the building and our room was huge the location is great for walking to wharf attractions and accessing public transportation we also enjoyed the free bike rental
cleaned_advanced: argonaut charming loved old bone building huge location great walking wharf attraction accessing public transportation also enjoyed free bike rental

original_reviews: this hotel smells just like a dog kennel which i love dogs but i do not like the smell on my cloths and the whole hotel smells like wet dogs my stay was not pleasant at all i told them i do not want to be put in a room with prior dogs in it i am very allergic to dogsi get hives i did not expect the place to be like this at all the hotel is located in a perfect spot main street and closed to cable cars views of the golden gate bridge because of this i think the hotel gets too many great reviews and if i saw anything about the wet dog smells i would not have booked this hotel at all the worst part was my expensive cloths smelled of dogs all week its was awful
reviews: this is a fantastic hotel very friendly staff the wine tasting gave everyone a chance to interact rooms very clean and comfortable our deluxe room with a view of the golden gate bridge was better than we had expected the only let down was the mermaid chowder restaurantthe food was served on cold plates and was cold when it arrived at the table
cleaned_advanced: fantastic friendly staff wine tasting gave everyone chance interact clean comfortable deluxe view golden gate bridge better expected let mermaid chowder restaurantthe food served cold plate cold arrived table

original_reviews: from the moment we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff and the checkin was as smooth as it could be the lobby common areas and rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated our room faced the courtyard and to our surprise it wasnt noisy
reviews: i did not stay in here but used the lobby and i loved this hotel this was my second option and only second as lots of people say dont stay at fishermans warf but next time i visit san francisco this is the place ill be amazing location beautiful hotel dont know the rooms but im sure its great cable car station ghiradelli is next door
cleaned_advanced: used lobby loved second option second lot people say dont fisherman warf next time visit san francisco place ill amazing location beautiful dont know im sure great cable car station ghiradelli next door

original_reviews: we needed a local long weekend destination that could cater to my 2 boys imagination and interests and decided that we would brave fishermans wharf in sf which in only about 40 minutes from where we live while searching for hotels near the wharf i got a little concerned none of them quite fit the standards and style we typically prefer when traveling as a family then i found the argonaut lets start with the location it is so close to the wharf and pier and within steps from many family friendly restaurants cafes ice cream shops and stores we were greeted by the most friendly doorman who entertained my boys while we checked in the lobby is beautiful spacious and a perfect place to sit down for a quick drink we were able to stay at one of the suites which was decently spacious and adorable furnished in nautical theme room was clean and the window looked out to the bustling wharf the jacuzzi didnt work but its ok it wanted to avoid it anyways since if my boys got in they wont ever want to get out 45 minutes after we settled into our room we were greeted with a complimentary bottle of wine what a lovely surprise they know tired parents we found the staff extremely kids friendly which is always a relief i loved that even being family friendly they still cared about the little nice luxury details id highly recommend this for anyone looking for a highend but also family appropriate hotel spot wed definitely come back
reviews: the hotel was very nice very clean the staff were greatthe only issue was you can litterly hear the next door talking and tv the house keeping lady was very nice and took care of our room front desk was very nice and helpfulalso they have a great valet team they were very polite and help me in and out of my wheelchair
cleaned_advanced: nice clean staff greatthe issue litterly hear next door talking tv house keeping lady nice took care front desk nice helpfulalso great valet team polite help wheelchair

original_reviews: the location of the hotel is perfect to walk down fishermans wharf and visit san franciscos piers its near to the platform of powellhyde cable car line which can bring you directly to lombard street
reviews: not only is this hotel located in a great area for touring the wharf city the bed was hands down the most comfortable i have ever found in a hotel like sleeping on a cloud fabulous staff from housekeeping to front desk to bellman all very helpful friendly i will definitely be staying here again
cleaned_advanced: located great area touring wharf city bed hand comfortable ever found like sleeping cloud fabulous staff housekeeping front desk bellman helpful friendly definitely staying

original_reviews: we stayed at this hotel for 6 days and five nights in mid april the argonaut hotel is located in the perfect location right at the end of fishermans wharf on the main strip upon checkin the staff was friendly and attentive especially with the lobby being pretty busy we arrived early 4 hours before checkin time and were told they could have our room ready early that it would just be a little wait they secured our bags to the side took down our cell phone number and called us within 40 minutes our room was clean updated and comfortable we had the best nights sleep our mini bar was constantly stocked with liter bottles of water daily for us at a price of course this is big for us as we are always having to go out and buy water when on vacation so this was a nice convenience our room was cleaned every morning by the fast and efficient cleaning staff the hotel has an adjacent bar and restaurant there is a complimentary happy hour daily with wine beer connected to the hotel is a maritime museum the hotel has a nautical historical feel which was really cool we used the fitness facilities almost daily while there and it was never over crowded from the hotel there are endless activities and attractions within an easy walking distance ghiraradelli square a starbucks the buena vista restaurant the trolley pick up endless shops and restaurants pier 39 the boat to alcatraz are just some of them there are various bike rentals locally making biking the golden gate very convenient san fran is a beautiful city and we will be sure to return and stay at the argonaut again
reviews: its located on the end of crazy the very busy touristy pier strip of fishermans wharf its a brick four story building located right next to the cable car hyde street its a walking distance to many attractions restaurants fort masonetc the lobby and the overall decor is very nautical beautiful and fitting with the surrounding they have a restaurant and a wine tasting room the staff was friendly and helpful the walls are thick and the brick structure does the trick its very quiet despite the busy location free wifi
cleaned_advanced: located end crazy busy touristy pier strip fisherman wharf brick four story building located right next cable car hyde street walking distance many attraction restaurant fort masonetc lobby overall decor nautical beautiful fitting surrounding restaurant wine tasting staff friendly helpful wall thick brick structure trick quiet despite busy location free wifi

original_reviews: our family of four 2 teenage boys stayed in a deluxe room with 2 queen sized beds the room was pretty comfortable not the biggest weve stayed in but this is an old building that has to accommodate a hotel so that is understandable we had a great stay and the hotel is in the perfect location for a family pluses location easy walk to cable car terminus bike hire for gg bridge lots of family friendly restaurants shops ghirardelli square pier 39 fishermans wharf nice restaurant bar attached comfy lounge area with board games wii great concierge service quiet bedroom minuses lack of clothes storage in bedroom for family of 4 just a small chest of drawers + 2 other drawers a wardrobe nowhere to hang clothes in bathroom when taking a shower pretty low powered shower over the bath restaurant is small for the size of the hotel takes non residents so we faced a 1 hour wait for a breakfast table on checkout day not end of world as other options out of hotel but no warning that we should book either
reviews: great location at the warf in walking distance to ghiridelli square boudin tons of restaurants and shopping the cable cars friendly staff and very helpful bed is comfy with a relaxing spacious shower with all the upscale amenities
cleaned_advanced: great location warf walking distance ghiridelli square boudin ton restaurant shopping cable car friendly staff helpful bed comfy relaxing spacious shower upscale amenity

original_reviews: we live in the bay area and had a special evening planned so we decided to stay in the city we had not stayed here before but we cant wait to go back the nautical dcor was really well done and did not feel gimmicky the winebeer happy hour was well attended and fun from the front door to the front desk and the housekeepers the staff was friendly welcoming and attentive the bed was comfortable i love the kimpton whimsical touches in the room including the animal print robes and yoga mat oh and the umbrella on a practical note the multiplugs at the desk allowed us to plug in several devices for charging at one time brilliant join the kimpton karma program and you will get wifi and a chance to eat some munchies out of the mini bar included this is hotel is really well located for visitors to san francisco you can walk to the wharf ghirardelli square the cannery be sure to stop at the buena vista for an irish coffee
reviews: we recently stayed in a king bayview room which looked out directly at alcatraz the hotel was great the staff was wonderful and we had the best time exploring the city this location is an easy walk to ghirardelli square and the piers but we managed to walk to north beach chinatown and the embarcco as well
cleaned_advanced: recently stayed king bayview looked directly alcatraz great staff wonderful best time exploring city location easy walk ghirardelli square pier managed walk north beach chinatown embarcco well

original_reviews: great hotel in the best location lovely friendly staff very knowledges and there to help would definitely stay here again great view of alcatraz from the room breakfast at 8am round the first we was amazing too
reviews: we really enjoyed our stay at the argonaut the staff were very professional polite and welcoming and made us feel really special the rooms are nice in a themey kind of way but a little dark and the bathrooms were very underwhelming also under the television where the mini bar area is was very dirty so maybe housekeeping could be a little more attentive the location is on the edge of the fishermans wharf area so its easy to avoid the chaos like i said in the title of this review this is a solid hotel over priced in my opinion but a safe bet in the fishermans wharf area particularly loved the infused water in the foyer
cleaned_advanced: really enjoyed argonaut staff professional polite welcoming made u feel really special nice themey kind way little dark bathroom underwhelming also television mini bar area dirty maybe housekeeping could little attentive location edge fisherman wharf area easy avoid chaos like said title review solid priced opinion safe bet fisherman wharf area particularly loved infused water foyer

original_reviews: we have always enjoyed staying at the agrenout the historical beautiful building at a great location beautiful comfortable rooms great restaurant all staff are very professional and makes you feel at home that is why i can say i recomend you to stay at this hotel next time in sf you will never regret that
reviews: we stayed at the argonaut for 2 nights the location is excellent our room had a lovely view of the golden gate bridge and the cable car turn around the hotel is an old factory the brick and exposed beams were beautiful the only negative was an added fee for things we had no interest in using i was not told of the fee at checking when i enquired the next day the clerk wouldnt remove it from the pervious night but didnt charge us for the second night
cleaned_advanced: stayed argonaut night location excellent lovely view golden gate bridge cable car turn around old factory brick exposed beam beautiful negative added fee thing interest using told fee checking enquired next day clerk wouldnt remove pervious night didnt charge u second night

original_reviews: we were encouraged to stay at this hotel whose rates are usually prohibitive to us because of its special offer its a lovely hotel were glad we did the historical nautical theme was consistent throughout the staff was polite considerate informative the room was gorgeous
reviews: we reserved two adjoining rooms they were each unique and beautiful good size rooms for downtown san francisco the decor in this hotel is gorgeous down to the smallest detail and it seemed new as there was no wear and tear we had a beautiful view of the bay everyone was very friendly too
cleaned_advanced: reserved two adjoining unique beautiful good size downtown san francisco decor gorgeous smallest detail seemed new wear tear beautiful view bay everyone friendly

original_reviews: beautiful hotel with one of the best views in the city one of the finest rooms ive been in and a perfect location for strolling the waterfront it wasnt cheap but the best rarely is if you want to give someone a first class san francisco experience this is a good place to do it
reviews: my husband and i recently stayed here for an anniversarybirthday trip and had such a wonderful time the area was great but the cable car and street cars stops were such a short walk from the property that we were able to explore other areas of the city as well the public transportation system is a breeze but the concierge will help you out if you have any questions special thanks to steven at check in chuck in housekeeping and richard and vuk y at the blue mermaid for making our trip so memorable
cleaned_advanced: husband recently stayed anniversarybirthday trip wonderful time area great cable car street car stop short walk property able explore area city well public transportation system breeze concierge help question special thanks steven check chuck housekeeping richard vuk blue mermaid making trip memorable

original_reviews: stayed here on our last night of our road trip in the us on great ta reviews and i can only agree actually i think it could be the best us hotel i have stayed in not cheap and i agree that breakfast could have been included although that is unusual anywhere these days but i have paid this for a matchbox in london with second hand furniture all the staff were super friendly not just american false if you know what i mean and we were upgraded to a room with a great view of the harbour but still quiet tasteful seaside theme and superfast wifi my only problem was that we only had one night here and had spent many in below par hotels on our trip i wouldnt hesitate to stay here again when in san francisco
reviews: lovely hotel right on fishermans wharf quiet luxury hotel with great bar restaurant the wharf is definitely aimed at tourists so youll pay more but if you want to spend time on the wharf access the various piers close to cable car stops and hop on tour buses this hotel is great
cleaned_advanced: lovely right fisherman wharf quiet luxury great bar restaurant wharf definitely aimed tourist youll pay want spend time wharf access various pier close cable car stop hop tour bus great

original_reviews: very nice hotel i recommended to my aunt and she stayed in november blue mermaid restaurant was fabulous everyone was friendly and helpful centrally located valet parking i would definitely stay here again
reviews: this was a great hotel far end of all the piers and wharfs where we like eating but that was ok still plenty of shops and things to bop into around the hotel also we truly were in the hotel from just after a late dinner to check out for the flight home so cant comment on a lot of the ammenities but i did like the place and certainly would look to book again should the need to stay in san francisco arise
cleaned_advanced: great far end pier wharf like eating ok still plenty shop thing bop around also truly late dinner check flight home cant comment lot ammenities like place certainly would look book need san francisco arise

original_reviews: loved most everything about our two night stay parking was priced too high took the free tour which was an nice amenity the lobby should have more plugs to charge phones as the only ones were located on the high table with stools
reviews: the best location on fishermans wharf walk along the pier and close to restaurants i was pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel i pay close attention to little things like the grout in the bathroom it was spotless plenty of space on the room for four of us would definitely choose to stay here again
cleaned_advanced: best location fisherman wharf walk along pier close restaurant pleased cleanliness pay close attention little thing like grout bathroom spotless plenty space four u would definitely choose

original_reviews: i stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate my 30th birthday it cost us around 1300 the hotel is spotlessly clean and really nicely decorated our room had a view of the golden gate bridge and upon arrival a note to wish me a happy birthday and a bottle of wine were in the roomive no idea how the hotel knew it was my birthday my boyfriend is adamant he didnt mention it so i can only assume this is how much attention to detail is given for booking that they noticed the date all the staff we came across throughout the stay were really friendly and went out of the way to ensure our stay was perfect the wine hour is great the free bicycle hire would have been fantastic if i could ride a bike however after borrowing one from the hotel it became evident very quickly that i lost that ability somewhere in the last 15 years haha the restaurant in the hotel is lovely but there are some really great ones in the courtyard next door too especially the mexican which was excellent the location is perfect easy to get a cab close to sightseeing buses cable car turn table and a short walk to pier 39 easy to walk to the alcatraz landing from here too room was warm and cosy bathrobes were super cute and all the staff we came across were super friendly the only negative point i have about the hotel is that our room whilst lovely was tiny perhaps it was because we had just arrived there after a week in caesars palace lv but im pretty sure we must have had one of the smallest rooms in the hotel it wasnt a problem as we didnt spend long in the room anyway but if you arent planning on exploring and want to stay in the room i would recommend upgrading to a larger room
reviews: excellent location super helpful and friendly staff easy walking to golden gate bridge pier 39 and beyond bedroom and bed very comfy no tea just coffee provided interior view means everyone elses shutters but theyre all white wooden ones so look good blue mermaid restaurant does delicious breakfast but a little pricey we paid 62 for the 2 of us however they are big portions and lots of great coffee refills really enjoyed our 2 might stay an route to new zealand from the uk
cleaned_advanced: excellent location super helpful friendly staff easy walking golden gate bridge pier beyond bedroom bed comfy tea coffee provided interior view mean everyone elses shutter theyre white wooden one look good blue mermaid restaurant delicious breakfast little pricey paid u however big portion lot great coffee refill really enjoyed might route new zealand uk

original_reviews: first off its a great boutique hotel fairly large with a pretty cool nautical theme the bar at the restaurant downstairs was cool as well everyone was helpful it was clean and upkept very well best part however was the location it is literally across the street from the maritime museum and about a block from fishermans wharf everything youd like to see in a long weekend is in walking distance ie no rental car needed i was at a conference so i didnt have all of the free time in the world but id definitely stay there again for pleasure
reviews: i stayed here with my mum back in march for my birthday as a short getaway from the moment we checked in the hotel team were friendly and very welcoming the hotel has a very unique looking design which fits in with its location in fishermans wharf the location is great for going out sight seeing and very close to public transport including the old style trams i cant compliment the hotel team enough they knew it was my birthday and laid out a few surprises which were lovely
cleaned_advanced: stayed mum back march birthday short getaway moment checked team friendly welcoming unique looking design fit location fisherman wharf location great going sight seeing close public transport including old style tram cant compliment team enough knew birthday laid surprise lovely

original_reviews: clean warm and comfortable but a long walk from reception to our room friendly staff but once again no free wifi no breakfast included or else they forgot to mention it and the most annoying they even charged for the bottled water in the room certainly americans like to milk every penny they can from tourists but that was pure meanness
reviews: the argonaut is in a great location it is slightly away from the main touristy area of pier 39 but still not too far away the building itself is beautiful and the nautical theme is nice the staff are all extremely professional and helpful from reception the door people and the cleaning people a warm hello from the cleaning people is always a great touch also the room was as expected of a high standard and most of all the bed was comfortable gone are the days when i can sleep on any kind of bed and my back appreciated the firmness of the mattress it wasnt too firm it was just perfect we had breakfast at the hotel which was very nice but for a more all singing all dancing kind of a breakfast id recommend the hollywood cafe on north point street we went on quite a few tours during our time in san francisco our favourites were out to visit the coastal redwoods at muir woods and of course alcatraz island dont forget the 5 all day vintage street car pass
cleaned_advanced: argonaut great location slightly away main touristy area pier still far away building beautiful nautical theme nice staff extremely professional helpful reception door people cleaning people warm hello cleaning people always great touch also expected high standard bed comfortable gone day sleep kind bed back appreciated firmness mattress wasnt firm perfect breakfast nice singing dancing kind breakfast id recommend hollywood cafe north point street went quite tour time san francisco favourite visit coastal redwood muir wood course alcatraz island dont forget day vintage street car pas

original_reviews: i was told a late checkout was not available but was available for 100 bucks more pretty shady also the walls were pretty thin and if you face the east window the sunlight is pretty strong great location though
reviews: hotel has the wow factor when you arrive and the continued all the way to your room we had a wharf view room and was well worth the extra cost to soak up the atmosphere the room had everything you could want breakfast was a bit pricey but thats a choice thing great location cable car stop literal 2 minutes away lots of shops and restaurants close to ferry for alcatraz and the sea lions absolutely loved this hotel and san francisco

reviews: the argonaut is in a great location in fishermans wharf the rooms are wellappointed spacious and nicely styled in the nautical theme but if you stay here dont go to the bar we were seated at the bar to get a drink waited 15 minutes without even being acknowledged by the bartender and then left to have a predinner drink at our restaurant instead during this time multiple customers had to walk to the bar to request their checks not great when one of the justifications for the resortservice fee is a 10 bar credit
